jobs.title: Linux Embedded Engineer
jobs.content:
A camera that comes with you everywhere... and can fly. 
With a gesture, Nixie takes off, captures the moment, and comes right back. Here at Nixie, we are looking for individuals who have a passion for difficult challenges and solving problems.


You are a Software Engineer who will significantly impact Nixie's development. You will collaborate with our electrical, mechanical, guidance, and algorithm engineers. You have the scope and understanding to make a significant contributions to the complete UAV software stack, and you have the experience to bring up boards and develop drivers on a variety of SOCs and embedded platforms.

jobs.title: Top Secret Clearance Software Engineer - Command & Control/Mission Planning
jobs.content:
Candidates MUST POSSESS a Current or Active SSBI and ability to obtain a security clearance at the TS/SCI level


The Solidyn Solutions, Inc. team is looking for highly qualified Software Engineers to join our subcontracting team supporting the M2C2 program in Aurora, Colorado.  This team is responsible for full life cycle engineering for a Satellite Ground System.


Solidyn Solutions, Inc. values highly qualified talent and supports them through a comprehensive benefits and training package.  We differentiate ourselves within the industry by valuing the individual employee, offering them a tailored and unique training package to support their career growth.  As a member of a growing small software engineering firm, you will have opportunities for growth that support our Nation on the largest most complicated programs.

jobs.title: Big Data Engineer
jobs.content:
DOES WORKING FOR AN ORGANIZATION WITH THESE BENEFITS, APPEAL TO YOU?



  • Working on complex transformation programs across many clients and many industries

  • Unlimited paid time off

  • Competitive compensation which includes uncapped bonus potential based on individual contributions

  • Mentor program

  • Career development

  • Tremendous growth opportunities (company is growing at a rate of 35% or more annually)

  • Strong work/life balance

  • A smaller nimble organization that is easy to work with

  • Visibility to the leadership team on a daily basis

  • Be a part of an Elite Data & Analytics team

  • If you love to travel, you can live outside of the SFO area, and still work for us!


IF YOU ANSWERED YES TO THE ABOVE ITEMS, KEEP READING!


We are looking for individuals with the ability to drive the architectural decision making process, who are experienced with leading teams of developers, but who are also capable and enthusiastic about implementing every aspect of an architecture themselves.


OUR DATA ENGINEERS:



  • Are hands-on, self-directed engineers who enjoys working in collaborative teams 

  • Are data transformation engineers

  • Work with business stakeholders and data SMEs to elicit requirements and develop real-time business metrics, analytical products and analytical insights

  • Profile and analyze complex and large datasets

jobs.title: Tiles Engineer
jobs.content:
Mapzen serves up bespoke map tiles for the masses via our open-source Tilezen project.


We're is looking for an experienced tiles engineer to join our data team to make important improvements our open-source vector tiles service. You will work with large-scale spatial datasets and build public-facing APIs. Your mission will be to improve access to open-data.


During a typical week you might learn about a new OpenStreetMap tag, work with the Who’s On First gazetteer, transform data in Python, configure a GDAL VRT, optimize a Postgres query, improve our test suite, write documentation, demonstrate new capabilities of our tiles services by writing Tangram scene snippets, and brainstorm with other data team members on new ways to publish open geographic information on the web.


Responsibilities



  • Design and develop interfaces for the Mapzen tiles service

  • Develop services that process and re-package open-data for global consumption

  • Collaborate with engineering and design teams working on new features, services, and demos

  • Improve service performance & reliability, and respond to service alerts

jobs.title: Personalization Engineer - Massdrop
jobs.content:
Personalization engineer is one of our most exciting positions at Massdrop! You’ll have a direct impact on the entire Massdrop experience by shaping the information that is presented to users via our daily emails, notifications, and drop sorting pages. You'll have the opportunity to work on our messaging systems that send millions of emails and notifications per day, and interpret a wide range of user preferences and interests to draw conclusions and optimize the content that we show our users.


Here's what you'll do as part of the team:



  • You will write awesome new personalization algorithms to give Massdrop users the best content.

  • Working on emails and notification systems that sent to millions of people every day (and growing!)

  • Dealing with huge amounts of logs and analytics data that we store on a daily basis. Work with our production team to analyze and interpret this data using data warehousing solutions.

  • Optimize our system architecture for the crazy amount of data that we handle!

  • Other things you find fun! We're an open-minded engineering team that is always looking for ways to take our software and architecture to the next level!

jobs.title: Senior Software Developer
jobs.content:
We're looking for people who enjoy thinking about programming in a thoughtful and methodical way. Cowboy programmers are not our style.


You would be joining a small team - 8 highly skilled developers on site, and 2 more when you include the president and CTO, both of whom spend as much time as possible in the code. Our company is technology-focused - meaning that getting the right architecture and code is more important than meeting arbitrary deadlines.


Our ideal candidate will be looking for more than just writing another web front end to a database. You enjoy theoretical aspects of software development, such as design patterns, OOP and software architecture. We have regular seminars on different aspects of software development and frequent discussions regarding software architecture choices. Developers work on all aspects of the software and drive all architecture, coding, and testing decisions. You will not be afraid to speak up to challenge design decisions or to offer new approaches to problems - in fact, you are encouraged to.



  • Primary programming language is Delphi

  • Will work in a small company environment.

  • Will report directly to CTO.

  • Will perform software coding and testing.

  • Will investigate new technologies and tools.

  • Depending on experience, candidate may perform software design and documentation.

  • Some Telecommuting OK

  • Permanent position only

jobs.title: Lead Embedded Systems Engineer
jobs.content:
Micron Optics has an immediate opening for a Lead Embedded Systems Engineer.  This is the primary software development position within a hardware-based company, and so we are seeking candidates who love interacting closely with hardware and making complex systems work.  This position will act as the lead firmware architect for our industry leading fiber optics sensing instruments, as well as future high speed swept wavelength laser sources for medical imaging.  This position will need to support an existing product line of instruments that utilize a custom Linux OS  build that interacts with the internal hardware subsystems for real time data acquisition and control.  Code is mostly written in c#/.net, with some c++.  Additionally, the position will need to support development of lower-level instruments and subsystems built on 32 bit micro controller cores.  Client-side APIs are also made available to our customers in a variety of languages.  This high level position will be one of the lead engineers in a diverse team that includes optical, mechanical, and electrical engineering disciplines.  The position is expected to be onsite regularly at our Atlanta office, but we do offer significant flexibility for remote work. The responsibilities for this position are:



  • Act as lead programmer for all embedded firmware on our fiber optic instruments.

  • Implement firmware testing and evaluation, in collaboration with other team members.

  • Produce and maintain functional documentation of firmware.

  • Provide key design input and technology guidance throughout all phases of product development.

  • Work with applications engineers for escalated customer support issues.

  • Work closely with other team members and offsite contractors to implement solutions.

jobs.title: iOS Developer-Swift
jobs.content: Zycron has a great iOS Developer-Swift opportunity. The selected candidate will play a key role in developing and implementing mobile technology and applications for our clients with a focus on improving the patient check-in experience in an outpatient setting.

jobs.title: Network Security Engineer
jobs.content:
Rally Health is looking for a Network Security Engineer to join our IT Security Team. This type of role is a unique personality set that likes to thrive on keeping networks reliable and secure for users connected with a variety of applications, products and services.


This individual will be a subject matter expert in the domain of network infrastructure, network engineering and network security. They will be working to ensure that network operations are secure and efficient by monitoring network performance, coordinating planned maintenance, adjusting network hardware components and responding to network connectivity issues and security incidents.

jobs.title: SENIOR FULL-STACK DEV -- SMALL TEAM OF EXPERTS -- 100% REMOTE, FLEXIBLE HOURS
jobs.content:
At Analytics Fire we are an distributed team working on a range of interesting projects -- some that might fit you: currently a scalable IoT platform for utility grade solar power plants, ML-powered autonomous cleaning robots, data analytics for predictive maintenance of clean energy assets, and a personalized health and medicine application. We are looking for a fun, interesting, and hardcore dev to join our small team of disparate experts.


This is a remote position. We are flexible about location and hours, so long as your normal working hours overlap heavily with normal business hours for the Pacific time zone.

jobs.title: DevOps Engineer
jobs.content:
Blue Apron’s software systems manage the forecasting, purchasing, preparation, and shipment of new fresh ingredients every week, delivering over 5 million meals nationwide each month. Our software and infrastructure enable us to tackle complex supply chain and logistical challenges requiring purpose-built solutions and data analysis.


The DevOps Manager at Blue Apron will be for the management, evolution, and growth of our DevOps team, our automated cloud infrastructure, and security policies and procedures.


Responsibilities



  • Manage the infrastructure of our public-facing website as well as the internal systems we build for various teams across the company.

  • Manage a team of talented DevOps engineers, holding regular one-on-one sessions.

  • Partner with recruiting to lead hiring for the DevOps team.

  • Ensure a scalable process and infrastructure, with a focus on high availability.

  • Implement configuration and automation tools to simplify the process of deploying and upgrading software across our infrastructure.

  • Our stack and tooling: AWS,Chef, NGINX, PostgreSQL, Redis, Cloudformation, Ruby, Rails

jobs.title: Software Developer
jobs.content: We're looking for a developer to join our team. We're growing and need more hands! See our company page to see what type of work we do. Our environment is very fun and energetic, and you'll get the opportunity to work on quite a variety of projects. It's hard to narrow down the exact specifics of the position because we are somewhat flexible and like to use people in what they are best at and enjoy the most. Contact us and we'll give you all the clarity you could want on this!

jobs.title: iOS Engineer
jobs.content:
Forcefield, a company based in Los Angeles, is seeking a new member of the team located in the US to build iOS applications using Objective-C and Swift. Qualified individuals will be just as passionate about enhancing the user experience as they are about creating clean, efficient, and extensible code.


KEY RESPONSIBILITIES



  • Work with the development of three iOS applications

  • Collaborate with development team to come up with the best solutions for each project

  • Estimate relative work-effort of solutions

  • Manage time appropriately and communicate clearly (often in non-technical terms) to help manage work expectations

  • Ensure that new code is maintainable through code-reviews and providing feedback to other developers

jobs.title: Test Engineer
jobs.content:
Want to join the team of an EdTech company that’s helping build the future of higher education? We’re looking for a Test Engineer to join our growing team in New York City. While we prefer candidates from the greater New York metropolitan area, we’re also open to candidates who’d like to relocate to the city.


The Test Engineer sets exceptional quality standards and is responsible for creating customer satisfaction by assuring that panOpens delivers on its software functionality.


Our team uses Ruby (Rails), JavaScript, React.JS, PostgreSQL, CodeShip (CI), and our platform runs on AWS (EC2, S3, Route 53, RDS).



  • Be the owner/creator of an Automation Framework using open source technologies

  • Work directly engineering (Ruby) to ensuring proper Functional and Regression test coverage using tools like Selenium Webdriver, Cucumber, etc.

  • Perform any manual tests as required

  • Ensure that the testing and automation tools are incorporated into CodeShip

  • Collaborate with Product and Engineering on building out test strategies and clearly defining testing goals, before development begins, on any product features

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer
jobs.company: Office of the State Court Administrator, Colorado Judicial Department
jobs.content:
General Statement of Duties


The Senior Software Engineer is responsible for working on various projects such as case management systems, electronic filing systems, jury systems, and data exchanges with criminal justice agencies as well as various other state and local governmental agencies.  Work is conducted in small, agile teams to design, prototype, and build new software offerings and enhance existing software and tools.  The position will design, develop, and document application and framework code in Java, Spring, JQuery, JavaScript, HTML, and CSS.


Minimum Qualifications


To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each of the above essential functions satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, ability, physical and environmental conditions required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

jobs.title: Hadoop Performance Engineer
jobs.content:
CSC Big Data and Analytics is a high priority incubator unit with in the Emerging Business Group with focus on helping our customers accelerate their path to innovation through the introduction of breakthrough analytic, big data platform and data science consulting capabilities. We are currently looking for a Hadoop Engineer to join our team.



What you will do: 



  •  Performance Engineer will be responsible for analyzing existing Hadoop systems/Applications, making recommendations to improve performance, and possible implementing those recommendations.

  • Responsibilities will also include analyzing planned usage patterns for a Hadoop cluster and developing a set of hardware specifications to support the usage.

  • Document solutions for long term support

  • Travel to client site as needed

  • Assist client support team with Performance related issue resolution

jobs.title: Creative Junior Developer
jobs.content:
We are seeking a creative and motivated Junior Developer with promising talent in front and/or back-end web development. You must have a passion for development and a strong desire to learn and grow.


You will assist our team in building, maintaining, and expanding our suite of digital products. You will work directly with our lead developer, as well as our sales and support teams. 


Your primary responsibility will be fielding internal requests or issues from team members, assessing common challenges of users, and then devising and implementing solutions in the form of new tools, automated processes or documented procedures. 


Another responsibility will be to configure and deploy the front-end integrations and tools that our clients utilize on their own sites. 


As you become familiar with our technology stack, we'll create more responsibilities which match your strengths and interests. 


This is a contract / part-time position with a potential for full-time employment in the future.

jobs.title: Creative, Junior Developer
jobs.content:
We are seeking a creative and motivated Junior Developer with promising talent in front and/or back-end web development. You must have a passion for development and a strong desire to learn and grow.


You will assist our team in building, maintaining, and expanding our suite of digital products. You will work directly with our lead developer, as well as our sales and support teams. 


Your primary responsibility will be fielding internal requests or issues from team members, assessing common challenges of users, and then devising and implementing solutions in the form of new tools, automated processes or documented procedures.

jobs.title: Software Developer
jobs.content:
Position Overview:


The Software Developer is responsible for developing, modifying, and maintaining software applications and components. This position provides timely, accurate and quality code design and construction for Kuder products.


Essential Job Functions:



  • Develop code per specifications using specified programming languages, tools, and techniques.

  • Implement, maintain and test new and existing software modules and applications.

  • Complete development work for all assigned projects by established deadlines agreed to by both the client and project team members.

  • Store, retrieve, and manipulate data for analysis of system capabilities and requirements.

  • Identification and correction of defects in existing software systems.

  • Work with Development Team to determine specifications for functional requirements.

  • Provide analysis for technical solutions based on functional requirements.

  • Investigation and development of skills in new software technologies.

  • Creation of technical specifications, test plans, and operational guides.

jobs.title: Software Engineer
jobs.content:
As a part of a rapidly evolving team, you will help develop 21st Century software systems to design, build and operate space vehicles. Using the latest technologies, you will build systems that will become the foundation of a company that is doing things for which no blueprint exists.

We are designing systems that track millions of physical parts (both on Earth and off), complex manufacturing activities in remote locations, systems that process massive amounts of data and engineering tools that enable rapid design and iteration. We seek software engineers of all backgrounds who are passionate about space and possess a strong desire to serve on a team that is the backbone of the company.

As a member of our team, you will work with:



  • Highly complex graph databases

  • 3-D visualizations

  • The latest UI development frameworks

  • Systems that integrate with physical hardware

  • Backend distributed systems

  • Cloud computing platforms



You’ll have a hand in all levels of the development stack, from gathering requirements to architecting systems to writing code to supporting users during operation. We’ll give you top-notch development hardware and drop you into a high-performing team so you can contribute immediately via direct interaction with our customers, which begins on day one.

Responsibilities



  • Work with customers to understand requirements and translate into system requirements and designs

  • Design, develop and support mission critical back-end systems

  • Design and develop rich user experiences that will be used on a daily basis all throughout the company

  • Evaluate, integrate and extend commercial products using industry standard integration approaches, e.g. REST services, enterprise service buses, web services and message queues

  • Think outside the box. Challenge why things were done a certain way in the past and figure out how we can do things better

jobs.title: Backend Engineer
jobs.content:
Overview


We’re looking for smart, driven and self-motivated Software Engineers to help build and scale our backend platforms as we evolve into a Men’s Grooming company. Our backend platforms power our consumer-facing website & mobile apps, our subscription billing & fulfillment systems, our marketing automation system and our internal apps. Our application platform is primarily Ruby on Rails, with a bit of Node.js, Python and Go for a few components. As a software engineer you will be helping build new features, expand existing capabilities and help scale the platform to accommodate our rapidly growing customer base.

What We’re Looking For




  • Self-motivation: You need to be a self-starter who’s proactive about using technology to solve the problem at hand.




  • A fast learner: We are not looking for specific experience with our tech stack - just the willingness and sufficient experience (with an equivalent stack) to pick it up fast.




  • An eager collaborator: We work in small cross-functional groups and expect engineers to actively participate and collaborate in charting the course of a project, while working closely with our architects.




  • Proficiency in at least one web framework in Ruby, Node.js, Python or PHP.






  • Proficiency in relational database schema design. We use MySQL & Postgres.




  • Experience designing RESTful APIs.




  • Domain knowledge of billing systems, fulfillment systems and/or marketing automation is a big plus.




  • Prior experience with a high-volume application is a big plus.

jobs.title: Software Developer
jobs.content:
What you'll do:


As a Software Developer on our fast-growing Agile team, you will design and implement solutions for our back-end, mission-critical data processing platform. In addition to developing new features, you will also help to reengineer our legacy codebase to a modern, testable, and maintainable platform.



  • Work with an experienced team leveraging SCRUM techniques and build software in C#

  • Design and implement internal and external APIs

  • Code and support web-based applications to support internal clients

  • Write automated unit tests using TDD and BDD techniques

  • Design performant software that will scale as our volumes increase

  • Profile and measure software performance

jobs.title: Mid-Senior Android Developer
jobs.content: Are you an excellent problem solver, communicator, and mentor? We are looking for on-site, architect-level software engineers to design client solutions, develop frameworks, and guide a development team in implementing solutions. We are looking for someone who has a solid understanding of the fundamentals of software development, with an ability to deliver an immersive experience through elegant, clean code.  This position offers the opportunity to work in a unique dev department with proven methods and philosophies, where building software is craft.  Tonic will not sponsor applicants for work visas.

jobs.title: Principal Architect I
jobs.content:
Principal Architect I
Shape the future of SaaS architecture


If you want to take the front seat in shaping future architecture of Software as a Service (SaaS) come and join us at Concur!


Be a part of R&D organization setting standards for new development and deployment models, and enabling development teams to migrate legacy systems into future. Concur delivers its vision of the Perfect Trip to customers by empowering developers to build their own vision of a perfect career in a friendly, collaborative, and agile team environment.



In the first 12 months you will:



Design and build Java framework to provide utilities, flow and platform for development of new features and services
Prototype and provide path of migrating legacy code (Progress 4GL) to Java
Enhance the technology behind Concur’s Travel, Expense, Invoice, Analytics, and Government stacks
Work with your team and product managers to identify problems that can be solved as we transition from legacy n-tiered architectures into a modern service-oriented, microservices-based approach
Grow the community and practice of architecture across Concur and facilitate information sharing, adoption of design patterns, and cross-pollination of ideas between teams in R&D organization
Become a liaison between the Concur Government R&D and other Concur/SAP R&D teams



In order to accomplish this you will need to:


Have solid grounding in computer science fundamentals, especially hands-on experiences working at consumer-facing software-as-a-service providers and utilization of public cloud infrastructures
Knowledge of state of the art techniques fundamental to enterprise architecture, as well as demonstrated leadership in transforming organizations’ infrastructures
Gain complex product functionality and architecture knowledge
Use computer programming languages, software tools, and software development environments to code, modify, and prototype programs
Participate in company-wide initiatives to develop design patterns, and champion them on the relevant R&D teams
Provide feedback on functionality requests regarding feasibility and complexity
Actively participate in code and design reviews
Construct Java microservice development/packaging/continuous integration/deployment environment and flow with GitHub/Docker/Kubernetes or similar tools
Have results driven personality, high enthusiasm, energy, and confidence

jobs.title: Web Developer
jobs.content:
What you'll do:


Billtrust is seeking a Associate Web Developer (Angular) to join our engineering organization tasked with building and supporting features for our Cash Application platforms. You will leverage skills in software design, coding and deployment as a member of a fast-paced SCRUM team, and collaborate cross-functionally to determine feasibility of design, ensure code quality and deliver releases.



  • Code, implement and support high-quality software solutions

  • Work with SCRUM team to deliver 100% of our Quarterly releases on-time

  • Improve and build upon existing unit test libraries

  • Build highly-scalable software solutions that will improve overall page load performance

jobs.title: Software Development Engineer - Android
jobs.content:
The Android team is looking for a passionate new team member to join us as we disrupt the local mobile marketplace. Each developer on the team is responsible for all aspects of our native Android application from new features to tracking performance. As an Android team member, you will be expected to not only build new features, but also participate in how to solve new and upcoming challenges. You share our passion for design and have a strong background in mobile development.


RESPONSIBILITIES:



  • You will create new features and perform maintenance of the OfferUp Android application

  • You will participate in design and code reviews

  • Collaborate with designers, product owners and other developers to generate success

  • Craft outstanding Android code

jobs.title: System / Application Administrator
jobs.content:
Do you love architecting infrastructure of multi-tier software applications, tuning the largest hardware around and troubleshooting complex networks?  Are you excited to learn new skills and grow your knowledge beyond applications and/or systems administration? Then apply to join EcoSys as a System / Application Administrator!



  • Work with a dynamic team to figure out the best ways to ensure performance of our product line in a wide variety of environments.  You’ll work on a daily basis with customer support, quality assurance, software developers, professional services, business analysts, and project stakeholders in a COTS Software Product implementation environment.

  • Grow your knowledge of application architecture, network and systems engineering, relational databases, storage technology, and horizontal and vertical scalability.  Get trained in areas that are new to you while helping to mentor your teammates in areas where you’re already an expert.

  • High visibility for project successes:  you’ll play the lead role on managing and executing performance projects across the wide array of Fortune-1000 customers.

jobs.title: Senior Full Stack Java Developer
jobs.content:
Informz Inc. is a company that provides software development as a service.


We are currently seeking a Full Stack Java Developer that is fluent in both Spring Boot and AngularJS to be a technical resource for the development of a supply side media platform.


At Informz, you are part of a company that values your work and gives you the tools you need to succeed. While our headquarters are located in Saratoga Springs, New York, we are a distributed team of remote developers across the US.


Informz provides competitive compensation and excellent benefits.


Core responsibilities:



  • Understand our client's fast-moving business requirements

  • Negotiate appropriate solutions with multiple stake-holders

  • Write and maintain complex, Enterprise ready software 

  • Build web applications using AngularJS and Spring Boot

  • Build Microservices that connect to Oracle and Hadoop

  • Manage the complete software development lifecycle

  • Work with Jenkins to perform continuous integration

  • Collaborate with other teams in order to deliver a highly performant application that contains little or no defects

  • Identify new opportunities, tools, and services to enhance the custom software platform

  • Support and troubleshoot issues (process & system), identify root cause, and proactively recommend sustainable corrective actions

jobs.title: Information Analyst - DevOps Engineer
jobs.content:
Our Exciting Work Environment

This position will be based out of Delaware North’s new global headquarters building- an iconic 12-story glass walled structure on the corner of Delaware and Chippewa. The headquarters integrates the latest advances in environmental, energy conservation and office design and features cutting-edge technology equipment including completely wireless work stations. This Delaware North initiative is a win-win for the community – it adds a new world-class building to Buffalo’s cityscape, enhances community renewal, restores a contaminated brownfield, and provides a substantial economic impact for the city. Picture yourself here in this brand new, modern office space with access to state-of-the-art systems and working with an extraordinary team!


The Opportunity

The DevOps Engineer will work closely with our Business and IT Operations team to identify and specify opportunities for automation of systems in a highly resilient manner.



  • Identification of requirements and participate in various exercises to design a technical solution as well as participate in the implementation with internal team mates and vendors.



  • Develop integration tests and work with Quality Engineers to validate solution acceptance criteria.



  • Keep the lines of communication open with internal clients regarding solution status and address technical blockers that may arise.



  • Develop integration tests and work with Quality Engineers to validate solution acceptance criteria.



  • Assisting with implementation, testing and support of applications and integrated solutions.



  • Maintain regulatory compliance of applications and environment.



  • All other duties as assigned.

jobs.title: Software developers of all skillsets and levels
jobs.content:
We’re looking for developers of all skill levels. We are a Ruby on Rails shop, but we’re open to accepting any talent with great potential. It doesn’t matter what tech stack you know. We’re looking for a good skill base and we’ll teach you the rest.


We are looking for:



  • Junior and intermediate developers willing to relocate or already living in Victoria, BC.

  • Senior developers for remote work or willing to relocate or already living in Victoria, BC.


We look for three important skills in all of our hires:



  1. The capacity to learn and then apply that knowledge in real life.

  2. The ability to work well in a team and also on your own.

  3. Good communication skills.


Please submit a link to your GitHub account with your resume when you apply.


We thank all of our applicants for applying, however only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

jobs.title: Information Analyst - Solutions Engineer
jobs.content:
Our Exciting Work Environment


This position will be based out of Delaware North’s new global headquarters building- an iconic 12-story glass walled structure on the corner of Delaware and Chippewa. The headquarters integrates the latest advances in environmental, energy conservation and office design and features cutting-edge technology equipment including completely wireless work stations.  This Delaware North initiative is a win-win for the community – it adds a new world-class building to Buffalo’s cityscape, enhances community renewal, restores a contaminated brownfield, and provides a substantial economic impact for the city.  Picture yourself here in this brand new, modern office space with access to state-of-the-art systems and working with an extraordinary team!


The Opportunity


Research, definition, development, recommendation and implementation of large & complex Delaware North IT solutions.  This includes understanding the architecture of a solution, piloting, first time implementation, documentation and standardization for repeatable deployment.  The focus of this position will be all DN’s major POS, PMS and payment systems and includes but is not limited to interfaces, integration, mobile & web technology, and cloud technology solutions.



  • The Solutions Engineer follows the standard for system implementation, support, change management & development lifecycles.  This includes having programming & development knowledge & ability.



  • Additionally this role serves as Level III engineer support requiring a deeper knowledge of systems or development.  This person assists with management of the vendor development space for work as well.



  • Provides input in order to maintain currency and compliance of system environments – keeping current of changes for vendor, security and platform releases.



  • Follows change and incident management processes.



  • Project Assistant/Coordinator for new and existing projects.  Effective communication internally to team, management and vendors.  



  • Technical definition, development, delivery, and evolution of large and complex projects.



  • Assisting with implementation, testing and support of client POS applications and integrated solutions.



  • Maintain regulatory compliance of applications and environment.



  • All other duties as assigned.

jobs.title: Cloud and I&S - IT Engineer
jobs.content:
Req ID: 114391

Ericsson Overview

Ericsson is a world-leading provider of telecommunications equipment and services to mobile and fixed network operators. Over 1,000 networks in more than 180 countries use Ericsson equipment, and more than 40 percent of the world's mobile traffic passes through Ericsson networks. Using innovation to empower people, business and society, we are working towards the Networked Society, in which everything that can benefit from a connection will have one. At Ericsson, we apply our innovation to market-based solutions that empower people and society to help shape a more sustainable world.

We are truly a global company, working across borders in 175 countries, offering a diverse, performance-driven culture and an innovative and engaging environment where employees enhance their potential everyday. Our employees live our vision, core values and guiding principles. They share a passion to win and a high responsiveness to customer needs that in turn makes us a desirable partner to our clients. To ensure professional growth, Ericsson offers a stimulating work experience, continuous learning and growth opportunities that allow you to acquire the knowledge and skills necessary to reach your career goals.

Responsibilities

The key responsibilities of 2nd Level BSS Engineer are defined as below:

Service Delivery Coordination:

- Effectively plans executes activities in 2st level Assurance - Billing team in order to deliver according to the WLA in place and with customer expectations all service deliverables at the correct quality parameters, respecting all GSC processes in place;

- Acts as KPI & SLA Operational responsible (ticket life cycle responsible for the Billing area);

- Minimizes the service impact in case of technical issues that affect the customer’s network, both reactive and preventive;

- Supports Billing team in critical and high incidents, available also out of business hours (oncall duty)

- Responsible for Business Continuity procedures execution in Billing area

Knowledge Management:

- Responsible for knowledge transfer from 2nd Level Assurance – Billing towards 1st Level Assurance teams

- Checks and reviews new OPI-s from the technical and process point of view;

- Responsible for structuring and maintaining a unique repository with technical documentation for the Billing area; Drives and coordinates technical workshops with 1st Level Assurance teams

Good Knowledge in:

- 2nd Level Assurance Support Activities

- 2nd Level Incident Management

- Problem Management

- System Administration

- 2nd Level Billing Operations

Technical Competence

Technical:

- GSM & UMTS TELCO Architecture

- Troubleshooting/Problem Solving

- Solid production environment experience

- Trouble Ticket Management

- BSS system understanding would be a plus (DWH, CRM, Mediation

 Core:

- Solid work experience with any Billing system.

- Oracle DB (release 8i/9i/10i,g/11g) knowledge and administration

- PL/SQL and SQL Programming experience

- OS Unix/Linux (HP/Sun/Centos/RedHat) knowledge and administration

- programming language experience (Perl, Shell scripting, awk)

- TCP/IP protocols knowledge

Qualifications:

- Bachelor of Engineering in Telecommunication / Electronics or equivalent university degree

- MBA will be considered as merit

- Minimum 2 years with good BSS/Billing experience (vendor, operator, and technology-related industries). Person having knowledge of Oracle Billing & Revenue Management products will be preferred

- Good understanding of general BRM solutions for Mobile, Fixed and Converged platforms

- Knowledge of Post-paid, Prepaid, Converged Billing, Interconnect

- Strong knowledge of wireless technologies (call flow), related protocols and telecommunication standards like 3GPP

*LI-ML1

Ericsson provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, marital status, pregnancy, parental status, national origin, ethnic background, age, disability, political opinion, social status, veteran status, union membership or genetics.

Ericsson complies with applicable country, state and all local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location across the world in which the company has facilities. In addition, Ericsson supports the UN Guiding Principles for Business and Human Rights and the United Nations Global Compact.

This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, training and development.

Ericsson expressly prohibits any form of workplace harassment based on race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, marital status, pregnancy, parental status, national origin, ethnic background, age, disability, political opinion, social status, veteran status, union membership or genetic information.

Primary country and city: Romania (RO) || Bucharest || Bucharest || Consulting&SysInt IT; ProdMgt; R&D SalesStratMkt&ComMgt ServEng; SharedServ; Stud&YP Supply&Log

jobs.title: JavaScript Software Developer
jobs.content:
The developers at StateScape are a small, cohesive team that offer a supportive environment and that allows for great deal of independence. We are looking for a mid- to senior-level developer. This individual will get to experiment with interesting technology and regularly see their work enter production.


The key things we’re looking for in a new hire are excellent problem solving abilities as well as the technical skills to work with our JavaScript platform and existing environment. This technology is mission critical and will support daily operations across the company.


Our offices are located in Old Town Alexandria, VA. We offer a casual work environment with flexible hours, both in-office and remote. We offer a competitive salary and a comprehensive benefits package. StateScape provides free parking on-site and is within walking distance of the King Street Metro Station.

jobs.title: Software Engineer
jobs.content:
ProModel Corporation is looking for an experienced software developer with a desire to create web-based Line of Business (LOB) applications typically centered on predictive analytics, modeling and simulation.


What You’ll Do



  • You will be a part of a Scrum team composed of talented developers, testers, DBAs, server administrators, technical writers, business analysts, and a person that silkscreens t-shirts on the weekend. Your primary responsibility will be taking QA oriented stories. As you gain domain knowledge and experience, the expectation is for you take on developer oriented stories of increasing complexity.

  • You will develop high-quality, sophisticated features in various languages such as C#, HTML, JavaScript, SQL and Silverlight.

  • You will test what you develop. You will test what others develop.

  • You will solve problems -- the phrase “I don’t do windows” will never cross your lips.

  • You will help the team become a better team.

jobs.title: Java Backend Developer for CRM Software
jobs.content:
Job Description Software developers - are you looking for an opportunity to build a great career with a dynamic and growing company? Join our team at Momentum CRM!  At Momentum CRM, we provide state-of-the art proprietary CRM software along with customized support and training to help high-end auto dealerships to maximize their sales. Due to our continued growth, we are currently seeking top candidates for an open Back End Java Developer position at our location in Laguna Hills, CA


As Java Developer, you will play a major role in the continued development of our core back-end infrastructure and building integrations with our platform partners. More specifically, you will:



  • Spearhead and build integrations between our platform and leading DMS, OEM and other 3rd  party vendors

  • Build robust and scalable software in Java/J2EE and develop object-oriented software in Java

  • Design and develop services and system architecture for your projects

  • Create web services accessible by mobile/web platforms

  • Build Java-based back-end apps and REST API services

  • Improve our code quality through writing unit tests, automation and performing code reviews

  • Work seamlessly in an agile environment

  • Troubleshoot and debug technical issues

  • Pitch in and support other functions (e.g. product) as needed


Benefits  At Momentum CRM, you will be part of a vibrant and growing organization with a supportive and team-oriented small-business environment. Ours is a friendly and relaxed work atmosphere. We offer schedule flexibility and plenty of opportunities for professional development and advancement. Your hard work and professional dedication will be rewarded with competitive compensation and great benefits, including: , a really cool place to work, on campus Gym, Yoga and Ping-pong.


100% company-paid medical, dental, and vision insurance



  • Paid holidays

  • Week-long company-wide Christmas break

  • Vacation

  • Sick days

jobs.title: Lead Marketing Designer
jobs.content:
Heroku provides the fastest path for application developers to turn an idea into a production app of any scale. Heroku provides not only the fastest path to success, but the most beautiful one too, crafted with care, flair, and attention to detail.  Everything, from our web sites to our developer experience, is imbued with our design, our brand, and some sense of where we come from, and where we’re headed to.

In this role, you will be part of the Marketing Team at Heroku, which is responsible for most of the public facing aspects of Heroku – for projecting our brand and its design. You will be responsible for the design of all that Marketing owns: everything from web properties like www.heroku.com, signup, blog, and Dev Center, to online advertising and email marketing, as well as collateral like newsletters, t-shirts and yes, even socks. You will also be responsible for stewarding the brand — including educating and evangelizing, and implementing the design of most of these items. You will work within a dynamic marketing team, all the while collaborating with and representing the greater Heroku team.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Collaborate closely with the marketing and product design teams to build, extend and act as the guardians of the Heroku brand promise and marketing experience.
  • Amplify Heroku positioning while ensuring consistent, on-brand execution – everywhere.  Understand and represent both marketing and product initiatives.
  • Produce wireframes, storyboards and other material to help communicate research and prove the case for all new concepts and ideas.
  • Own the design of our marketing web properties.  Own extending, producing, and creating material to support product launches and other initiatives. Create design to support new services and functionality.  Be ready to iterate (and innovate) constantly.
  • Execute – create & build & deliver the designs for our sites, extend our designs for our sites, own & code the technical bits that make that design.
  • Manage external relationships to augment in house production (design sub-contractors, event agencies, printers, & production vendors) and work with cross-functional internal teams; Marketing Web Ops, Vibe, Languages, Product, and Design, all of whom collaborate closely to develop and successfully execute our marketing programs.
  • Effectively share ideas and designs with the team. Excellent written and spoken communication skills.
  • Managing extensive digital asset library of branded resource, art and templates so the wider team can self-serve, share and collaborate.
  • Conceptualize and execute collateral for external events and internal use by Heroku. Design items for swag, presentation templates, booth design, banners posters, and other digital and print materials.

Key Competencies:

  • Comfortable working in a fast paced, agile environment. Track-record of getting design work from draft to final in very few steps and iterating quickly after launch.
  • Fluent in HTML5 / CSS3 required.
  • Ability to work with Sass, JavaScript, git and the command line – all would be a plus.
  • Master of the craft and the tools. Fluent in Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign, Sketch and other key visual design tools. Animation skills a plus.
  • Ability to translate design and brand thoughts to clear input and direction.
  • 5+ years of proven, multi discipline design experience in a combination of high-tech, developer and b-to-c design teams.
  • Curiosity, creativity, and ambition. Expensive diploma or not, true talent isn’t always something that can be taught in school. True passion breeds “incredible.” Understanding of design principles and designing for marketing.
  • Proven ability to work within a distributed team.
  • Must own a rich portfolio of relevant work examples – online, print, events, packaging, typography, collateral, iconography, infographics etc. Video production skills and creating assets for online marketing earn bonus points.

jobs.title: Senior Compliance Program Manager
jobs.content:
Heroku’s security team is responsible for the overall security of the Heroku platform and infrastructure and for compliance with established security policies. We’re looking for a  dedicated and thorough program manager, who understands large cross-functional projects, to join the team.

Reporting to the head of trust for Heroku, the primary focus of this role will be that of program manager for our security and compliance journey. You should have a proven track record of program or project management experience and some familiarity with security, compliance and privacy frameworks such as HIPAA, PCI-DSS, SOX ITGC, ISO 27001, and SOC 2. You’ll need to be comfortable running large scale cross cutting projects which require parallel efforts from dozens of teams. You will work closely with engineering and product management and our compliance engineers to ensure timely delivery of all compliance projects. You will also be responsible for building our relationships with other compliance teams throughout the larger Salesforce family.

If you’re the right person for this job, you take a communicative and collaborative approach to program management. You know how to assess cost and risks, and you’re adept at guiding individual teams in striking a healthy balance between their needs and the needs of the larger program. You will partner with engineering to foster a deep understanding of the meaningful security work driving compliance requirements. You set a high standard in your own work, and also enjoy helping others with their project challenges.

Key Responsibilities: 

  • Manage the compliance programs for Heroku, including HIPAA and PCI efforts currently underway, SSAE 16, SOC and others as they come online.
  • Manage large cross-cutting security development projects
  • Coordinate with all project managers responsible for remediating compliance gaps
  • Manage the relationship with compliance teams throughout Salesforce
  • Drive Heroku’s compliance efforts, both in achieving new certifications and maintaining existing ones.
  • Guiding vision for evidence creation, validation, and assessment workflows.
  • Host customer security and compliance audits

Key competencies:

  • Program/project management experience on large cross-functional projects
  • Software industry knowledge of technical security certifications, such as PCI, HIPAA, SSAE/SOC, etc.
  • Able to work collaboratively across diverse engineering teams and products to meet organizational security goals.
  • Able to effectively communicate compliance and security requirements to diverse teams with differing priorities and experience levels.
  • Able to tailor program status information for the needs of various stakeholders by understanding how they’ll be able to most efficiently consume the information.
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills across multiple levels and functions.

Location:

Heroku is headquartered in San Francisco, California. Due to the training nature of this role, we’re seeking a candidate who will be able to work with us here for six months to one year. The security team is fully distributed and this position can convert to 100% remote after the candidate has ramped up on security fundamentals.

jobs.title: Lead Infrastructure Engineer (Data)
jobs.content:
We’re looking for passionate engineers who will join us in reinventing how databases are deployed, used, and protected.

The Department of Data is a team that provides performant data services in a highly dynamic environment. We manage one of the largest collections of databases in the world, and you could have an impact on the developers’ experiences by designing and implementing simple, intuitive workflows for running databases and interacting with their data.

In this role you will work directly on automating operations behind our database-as-a-service platforms, focused specifically on Cassandra operations. You will write tools to reliably operate thousands of servers including automated backups, disaster recovery, high availability  orchestration, monitoring systems, configuration management, security and much more. If you have experience operating Cassandra at scale, have passion for data storage and management, intuition for code maintainability, and care about making customers succeed, get in touch.

You should be familiar with Cassandra operations, and be excited to learn any of these skills:

  • Go, Ruby, Python and Bash
  • Amazon web services (EC2, S3, VPC, and so on)
  • Databases (PostgreSQL, MySQL, Redis, Cassandra and other NoSQL databases)
  • Unix tools and services
  • LXC containerization, Docker
  • Information security
  • RESTful API design and implementation
  • Distributed systems and service-oriented design

While most of the team is located in our San Francisco office, we are open to hiring someone who prefers to work remotely from locations with significant time zone overlap.

jobs.title: Senior Platform Engineer (Cedar)
jobs.content:
Heroku operates the world’s largest PaaS cloud, continuously delivering millions of apps with 6+ million container deployments, 5+ billion routing requests, and 10+ terabytes of application logs per day. Our vision is for developers to focus on their applications and leave operations to us.

Our team members each bring a personal area of expertise, such as containerization, networking, API development, HTTP routing, orchestration, AWS, etc, while also being versed in the entire system from a high level and responsible for its production development and operation. Within our team, engineers are comfortable moving between the technologies, from web app development to infrastructure services. If you don’t know how do something, we’ll make sure you have the time, mentors, and opportunity to learn.

We work in small groups who are heartfelt about our user’s problems. We plan weekly, chat daily, and work closely together. Our team is a remote community with members excited to work together on challenging distributed systems problems. Equality is a core value for Salesforce; it’s at the heart of everything we do and strive to be. That means Equal Opportunity, Equal Advancement and Equal Pay for all. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

We hope you are passionate about joining our community of engineers who love to learn, work, and operate a gigantic distributed system, build and sustain a remote culture, and help grow and mentor other engineers.

Your Responsibilities

  • Contribute throughout the full stack, from APIs and web applications to core infrastructure services
  • Develop and operate critical production applications written in Go, Erlang, Elixir, and Ruby
  • Serve on the team’s on-call rotation and respond to production incidents and investigations
  • Contribute to architectural design discussions and technical decisions
  • Ensure that we are continuously raising our standard of engineering excellence by implementing patterns for coding, testing, deploying and supporting

Your Capabilities

  • Proficiency developing in at least one of the following: Ruby, Go, Elixir, or Erlang
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills, including the ability to work effectively with geographically distributed teams and people of various backgrounds

Your Experience

  • Experience developing and operating highly scalable distributed systems
  • Familiarity with AWS (VPC, IAM, CloudFormation, EC2) and Heroku
  • Strong programming and operational experience in one of our domains. Examples include:
    • For Routing: HTTP, SSL, TLS, TCP, ELB, HAProxy, or Nginx
    • For Orchestration: Kubernetes, Mesos, Swarm, or Yarn
    • For Runtimes: LXC, Docker, or Linux
    • For Logging: Syslog, ELK stack, Hadoop, EMR, or Splunk

Bonus Points

  • Experience transitioning from apps to services including skills in NSQ, RabbitMQ, Kafka, Kinesis, Microservices
  • Would rather automate than operate
  • Front-end experience with Ember, Node.js, and HTML5/CSS
  • A good story about a problematic distributed system that you diagnosed and fixed

Location

Heroku is headquartered in San Francisco, California. For this position, we are open to candidates in locations with no more than a two hour time difference from the US Central timezone, given sufficient remote work experience.  This includes the majority of the Americas.

jobs.title: Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Job Overview:  The Software Engineer II is responsible to analysis, design, develop and test software solutions for the company’s products.  This position is also responsible to provide maintenance and support to existing code following company’s standards and best code practices. The Software Engineer II, with little help, will be able to abstract requirements to innovate solutions to enhance our products within our environment. 


We offer...



  • The opportunity to work for a well-established, industry leader in local government web design and introduce a highly marketable product that is changing the way citizens interact with their government

  • Competitive compensation, autonomy, workplace perks (free beverages, social events, etc.), and benefits (Health, Dental, 401k) 

  • An informal, "Google-esque", social workplace where enthusiasm and talent are rewarded

jobs.title: Software Solutions Architect
jobs.content:
We at simplesurance are building an innovative and unique cross-selling platform for insurance products. In 30 countries across the world, our technology is used by 1.000+ e-shops including world's biggest insurance companies and smartphone brands.


We are looking for experienced Software Solutions Architects (f/m) to solve design and scale challenges for our cloud based, micro service oriented architecture.


About the job



  • You will produce all the technical design specifications for the new features coming from the Product Team

  • You will create technical tasks for each development team, and prioritize them

  • You will be working in close contact with the QA team to create test specifications


With us…


…you have the chance to gain first experiences within the Start-Up world. With us, you’ll be working together with over 90 teammates from 17 different nations – we are quite multicultural and we love it. And when work should last longer than expected – dinner is on us!

jobs.title: Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Imaginary Landscape is seeking a full-time Software Engineer who will work on a technical team that specializes in building, deploying, and maintaining Django web applications.



About Us:



Imaginary Landscape is a web development agency that specializes in Django and Python.  We've been hard-core Python developers since 1998, and have been Djangonauts since 2006.  Over the years, we've built social networking sites, eCommerce sites, banking sites, hospital network sites, sites for startups, and more.  Our loft offices are in the Andersonville neighborhood on Chicago’s north side, the work atmosphere is relaxed and we offer strong benefits.  


About the Position:


You will frequently interact with Rackspace, AWS Cloud servers, Digital Ocean, and Heroku servers, as well as physical servers, in a variety of different server configurations and utilizing a variety of Linux-based operating systems.  You'll be using many modern web-dev tools, such as Nginx, PostgresSQL, MySQL, Redis, Memcached, Saltstack, Ansible, Fabric, Supervisord, Git, and more.  You'll have the opportunity to interact with numerous 3rd party APIs.  You may have opportunities to work with the latest front-end technologies, such as Node.js, Gulp/Grunt, React.js, Angular.js, etc.  And more specifically, you will become an expert in Django.  If you are excited by this, we'd be excited to speak with you!

jobs.title: SDE - AWS Application Engineer | Time Inc.
jobs.content: Cloud Application Engineer for the Ecommerce and Enterprise Solutions team will be responsible for development and enhancement of our enterprise applications and services both in the cloud and on premise. The candidate will be involved at every phase of the project lifecycle from requirements intake through delivery. The candidate will be able to architect solutions using DevOps methodologies including configuration management, continuous delivery, release management, TDD and container technologies.

jobs.title: Mid-level ASP.NET MVC C# web developer
jobs.content:
We work with a wide range of clients to design and build custom websites tailored to each project's requirements. We are a Chicago-based boutique firm with a reputation for creating easy-to-use and highly functional web-based solutions.


Join our team of talented designers and software developers and you will quickly become an active contributor with new and existing clients. Whether you're implementing a dynamic website based on our content management system, customizing our web-based association management system, or building a cool data visualization, you'll be working with fun and motivated colleagues, great clients, and making a difference with your software development and technology skills.


Qualifications



  • An interest in applying technology to solve real world problems

  • Self-motivated, independent, and capable of adapting to meet client needs

  • A good communicator (with colleagues and clients) and team player

  • Eagerness to learn from colleagues and to learn new technologies

  • Practical perspective and ability to balance innovation and productivity


About us



  • Chicago-based team of 15 software developers and designers

  • We've been solely focused on web development for 20 years

  • All members of our team work out of our loop office

  • Casual, creative, results-oriented work environment

  • Flexible work schedule

jobs.title: Sr. Ruby Software Developers
jobs.content:
PhishMe is seeking professional and experienced Rails developers to join its software engineering team.  Our product line is growing and constantly improving, so we need some really talented people who have worked well on Scrum teams and want to do so again to build truly world class software.


If adding features, extending capabilities, and actually delivering working and fully tested software excites you, then we want to talk with you!  We’re looking for software developers, not just coders.


The successful candidate will have professional work experience (internships or professional jobs held as a student are valid). This is a full-time position working for PhishMe, Inc in the Leesburg, VA office.




Successful Applicants Must Be:



  • A self-starter who is willing to take a task from gathering requirements to deployment and maintenance

  • Able to work effectively and be pragmatic as part of both collocated and remote teams in a dynamic business environment

  • Comfortable working independently or paired and is able to escalate problems when necessary

  • Able to communicate effectively in writing and orally.

  • Eager to learn and able to understand and apply new things relatively quickly

  • Willing to mentor and guide fellow team members kindly and constructively

  • Detail-oriented

  • Willing to work for eight solid hours per day where at least five overlap with 8am to 6pm EST

  • Available to work off-hours occasionally

  • Happy to travel occasionally for team meetings and events

jobs.title: React Developer / Web Designer
jobs.content:
We are looking for a passionate Software Engineer who eats, sleeps and breathes code.  The kind of person who dreams about perfectly encapsulated objects, elegant method signatures, and consistent indentation.  Are you hacking away on hobby projects on the weekend?  Do you contribute regularly to Open Source projects on GitHub?  You know who you are.  You couldn’t imagine doing anything else for a living.  We want to harness your passion to drive our business forward.


We have multiple development projects that we need to get over the finish line this year.  These projects include a Customer Portal, Back-End Administrative Dashboard, Feature-rich Scheduling App, Automated Workflow Engine, and a customized CRM/ERP implementation.  We’re a polyglot shop so you must have a wide variety of experiences from Windows to Linux and an assortment of software languages and technologies.  You must be able to pick up new skills quickly as things are constantly evolving and we like to stay on the cutting edge.


We need a sharp, creative, prolific front-end developer who specializes in React.js.  The components you develop will become the foundation for many dynamic and interactive web apps.  You must be up to date on ES6/7, Babel, Webpack, etc.  Also, a rock-solid understanding of the React Component lifecycle is a must, and you should be able to integrate 3rd-party libraries into this cycle in a Reactful way.  We want to make use of animations and transitions so in-depth knowledge of react-motion & gsap is essential.


The second half of this position is related to Web Design.  We need an artist to help us create beautiful websites with stunning CSS and custom graphics.  We are tired of the same templates that you see everywhere and want to differentiate ourselves with uniquely designed pages.  You'll need to leverage all the latest features of CSS to bring our applications to life.  We are always in need of custom graphics so you'll need to be able to sketch out ideas quickly and then translate those into gorgeous graphics and vector art using Adobe.

jobs.title: Programmer Analyst II
jobs.content:
Programmer Analyst II – Business Technologies Systems (BSD)


What IS Business Technologies Systems (BTS) Development does…


The IS BTS Development team is responsible for providing re-usable front-end components, libraries and services and the support needed to allow teams to deliver an integrated look and feel to our 12,000 branch teams. By researching technology advancements, we recommend and help implement solutions that fit Edward Jones' business needs. We're seeking an exceptionally talented person to provide full lifecycle systems development.


What you'll do …



  • Innovate – Proactively seek technical improvements and take the initiative to communicate and implement solutions

  • Lead – Stay informed of trends and provide technical leadership to others on systems development and design

  • Collaborate – Participate in and represent BTS Development in cross−functional groups across the IS division and the firm to continually advance the firm's technology solutions and take our systems to the next level

  • Strategize – Advise teams on the effective use of technology within the enterprise architecture tools, especially front-end technologies, methodologies, best practices, processes and standards

  • Design – Perform lead analyst role to design, develop, test and support complex enterprise applications using object-oriented analysis and design principles

  • Implement – Ensure tools and best practice processes are in place for technologies

  • Mentor – Provide guidance, training and mentorship on the business impact of the systems supported, technical systems design, development of best practices, and IS processes and tools

jobs.title: Product Engineer
jobs.content:
Alluvium is currently seeking a Product Engineer to join our team, and work directly with our world-class software engineers and data scientists to develop and deliver engaging products across a wide range of platforms and browsers.


We are a tight knit team and highly collaborative team where everyone is expected to participate in product development. Our Product Engineer will — among other things — travel with the team to customer on-sites to conduct user interviews and user-centric design sessions; develop wireframe UX/UI mockups for new product features and deployments; and, implement and revise web-based user interfaces and touch points.

jobs.title: Watson Cloud Developer
jobs.content:
Job Description


Ready to change the way the world works? IBM Watson is ushering in the next phase of Cognitive Computing and in doing so is tackling some of humanity’s most challenging problems - e.g. revolutionizing how doctors research cancer or transforming how businesses engage with their customers. We have an exciting opportunity for software engineers to join our fast growing, highly visible Watson North American development organization
As an IBM Watson Cloud developer you will bring Watson solutions and services to the cloud. The ideal candidate will be passionate about the potential of cloud computing, and about building elegant software solutions, customer centric products, and utilize agile development processes. We are looking for cloud developers who are motivated and successful in delivering high quality technology products/services in a high growth environment where priorities shift quickly. Sample of the types of experience we are looking for are: • Micro-Service Oriented Architecture  design/implementation 
• Large scale systems design/implementation 
• Software as a Service offerings 
• Cloud computing 
• Service registration and discovery 
• Distributed logging stack .. eg  ELK. (Elasticsearch, Logstash, Kibana) • Representational State Transfer (REST)ful services 
• Systems Development Java Distributed computing 
• Highly available systems, and performance engineering is an advantage. 
• Continuous Delivery  
• Distributed datastores: Casandra, Redis, ZooKeeper, Swift 
• Java web application development: front end and back end solutions. Java, jQuery, Dojo, CSS, Ajax, JMX, Servlets, SQL. 
• DevOps 
• Multi-tenancy design/implementation
• Deployment technology experience in areas such as containers, Docker, Kubernetes, Mesos
• Securing data in cloud environments



 Come join us on our journey...

jobs.title: SDE - Sr. DevOps Architect; Multimedia  | TimeInc.
jobs.content:
The successful candidate is passionate about building world-class tools for world-class photo and video content producers. As the Senior Multimedia DevOps engineer, you will be part of the team that is at the center of building the technology for Time Inc.’s photo and video asset management and workflow systems.



Responsibilities:
• Act as the primary engineer for the team, working to develop systems and user experiences for internal-facing products.
• Work with end users on resolving escalated issues on supported systems; participate in on-call rotation.
• Familiarity with asset management systems: SCC Mediaserver & Mediafactory, Mediabeacon.
• Develop against 3rd party APIs to integrate various internal systems; familiarity with Aspera Connect API.
• Create documentation regarding code deployment and support.
• Build dashboards for monitoring storage, memory, CPU on local Windows and Linux infrastructure, setup automation deployments of server updates and patches.

jobs.title: Web Developer, Harvard Law School
jobs.content:
The Harvard Library Innovation Lab (LIL) is looking for a dynamic and thoughtful developer that will contribute deeply to our web archiving effort, Perma.cc.

Located in the Harvard Law Library, LIL is a fun and collaborative lab working to make libraries better by exploring the countless, dimly lit pathways that connect libraries to the larger world. We are a small but active team of thinkers and doers. Please see our website at http://librarylab.law.harvard.edu to get a sense of our current projects and activities.

LIL’s projects can range from large to small, and can bring immediate benefit or prototype the future. A great deal of passion and creativity is required, as well as the ability to work collaboratively on long-term and short-term projects with a great team. A good design sense and user-centricity are important. Proficiency in JavaScript or Python is expected, and familiarity with web archiving tools and standards is helpful.

While broad collaboration is highly encouraged, this role will primarily direct energy into Perma.cc. Perma.cc has an exciting future and a tremendous amount of positive momentum.

•    Design, develop, test, and document enhancements to Perma.cc
•    Work with design experts to ensure that enhancements are highly usable and are visual gold
•    Be an endless stream of ideas - both good and bad
•    Have a bias for action – we expect you to build your good and bad ideas quickly. We think and we DO.
•    Collaborate and bring great energy to an existing team
•    Work closely with librarians in the Law School Library and the designers, developers, lawyers, and freewheeing minds in the Lab

jobs.title: [Senior Mobile Developer Android]

You will be working with a new dedicated team of engineers in Munich (no remote position!) building and improving our existing and future native mobile apps.

  • Design, implement and maintain Features for existing and future apps

  • Be a central contact point in the company for Android-related questions

jobs.title: Data Analyst
jobs.content:
PLEASE NOTE THIS ROLE IS BASED IN BANGKOK, THAILAND - full relocation and visa sponsorship provided.

Overview:

Agoda is the largest and fastest growing online hotel booking platform in Asia. And as a Priceline Group company, we are part of the largest online travel company in the world. We have the dynamism and short chain of command of a startup and the capital to make things happen. What's stopping you from getting in touch?

Bangkok: While it's 30°+ outside, our engineers don't sweat, knowing they have the coolest jobs out there. Working in one of the largest international Internet employers headquartered in Asia, your work has an impact on what we do around the globe.

We move fast - why wait ages to see your ideas go live? Work on tough challenges, safe in the knowledge that you are surrounded by people as smart as you are (if not smarter!) to help solve them. And while we're on the subject, Agoda people come from over 65 countries: It's an incredible technical creative melting pot.

Technology is not just what we do - it's at the heart of who we are. We put cutting-edge technology in your hands so you can help us change the way people run their lives. We want you to come here so they can get there - and get your career going places, too.

Responsibilities:
  • Provide problems and analysis results with valuable insights for management
  • Work closely with Business to identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets using different techniques and tools such as R studio or Tableau
  • Analyze and optimize data usage, and precise for more data capturing if needed
  • Propose actionable solutions and options to solve problems


Qualifications:
  • Bachelor Degree in Computer Science/Statistics/Math or Engineering
  • At least 3-years in Data Analyst position or otherwise in projects involving big data
  • Proficient in business intelligence tools and data warehouse i.e. T-SQL commands, Tableau and MS Excel
