jobs.title: Software Engineer
jobs.content:
We are expanding our product  engineering team and looking for high level contributors. Are you looking to work on a smart team where you can both learn and share?

At Kissmetrics, we’re solving hard problems with simple solutions that make our customers happy. We’re creating an analytics and conversion platform that helps marketers drive conversions. And we’re having fun doing it.

jobs.title: Software Engineer - Cloud Foundry - Santa Monica
jobs.content:
The Cloud Foundry engineering team is looking for a few great engineers to join us in building an open source platform that transforms how the world deploys and scales software.


Watch this short video from the engineers at Pivotal!


You
 
You love shipping features, but know that well factored code is what lets you keep shipping features in the long run.  Maybe you get antsy writing code without tests, or perhaps you’re a large-scale system operator interested in leveling-up your coding skills.
 
Either way, you judge your success by the success of your team; you are interested in learning about distributed systems; and you are excited to work on open source.
 
Us
 
At Pivotal Cloud Foundry we are opinionated about how software should be built. We pair program, all-day every-day, because we know it delivers remarkable results. We work in small teams, and rotate between them frequently. We believe in working at a sustainable pace – you’ll typically code hard for 8 hours each day, but then you’re off work to relax, recharge, and refocus.
 
Where


To make sure you start your day energized, we provide a catered breakfast every weekday morning, and unlimited snacks/drinks are of course available all day. Our collaborative, open-plan office space is filled with talented, like-minded engineers who enjoy taking advantage of our weekly Tech Talks, playing ping pong, and hanging out with their co-workers.

We’re seeking more amazing developers to add to our team. Apply by sending us a resume and a cover letter.
 
Desired Skills/ Experience:
      Operations or Systems Administration experience, particularly on UNIX. (You know what a daemon is and how to restart one. When the daemon won’t start because some other process is listening on the port it needs, you can find and kill the errant process.)
      Experience and/or interest in Test Driven Development (TDD) and agile methodologies
      Ability to dive into a polyglot codebase and contribute while learning
      BA/BS in Computer Science or related field, or equivalent experience
 
 
We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

jobs.title: Front End Developer
jobs.content:
PeopleDoc is seeking a Developer to join our front end team.  This small but important team is responsible for designing and implementing UX and UI across our solutions.


 Based in Paris, or able to telecommute (European timezones only), the successful candidate will have experience building modern web applications and working with other developers towards shared goals.  He / She will be skilled in writing production grade HTML and CSS, be familiar with front end tooling (such as Grunt and Make), and have experience working with Git or other similar version control systems.  Knowledge of JavaScript and CSS preprocessors is advantageous.


 Candidates with experience working on large CSS code-bases, or those who have investigated various CSS methodologies (BEM, SMACSS, etc.) will be viewed favorably.


 As a member of the team, the developer will be responsible for integrating new front end code into existing systems, fixing production bugs and rolling out new user interfaces.


About the Position:



  • Developing, reviewing and testing new UI components (HTML, SCSS, JS)

  • Working with product owners and back-end developers to integrate front-end code into existing product codebases

  • Supporting the team by triaging bugs and implementing new UIs

jobs.title: Sr Software Engineer - HERE - Java, AWS, Big Data
jobs.content: The research, architecture, and systems engineering team in HERE’s traffic and dynamic content organization is looking for multiple software development engineers to help drive the development of new and innovative technologies for connected vehicles and smart cities.   Located in downtown Chicago, our team is responsible for identifying and creating the prototypes for future products and systems that shape the efficiency, safety, and performance of delivering the dynamic content relevant to tomorrow’s vehicles.  We are expanding and this is a great opportunity for experienced and motivated software development engineers who have a proven track record with creating large scale highly reliable systems to contribute.

jobs.title: Software Developer
jobs.content:
Job Description:


PeopleDoc is looking for experienced and talented web developers who love working with Python, Django, JavaScript, ember.js. You will join a passionate and entrepreneurial team, and work in a very challenging environment in one of the fastest growing SaaS startup in the HR space.


Successful candidate will be able to:



  • Design and ship new features in collaboration with the Product & UX Team

  • Use your deep understanding of web technologies and APIs to advise on the system's architecture and improve our processes to get new code on production

  • Analyze, rethink and refactor the code to scale the application

  • Write unit, functional and performances tests

  • Push your code in production, optimize our deployment process

  • Contribute to our OpenSource Projects


What we bring to the table:



  • A passionate and welcoming team,

  • Team work is in our core values; we learn from each other by pair programming or via extensive code reviews

  • Double screens, supercharged PCs,

  • Croissants every monday,

  • 2 annual programming events sponsored,

  • Babyfoot, tennis table and PS4 for the lunch break

  • Open to remote workers

jobs.title: Sales Development Representative
jobs.content:
About PulsePoint

PulsePoint™ is a next-gen advertising technology platform that fuses the science of programmatic targeting, distribution and optimization with the art of content marketing. Our platform is powered by terabytes of impression-level data, allowing brands to efficiently engage the right audiences at scale while helping publishers increase yield through actionable insights.


We have built a platform that will radically change the way brands distribute their digital content and we are looking for talented individuals to expand our North American Sales team. Sales Development Representatives (SDRs) are responsible for identifying and creating new qualified sales opportunities for their enterprise sellers. The SDR is responsible for prospecting activities, qualifying active buying interest and developing opportunities.

 As an SDR you will work closely with the team responsible for bringing in new customers to our corporate sales team. This is a collaborative effort integrating the work of marketing, sales, and sales development in an effort to rapidly increase the volume and improve the quality of new business for our company. 

This is a great opportunity to gain an education in digital advertising and accelerate your sales career. Our SDRs will work closely with our existing team to help build an exceptional department and set a new standard of excellence as we continue our growth.

 

What you’ll be doing:

  • Source new business by presenting PulsePoint’s Content Marketing Platform on a consistent basis
  • Build an intimate understanding of PulsePoint’s Content Marketing Platform in the industry
  • Develop and execute sales strategy in dynamic small team environment
  • Reach and exceed aggressive KPIs consisting of outbound phone calls, emails, and pitches

What you’ll need:

  • 1 to 3 years relevant work experience
  • A Bachelor’s Degree is required
  • Basic understanding of fundamentals of online advertising processes and technology
  • Exceptional communication skills (both verbal and written)
  • Tenacity, and ability to “think on your feet”
  • Comfort in a start-up environment
  • Strong attention to detail and ability to QA own work

What you’ll get:

  • Sane work hours (with flexible scheduling)
  • Competitive Salary & 401K Plan Match
  • Generous paid vacation (we consider your birthday a holiday)
  • Sabbatical at 5 years of employment
  • Annual Company Retreat
  • Weekly team lunches and monthly Happy Hour parties
  • Professional training and industry membership access
  • Indoor dart wars, and Ping-Pong Tournaments

jobs.title: Software Engineer (backend)
jobs.content:
Company Description

AOL’s Identity Engineering Team provides the authentication, registration and account management functions and features used across most of the AOL-owned products.  In addition to providing these capabilities, the team tracks, identifies and mitigates abusive activity against AOL user accounts. This role will provide exposure to experts in online security who can help to teach and mentor you. This will allow you to then share this knowledge with other development groups who are implementing mobile, web and desktop applications while you continue to grow your own skills.


Job Description

Role Summary

As a Software Engineer, you will be involved in resolving complex issues, designing and implementing applications and user experiences at scale to support various online brands. You will collaborate with other teams, to aid them in leveraging features you build and developing ways to incorporate them with web, mobile and desktop products. This position has a direct impact on improving new products’ time to market, online identity management and security capabilities for our customers. We’re seeking a candidate who is committed to improving processes, solving problems and growing their engineering skills. The right person will be hungry to learn more about software development from their direct team, as well as sharing their own experience and expertise with other developers.

Qualifications

Bachelors degree in Computer Science or higher degree

Collaboration and communication with internal technology and product team members.

Experience building and working on web applications and public facing APIs.

Experience with Java, Spring, No SQL Db 

Experience with build and CI tools like Grunt, Gulp, Jenkins, Sonar, Maven, etc.

Some general application security fundamentals is a plus.

Ability to communicate with both technical and non-technical customers.

Be part of the team, while having the freedom to manage your workload independently.

Additional Information

AOL is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of age, color, disability, marital status, national origin, race, religion, sex, sexual orientation, veteran status or any other classification prescribed by applicable law.

jobs.title: Accounting Manager
jobs.content:
Responsibilities
  • Supervise accounting staff on daily tasks
  • Provide training to new and existing staff as needed.
  • Ensure an accurate and timely month end close by providing leadership and support to the accounting close process. This role includes serving as a hands-on team member responsible for performing and reviewing transactions.
  • Assist with daily banking requirements. Monitor and forecast cash position
  • Establish and enforce proper accounting policies and principles
  • Assist in development and implementation of new procedures to enhance the workflow of the department.
  • Responds to inquiries from the CFO, Controller, and company wide managers regarding financial results, special reporting requests and the like.
  • Assist in preparing for and managing annual external audit. Coordinate with other auditors as needed.
  • Support overall department goals and objectives
  • This person will initially coordinate third party providers as an individual contributor. Over time this person will be expected to build and manage a team.
Requirements
  • MUST:  Proven work experience as an Accounting Manager or similar leadership role.
  • Ability to contribute to the career development of staff and a culture of teamwork
  • Strong working knowledge of GAAP principles and financial statements
  • MUST: Must have experience with Netsuite
  • Proficient with excel and google sheets
  • MUST:  Must have multiple entity consolidation entry experience with International tax experience preferred.
  • Detail-oriented, self-directed and able to effectively complete tasks with minimal supervision
  • Proficiency with GitLab
  • You share our values, and work in accordance with those values.

To apply: Visit our team page and click on the "apply" button.

jobs.title: Manager of Application Development
jobs.content:
We’re looking for a leader within engineering to build cutting edge cloud applications to revolutionize the world of content marketing and enterprise software. Desired applicant will wear the hats of both a well-rounded senior hands-on engineer and a leader for fellow engineers. This role will be responsible for technical design, new feature development, working with UX designers, researching and evaluating new technology, and maintaining a well-tested and high quality software codebase. Individuals that succeed at NewsCred are intelligent, highly motivated, fearless team players capable of working in an agile environment. They are proven self-starters and quick learners. We have a passion for technology but are not dogmatic. We use Node.js, Angular.js, MongoDB, Python, Solr, MySQL, and a number of big data analytics tools.


We are looking for strong technical leaders who:



  • Are eager for opportunities to mentor and teach.

  • Thrive in an autonomous, high energy environment.

  • Enjoy pairing with team members to produce innovative solutions.

  • Care about efficient code, beautiful algorithms, fearless refactoring, and iterative development.

  • Love to delight users.


What you’ll do:



  • Provide technical leadership to the development team

  • Evangelize great practices across teams

  • Work closely with product owners, designers, agile coaches and developers in a dynamic, agile environment innovating on new products and features

  • Design and develop software collaboratively in a pair-programming environment

  • Continuously deploy high quality software to customers

  • Design and architect solutions focused on performance, scalability and high availability

jobs.title: Sr. UX Engineer - Voice
jobs.content:
As a full stack engineer on the Programmable Voice team at Twilio, you will be responsible for creating compelling web experiences for Programmable Voice.

About the job:


You will define the interactions that developers both external and internal have with Twilio’s expanding Programmable Voice product and create new dashboards and analytics to convey user-critical information. The interfaces that you build will be relied upon by Twilio’s largest customers on a daily basis, and you will continually expand and refine the experience to meet our customers' changing needs. 


Responsibilities:



  • Develop and maintain the backbone of our web framework to support the Programmable Voice product line.

  • Own your production infrastructure end-to-end.  You’ll deploy your own code multiple times a week.

  • Work directly with product and engineering management to define, architect, and build new customer-facing features.  At Twilio, product roadmaps are a team sport.

  • Write quality, maintainable code with extensive test coverage in a fast-paced professional software engineering environment.

  • Influence cross team initiatives and mentor junior engineers.

jobs.title: Software Engineer - C++/C#
jobs.content: Help us develop the next generation of our industry-leading, physiology-based credibility assessment software, which is utilized by government agencies and thousands of users worldwide in multiple languages.  This position is a ground floor opportunity to redesign our existing commercial Microsoft Windows application to incorporate leading-edge technologies that allow our software to fully utilize Windows 10 running on computers in all forms to include laptops, desktops, tablets, and other mobile devices.  The current system provides an extensive user interface and performs functions such as data acquisition, data display, automated data analysis, audio/video recording, and automated report generation.  Our system has appeared on television programs such as Myth Busters, Dr. Phil, and numerous others and is routinely referenced in the media.  Join us for this unique opportunity!

jobs.title: DevOps Engineer
jobs.content:
When it comes to modern day software development, you will have your finger on the pulse of the entire pipeline. You will need to be comfortable interfacing with various software components and always considering how best to deliver in a rapidly iterative fashion with a strong focus on service availability, scalability and resilience.


DevOps is as much about communication and business relationships as it is about any of the software or tools you will use.


Duties & Responsibilities


As a New Context DevOps Engineer you will be expected to provide technical leadership with a hands-on approach. On a daily basis you will be interfacing with our clients and other New Context staff members while working from the New Context office, at client sites or from your home. Expect to heavily leverage open source software to tackle challenges like delivery of highly secured containers to IoT devices or building Big Data ecosystems at petabyte scale and beyond.


The team works well together, but also understands that sometimes they go rogue to motivate the group into being effective. Your most important daily responsibilities: have fun, lead by example and solve exciting challenges.


Qualifications



  • Seasoned Technical Veteran


    • We are looking for a team member with 5+ years of experience in a similar role that can demonstrate they have already learned how to excel in this role.

    • Experience with highly available and high-performance open source web technologies

    • Existing familiarity (or the eagerness to learn) Ruby and/or Python is helpful, given they are the common languages of systems automation.


  • Strong communication skills


    • You must be ready to communicate current status in an effective and professional manner.


  • Independent worker


    • Work may often require direct interaction with clients or team members without direct supervision. You must be able to think on your feet, communicate constantly and professionally, and above all else meet the expectations of our clients.


  • Calm and professional demeanor


    • This is critical! You will be faced with frustrated clients, team members and situations. You must be able to handle yourself in a professional manner and find the best course of action to take in order to please the client as much as is possible.

jobs.title: Senior DevOps
jobs.content:
DialogTech (formerly Ifbyphone) provides the only platform for end-to-end call attribution and conversion essential for data-driven marketers. DialogTech’s platform solves one of the most pressing challenges in today’s mobile-first world by eliminating the black hole inbound calls create in understanding true marketing performance.


Thanks to smartphones, consumers are calling businesses to engage in conversation at record rates throughout every stage of the customer journey, and at DialogTech we are changing the world of voice communication for our customers.  We enable our customers to better attribute their voice interactions at each stage of the marketing and sales processes and more quickly convert those calls to sales.


Looking for a team member that is passionate about building highly scalable and reliable systems, and relentless about driving continuous improvement. You will be part of a multi-location team developing web, analytics, and telephony systems.


This role is located in our Independence, OH office, with convenient access from both Cleveland and Akron.

jobs.title: Software Engineer, Android Applications
jobs.content:
Since its inception, Google has built products that change the way people all over the world live and access information - looking up recipes, finding their favorite song, turn-by-turn directions, checking their email, and so much more. How and where people view this information continues to change as the world becomes an increasingly mobile place.


As an Android Applications Software Engineer, you’ll drive new innovations and build beautiful user experiences on the largest mobile platform in the world. You’ll work with world-class mobile developers and resources to drive the next generation of apps at Google. Whether building native applications on Google’s core products and services - Search, Gmail, YouTube - or pioneering new visions - like Google Now on Tap, Android Wear, Cardboard - you’ll impact people’s lives wherever they interact with our products - in their homes, on the go, or someplace in between!


You will develop applications primarily in Java and using the Android SDK. You might design and develop open-source Android applications that are part of the Android Open Source Project or closed-source Google applications that are the interface to Google services on Android.


Google is and always will be an engineering company. We hire people with a broad set of technical skills who are ready to tackle some of technology's greatest challenges and make an impact on millions, if not billions, of users. At Google, engineers not only revolutionize search, they routinely work on massive scalability and storage solutions, large-scale applications and entirely new platforms for developers around the world. From AdWords to Chrome, Android to YouTube, Social to Local, Google engineers are changing the world one technological achievement after another.





Responsibilities




  • Design and implement new user-facing features in Google’s products.

  • Build the libraries and frameworks that support large, complex web applications like Gmail, Google Search and Google Maps.

  • Write scalable, performant server-side code. Build on top of our world-class infrastructure to create the services that support an amazing mobile experience.

jobs.title: Full Stack Developer - Learning, Teamwork, Humility, and Fun
jobs.content:
We're looking for software developers of all experience levels to join our Chicago-based team. We build complex and compelling web applications for clients in the health and well-being industry, utilizing our own software, Pepper. To best serve our clients, you'll delve into new subject matter every day, and you'll always be on the lookout for innovative ways to approach our software projects. We're looking for curious, collaborative people who are eager to teach what they already know and who jump at an opportunity to dive into new territory. 


Here's where you come in:


You'll join our cross-functional consulting teams in developing custom web applications for our clients. Our software is currently written with Java, the Spring Framework, Vaadin, HTML5, CSS (using Less), and a very heavy dose of JavaScript (primarily jQuery, Dojo, and Angular). You might have a greater interest in some of these technologies than others, but we're looking for people who want to make a well-rounded, full-stack contribution to every part of a project.


Since work is a huge part of your life, we want it to be interesting (new technologies, subject matter, and challenges) and fun (company outings, team sports, catered lunches, etc). Vodorians work hard, support each other, and walk away satisfied. We keep up with the latest technologies, tools, and tricks of the trade - we're always refining our approach, and everyone has a seat at the table.

jobs.title: Product Designer
jobs.content: Society of Grownups is hiring a Product Designer in Boston, MA

jobs.title: Full-Stack Developer
jobs.content:
We are searching for an outstanding web developer to be responsible for developing innovative, reusable Web-based tools for progressive online activism and community building. Our web developer/database administrator will work closely with our project managers, strategists and design team members to develop specifications and make recommendations on the use of new and emerging technologies. Programming, graphic design and database administration are all elements of this position. Responsibilities

  • Work closely with Project Managers and other members of the Development Team to both develop detailed specification documents, with clear project deliverables and timelines, and to ensure timely completion of deliverables.
  • Produce project estimates during the project process, including expertise required, total number of people required, total number of development hours required, etc.
  • Attend client meetings during the sales process and during development.
  • Work with Project Managers to build and refine graphic designs for websites. Must have strong skills in Photoshop, Fireworks, or equivalent application(s).
  • Convert raw images and layouts from a graphic designer into CSS/XHTML themes.
  • Determine appropriate architecture, and other technical solutions, and implement recommendations.
  • Communicate to the Project Manager with efficiency and accuracy any progress and/or delays. Engage in outside-the-box thinking to provide high value-of-service.
  • Alert colleagues to emerging technologies or applications and the opportunities to integrate them into operations and activities.
  • Be actively involved in and contribute regularly to the development community of the CMS of your choice.
  • Develop innovative, reusable Web-based tools for activism and community building. Required Skills
  • BS in computer science or a related field, or significant equivalent experience
  • 3 years minimum experience with HTML/XHTML, Javascript, Python and CSS
  • 2 years minimum Web programming experience, including ASP.net, Linux, and Apache
  • 1 year minimum experience working with relational database systems such as MySQL, MSSQL or Oracle and a good working knowledge of SQL
  • Development experience using extensible web authoring tools
  • Experience developing and implementing open source software projects
  • Self-starter with strong self-management skills
  • Ability to organize and manage multiple priorities

jobs.title: Web Application Engineer
jobs.content: We are looking for a passionate developer to be the next member of our small developer-owned company (everyone here writes code every day). The ideal candidate would have experience with Ruby or Rails, but this is not a requirement. Instead, we are looking for someone who has experience building production web applications and is as passionate about helping customers as they are about working with new technologies. We need a candidate that is confident and values freedom (we work 100% from home), but is humble enough to ask questions when they are stuck. We need a candidate who wants to build new things, but doesn’t mind rolling up their sleeves and doing some maintenance work. We know this is a hard mix to find, but if you feel like you’re up for the challenge, please get in touch!

jobs.title: Team Leader Software Developer
jobs.content:
The Team Leader of Software Developer manages a variety of subject matter experts including Software Engineers, DBAs, etc. They lead a specific team to support and maintain existing applications and development of new technical solutions.


What you’ll do:



  • Accomplish results by communicating job expectations; planning, monitoring, and appraising job results; coaching, counseling, and disciplining team members; initiating, coordinating, and enforcing systems, policies, and procedures

  • Maintain team by recruiting, selecting, orienting, and training team members; maintaining a safe and secure work environment; developing personal growth opportunities

  • Maintain effectiveness and efficiency by defining, delivering, and supporting strategic plans for implementing information technologies

  • Complete projects by coordinating resources and timetables with teams of focus

  • Verify application results by conducting system audits of technologies implemented

  • Recommend information technology strategies, policies, and procedures by evaluating organization outcomes; identifying problems; evaluating trends; anticipating requirements

  • Maintain professional and technical knowledge by attending educational workshops; reviewing professional publications; establishing personal networks; benchmarking state-of-the-art practices; participating in professional societies

  • Contribute to team effort by accomplishing related results as needed

jobs.title: Senior Front-End Engineer, Publisher Engineering
jobs.content:
Quantcast’s publisher engineering team is responsible for developing products to deliver valuable audience insights and products to publishers. As a Senior front-end Engineer you will help define the front-end architecture, and direction of the product. You will work closely with our Product Design team to bring their designs to life, while keeping your eye on the future with re-usability always at the front of mind.

The right applicant will thrive in an environment where independent decision-making based on product requirements is the norm. Individuals in this role be excited to see their user interface being used by customers, and spot usability and code issues before customers. You should be comfortable implementing APIs (in Java) that are required for a complete implementation of a user interface.


RESPONSIBILITIES



  • Work with your team to determine product direction and customer needs

  • Develop interactive user interfaces using modern frameworks (in particularly AngularJS)

  • Share knowledge and best practises amongst the publisher engineering team and the wider engineering team

  • Participate in a team-wide on-call rotation to keep the systems ticking along

jobs.title: Embedded Software Developer
jobs.content:
DESCRIPTION We’re looking for a focused & driven Senior Embedded Developer to be a key participant in creating the architecture, systems, and technologies that are core to Cirrent’s services. This person will be a key contributor to our embedded code base, and will work closely with our early customers to ensure their success.

REQUIREMENTS Cirrent demands the best. The successful candidate will be a hotshot coder, a thoughtful architect, a voracious learner, and an all-around smart person with a strong desire to succeed. Must have been a key contributor in a previous company and must have shown the ability to innovate, understand complex systems, and solve problems. The person should also have:

  • High-energy work habits
  • BS or MS in computer science or equivalent
  • Experience with embedded development for consumer products
  • Proven experience in a startup environment
  • Demonstrated ability to deliver highly robust and reliable products
  • Experience with connected products (preferably as a developer and a consumer!)

The person must be proficient with:

  • Embedded OS: embedded Wi-Fi development platforms from Qualcomm IoE, Broadcom WICED, TI, Marvel, and others; linux, micrium, VxWorks, and others
  • Embedded development: C, C++, python, java
  • Wireless: 802.11, 802.1x, OpenWRT, wpa supplicant, hostapd,
  • Networking: TCP/IP, dhcp,
  • Security: Public key cryptography

BENEFITS Competitive salary and equity. Excellent health, vision, and dental coverage. Great downtown San Mateo location and a fun work environment.

** Local candidates only **

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer, Prospecting
jobs.content:
The Prospecting team’s vision is to help our customers better understand their audiences and to deliver relevant advertising across all internet media. The team builds and operates real time prediction and control systems that power all our advertising products at scale. This means getting up-close and personal with cutting edge machine learning techniques and advertising delivery systems. You’ll have the opportunity to leverage Quantcast’s massive computing power to build tens of thousands of predictive models, use these models to make over 2 million advertising decisions per second, and deliver advertising to relevant audiences 24x7.

We are looking for top tier talent to solve day-to-day advertising campaign issues, identify opportunities to improve our machine learning and advertising delivery technologies, and implement those improvements to reach relevant audiences on behalf of our advertisers. We are interested in Senior Software Engineers with a strong production development background as well as a keen interest in data analysis, machine learning and control systems. You might have used one of our open source projects like QFS,or maybe you’ve read our blog post on how we manage the key-value distributed store using Keebler. If this sounds like you, join the team that’s building the next generation pacing services.

jobs.title: Exhibit Designer
jobs.content:
Southwest Displays and Events seeks to hire an entry-level to junior-level exhibit designer. This position gives the opportunity to work and grow as an exhibit designer with a full-service trade show exhibit and events company in Carrollton, Texas. The designer will work within the design department and work closely with the project management team to develop rental and custom exhibit concepts and solutions.

Responsibilities:
• Assist design director with all phases of exhibit concept development
• Work with project management group to develop and engineer rental exhibit solutions
• Create concept 3D renderings and design presentations.

Skills:
• Proficient with AutoCAD, and 3D design programs such as 3DS Max, FormZ, etc.
• Proficiency with Adobe CC (Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign, etc.)
• Good sketching/drawing skills
• Technologically and engineering savvy

Qualities:
• Bachelors or Associate degree in industrial design or related field
• 0-3 years design work experience
• Strong 3D visualization capability
• Ability to communicate concepts and ideas visually/verbally
• Strong sense of design/eye for detail and making beauty out of pieces and parts
• Comfortable working independently and proactively

jobs.title: Technical Project Manager
jobs.content:
Omada Health is on a mission to inspire and enable people everywhere to live free of chronic disease. We are seeking a Technical Project Manager (TPM) to facilitate technical integrations with Omada’s customers and partners. The TPM works directly with customers and coordinates with Omada’s Program Delivery and Engineering teams to ensure the timely technical integration and ongoing support with multiple customers in parallel.


The TPM will be responsible for educating customers about the technical integration process and the capabilities of Omada’s systems, determining the specific requirements of the integration that both delight the customer and minimize the engineering workload, keeping stakeholders updated with technical progress and challenges, being an ongoing technical point-of-contact for customers, and informing our Product team about the features that might make customers happier or integrations easier.


Responsibilities:



  • Own planning, tracking, and documentation to ensure the timeliness, effectiveness, and overall success of your internal and client-facing projects

  • Track technical progress of integration between Omada’s and our clients’ systems

  • Meet with clients and provide technical direction

  • Ensure that technical requirements are never the bottleneck in delivering Omada’s services

  • Work with engineering groups at Omada to understand and evolve how our internal software interfaces with clients

  • Maintain good judgment regarding promises made to clients and internal stakeholders

  • Write concise, friendly, and timely email responses to internal and external stakeholders

  • Contribute to the development and sharing of best practices within Omada

  • Limited travel (5-10%) to client sites


Strong candidates for this position will have:



  • A bachelor’s degree and 5-7 years customer-facing project management experience

  • Proven experience managing complex projects and technical implementations with grace (health care focused experience strongly preferred)

  • Ability to write clear, concise, friendly emails

  • Ability to balance day-to-day execution with long-term priorities

  • Ability to engage with all levels of an organization and with different types of teams (executive, technical, marketing, product, etc.)

  • Familiarity with agile engineering practices

  • Familiarity with file transfer, specifically SFTP over SSH

  • Familiarity with web development, specifically Ruby on Rails

  • Knowledge of chronic disease prevention, the US healthcare system, digital health, and the startup work environment

  • Proficiency in Google Docs, Keynote, Powerpoint, Excel, CSV files


Benefits:



  • Competitive salary

  • Stock options

  • Flexible vacation

  • Parental leave

  • Health, dental, and vision

  • Healthy snacks and meals

  • Wellness events (e.g. running club)

  • Community volunteering

  • 401k retirement savings plan

jobs.title: Front-End Web Developer
jobs.content:
The Tepper School of Business at Carnegie Mellon University in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, is seeking a talented Front-End Web Developer. This is an exciting opportunity to join a fast-growing academic unit whose mission is to advance technology behind both graduate and undergraduate education at Carnegie Mellon.



As part of the Application Development team, this position will be focused on front-end software engineering to implement and support high quality websites and applications that will enhance the experience and usability for faculty, staff, students, and visitors.



Primary professional responsibilities:



The Front-end Web Developer is responsible for implementing, deploying and supporting customized Sitecore-based websites and applications for Tepper’s web portals using Microsoft C#, ASP.NET, HTML, JavaScript, CSS and XSLT. This includes:




  • creating new Sitecore templates and layouts from provided Adobe Illustrator or Adobe Photoshop files;

  • translating wireframes and design mockups into HTML/CSS files including dynamic elements;

  • creating web front-end user interfaces to existing ASP, ASP.NET applications, SQL Server databases, and other web services;

  • ensuring that the visual presentation and content of Tepper websites reflects and enhances the overall branding visual identity practices and marketing plan of the school;

  • testing websites thoroughly and ensuring that they function properly across a variety of browsers and devices;

  • working collaboratively with peers and Tepper operating units to enhance the user interfaces in a variety of applications. 



The person selected in this role will demonstrate excellent interpersonal, presentation and problem-solving skills.  Previous experience in a higher-education or other non-profit organization preferred.

jobs.title: Jr. JavaScript/Python Developer - Blockchain
jobs.content:
Our development team is looking for an entry-level developer with related experience building software using primarily Javscript/HTML5, python and golang, and is comfortable straddling both the front and back end. You will use your skills to help us build a blockchain-based data verification system. As a startup we are interested in a person who is excited to take on new (and sometimes unexpected) roles, tools, and languages as requirements pop up, and is familiar with Agile or Scrum project management methodology.



In this role you will:



  • Help design and build backend and frontend services for our Bitcoin, Ethereum, and blockchain-based services.

  • Prototype new ideas and explore innovations made possible by the blockchain.

  • Interact with the bitcoin developer community, online and in New York City.

jobs.title: Engineering Manager - Messaging
jobs.content:
The Twilio platform enables companies to integrate communications directly into their applications via simple cloud API’s and with on-demand global reach.  Twilio is therefore challenged with abstracting away a world of complexity so that our customers can go global without concern for managing a global communications network, carrier integrations and relationships throughout the world.


About the job:

 As Manager in the Carrier Services organization, you will lead by guiding the engineering team through the implementation of messaging services using Java and Scala while leveraging standards such as SMPP, MM4, MM7, ENUM and HTTP.  To take it to scale, you will be managing a complex distributed platform with points of presence globally and will be concerned with availability, throughput, latency, payload fidelity as well as scalability considerations. There are significant data components so you will be working with distributed SQL and NoSQL databases and caches at Web scale.  At the core are cloud technologies that enable deployment and management of computing resources globally.   


Responsibilities:



  • Lead and grow a team of passionate engineers through their journey to Agile Maturity.  Provide support and guidance that enables the team to self-organize and to achieve sustained high velocity and predictability.  

  • Manage employee career development by providing coaching and mentoring to junior engineers while guiding senior contributors to maximize their potential.  Write performance evaluations, collaborate with employees on their objectives and provide a clear path for progression through personal development plans.  

  • Own, operate and maintain your team’s services.  Employ Agile methodologies to continuously deliver value to customers.  Institute and maintain a rotating on-call incident escalation and response processes for the team.

  • Collaborate on roadmaps with Product Managers, Architects and Tech Leads to ensure the team has clear direction and priorities.  Ensure there is cross-training and a healthy balance between features and technical debt.

  • Institute development best practices to ensure the team produces high quality, well architected and supportable code.  Lead reviews of architecture design.  Also work to enable a Continuous Integration environment.

  • Serve as the team’s Scrum Master, breaking down roadblocks as well as managing communications with stakeholders and dependent teams.  Create a culture of continuous improvement through retrospection.

  • As a member of the Engineering Management team, foster leadership principles and behaviors throughout the organization to groom the next generation of leaders.

  • Act as an ambassador for Twilio, recruiting and motivating top talent.

jobs.title: AngularJS Developer
jobs.content:
The Equity Engineering Group, Inc. is seeking a well-rounded AngularJS (Angular 2) Developer responsible for creating the client side of complex engineering applications. The primary focus is to implement a complete user interface in the form of a dynamic mobile and desktop web app, focusing on performance, accuracy and usability.


Main duties will include:



  • Creating modules and components and coupling them together into a functional application

  • Setting up and maintaining cloud-based platforms for delivery (such as Microsoft Azure, Google Cloud Computing, Amazon Web Services, etc.).

  • Creating stages of interface design, such as

    • Developing an effective theme and style

    • Creating mock-ups for discussion and review, animations, CSS, and final HTML output.



  • Developing 2D and 3D engineering element-based data visualization of the results coming from CAD, FEA, and CFD (element based data) using WebGL, VTK, Paraview or similar technologies.


This team is composed of several back-end developers, engineers and mathematicians and communicate with RESTful APIs using standard methods. A thorough understanding of all of the components of our platform and infrastructure is required. A knowledge of Python based development environments (such as Django) is helpful.


Candidate applicant must have two years of demonstrable experience developing dynamic, resizable, web based applications similar to the ones described above.


https://www.equityeng.com/jobs/angularjs-developer/

jobs.title: Senior Salesforce Administrator
jobs.content:
Company Overview:


Morgan & Morgan is one of the largest personal injury law firms in the United States. We are currently implementing a new Call Center and Matter Management platforms in order to support our rapidly expanding business, to position our firm as a technical leader in our industry.


We are looking to add a permanent, seasoned Salesforce Administrator/ Business Analyst to maintain our production environment, support end-users, assist with requirements gathering, and help make our salesforce roll-outs be successful.  This is a very fast paced environment where the only constant is change.  We are looking for an individual that can be agile and easily change focus in accordance with business needs.


Job Description:


The Sr. Platform Administrator will work closely with business stakeholders and project teams for all things related to the company-wide salesforce.com deployment.  Act as a subject matter expert for salesforce.com. 



  • Lead meetings to define business processes and put together documentation that maps these processes back to salesforce.com functionality for a working solution.

  • Establish support processes for production users, and manage deployment schedules.

  • Manage and maintain sandboxes including development and UAT environments.

  • Deploy metadata changes from sandboxes to production environment. Conduct UAT sessions with users prior to releasing net new functionality.

  • Assist project team with new system related configuration.

  • Work with 3rd party vendors for applications that integrate into salesforce.com, as well as 3rd party consulting partners to ensure project and support related tasks are completed on time.

  • Build and deliver any training initiatives for new functionality released.

jobs.title: Back End Java Developers (Mid level - Senior)
jobs.content:
Back End Java Developers (Mid level - Senior)
West Los Angeles, CA


About the position:

We are a successful and well-funded growth company in West Los Angeles with other offices in San Diego, CA and Alpharetta, GA. 

Due to continued company growth we are looking to hire some key Java Developers to join our growing team. You will have 6+ years of overall Java Engineering experience to join our Enterprise Ordering Systems group. You’ll be engaged in hands-on coding, managing process, procedure and projects.

Responsibilities:

  • Developing web applications, services and integrating different enterprise applications in a scalable and reusable manner.
  • Utilizing application servers, such as Tomcat in order to implement the proposed solution.
  • Utilizing various application integration techniques to communicate with third party and legacy/back-end systems. 

Requirements:

  • 6+ years experience in design and development of high-volume, high-performance, high-availability, service-oriented Java applications using proven Java frameworks and technologies.
  • Strong understanding of data structures.
  • Design and develop scalable web-services using SOAP or Restful services.
  • Design and develop reusable libraries and APIs.
  • Java technologies: Core Java,Collections, Servlets, JDBC, JMS, JSON, JUNIT,
  • Detailed knowledge of Service Oriented Architecture (SOA), Object Oriented Analysis and Design/Development (OOA/OOD).
  • Other Framework/Technologies: Apache CXF, JPA, Hibernate, Spring, Git, Java Executor.
  • JVM Semantics/ Knowledge in Garbage Collection, Performance tuning and Multithreading.
  • Application Server (such as Tomcat ) experience and Web Server (Apache) knowledge. 
  • MySql database experience including transaction management, SQL programming, schema design.
  • Relevant O/S knowledge (Linux/Unix and Windows).
  • Networking knowledge and experience.
  • Ability to identify issues, support and provide real time solutions for them.
  • Ability to communicate effectively in English, with good verbal and written skills.
  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science (or similar)

 

About Tillster:

As a Tillster employee you will be part of an exciting, growth stage company with US offices in San Diego, Los Angeles and Atlanta and world-class customers throughout North America, Europe and Asia-Pacific. We offer the opportunity to work with talented, solutions oriented colleagues, cutting-edge technology and consumer experiences and some of the world’s most admired brands.  As a member of the Tillster team, you’ll help create positive disruption in huge market – $683 billion in the US and a global foodservice market with $2.6 trillion in worldwide sales. We offer competitive salaries, pre-IPO equity, Fortune 500 level benefits and the opportunity to grow, contribute and drive results.  Please visit our website at www.Tilllster.com

RELOCATION ASSISTANCE WILL BE CONSIDERED


IND123

jobs.title: Account Coordinator
jobs.content:
Who is Return Path?

Return Path is a global data solutions provider that helps the world’s leading companies build closer, safer, and smarter relationships with their customers. Our unique and proprietary data platform, SaaS products, and professional services allow our customers to protect their brands and their consumers from fraud, generate more revenue and engagement from their marketing campaigns, better understand competitors’ strategies and performance, and gain unparalleled insights into the behavior of millions of consumers.
Once you’re an employee here, this is a place where you’ll be challenged, inspired, rewarded, and transformed.

The Impact You’ll Have at Return Path

Account Coordinators at Return Path are enthusiastic problem solvers! You love to troubleshoot client problems, as well as view and analyze situations from a very logical, systematic perspective. In this role you will work closely with the Client Services team to assist in ensuring that clients maximize their email programs’ potential. This position has close interaction with all members of the Client Services team, providing administrative and account management support on both an ongoing, and “as needed” basis including:

Role Objectives:

  • Assist account team by proactively monitoring client accounts, analyzing issues and providing recommended resolutions.
  • Analyze client delivery performance across a variety of proprietary Return Path tools and publicly accessible tools to assist in determining most likely root cause(s) of delivery problems.
  • Modify and maintain user accounts, contacts and IP addresses for clients.
  • Responsible for generating, formatting and preparing initial reports based on client specific data.
  • Record customer interactions in the issue tracking system.
  • Join strategic client calls, take notes, perform action items from those calls as a path to learning about email program optimization.
  • Onboard new clients and provide training on the RP Tools Suite
  • Work with account team on annual reviews and industry updates in order to strengthen client relationship.

What does it take to be successful in this role?

  • 1-3 years of Client Service experience and a demonstrated ability to learn quickly, both about businesses and technologies.
  • Ability to troubleshoot client problems and complex product issues.
  • Ability to work independently with little supervision and to seek assistance proactively as needed to reach the goals of the department.
  • Proven ability to work in a fast paced, iterative department with rapidly changing conditions.
  • Write and speak to internal and external clients in a clear, concise manner appropriate for the audience.

In addition to the above, you must be a good fit at Return Path. To be successful here, you must demonstrate Personal/Professional Growth, Professionalism, Execution, and Strategic Thinking; have a Positive Impact and a great sense of humor.

People First

At Return Path, we are building an extraordinary company that helps people and businesses communicate more reliably, effectively, and securely. We put people first, do the right thing, and succeed together.

We have a strong belief that our people are the most important part of our business. We incorporate this philosophy into our practices and we live it every day. This means we have generous traditional benefits and take a lot of time to focus on quality management and leadership development. We also strive to ensure each person in the company is in the right job, knows how his or her job contributes to the overall company mission, and has a clear sense of career growth and direction. We have great employee retention over the years because people love coming to work here and really feel like they're part of something special.

Do the Right Thing

The Return Path experience is a two-way exchange. We expect you to give us your best every day, and you can expect the same from us. In exchange for your talent, your energy, and your unique contributions, we will strive to give you what you need to live a balanced, healthy life. This means more than competitive pay and benefits—it means offering the freedom and flexibility to create your ideal experience inside and outside the office.

For more information visit www.returnpath.com

jobs.title: Senior Engineer, Advertising Platform
jobs.content:
Quantcast seeks a software engineering leader to scale its Advertising Platform software and team to new heights.

In this position you will design and implement systems that drive the volume of Quantcast’s entire advertising business.  We expect this to grow up to 10x in the next 3 years.  As such, this position has high visibility and substantial impact on the company’s bottom line.

The right applicant will be a versatile leader, deeply interested in technology and finding the best solution for a problem, as well as redefining the problem to make our systems best-in-class.

The Advertising Platform consists of:
- UIs and APIs used to configure advertising campaigns
- Automated QA systems for ads
- Integrations with business partners and internal systems used to deliver our industry-leading ad campaigns.

We use Go, Python, Java, PostgreSQL and we’re open to new technologies.

Responsibilities

  • Design and implement horizontally scalable, low-latency architectures for propagating configuration to internal and third-party systems for ad trafficking
  • Mentor junior developers in best practices
  • Work with business operations and UX teams to define solutions
  • Develop and maintain execution timelines for a small team
  • Find the best technologies to solve challenging problems

Requirements

  • Bachelor’s degree or higher in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Statistics, or equivalent and demonstrable competency
  • 5 years experience professional software development, with at least 2 years in a Senior role or higher
  • Experience successfully leading at least one team project on a real-world distributed system
  • Deep understanding of web technologies and their implications, from HTML, CSS, and Javascript through to the back-end technologies that support websites
  • Demonstrable competency in Java or Python

Bonus Requirements

  • Contribution to one or more open-source projects

Quantcast helps create a more personalized digital world. We have built one of the world’s most sophisticated data-intelligence platforms, utilizing big data and machine learning to solve the biggest challenges in marketing and create more rewarding experiences across the digital landscape. Publishers use our insights to better understand audiences and how content resonates with consumers they want to attract and retain. Marketers utilize our understanding of online behavior and our predictive advertising capabilities to reach the customers likeliest to engage with their messages. Consumers see the results of our work in relevant stories and advertisements that create a personalized experience across all of their devices. 

Quantcast was honored as a Glassdoor Best Place to Work in 2016. To learn more, follow Quantcast on Glassdoor.

jobs.title: Quality Assurance Engineer II
jobs.content:
Job Title: Quality Assurance Engineer II


Location: Portland, OR


Reports To: Senior Manager, Quality Assurance


JOB FUNCTION


The Quality Assurance Analyst will conduct thorough product testing and maintain agreed upon quality standards in order to provide the highest quality software products to both external and internal customers. The QA Analyst will work to understand the business requirements and objectives relative to the desired functionality of products and applications. Additionally this role will evaluate and test new or modified software to determine that software meets user requirements and established quality standards.


ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES



  • Writes and executes detailed test cases; performs complex manual, integration, and regression tests

  • Documents software issues and enhancement requests and assists development with concise and detailed steps for duplication of the problems found while performing manual functional, integration, and regression tests

  • Verifies resolved Jira issues and maintains accurate status for Jira issues entered and assigned

  • Assists fellow team members and customers with problem reporting and resolution and maintaining appropriate follow-up communications throughout the resolution process

  • Creates master test plans with clearly defined test objectives

  • Contributes towards QA estimation and scheduling process

jobs.title: Junior to Mid Level Software Engineer
jobs.content: We are looking for a passionate, experienced PHP Developer who enjoys both the thrill of building custom solutions for our customers as well as the discipline in resolving complex bugs. You will have the opportunity to do full stack WordPress/PHP development, from backend scripting to frontend HTML/CSS/Javascript work.  You must be as comfortable working with people as you are working with code, and be able to communicate well with people in different groups such as Client Services, Engineering, Support, and Sales.

jobs.title: iOS Software Engineer, Mobile Applications
jobs.content:
At Google, we care deeply about our iOS users, and we develop for iOS as enthusiastically as we do for Android. We strive to enable users on any platform to access Google products and services — from mainstays like Maps, Search, and YouTube to cutting-edge projects like Translate, Photos, and Google Now — in the best possible way. And we solve problems at Google's unique scale, bringing large data to small devices and crafting elegant user experiences.


As an iOS software engineer, you’ll get to work on products that help millions of people around the world, and collaborate with other passionate mobile developers to bring the most delightful and useful services and apps to life. You should be comfortable with Objective-C and have extensive knowledge of iOS development techniques and practices.


[Responsibilities]



  • Design and implement new user-facing features in Google’s large, complex mobile applications.

  • Build the libraries and frameworks that support authentication, copresence, and cutting-edge network protocols.

  • Optimize mobile applications on the iOS platform.

  • Develop prototypes quickly.

jobs.title: Software Engineer - iOS
jobs.content:
Our Mobile Software Engineering Team work on the cutting edge to produce high-quality mobile apps for both iOS and Android. We are now on the lookout for an iOS Software Engineer to join this dynamic team. If your heart beats a bit faster when you are writing clean code and if you have a natural instinct for spotting new trends or technologies then we want to hear from you. Our Software Engineering teams help to shape the future of the world’s largest hotel search. With around 3 billion requests per month, we are operating on a large scale, complex and rapidly evolving IT landscape. We encourage all team members to question established processes and give them the freedom to experiment with new technologies in order to drive trivago to the next level.

Your responsibilities:

  • Develop our mobile apps in an agile environment.
  • Use your expert knowledge to bring fresh new ideas to the table.
  • Analyze feature requests and then plan & implement them in a test-driven way.
  • Create and review pull requests in order to achieve the best possible solution.
  • Contribute to the maintenance and development of new and existing open source components.
  • Exchange ideas and share your knowledge with the rest of the team and participate in pair programming. .

The ideal candidate:

  • Is looking for a new challenge!
  • Has earned a degree/equivalent qualification in computer science or similar field.
  • Can prove their technical skills in native iOS development and can share code references.
  • Has experience in dealing with iOS frameworks, design patterns and software architectures such as MVC/MVP/MVVM.
  • Is genuinely interested in agile development processes and automated testing. Experience in these areas would be a plus.
  • Is familiar with Scrum, Kanban, TDD, BDD, Reactive Programming and Continuous Integration.
  • Speaks English fluently. German language skills would be a plus.

Life at trivago is...

  • The ability to push your ideas through to execution without being held back by bureaucracy.
  • The freedom to embrace small-scale failures as a path to large-scale success.
  • The belief that factual proof, not seniority, determines which path to take.
  • Self-determined working hours based on measuring productivity through goals rather than number of hours spent in the office.
  • Being supported in all your needs, including relocation assistance and language classes for international arrivals.
  • The opportunity to develop personally and professionally with regular free code workshops and Hackathons, as well as the chance to contribute to our tech blog.
  • Living in Düsseldorf, a city boasting the 6th highest quality of life in the world for expats.  Additional information:
  • Please note that your CV and motivation letter must be written in English.
  • We do not require the services of an agency for this position.  If you would like to learn more about the application process at trivago, please click the link to the right.

jobs.title: .Net Developer - Mammoth Mountain Ski Area
jobs.content:
Mammoth Resorts is in the recreation and leisure business. We own and operate ski areas, summer bike parks, hotels, restaurants, retail shops, and golf courses. Our main office is located in Mammoth Lakes, California, on the eastern side of the Sierra Nevada mountains. Mammoth Lakes is a mountain town in one of the most beautiful places on earth. National Geographic recently ranked the Sierra Nevada mountains as the #2 destination choice in North America.


 Our IT team is looking for a .Net web developer to help us support and enhance Mammoth Resort’s corporate websites and web applications. We currently have 24 corporate web sites (e.g. www.mammothmountain.com), and lots of ideas for how to improve them for the benefit of our customers. We also sell products on about half our web sites through our in-house developed e-commerce software. Here are the specific duties of the position: 



  • Develop web-based solutions in C#, ASP.NET, CSS, JavaScript, HTML5, Visual Studio, and SQL Server.

  • Developing new websites on the Sitefinity Content Management System. For example, developing custom Sitefinity widgets for Marketing to show winter trail status.

  • Developing new e-commerce functionality to help us increase our revenue.

  • Provide break/fix support as we do have 24 web sites and they sometimes need fixing.


 YOUR TYPICAL DAY


You’re a member on a small development team (4 developers and a manager), and you’re clear on your priorities for the quarter. You have a 20% chance you have a meeting with the Marketing team sometime during the day to talk about your latest progress on a project, or about new projects that are coming. Projects that you may be working on:



  • Improve our e-commerce check out flow to make recommendations for other products our customer may have interest.

  • Simplify the checkout process so purchases are made with as few clicks as possible.

  • Improve how we present our lodging to our guests so they can easily filter and sort to find what they need.

  • On rare occasion, staying up late or getting in early for an implementation.


OUR CULTURE


If it’s a powder day (that means there’s fresh snow), you’ll find many of us on the slopes making turns. We take our jobs and the work we do seriously, but we always leave room for fun and play. If your job is the #1 priority in your life, then Mammoth Resorts is not the place for you. We are looking for people with a well-rounded perspective on life.


BENEFITS



  • A season pass for you and your immediate family.

  • Three health care plans for you to choose from.

  • 401K plans with 50% matching donation up to 5%

  • 3 weeks of vacation, 5 paid holidays, and a bunch of “I’m leaving early today to go play outside” days.

  • No long commutes.

jobs.title: JavaScript Software Developer
jobs.content:
Varen Technologies is looking for a software developer who enjoys solving hard problems, delivering mission capability to the operator and analyst, working independently or on small-distributed development teams, and has the expertise to hit the ground running with little to no supervision.


This position supports the DoD’s Big Data Platform (BDP) cloud development team by working across multiple tasks and ensuring that all front-end applications adhere to a shared vision, resulting in a consistent user experience. The developer may also work to modernize legacy codebases written in a host of frameworks, coalescing around a standard toolchain and sound front-end architecture.


The position will also include writing tests, test plans, and test scripts and optimizing and troubleshooting the front-end interfaces of the BDP. Primary development languages for working with the BDP’s web services are Javascript and Java. Team members are expected to participate and collaborate with other team members as well as with end-users through agile development cycles.



  • Employee will select their laptop (MAC, IBM, DELL, etc) and work in an environment that allows you to use approved resources. (Github, ZenHub, Slack, Node, etc)


Participate in development and implantation, use software deployment tools; code and test software based upon software specifications and designs; support using formal specifications, data flow diagrams, and other accepted design techniques; use sound software engineering principles to ensure that developed code is modifiable, efficient, reliable, understandable, and fault tolerant.


Familiarity with:



  • with D3, WebGL, git and gitflow

  • Open source contributions, and modern frameworks such as Angular, Ember, and Backbone


Desired Experience:



  • js’s ecosystem

  • in-depth knowledge of web standards and page optimization

  • displaying/navigating streaming data (SSE, WS, CometD)

  • knowledge of distributed systems software design

jobs.title: Embedded Software Developer
jobs.content:
Cirrent is a breakthrough company in the hot internet-of-things space. We've built a strong business working with the big internet service providers, and are positioned to revolutionize Wi-Fi for connected products.

Were looking for a focused & driven Senior Embedded Developer to be a key participant in creating the architecture, systems, and technologies that are core to Cirrents services. All of our developers are smart, driven, friendly, and fun -- if that sounds like you, we want you to join our team!

On a day-to-day basis you'll be writing code for linux or RTOS platforms (Broadcom/Cypress' WICED platform, Qualcomm's IoE, Marvell's Ez-Connect), reviewing and merging code from other developers, and working with our customers -- product companies integrating our technology into their products.


Benefits


Competitive salary and equity. Excellent health, vision, and dental coverage. Great downtown San Mateo location and a fun work environment.


** Local candidates only **

jobs.title: Sr. Cloud Integration Specialist
jobs.content:
Our Computing and Information Systems (CIS) division has an exciting opportunity for a Sr. Cloud Integration Specialist who will develop, plan and support integrations between Argonne’s business systems, vendors and cloud systems. 


In this position, you will:



  • Analyze the requirements, define projects, and implement and support integrations and web based solutions for our customers here at the Laboratory

  • Develop and support web-based applications used in production for Argonne’s business systems and public web pages

  • Translate technical information to a non-technical audience and provide excellent follow-up with clients. Ensure correspondence & communication is complete, concise, professional & timely. Express written ideas clearly. Verbal presentations are logical & well thought out.

  • Provides direction and on-the-job training to other staff members when appropriate.

jobs.title: Software Engineer - Java Developer
jobs.content:
• Improve the daily lives of hundreds of thousands of grocery shoppers

  • Go where nobody has gone and get wide recognition for a world class web store

  • Design, create, own and maintain our high-performance cloud-based eco-system (Java stack)

  • Innovate, design and implement elements like the online store, order management, inventory and warehouse management, transportation planning and many more

  • Push your limits in creating super clean, well structured, testable, performant, high quality code and application tests

  • Keep up with the latest technologies and define our future technology stack

  • Be challenged every day again by our extremely talented team

jobs.title: Full Stack Developer
jobs.content:
Full Stack Developer - Product Engineer

TransferWise is a VC-backed, international money transfer start-up co-founded by Skype’s first employee and backed by some of planet's most experienced innovators, including Sir Richard Branson and PayPal founder Peter Thiel, we're disrupting the world of currency & international money transfer. That means flipping a gazillion dollar industry on its head using only real exchange rates and tiny non-hidden-fee. Headaches averted, revolution sparked.

Are you up to building a modern international financial institution from the ground up, but better than any of the existing global banks? We are looking for a number of Product Engineers to join our Tallinn office. As a Full Stack Product Engineer you will have solid experience with the full stack of web technologies. You will be hands on within the technology and working towards making our product the best that it can be by solving the challenges that we face. However our flat organisational structure means you'll be someone who is unconcerned with titles and hierarchy. What really excites you is problem solving and delivering innovative technology and products that create happy customers.



You will collaborate with product managers, UX and design experts, data scientists and other developers to work towards one unified goal - growth. There are a number of teams that we are currently looking for awesome developers to join in Tallinn, you will be applying for all and throughout your journey with us you will get to find out about them all!



As part of the a Product-Engineering team, you'll be making sure that the user journey is as precise and delightful as it can be. You'll join a great team that is customer focussed to it’s core.



Product engineers only

Here at TransferWise we don’t hire coders, who pick up tickets from a backlog and push code to production.

We hire engineers that empathise with our customers problems, develop solutions and measure results. We’re proud of engineering team - it's built an incredible product that’s changing the world. They operate autonomously within their teams, focussing relentlessly on our customers.
