jobs.title: Senior/Intermediate Full Stack Node and Angular Dev
jobs.content:
We are currently hiring 2 senior/intermediate software devs for Broadsoft (http://www.broadsoft.com).
You will be working in BroadsoftLabs. The coolest place to work at Broadsoft. (https://broadsoftlabs.com)


Your day to day will include working on bugs and features in github for several projects we maintain and develop. The main project is a corporate messaging app and the other pieces you will work on are integrations to cloud services. Such as google, slack, spotify etc. We also will be making some small games for teams to use while waiting for meetings to start.


Salary can be something around 100k USD per year for this permanent position for the right person. Its a secure company on the NYSE (https://www.google.com/finance?q=NASDAQ:BSFT) and has been in business for about 20 years with over a thousand employees. Around 350 are software devs like yourself. There is lots of room to move up. Health benefits and share options are also added to salary.

Your team will consist of about 10 other developers that have been working on this project for over a year. You will be programming in javascript with Node and angular.

jobs.title: Business Development Consultant
jobs.content:
BUSINESS DEVELOPMENT CONSULTANT


Cloudreach is an idea that started out in a London pub that is now a global cloud enabler and one of the world’s largest AWS partners. We have hubs in North America and Europe, with more certified technical staff than anyone else in the world.Cloudreach works on challenging technical projects such as data center migrations, data analytics, and managing digital estates. This is not your average company; we keep our feet on the ground and our heads in the cloud.


We are looking for a superstar sales professional who can contribute to our growth in the Northeast.


How will you spend your time at Cloudreach?



  • As a Business Development Consultant, you will be accountable for meeting / exceeding customer acquisition targets as well as being the main face and Cloudreach’s ambassador for our partners.

  • Owning, developing and driving the strategy across your account set.

  • Working with some of the largest companies in the US across all verticals.

  • Partnering with the top cloud technology providers (AWS, Microsoft Azure, Google, SFDC).

  • You will wake up every morning thinking about how we penetrate the Enterprise organizations assigned to you and how to execute your customer acquisition plans.

  • You will develop relationships with our partners on building joint account plans as well as using your consulting skills to engage senior decision makers within the customer’s organization.

  • Working with a sociable, friendly team of people who love what they do!


What are our cloudy perks?



  • MacBook Pro, big screen monitor, and phone coverage.

  • Unlimited vacation daysand your birthday off every year.

  • A well-rounded benefits package including great health benefits, a competitive 401(k) plan, discounts on restaurant meals, gym memberships, travel deals, and more. We also believe in rewarding work when it’s done; if you do something amazing, we’ll give you a spot bonus.

  • We provide world-class training and career development opportunities through our Cloudy University.

  • Good food (free snacks and drinks in the office) and team ‘cloudy’ lunches, taking over a local restaurant every Friday. There are also cool office amenities like beanbags, games like pool and ping pong, and big screen TVs

  • Quarterly meetings around North America.

jobs.title: C# Software Engineer - Baltimore
jobs.content:
We (Adashi) are a US company that builds interconnected multi-platform software apps that allow fire, police and ems personnel  to respond to emergencies. We are  looking for highly motivated C# developer to join our core team and perhaps make the world a little safer.


Client applications are developed in C# using WPF. Server applications are written in C#, are database agnostic and support a large number of concurrent clients (both mobile and pc) that keep the entire fleet instantly in sync.


Preferred Experience for all positions:


Ability to understand an end user’s requirements and story, and then work with a team to build a solution that meets the user’s needs.


Nice to have:


Domain knowledge in Public Safety.  Specifically 911 centers, command and control, and mobile data terminals, Computer aided dispatch systems.


Experience in ESRI and other Geospatial technologies.


Database knowledge and experience. 


Experience with WPF and XAML.


Experience implementing UIs using the MVVM pattern.


Appreciation for visual design and its impact on user experience.


Compensation: Competitive full-time salary dependent upon skills/experience plus a great benefits, vacation package and opportunities for advancement.  Offices located in Farmington Hills, MI, and Baltimore, MD

jobs.title: Mid Level Full Stack C# Web Developer
jobs.content:
Do you want to work and learn from some of the best developers in the Twin Cities?


Do you want to help solve some big data problems?  


Do you want to help build something significant that can help keep counterfeit pharmaceuticals off the market?


Then this job is likely for you.


Verify Brand is looking for up to 4 web developers with strong technical skills and a desire to make a big impact at a growing software company.  We are a fast-paced, agile development team working on a web based SaaS product written in C# MVC with a SQL Server backend.  We also use ElasticSearch and RabbitMQ to support analytics and scalability over terabytes of data.  


We are currently expanding our industry leading software platform to have international capabilities in the Pharmaceutical landscape.  This means tracking product as it flows through the supply chain and keeping a record of updates along the way. A large portion of our software’s value comes from our innovative ways to report on the massive amount of data we acquire on a constant basis. Your contributions to our software will go towards many lofty goals; such as counterfeit detection, supply chain diversion detection, and improving customer-loyalty brand programs.


The types of problems you'd be working on at Verify include:



  • Creating APIs with 100% up-time that can handle 100 requests per second

  • Designing responsive UIs to display data from over 100 million database records

  • Working directly with customers to design new APIs and new UIs that meet, and exceed, their needs and wishes.


You will be tasked with creating software that contributes directly to the success of the company. We are constantly striving to find the right tools, methodologies, and techniques such as Domain Driven Design, Continuous Integration, and Agile to ensure that we are at the top of our game.


To be the right candidate, you need a balance of interpersonal skills and technological savvy; you must enjoy working with others in order to make great software designs come to life.  Our ideal candidate would be strong in the Microsoft web stack, but we recognize that good problem-solving skills are language-independent.


Perks of working at Verify include:



  • Competitive salary

  • A stake in our private company

  • Working for a small, agile company (~25 people) with the financial backing of a large parent company (+200 people)

  • Develop exclusively in the latest and greatest (.NET 4.6.1, MVC 4, SQL Server 2014)

  • 4PM Friday Happy Hour!


Some of the technologies we currently use:



  • C# MVC

  • SQL Server

  • .NET API 2.2

  • Angular

  • SQL Server

  • RabbitMQ

  • HaProxy

  • ElasticSearch


We do not expect that you have used all of these technologies, but knowing about them and being excited about them is a major bonus.


This is a an opportunity in Plymouth, MN, just west of downtown Minneapolis.  All applicants must be local or willing to relocate to the Twin Cities.

jobs.title: Development Manager
jobs.content:
Senior Delivery Manager

To manage 3 delivery managers how each manage several scrums, within the Software Engineering Capabilities function at Sky, Covering TV Services, Recommendations, Search and Programme Database. Ensuring the consistent on-time delivery of high quality software applications and the ongoing management of these systems in production.

The Delivery Manager will report to and provide advice and support to the Head of Technology. Delivery Manager will have line management responsibility for several Scrum Masters and other key delivery resources.

Key Responsibilities:
  • To lead and coach Scrum Masters, managing the delivery of the roadmaps and establishing and agreeing best practice to improve the predictability, efficiency and quality of software delivery
  • To build an effective working relationship with the Stakeholders requesting delivery from his/her team.
  • To educate business stakeholders on the benefits of agile delivery and influencing their behaviour to support this delivery method.
  • To ensure the adoption of Agile/XP methods within his/her scrums.
  • To act as the key contact within their area of delivery.
  • To manage delivery of projects across their scrums.
  • On a case by case basis to act as the lead delivery manager for projects that span various delivery managers within Sky Technology
  • To provide management reporting on the delivery status of their area. Balancing the requests for a defined delivery date, from stakeholders, with the agile delivery method.
  • Being aware of, and ensuring appropriate communication of, any delivery issues, dependencies and or risks to the roadmap.
  • To monitor and assess the demands for resources across their area and ensure appropriate staffing levels to meet the customer demands whilst ensuring effective & efficient delivery.
  • To support their Scrum Master in the communication of delivery and application support issues.
  • To work with senior leadership of other delivery streams inside and outside of the team to negotiate and agree how dependencies will be managed and assured.
  • To develop and coach delivery personnel to improve their personal and collective performance as Scrum Masters and Delivery professionals.
  • To be accountable for managing the quality and timeliness of the delivery across their Scrums.
  • To manage (with the help of their team, the Principal Software Engineer & Architects) the technical direction of their portfolio.
  • Work with integration partners (Broadcast and STB) to build better relationships and agree testing strategies.


Expertise Expected:
  • Use cutting-edge practices in Project Management, Product design, Requirement Analysis, Test Driven Development, Continuous Integration, Automation & Unit Testing in a software development environment.
  • Commercial experience in managing software development teams, with a least 18 months being in a commercial agile environment.
  • Proven capability in managing team dynamics, building team relationships, mentoring team members and delivering feedback.
  • Experience in release planning, estimation, capacity planning and managing project risks in a multi Scrum environment.
  • Direct Scrum Master experience.
  • Certified Scrum Master credentials are a plus.
  • Good at understanding complex technology intensive domains.
  • Exceptional listening, written and verbal communication skills.
  • Experience with Extreme Programming , Scrum and other agile techniques.
  • Management experience of full life-cycle system development with teams of developers, analysts, and testers/QAs.
  • Awareness of one or more automated testing tools such as Silk Test, QTP, RFT or exposure to any open source testing tools such as Selenium, FitNesse etc.
  • An awareness and appreciation of current development tools and their usage.


Capabilities Specifics (Team Overview):

The Capabilities Group currently provide a number of online services to Web, Mobile and more recently the STB propositions, The teams are as follows:
  • TV Services
  • Recommendations
  • Search
  • Programme Database


To support this application set is a diverse set of technologies and skills from software engineering

Key Technologies and Challenges:

Due to the diverse array of applications this team provide and the sheer number of customers that make advantage of our services there is constant pressure to delivery more for less. Working with the business we need to change the way we are structured and deliver software. Recent integrations with the STB have brought about its own challenges with the risk adverse testing strategy and lengthy development cycles.

One of the key challenges in this area is this area is to deliver to scale, the current STB enjoys over 6 million connected users that are putting an ever increasing demand on the capabilities platform,

Specific Candidate Desired Attributes:

The successful candidate will be an excellent people manager and motivator and should be able to get the best out of a diverse team, by fostering collaboration and cross-fertilisation, where applicable. They should be experts in the agile process, and specifically be able to ensure the right level of discipline is maintained to ensure only quality software is delivered. They should also be able to creatively find solutions to operational challenges.

If you are appointed to this role you will be subject to the successful completion of a Criminal Record Check.



Sky - Believe in Better

jobs.title: Sr. Developer - Outlook Integration
jobs.content:
Why EMS?


If you crave the chance to achieve at the highest level while working with an exceptionally talented team with enlightened leadership, we have the opportunity you’ve been looking for.


Used by millions of people, EMS manages some of the highest profile spaces in the world like the NASDAQ bell! The EMS team is consistently delivering new features to its suite of products, and we want to grow our team, tackle even bigger challenges, and do amazing things. We work in small, concentrated teams to constantly improve our code base, and have amassed a large backlog of interesting technical challenges and product initiatives. We’re growing our team to enable even greater success within our industry. This is where you come in.


Summary:


Our integration with Microsoft Outlook and Exchange must be slick, fast, and easy. We’ve made great strides but we need another great mind on the team to accelerate our pace.


As a senior developer on Outlook, you’ll help maintain the current generation of our integration (VSTO based) while building a new integration using Microsoft’s latest add-in technology. You have strong experience with HTML, CSS, and JavaScript, and you have mastered .NET applications. Additionally, you have hands on experience working with RESTful API’s.


Responsibilities:


In your first month, you’ll focus on learning both the architecture and functionality of the current generation of our integration with Outlook. You’ll also learn our tools, processes, and people.


In your second month, you’ll help build out additional capabilities of our product’s integration with Outlook. You’ll also start learning the Microsoft Office Add-in architecture.


In your third month, you’ll continue to work on building out our existing product, but you’ll also work with our UX team to help them understand the capabilities and limitations of the Add-in architecture, especially as it applies to our software.


By the sixth month, you and the team will have completed the next release of our Outlook integration and then you’ll be off and running on developing against the Add-in architecture.


Your duties and responsibilities will include:



  • Design and develop new functionality for our existing .NET-based Outlook integration.

  • Learn Microsoft’s new Office Add-in architecture

  • Work with UX to extract the best possible user experience from the Add-in architecture

  • Help develop our next-generation integration with Microsoft Outlook and Exchange

jobs.title: Senior Product Designer
jobs.content:
WHO WE ARE:
GigMasters, recently acquired by XO Group, is the marketplace for every event, providing party planners and hosts with an online tool to find entertainment and event services of all kinds. We’ve helped facilitate over 275,000 bookings and have over 70,000 event vendors, ranging from musicians and photographers to impersonators and magicians. GigMasters empowers people to make a living doing what they love, and we take pride in being able to do so.

GigMasters was founded in 1997, so technically we're not a startup, but the fun atmosphere, fast-paced work environment and regular happy hours kind of make us feel like one. We're a tight-knit group. We hold regular company events, and we believe in celebrating company milestones.

ABOUT THE DIGITAL PRODUCT DESIGNER ROLE AND OUR TEAM:

This is the first Digital Product Designer in-house role for the GigMasters team! We are looking for an experienced, full-stack Digital Product Designer with both UI and UX experience, to join the GigMasters product team.

The right candidate will possess the following qualities:
• You are excited about the opportunity to be part of a small, entrepreneurial company with a lively startup feel.
• You are passionate about creating user-first digital products for a diverse community of users.
• You are capable of producing high-quality, pixel-perfect design work.
• You are a strategic thinker and champion of the user with great collaborative skills.
• You are a thoughtful problem-solver with a passion for research and study/analysis of user feedback and habits.
• You are an excellent communicator, capable of presenting your ideas clearly and in the context of user value and brand value proposition.
• You process quantitative as well as qualitative data alongside empathy as a driver to distill into innovative, user-centric solutions and designs.
• You are self-managing, detail-oriented, and express ownership down to the last pixel.
• You are interested in partnership and collaboration with your product team.

RESPONSIBILITIES:
• Work as a partner within the product team, contributing at a strategic and tactical level.
• Work collaboratively within product teams on defining requirements, producing wireframes, user flows, user interfaces and interactions, complete visual designs, prototyping, testing, and delivering pixel perfect design assets.
• Contribute to the brand visual language and user experience through the honing of our brand digital guidelines and holistic site experience development.
• Work as a partner within the product team, contributing at a strategic and tactical level.
• Balance needs of users with technical constraints and business objectives.
• Demonstrate sensitivity to user interaction through intuitive and engaging solutions and design.
• Design and iterate on interfaces and interactions for desktop, web, and mobile devices, including iOS and Android apps.
• You’ll maintain a spirit of shared ownership, cooperation, and accountability through all phases of product development: conception through release, and post-release.
• Collaborate with product managers and engineers to define and deliver innovative, iterative solutions.
• Work with the engineering team to meet technical requirements for projects.
• Deliver design assets with complete UI implementation specifications. Pair with front-end developers to ensure best execution.
• Effectively present and discuss solutions with stakeholders.

SKILLS & EXPERIENCE:
• Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree in Graphic Design, Interaction Design, or a related field.
• 5+ years proven experience designing user interface solutions for interactive media, mobile, and web.
• Proficiency in Photoshop, Illustrator, Sketch, and favorite prototyping tools)
• Demonstrated experience with brand development and designing branded experiences.
• Demonstrated experience with UX design principles and practice.
• Experience working as a UX/UI designer in a mobile-first, Lean UX process.
• Experience designing for iOS and Android applications.
• Working knowledge of HTML, CSS, and JavaScript; iOS, Android.Excellent typographic, layout, and visual system design skills demonstrated through a portfolio.
• E-Commerce experience a plus.
• Illustration abilities a plus.

jobs.title: Production Designer
jobs.content:
Who We Are
PlanetArt’s mission is to be the leading online destination for personalized invitations, announcements, home décor and other personalized products. We provide consumers with unmatched tools and content and an unparalleled end-to-end customer experience that result in high-quality and meaningful finished products and memorable celebrations of life events.

Visit www.planetart.com to learn more.

Overview
• This position is on-site at our office in Calabasas, CA 91302
• This role is ideal for someone who finds satisfaction in transforming messy artwork files into clean, organized documents. It is not a good fit for someone looking for a creative design position.

What You’ll Do
• Prepare print-ready artwork files to meet specific requirements using the Adobe Creative Suite.
• Export assets and upload designs using our proprietary tools
• Ensure all designs have accurate merchandising information
• Quality control the work of other content team members

What You Should Have
• Positive, can-do attitude is an absolute must.
• Keen attention to detail and exceptional organizational skills
• Ability to work well under pressure of tight deadlines without compromising accuracy.
• Solid understanding of Adobe Photoshop and Illustrator, with higher pay for individuals with proven experience using these programs in a production environment
• Good written and verbal communication skills
• A fast learner who is always looking for ways to improve processes and automate tasks

How To Apply
If you would like to work in a creative, collaborate, high-growth environment, PlanetArt’s Production Designer role may be for you! Please submit your resume and cover letter. We look forward to hearing from you!

jobs.title: Senior Developer
jobs.content:
Take Three Technologies is seeking a Senior Developer to join our team. Located in Denver, we are an exciting and vibrant technology company that builds enterprise solutions for the residential mortgage banking industry.


We are preparing for the launch of our brand new Loan Origination System and need a talented developer to help us provide additional features and enhancements that will support this product. Along with our existing software (The Rule Tool – a business rules engine for loan officers in our industry), we will also be developing back-end systems for the secondary mortgage market aspects of our business. As such, the right candidate for this position will thrive in a fast moving, dynamic, and ever evolving environment.


Responsibilities:



  • Collaborate with stakeholders and other team members to determine features and enhancements and priorities for implementation.

  • Design and support external API’s


Experience Requirements:



  • A minimum of three year’s direct hands-on experience.

  • Strong project and process management skills are critical as these are highly complex systems in an ever evolving industry.

  • Ability to work independently to design, develop, test, and maintain our proprietary systems.

  • Must take ownership of projects and be accountable to quality and timeliness of completion benchmarks.

We are an exciting entrepreneurial company and will provide you with a competitive salary that will be based on your experience level. Benefits include medical, dental, vision, life insurance and a 401K.

jobs.title: Senior Director, Advertising
jobs.content:
The NBA is seeking a qualified candidate for the position of Senior Director, Advertising.
The Senior Director, Advertising will be responsible for leading the advertising, promotional and creative campaigns for the NBA, WNBA, D-League, and USA Basketball. He/she will manage an internal marketing team responsible for in-house creative assignments with the NBA's internal creative and production teams in addition to external assignments with our creative agencies. In addition to supervising broadcast, digital and print creative development and production , the ideal candidate must successfully guide multiple simultaneous projects from project briefing through final approval. This requires solid management and organizational skills and ability to accurately track timelines, due dates and budget details.

Major Responsibilities:
• Lead the day-to-day working relationship and creative development with external creative agencies.
• Manage the briefing process, projects (e.g. agency meetings, timelines, deliverables, and budgets), requests for internal assets (e.g. footage, photos, etc.), and financial transactions (e.g. tracking budgets, invoices and reconciliation).
• Lead regular communication efforts with internal constituents about brand and advertising campaigns, timelines, and creative, and advise on how key themes and graphic standards can be integrated into various business units
• Ensure creative campaigns are on strategy and consistent with the brand platform.
• Manage and plan the creative workload for internal creative team.
• Lead collaboration between internal creative teams and external agencies to develop key video elements, visuals and graphic standards.
• Create and deliver in-person presentations to internal and external partners about campaigns and creative.
• Oversee digital creative development for a variety of elements, including campaign landing pages, digital displays, video assets and other online solutions for emerging digital technologies.
• Provide feedback on creative briefs.
• Collaborate with internal project management team on creative execution.
• Participate in Business Review process for agency brand work and broadcast partners (ESPN and Turner).
• Oversee the submission of creative on their behalf and report feedback and ensure that recommendations and outcomes from Business Review are incorporated according to brand standards.
• Manage creative team responsible for advertising and creative development.
• Evaluate advertising agency performance.
• Performs other related duties as assigned.

Required Skills/Knowledge:
• Ability to lead within a fast-paced environment and deliver against demanding timelines.
• Demonstrated ability to lead and inspire a creative team.
• Experience leading a creative agency.
• Ability to organize and oversee multiple priorities and projects simultaneously.
• Extensive understanding of creative production processes.
• Extensive experience developing digital creative solutions.
• Strong problem solving, decision making and analytical skills.
• Demonstrated understanding of how creative and media work seamlessly to help brands succeed.
• Exceptionally strong interpersonal and communication skills.
• Strong presentation skills.
• Independent, self-motivated and creative.
• Proficient in Word, Excel, PowerPoint.

Experience:
• At least 10+ years of experience managing advertising/creative production on the agency or client side, with a heavy emphasis on digital creative production.
• At least 8+ years of experience within the sports, entertainment, advertising agency or media industries.
• At least 8+ years of experience working with media agency to coordinate delivering creative assets in accordance with media plans.
• At least 3-5 years of direct supervisory experience.


Educational Background Required:
• Bachelor’s degree.

jobs.title: Junior Technical Consultant
jobs.content:
Techfino has a unique opportunity for a Technical Consultant interested in building an exciting new start-up bus-tech consultancy.  At Techfino, we help our clients to grow their business by improving their operational efficiency, increasing revenue, and reducing their IT costs using cloud-based technology.  We provide customization, support, implementation, and systems integration services for industry leading cloud solutions such as NetSuite and SalesForce.


We are seeking a bright JavaScript developer who will work closely with management to prioritize needs, resolve conflicts, and develop high quality solutions for our clients.  Here, you will receive two weeks of paid training on how to develop on the NetSuite SuiteCloud platform and apply Techfino’s best practices on client engagements.  You will interface directly with clients and be given additional responsibility as you progress in your career.  Tons of opportunity for career advancement, on the job training, and exposure to all aspects of business.


This is a full-time position based out of Philadelphia, PA.  We offer flexible work from home arrangements.  Must be willing to travel up to 40% depending on the needs of the project.

jobs.title: Senior Full Stack Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Greenhouse is looking for Senior Full Stack Engineers to join our growing tech team. We’re at a unique point in our growth where we’re big enough to offer stability, development best practices, and a variety of projects but still small enough so that every engineer makes a big impact on the product and code base. 


In the past year, we’ve started to move from a monolithic application to distributed web services, begun switching our hosting from Heroku to AWS, and built a test suite with over 8k tests covering our system; but we’re just getting started with scaling challenges. Here is a glimpse at some of the projects and architecture decisions you’d be involved with:



  • Scaling from 100M requests per month to 500M requests per month

  • Building and deploying globally distributed systems with sharding, read/write splitting, and HA

  • Improving page load time by 30%

  • Designing and implementing a unified API

  • Building Greenhouse's mobile experiences


Our engineers can expect to start contributing to feature development within their first weeks using Ruby on Rails and Javascript. You’ll also influence how the team is structured, mentor and teach your fellow engineers, and learn alongside other senior engineers in an agile environment. At Greenhouse, we believe in concrete deliverables, feedback and iteration, collaboration and transparency, and recognition for your impact and contributions.

jobs.title: Customer Support, L1 (West Coast Hours)
jobs.content:

Thatâs why more than 2,000,000 designers, product managers, marketers and other stakeholders at so many of the world's most loved startups, agencies, & corporations use InVision every day, including Uber, Evernote, Twitter, Adobe, Salesforce and many more.

jobs.title: Junior C++ Machine Vision Developer
jobs.content:
About Robotic Vision Technologies

Robotic Vision Technologies (RVT) is a privately owned and funded company looking for a self-starting junior developer with experience and interest in Machine Vision and Windows-based C++ Programming.

Robotic Vision Technologies is the leader in 3D Vision Guided Robotic technology. With our software, industrial robots are empowered with the ability to locate parts both large and small in 3D space with a single camera – a process called Single-Camera 3D. This enables the robots to safely and accurately work within the variances of real life manufacturing situations.

Now, RVT is focused on the new and rapidly expanding market of Collaborative Robots. The successful candidate will have the unique opportunity to work with real state-of-the-art robots, be key in the development of new products from design to implementation, and deliver real impact to the world of robotics, machine learning, and A.I. This position provides immediate leadership potential and growth within a small but cohesive group, as well as fantastic bonus and option compensation plans with flexible hours and vacation time.

Presented here is a unique opportunity to work with state of the art technologies with a small private company aiming for early exit. Don't pass it up!

RVT’s culture is one where everybody is able to contribute in any way they want – there’s no bureaucracy, politics, or procedural noise. We all work together where needed to deliver great products to market. We value initiative, problem-solving, and decision-making skills.

Job Description

  • Be a key component of an Agile-driven development team
  • Contribute to and lead product decisions from feature design to implementation to testing
  • Potentially travel and work with customers to solicit feedback and integrate that feedback into future product versions
  • Help work on new robot and machine vision algorithms, products, and solutions

Required Skills

  • 1-5 years experience designing and developing client applications
  • A solid understanding of C++, Visual Studio, debugging techniques, and at least one scripting language
  • Proficiency with Windows API. Knowledge of Windows Forms and COM a huge plus
  • Demonstrated skill or interest in Machine Vision or Robotics
  • Good communicator with both technical and non-technical coworkers and customers
  • A bias for action, self-motivated, able to take direction well, and able to self-direct when needed

Bonus experience

  • Machine vision algorithm design and implementation
  • Familiarity with computer vision libraries (like OpenCV)
  • Knowledge and implementation of good coding and testing practices
  • Working on and refactoring legacy code
  • Leadership skills

Some travel may be required. Located in Silver Spring, Maryland with planned office locations in DC and/or Northern Virginia. www.roboticvisiontech.com

jobs.title: Frontend Engineer Javascript React Redux
jobs.content:
Who we are


BuzzBird is the #1 platform for influencer marketing automation. We connect branded companies and social media influencers, and in order to progress further, we’re looking for front-end engineers (m/f/other) to work with Javascript/React.


What you’ll be dealing with



  • The stack is functional, however there exists almost no legacy code since we’ve thus far been rewriting the front-end (in PHP) step by step with each new feature.

  • To do so, we use a state of the art Javascript development process loaded on a component basis, along with linting, guidelines and tests.

  • The stack is comprised of React and Redux on an ES2015 basis. The most essential modules are: react-intl, redux-form, ImmutableJS. You should be familiar with these.

  • For the front-end workflow we rely on: SCSS, SVG, Gulp and Webpack.

  • We run tests using AVA / Enzyme and Nightwatch.

  • We squash merges in GIT. You should be able to resolve conflicts that may arise.

  • The work is in the field of social media / marketing (YouTube, Instagram, Facebook,…) – So you should have at least a slight interest in this area.


We’re currently seeking multiple engineers. When it comes to team setup, we’re looking for senior level full time employees. What’s of utmost importance is that you possess a strong command of React and Redux, are able to begin on short notice and have a moderate availability.


How to proceed


If the stack and the circumstances work for you, you can apply directly by sending your application to klaus@buzzbird.de.


Application Checklist:



  • Brief résumé: Who are you? What have you worked on so far? Using which technology?

  • Tell us about your project experience with React and Redux!

  • Have you ever contributed to Open Source Projects?

  • Your conditions: What’s your idea of an ideal salary?

  • Your approximate availability and how many days per week you’d like to work and from where you want to work.

  • And most importantly: When can you start?


Meeting in person:


If your preferences and formal skills fit the profile, we’ll meet in person. Preferably face to face, if you live in Berlin. Otherwise we can first conduct a Skype interview and invite you to come to Berlin afterwards.


Onboarding:


Once we’ve agreed upon your conditions and everything else suits both sides, you’ll receive 1-2 weeks of boot camp training on-site here in Berlin (we’ll bear the costs).  Afterwards you’ll be able to work from wherever you like. We communicate using Slack and Trello. If you live in Berlin, you’re free to work in the office, as well.

jobs.title: Cloud Business Process Engineer
jobs.content:
Autodesk, the leading Design and Engineering software, is transitioning to the Cloud.  Our innovative software enables Designers and Engineers to imagine, design and create the world around us:  cars, buildings, bridges, movies, clothes, 3D printed objects and so much more.  With tools such as Simulation and Digital Prototyping, we make an efficient, productive and greener world. 


As one of the Bay Area’s most innovative companies, Autodesk’s business transformation is revolutionizing our industry. The Autodesk Cloud Platform allows designers and engineers to collaborate from anywhere on any device from anywhere in the world.  At Autodesk, we’re building the future of making things and looking for people who share a passion for making things happen.


As a member of the Cloud Operations Tools Team, you will be part of an exciting and fast-paced team working in an incredibly agile and innovative environment. This team is responsible for integrations between people, processes, and tools.  You thrive in this space.  You are a team player, who loves technology and who’s able to find lean/simple and scalable solutions to business problems. You easily build integrations, automation scripts, plug into engineering processes and support the team by providing high quality, simple solutions.  These solutions bridge the business process gaps between our development and operations teams and help the team ensure that our internal applications and people work well together.


The ideal candidate has a can-do attitude, understands software development, is a good communicator and has superior critical thinking and analytical skills in addition to the engineering discipline.

jobs.title: Product Manager, Stack Overflow Careers
jobs.content:
At Stack Overflow, we are obsessed with serving developers. Whether we’re helping developers get answers to their questions or find a new job, we build products that make millions of developers' lives better every day.  As a Product Manager for Stack Overflow Careers, you’ll work with our passionate Developer, Design, Marketing, Sales and Community teams, bridging the gap between the technical and business worlds.  You’ll spend most of your time building the product that employers interact with: posting jobs, searching profiles, and managing their recruiting pipeline.  While the product’s end users are employers, we believe the policies we put in place should be reflective of an outstanding developer experience.  If candidates are deliriously happy on our platform, employers will be as well.


You’ll have the opportunity to do a lot.  You can expect during the first year:



  • First Month: Get onboarded and brought up to speed on our current roadmap.  You’ll spend a lot of time learning about our products, building rapport with the product, marketing, community and sales teams, and building small features.



  • Next 3 Months: Start taking on projects of your own from our roadmap.  You’ll take an idea and turn it into a prototype, talk to the community on Meta, pitch your project to the rest of the company, and run a detailed testing plan.



  • Next 6 months: You can expect to being taking ownership over the employer product, Stack Overflow Careers.  You’ll be involved not just in product development, but in improving on our processes and planning the roadmap for your team.


We like to work in public.  Not only does that mean being open within the company about what the product team is building, we try and bring the community in as soon as we’re able.  Some examples of big projects we’re working on with the community presently:



  • Documentation

  • Teams

  • Jobs on Stack Overflow


We’re looking to hire the best person wherever you are in the world. We work remotely (see http://blog.stackoverflow.com/2013/02/why-we-still-believe-in-working-remotely) so you can work from home and interact with the team over Google Hangouts and chat, usually during US or European working hours. We have offices in New York, London and Denver, so if you’re in (or want to relocate to) one of those cities you can, and our offices are awesome.

jobs.title: Security Engineer Cyber Security Engineer
jobs.content:
The Cyber Security Engineer is a member of an enterprise-level team of security and compliance experts. This person is responsible for protection of the corporate infrastructure from infiltration or exfiltration as a part of the Security Operations Center (SOC). This individual is also expected to participate in many facets of corporate security and thus must have a well-rounded, hands-on background.

Viewpost encourages both independence and collaboration in an environment that fosters a fun yet serious atmosphere. Team members are expected to diligently maintain existing protocols while simultaneously challenge the status quo in an effort to continually improve and enhance the security measures at Viewpost.


The candidate must have demonstrable experience in at least 2 of the following:


* Palo Alto Networks firewall administration. Candidate must be able to troubleshoot service issues in support of Enterprise initiatives and have a strong understanding of networking concepts.  Experience with Panorama is a plus

* Websense proxy administration to include O&M of Triton and appliances.  Candidate must have experience with configuration and troubleshooting of DLP, exceptions, incidents, SSL decryption, and content filtering

* McAfee ePO administration, to include O&M of McAfee security features such as anti-virus, whole disk encryption, HIPS, and VSE.  The Candidate will be expected to keep devices up to date with latest signatures, troubleshoot issues, and report end point compliance

* Splunk administration to include data ingestion, custom alerts, agent configuration and deployment, management of indexers and heavy forwarders, development of complex queries and dashboards, and troubleshooting of Splunk service issues.  This role will require Linux experience

* Incident Response to including incident identification, investigation, response, recovery and data connectivity.



Other responsibilities include:

* Perform daily checks of all services to ensure functionality

* Interface with our internal customers to assist with their service requests

* This position may work in shifts to support a 24x7 security operations center

* This position participates in an on call rotation (approximately 1 week on call every 2 months)

* This employee shall maintain or assist in the maintenance of the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of all data in physical and/or electronic format

 

Qualifications: 

* Bachelorâs Degree in one of the STEM areas (Science, Technology, Engineering, Math)

* 6 years of experience with at least 3 years of Systems Administrator experience and two years in a role with a security focus

* Ability to automate tasks to minimize manual work
Ability to read and understand IP network designs and security fundamentals, including firewall ACLâs, router configurations, and system alerts

* The candidate should have an understanding of security policies and security best practices driven by federal regulations

* Must be able to work with geographically dispersed peers and internal customers

* Experience with IT ticketing systems and IT customer support

 

Preferred Skills: 

* Cross platform experience with Windows, Linux, MAC OS and UNIX Platforms

* Experience working in a security operations center or network operations center which operates 24/7/365

* Industry recognized professional certification (e.g., Cisco, Microsoft, SANS, CEH, Security+, CASP, CISSP Associate)

* Knowledge of security control initiatives such as ISO, SSAE 16, PCI, ITIL, and COBIT a plus

* Experience with SIEM, vulnerability scanners, IDS/IPS, forensics tools

* Experience with IDS/IPS and Snort rule creation
VPN administration experience



Accomplishments of the Security and Compliance team at Viewpost:

IDGâs 2015 CSO50 Award for top50 innovative security initiatives across the US

ISO 27001 Certified by Brightline

TRUSTe certification

AICPA certification

 


Viewpost is not accepting unsolicited assistance from search firms for this employment opportunity. All resumes submitted by search firms to any employee at Viewpost via-email, the Internet or in any form and/or method without a valid written Statement of Work in place for this position from Viewpost HR/Recruitment will be deemed the sole property of Viewpost. No fee will be paid in the event the candidate is hired by Viewpost as a result of the referral or through other means.  


 

Viewpost is an Equal Opportunity Employer that does not discriminate on the basis of actual or perceived, race, religion, color, sex (including pregnancy and gender identity), sexual orientation, parental status, national origin, age, disability, family medical history or genetic information, political affiliation, military service, any other non-merit based factoror any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state or local laws. Our leadership team is dedicated to this policy with respect to recruitment, hiring, placement, promotion, transfer, training, compensation, benefits, employee activities and general treatment during employment. If youâd like more information about your EEO rights as an applicant under the law, please click here http://www1.eeoc.gov/employers/poster.cfm  

Extra tags: cyber, security, information

jobs.title: Industrial Designer
jobs.content:
Overview:
Responsible for the design and development activities associated with Enterprise Industrial Design (ID) Server and Data Center concepts and specifications for a global market through executive engagement that optimizes the end user experience as it relates to function, aesthetics, value, ergonomics, Design language and trends. Contributes and drives design strategy, through analysis, documentation and validation of ID concepts. Ensures final designs align with corporate strategy, marketing requirements, quality, business goals, product specifications and manufacturing standards. Coordinates, manages and drives vendor / ODM commitments and business deliverables.

• Maintains a global end-user perspective in all product concepts.

• Strong communication skills
• Excellent 2D/3D digital tool skill set

jobs.title: Senior Systems Engineer
jobs.content:
Senior Systems Engineer     

About Us:

Healthx, headquartered in Indianapolis IN, is the healthcare industry's leading digital engagement platform for connecting payers, providers, consumers, employers and brokers. Founded in 1998, Healthx leverages its industry knowledge, influence, and relationships to deliver customized solutions to payers that are looking for differentiators in the healthcare space. Fueled by innovation, Healthx is one of the first healthcare technology companies to offer a cloud-based platform for member engagement and provider collaboration resulting in 16 million log-ins annually. Today, more than 150 healthcare payers across the United States rely on Healthx Solutions to drive greater ROI for their business. Healthx is powered by healthcare and technology experts that are passionate about member and provider engagement.

What we need:

A Senior Systems Engineer who is responsible for providing first tier technical support for internal end-users and customers. Responsibilities include monitoring the availability of hardware, software, and 24/7 website infrastructure. Duties include problem analysis, resolution, and escalation when hardware and software infrastructure resources are unavailable or performing unsatisfactorily and impacting business processes.  Position requires hands on troubleshooting support and experience in Windows 10 and Windows server 2008/2012.

Outcomes:

  • Installation and configuration Microsoft SQL 2014 Servers

  • Maintain Microsoft SQL 2014 Servers log shipping, or other redundant solutions

  • Administration of Office 365

  • Monitoring of server logs and security device logs

  • Backup of system files and business data

  • Maintaining system-related documentation, policies, and procedures

  • Configuration and management of network services (i.e. DNS, DHCP, IIS, etc.)

  • Installing and managing network devices (hubs, switches)

  • Setting permissions on network resources

  • Troubleshooting server hardware, software, network services, network communication issues and end-user application/network connectivity issues

  • Upgrading server hardware and software (e.g., network card replacement, operating system service packs and updates, etc.)

Requirements:

  • A passion for all things IT

  • A minimum 5-7 years Microsoft Windows server and SQL server experience

  • A willingness to learn and grow in a fast moving high demanding environment

  • Experience working with Linux servers (Debian is a plus) and Server Virtualization with Windows Server Hyper-V

  • Powershell, IDS experience, FTP server experience, PGP experience is a plus

Perks:

  • Participation in the Healthx Employee Bonus Plan
  • Excellent benefit package that includes medical, dental, vision, life, accident, disability and 401k benefits as well as paid vacation and holidays

jobs.title: Python Backend Engineer
jobs.content:
Are you interesting in helping people across the globe improve at aspects of their lives that mean the most to them? We are looking for experienced Python developers to join the core platform team to do just that.


You will be working alongside experienced Python developers as well as interfacing directly with our front-end, neuroscience, and data science teams. You’ll be part of a growing and fast moving team delivering new technologies to elite athletes and patient populations. jobs.title: Inbound Content Marketing Consultant
jobs.content:
Weâre seeking an Inbound Marketing Consultant with an emphasis on content management. 

A sampling of a few days on the job might look like this for you: 

One morning you might be writing a blog post from scratch or editing an article written by one of your writers. That afternoon you might be setting up the Facebook ads campaign. Choosing the ad images, writing the copy, strategizing about the targeting and deciding on the budget. 

The next morning will find you brainstorming article titles for a month's worth of content and by that afternoon you will be editing product descriptions and creating merchandise collections for a clientâs ecommerce site. Before you finish for the day you will assign the content orders to the best writer for each piece. 

The following day will bring a metrics and analytics deep dive, reevaluating and tweaking strategy, and planning out future tasks and deadlines. By the afternoon you will be crafting a series of emails and automated workflows; writing subject lines, ordering images from the graphic designer, writing the emails, testing links and choosing send times. Before the day ends you might have a client call where you get to educate the client on an aspect of inbound marketing, discuss a future strategy we want to implement and answer any and all questions they might have. 

And thatâs just 3 days worthâ¦ 

1. Execute and implement inbound marketing strategy and activities 
2. Working within HubSpot to create campaigns, manage the database, build workflows
3. Own and manage the content marketing efforts
4. Email marketing
5. Edit and polish content written by others
6. Content review process - liaison with writers, internal team and clients
7. Website copy, landing pages, CTA button copy 
8. Analyze client accounts and recommend strategies and tactics 
9. Main point of contact for client: personable and helpful 

You Need: 

1. Exceptional writing and editing skills with an ability to adopt different writing styles tone, and voice (a journalism degree would be a plus) 
2. Attention to detail, competency and professionalism is critical
3. HubSpot certification and experience is a plus for the application and will be required for the role
4. Ability to work remotely, think independently and be solution oriented 

**Additional notes or requirements**
Initially, this is an hourly, freelance role (first 90 days) with 20-30 hours per week, and time tracked with Harvest software. Great opportunity to grow into full-time salaried position for the right person.


Extra tags: inbound marketing, content marketing

jobs.title: Senior Data/Database Software Engineer
jobs.content:
The “TripAdvisor for Business” (T4B) team is responsible for areas of the business where we allow travel-related business like: hotels, resorts, travel agencies, vacation rentals, and restaurants to connect with their customers and travelers around the world. We help these businesses promote themselves by generating unique and new opportunities to build their brand and grow their businesses.


T4B’s Partnerships team is responsible for projects supporting display and integration of TripAdvisor content on third party websites around the world as well as integrating third party presence on TripAdvisor. This team designs and maintains the major portals into the TripAdvisor ecosystem for our business customers.


Now that you’ve got an idea about what the T4B team does, here’s some detail about the role!


This is a fast-moving and growing team and looking for someone who is just as comfortable whipping up a web page as developing the platform that will deliver that dynamic page to millions of visitors per hour (yes, millions per hour!).


So, until Chuck Norris applies for this job…


We’re looking for an experienced full-stack engineer with in-depth and hands-on knowledge of PostgreSQL, Hive/Hadoop and Microsoft SQL Server which is used to deliver our content. In this role you will design API’s, build global e-commerce systems, and create analytic platforms for customers and everything else facing our business clients.

jobs.title: Software Engineer -- Personalization
jobs.content:
TripAdvisor, the world’s largest travel site, is looking for dynamic, passionate and effective Software Engineers to join our team. Our product is the wildly successful travel website www.tripadvisor.com. Our website and mobile apps provide our users with a rich user experience to research, collaborate, and contribute. We have big data with over 150 million reviews, opinions, photos, and videos reaching over 260 million unique visitors each month.


We are seeking developers for our Personalization team, which is responsible for understanding, analyzing and delivering knowledge based on the activities of the millions of users of our site.


Can you operate in a highly-iterative agile development environment, delivering significant new functionality every week?Can you interact with a wide variety of peers across the organization to get to a single result? Are you, above all else, passionate about what you do and who you do it for?

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer, Android Team
jobs.content:
TripAdvisor, the world’s largest travel site, is looking for a talented senior software engineer in the native Android team. In this role, you'll be a driving force in the Android team. You will take the lead on key technical features, help others in the team with the harder problems, work closely with product on specs, and interface with the API and iOS teams to take the app to the next level. We iterate and deploy code fast, and everyone is looking at the impact that the team makes to our numbers.


We're rocketing up the hockey stick, playing with the coolest toys, and working on interesting problems that engage both the technical and aesthetic sides of the brain. We move quickly - projects are short (generally 3-7 days), and we have a new native release every month. The features you create will be used by millions of people every day. Trip is well known for having an extremely strong engineering organization - you'll be working with the best and getting stuff done, in the fastest growing area of an incredibly profitable, growing, fun company. Download our Android app and give it a spin!


The Facts


* Our apps are used around the world and have been download over 100 million times


* TripAdvisor has well over 100 million average monthly mobile unique visitors, which is doubling year-over-year


* We have over 3 million unique users / engineer, among the highest in the industry


* As mobile devices are replacing desktops and laptops as the standard for browsing the web, we have a unique opportunity as well as the market position to capitalize on enormous monetization potential


You Will


* Design complex systems and lead the technical solution of projects


* Work closely with our product and design teams to define feature specifications


* Be responsible for the code quality on your team


* Mentor more junior developers


* Develop, deploy and maintain the consumer-facing features of the TripAdvisor native Android App


* Be responsible for all aspects of software engineering, from design to implementation, QA and maintenance.

jobs.title: Customer Success Engineer - Remote @ Codeship
jobs.content:
As more and more teams are using Codeship for their Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery needs, we are looking to extend our Customer Success team. When our users are having problems, they’ll contact our support team, and it is our job to make sure to help them and solve their issues in a timely manner.

Your primary responsibility will be to work with our users to resolve their support tickets. Those tickets cover all possible topics from workflow specific questions to issues with their build, their Codeship setup or bug reports and feature requests. You will work closely with our Product and Engineering teams to provide feedback and help improve the customer experience. You will also make sure our documentation is up to date with current information as well as the extend and improve articles.

Codeship works remotely and asynchronously as much as possible. While this role does not require you to live near our office, it will require some travel to meet with co-workers or attend company events.

Responsibilities

  • Assisting customers with solving problems they experience with Codeship and their project setups.
  • Communicate customer feedback and requirements to Product Management teams.
  • Update and extend Codeship product documentation as well as write documentation for upcoming features.

Qualifications

  • Excellent problem-solving skills
  • Prior experience providing technical support
  • Familiarity with at least one programming language (Ruby, Python, Go, …)
  • Understanding of continuous integration and automated software testing
  • Familiarity with a modern web application stack (Rails, Django, AngularJS, …)
  • Enthusiasm for working directly with customers
  • Stellar English verbal and written communication skills
  • Familiarity with Git and GitHub or Bitbucket

Bonus Points

  • B.S. in Computer Science or a related field is strongly preferred
  • Previous experience as a Software Engineer or an Operations Engineer
  • Familiarity with LXC and/or Docker

About Codeship

Codeship started in early 2011 with the vision of bringing continuous delivery to every software team. The founding team is originally from Vienna, Austria and moved to Boston in early 2013 to take part in the Techstars Accelerator Program.

The Codeship team is distributed across multiple locations. We're committed to working together regardless of physical location or time zone. We rely on great communication to enable lots of collaboration, and you'll have the chance to work in-person with team members in different cities and offices.

Our culture is collaborative and inclusive - we value diversity. As a software development tool company we have pride in what we build and enjoy making our software available to others. We love to share the knowledge and learnings of all software engineers on our blog at blog.codeship.com

jobs.title: User Interface Specialist / Front End Developer
jobs.content:
Open Source. Open Data.


Help create useful applications for municipal governments everywhere. The Information and Technology Services Department at the City of Bloomington, Indiana develops custom software to solve challenges common to all cities. We publish these solutions as open source software via our Github page, and we strive to make use of existing open source solutions when possible.


We're looking for a skilled Front End Developer (aka Webmaster and User Interface Specialist) to help us as we make our web applications easier to use. You'll use the latest best practices in HTML, CSS, and Javascript to guide the look and feel of our public website (https://bloomington.in.gov/alpha) and internal applications (https://github.com/City-of-Bloomington). You'll manage the City of Bloomington’s website content and serves as the City’s primary Webmaster while working in a modern office environment providing health, holiday and paid time off benefits. This is a full-time non-remote position. For more details, visit us here: bloomington.in.gov/jobs.

jobs.title: Xamarin Developers
jobs.content:
Headquarters: San Francisco
URL: http://bit.ly/1YwuqbZ

About Toptal
Toptal is one of the most innovative and rapidly expanding tech start-ups from Silicon Valley. With backing from investors such as Andreessen Horowitz and Adam D’Angelo, our platform is the fastest growing labor marketplace in the history of the Internet—connecting thousands of elite engineers all over the world. In the last four years, Toptal has become the #1 choice for tech companies requiring top-tier engineering talent and for the top 3% of freelancers looking for their next challenge.

Position Description
We are looking for a Xamarin Developer passionate about creating highly performant, scalable, cross-platform, and feature-rich mobile applications for Android and iOS. Your primary responsibility will be to build production-ready, Xamarin-based mobile applications for a large variety of industry-leading clients. To do this position, you must have a deep love for creating top quality C#-based mobile applications for Android and iOS.

By joining the Toptal network, you’ll have the opportunity to work on many client projects ranging from start-ups to Fortune 500s with teams of highly skilled experts from around the world.

This is a remote position that can be done from anywhere.

Benefits:
  • Freedom to choose your own schedule and choose from a variety of hourly, part-time, and full-time projects.
  • The ability to work from wherever you want. Whether you prefer traveling and working from exotic beaches or spending time with your family and working from home, the choice is yours.
  • Access to a thriving, collaborative community of talented peers.
  • Invitations to frequent Toptal events going on around the world, including dinners, tech talks, conferences, and more.
  • Extremely competitive compensation.

Responsibilities:
  • Lead the development of iOS and Android applications using Xamarin, including writing and maintaining code, creating unit tests, collaborating with team members, and leading teams as necessary.
  • Ensure the highest level of quality throughout the mobile software development life cycle.
  • Use C# and Xamarin best practices to ensure the same quality of applications across multiple platforms with minimal duplication of effort.
  • Translate designs and wireframes into high quality code.
  • Design, build, and maintain high performance, reusable, and reliable C# code.
  • Ensure the best possible performance, quality, and responsiveness of applications.
  • Identify bottlenecks and bugs, and devise solutions to these problems.
  • Help maintain code quality, organization, and automation.
  • Collaborate with a team to define, design, and ship new features.
  • Collaborate with other team members and stakeholders. 
  • Take smart risks and champion new ideas.

Requirements:
  • Extensive experience developing mobile applications for both Android and iOS, including a deep understanding of the differences between them and the nuances of working with each.
  • Extensive experience building mobile applications using C# and the Xamarin framework, including familiarity with the APIs available with Xamarin.
  • Excellent object-oriented programming skills in C#.
  • Strong knowledge of Android SDK, different versions of Android, and how to deal with different screen sizes.
  • Strong knowledge of iOS SDK and experience with Xcode.
  • Experience with integration of web services into mobile applications, including a record of working with SOAP, REST, JSON, and XML.
  • Experience with offline storage, threading, and performance tuning.
  • Ability to design applications around natural user interfaces, such as “touch”.
  • Familiarity with the use of additional sensors, such as gyroscopes and accelerometers.
  • Ability to understand business requirements and translate them into technical requirements.
  • Familiarity with cloud message APIs and push notifications.
  • A knack for benchmarking and optimization.
  • Be willing to help your teammates, share your knowledge with them, and learn from them.
  • Be open to receiving feedback.

To apply: http://bit.ly/1YwuqbZ

jobs.title: Software Developer
jobs.company: KNMP (De Koninklijke Nederlandse Maatschappij ter bevordering der Pharmacie)
jobs.content:
Ben jij de ICT expert die graag luistert naar de klant en samen tot een oplossing wilt komen? Zie je het als een uitdaging om onze core-systemen naar het volgende niveau te brengen? Heb jij daarnaast affiniteit met de apotheek-/zorgsector? Dan is deze baan iets voor jou!

Software Developer Fulltime, Den Haag centrum

Je hebt de vrijheid om bij andere producten en teams mee te helpen. Denk hierbij aan de KNMP Kennisbank, Apotheek.nl, SFK Select, knmp.nl, pw.nl, zindex.nl, sfk.nl, de appotheek, de oncologie app, de verminderde nierfunctie app, de verkeersdeelname app en verschillende andere apps en websites. Daarbij werk je met bijzondere data en de ‘next generation’ informatievoorziening voor de zorg.

Wat ga jij als Software Developer doen?

  • Het ontwikkelen van de back-end van onze core-systemen waarmee wij onze unieke informatie ontsluiten voor de zorgsector binnen Nederland;
  • Het herkennen van structuren en patronen in data door het analyseren van onze meer dan 40 unieke kruislings verbonden bronnen;
  • Het koppelen met andere systemen en het bedenken van nieuwe manieren om onze informatie te delen met anderen via layering, API´s en webservices;
  • Het steeds verder uitbouwen en door ontwikkelen van het bestaande producten- en dienstenpakket middels het ontwikkelen van nieuwe functionaliteiten;
  • Het in kaart brengen van wensen en eisen voor nieuwe functionaliteiten en wijzigingen bij de business;
  • Het opstellen van een functionele ontwerpen aanleiding van de requirements;
  • Het werken met agile, waterval of hybride projectmethodieken.
  • Het testen van de ontwikkelde code;
  • Het bedenken van manieren die de data integriteit hoog houden en de voorspelbaarheid maximaal (door bijvoorbeeld invoerprocessen te harmoniseren).

Jij bent een Software Developer met:

  • HBO werk- en denkniveau
  • 5 tot 10 jaar ervaring als software developer
  • Je hebt ervaring/affiniteit met complexe systemen en data
  • Je hebt een passie voor het koppelen en ontsluiten van informatie via kanalen
  • Je bent zeer bekwaam in minstens één moderne programmeertaal
  • Je bent gemotiveerd om de taal Python op te pakken

Daarnaast ben je analytisch, proactief, kwaliteitsgericht en een teamplayer (ervaring met multidisciplinaire teams; zoals klanten en product owners). Je bent van nature nieuwsgierig en zeker niet bang om vragen te stellen.

Verdere Pre’s die we graag zien: Je hebt affiniteit met de apotheeksector, de zorgsector of specifieker met AIS/ZIS/HIS systemen. Je hebt ervaring met het aansturen en coachen van collega´s en teams. Eerder hebben gewerkt met online dienstverlening/front-end systemen zien we graag. Daarnaast is ervaring met pair-programming en ervaring met Python een pre. Als laatste zien we graag ervaring met Django, Pyramid, JavaScript, PHP, Flask, GIT, Angular, Bootstrap en IBM RPG.

Wat bieden wij?

  • Werken voor dé beroeps- en brancheorganisatie voor apothekers
  • De mogelijkheid om te werken met diverse back-end én front-end systemen
  • Werken in een open (minded) sfeer met gemotiveerde en slimme collega’s
  • Een uitstekend salaris
  • Goede secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden zoals; een goed opleidingsaanbod zowel incompany als persoonlijk afgestemd op de medewerker, 30 vakantiedagen, reiskostenvergoeding
  • Een werkplek in het centrum van Den Haag op loopafstand van het Centraal Station.

Werken als ICTer bij de KNMP, wie zijn wij? De Koninklijke Nederlandse Maatschappij ter bevordering der Pharmacie (KNMP) is de beroeps- en brancheorganisatie voor apothekers. De KNMP heeft tientallen producten en diensten en het merendeel hiervan is digitaal. Deze producten worden door afdeling ICT & Business Innovatie in nauwe samenhang met de product owners gerealiseerd.

Z-Index (onderdeel van de KNMP) levert bijvoorbeeld ook de G-Standaard databank uit. Dit is de standaard in Nederland die processen in de zorg zoals voorschrijven, afleveren, bestellen, declareren en het vergoeden van zorgproducten mogelijk maakt. We onderhouden ook praktijkgerichte informatiesystemen zoals de KNMP Kennisbank, wij maken en onderhouden de genomineerde website Apotheek.nl met bijna een miljoen unieke bezoekers per maand. Ook lanceren we verschillende apps en hebben we regelmatig nieuwe ideeën die we zelfstandig en met partners ontwikkelen.

Solliciteren Spreekt het je aan waar de KNMP voor staat en lijkt de baan jou op het lijf geschreven? Dan nodigen wij je graag uit om te solliciteren middels ons digitale sollicitatieformulier via de link.

Klik hier voor het sollicitatieformulier!

Heb je nog vragen? Neem dan contact op met Bill Marks (manager ICT), tel: (070) 373 72 76.

Acquisitie naar aanleiding van deze vacature wordt niet op prijs gesteld.

Trefwoorden: Vacature, Fulltime, Den Haag, Software engineer, Software ontwikkelaar.

jobs.title: Graduate Junior Full Stack Developer
jobs.content:
Role Summary:


Our multi-award winning SMS marketing platform is trusted by brands including Volkswagen, Surfers Against Sewage and Uber; and our API allows our customers to integrate SMS with Eventbrite, Zendesk and Zapier as well as many others, allowing customers to add their own integrations.


We are looking for someone who will be involved in the development of all aspects of our powerful web application, including automating the provision of our infrastructure, designing database models, building APIs and server code (primarily in PHP), as well as writing front-end HTML, CSS and JavaScript.


The role offers excellent opportunities for growth, so our ideal candidate will always be seeking to improve their knowledge and skills, and we’ll support that by sending you to conferences and providing access to relevant training.  We are a distributed agile team operating on 2-week sprints with a strong focus on testing, so the ideal candidate has great communication skills and takes ownership of code and development. 


You will report directly to FireText’s Chief Technology Officer and company directors and we are happy for you to be based at either of our offices, Reigate, Surrey or Penryn, Cornwall; remote working may be considered for the right candidate too.


The role will involve some travel to our office locations.


If you're a graduate or an engineer with web development experience looking to further your skills, apply now!


Example Duties: 



  • Development of new features, and maintenance of existing applications

  • Work with the team to design, program, and deliver software solutions using a variety of technologies and programming languages

  • Troubleshoot and fix operational issues as they arise

  • Continuous improvement of the systems and codebase

  • Ad-hoc internal support of operations

jobs.title: Senior Android Developer
jobs.content:
• Development and implementation of new and exciting features for our award-winning idealo travel App to help our users plan their next holidays

  • In cooperation with UX and Project Management teams, your UX expertise will help us achieve great user experience
