jobs.title: Campaign Support Engineer
jobs.content:
Headquarters: None - virtual office!
URL: www.moveon.org

CAMPAIGN SUPPORT ENGINEERTEMPORARY, FULL TIME • STARTS ASAP, ENDS NOV 30 • COMPETITIVE PAY • EXCELLENT BENEFITS • WORK FROM ANYWHERE IN THE CONTINENTAL US
Help make a difference this election!

In preparing for the opportunities and challenges ahead of us in the 2016 election, MoveOn is investing even more deeply in supporting our campaign team to use technology that amplifies ordinary people’s voices in our democracy. We are hiring a passionate problem solver who will work with campaigners to run innovative campaigns using top-of-the-line political technology, digital campaigning tools and data analysis. Do you love working at the intersection of progressive organizing and technology? Join our team! Together we will create impactful campaigns of massive scale. Join us for the election season and work alongside MoveOn’s core team of organizers, campaigners, data scientists, and software engineers on projects that make the world a more progressive place!

Technology is a core part of our DNA. As we prepare for election season, we need a campaign support engineer to work side by side with campaigners through the election to help them master new tools and take these tools to the limits of their ambitious imaginations.

The MoveOn team works and lives in communities around the country, providing employees tremendous flexibility to live and work anywhere in the continental United States. MoveOn staff are embedded in the communities that make up America, and we pursue the healthy development of community and social connections outside our work lives.

Responsibilities:

  • Quickly get up to speed and develop mastery in the online campaigning platform ActionKit
  • Work side by side with MoveOn team members on complex digital organizing tasks like creating targeted emails, surveys, donation forms, and live event recruitment pages.
  • Help MoveOn team members edit HTML on campaign webpages.
  • Write SQL and use data analysis tools to support team members with campaign reporting.
  • Train MoveOn team members on complex workflows that use online campaigning tools.
  • Contribute your ideas to tech team discussions to enhance and improve our digital campaigns.

Required skills and experience:

  • Working knowledge of SQL in a relational database like MySQL or PostgreSQL
  • Experience editing HTML and CSS, or a desire to quickly learn.
  • A strong interest in learning and developing expertise in new technical tools, frameworks, and software.
  • Able to fluently communicate with both technical and campaign staff, and communicate technical information to a diverse audience
  • Determined and thorough- see projects through from idea to implementation to launch, supporting MoveOn team members through the whole process.
  • Curious, and a fearless learner and problem solver.
  • Ability to be effective in an organization whose team members all work remotely.

Location: Position may be based anywhere in the continental United States.
Classification, Salary, and Benefits:  Temporary, Full-time, competitive salary including benefits such as 100%-employer-paid premiums for medical, dental, and vision insurance for all staff and their children; employer-paid premiums for life insurance for all staff; four weeks accrued paid vacation time per year; 12 weeks of paid maternity or paternity leave, 10 days accrued paid sick time; and reimbursement of office expenses.  

To apply: Go to https://docs.google.com/forms/d/1EcaYfT4PxoX4ynX3b3rU1EVV7AYDey7-ddpY_lnZ4SM/viewform to submit your application, resume, and cover letter. MoveOn.org Civic Action and MoveOn.org Political Action provide equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, disability, genetic information, marital status, amnesty, or status as a covered veteran in accordance with applicable federal, state and local laws.

jobs.title: SW Design Engineer Senior
jobs.content:
Job Description


Are you passionate about software and technology? Do you want to work in an Agile environment that is dynamic, challenging and constantly evolving? Come help us with the continued transformation of our platform into a highly scalable and robust Data Architecture. Your work will reach millions of customers around the world!


In the first 12 months you will:



  • Contribute to an industry leading analytics platform: As part of the team you will be involved in backend data integration that drives our analytics platform and data related features to bring value and insights to our customers and end users.

  • You will be part of an end-to-end service: Working closely with an agile team to deliver your work to our customers.

  • Turn requirements into product: Work with Product Owners to understand customer needs and turn them into product.

jobs.title: Manager, Software Development
jobs.content:
Build and lead a talented team of world-class developers. Deliver features and bug fixes for a market-leading software product for tens of millions of users. Work in an Agile environment architecting and building SAAS solutions to perform at internet scale. Get a chance to help redefine the Travel industry!


In this role you will:



  • Complete your team by hiring great developers: You will start out with a core of experienced developers. We’ll work with you to hire the rest of your team.

  • Be a technical leader on your team : Our development managers are also involved in architecting our product and helping drive the solutions your team produces

  • Empower your team to do good engineering work: Our teams use the right tools for the right job, and we do not have to hack fixes to meet arbitrary deadlines. We give our engineers the chance to do their work the right way the first time.

  • Be a mentor to future leaders: Your team will have a mix of senior and junior developers. They will look to you to help steer their careers at Concur.

  • Maintain a work/life balance: We are not a sweatshop. Our developers and managers work hard and have challenging problems to solve, but they go home at the end of the day and enjoy their evenings and weekends. We can’t promise you’ll never work late, but we can promise that it is not accepted as “normal.”


In order to accomplish this you will need to:



  • Take design and architecture seriously. Get the chance to design things the right way, to scale and perform as a world class product.

  • Take quality seriously. Your team has time for unit tests, integration and automation.

  • Work with Program Managers and your developers to design and build features for our world leading business travel product.

  • Help refactor and rebuild legacy code into ultra-scalable services that will allow us to continue to grow

  • Lead a team that will help build the future of corporate travel!

jobs.title: Linux Administrator
jobs.content:
We're ClickTime. We help businesses become more productive every day. Our time and expense tracking tools are used by thousands of companies worldwide.

Our office is in the heart of downtown San Francisco, with great food and coffee just steps away. As a bootstrapped, privately held, profitable entity, we provide big company benefits while maintaining the size and energy of a startup. Working with us means youâll be challenged, surrounded by high-quality teammates, and empowered to thrive.

__About the Role__

ClickTime is all about making companies more productive, and we log tens of thousands of customer hours every day to fulfill that mission. The key to our success is creating a simple application thatâs available 24/7. Thatâs where you come in.

As ClickTime's Linux Administrator, you'll be working on the ClickTime platform to make sure the lights are on all the time. Youâll help with system monitoring, troubleshooting, general maintenance, and upgrades and enhancements, all while exercising good judgment and responsibility toward a critical application.

__Responsibilities:__

* Be responsible for the Linux portion of our environment
* Assist in the support of other systems (MS Windows) as needed
* Maintain production application uptime at 99.99%
* Perform standard systems maintenance of the whole platform stack
* Perform system updates, replacements and additions as directed
* Maintain our Dev/QA and stage environments and the accompanying infrastructure (build machines, virtual hosts, test systems, source code repositories etc)
* Work collaboratively with the infrastructure team
* Resolve internal IT issues

__Requirements:__

* Responsible. This role is part of an on-call team that's available to respond to systems emergencies as part of a rotation
* Technically flexible. This is a broad role that works with many different technologies
* Highly proficient in administering Linux based operating systems (Ubuntu and CentOS)
* Comfortable working in a virtualized environment (VmWare)
* Comfortable maintaining and upgrading computer hardware
* Understanding of network technologies and relational databases

__Bonus if you have:__

* Some Experience administering Windows based servers.
* Experience working with a software development team.
* Basic understanding of relational databases.
* Experience with Git, Jenkins, CoreOS, Docker and/or Chef

__We Offer__

Competitive salary, profit-sharing (did we mention we're profitable?), medical/dental/vision, health savings account, subsidized transit, 401(k) with matching, weekly catered lunches, unlimited coffee, a dinosaur.

__What's Next__

Please submit your resume, cover letter, and relevant links (e.g. Github/bitbucket/personal website). Please, no phone calls, drop-ins, or recruiters.

_ClickTime provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics._

jobs.title: Senior Database Developer
jobs.content:
The Sr Database Developer will be responsible for database architecture, ELT process development, Data Management policy development, support and QA activities of data management developments. The individual will be responsible for coordinating with the various IT and functional system owners to design and deliver integrated Data Management solutions that will result in operational efficiency and a high data quality standard in the provisioning and distribution of enterprise data.


Responsibilities:



  • Build/enhance data models and database architecture for Enterprise data Model.

  • Assist in defining, developing and documenting Application model and architecture

  • Help define data standards and implement best practices working with the other members of the Data Management team

  • Evaluate, design and develop functional specifications through detailed technical requirements document

  • Evaluate MDM Applications, developments or models and provide recommendations for improvements

  • Evaluate existing database structures and recommend improvements

  • Build and/or maintain ELT processes in support of the enterprise model

  • Evaluate and help select various data warehousing tools and components

jobs.title: Workday Integration Engineer
jobs.content:
The Opportunity       :           Workday Integration Developer


The Johnson and Johnson, EMEA Development Centre, are currently seeking Workday Integration Developers to join our team. We develop, design and deliver high quality business applications, software solutions and services to meet J&J business technology requirements. The offices are newly designed, specifically to accommodate Scrum development and are based on the University of Limerick Campus. It is an open and highly collaborative environment based on LEAN principles with a strong emphasis on continuous integration, automated testing and continuous delivery. Scrum teams are encouraged to be self-organising and autonomous.


Responsibilities:



  • Developing J&J’s Digital Experience across brands, electronic media and software delivery channels.


Requirements:



  • At least 4-5 years of strong integrations and reporting experience in Workday technologies

    • Workday Studio

    • Core connectors

    • PICOF/PECI experience required

    • Cloud Connect

    • Calculated fields

    • EIBs

    • ILOADS



  • Demonstrated experience in XSLTs, XSDs, WSDLs and web services (Workday Public Web Services SOAP/REST).

  • Solid competency in configuring and customizing the integration patterns

  • Workday Developer Certification

  • Minimum 5 years total HR/IT experience

jobs.title: .NET Web Developer
jobs.content:
Position Summary:


As Web Developer at Marcel Digital you will lead full life cycle, full stack development for custom, CMS, and ecommerce driven websites.


Functions and Responsibilities:



  • Develop and maintain client websites including front and back end development, managing databases, working with design teams, setting up cloud hosting, DNS, SSL, monitoring.

  • Develop on the ASP.NET MVC stack (including Umbraco).

  • Ability to work with or learn web technologies such as HTML5, CSS3, jQuery, Twitter Bootstrap, C#, PHP, Angular, Azure, Google Analytics and Tag Manager, Entity Framework, SQL Server, MySQL, Visual Studio, Visual Studio Online, Gulp, Grunt, Continuous Integration

  • Integrate with external systems, such as databases, payment processing systems, CRMs, email delivery and other web services.

  • Provide troubleshooting and technical support to clients to resolve bugs, downtime, hosting or other issues.

  • Use Git and SVN manage and collaborate on source code.

  • Work in agile processes on small teams and individually.

  • Ability to refactor new and existing code.

  • Stay ahead of technology curve by following web development trends and news and prototyping new functionalities and attaining appropriate certifications.

  • Work with client teams and internal account teams to gather requirements for tasks and projects.

  • Recommend technical, usability, performance or process improvements that will contribute to achieving clients’ business goals.

  • Ensure cross browser compatibility and usage on mobile devices (responsive, mobile first).

  • Test websites and services using manual as well as automated methods.

  • Implement on-site SEO recommendations and Google Analytics customizations.

  • Collaborate with sales and account teams to evaluate clients’ websites to understand online goals, challenges and objectives.

  • Provide estimates for development projects and tasks.

jobs.title: Drupal Developer
jobs.content:
The Opportunity       :           Drupal Web Developer


The Johnson and Johnson, EMEA Development Centre, are currently seeking Drupal Developers to join our team. We develop, design and deliver high quality business applications, software solutions and services to meet J&J business technology requirements. The offices are newly designed, specifically to accommodate Scrum development and are based on the University of Limerick Campus. It is an open and highly collaborative environment based on LEAN principles with a strong emphasis on continuous integration, automated testing and continuous delivery. Scrum teams are encouraged to be self-organising and autonomous.


Responsibilities:



  • Developing J&J’s Digital Experience across brands, electronic media and software delivery channels.


Requirements:



  • 3+ years’ experience writing clean, hand-coded X/HTML, JavaScript and CSS in consumer-facing web applications.

  • 3+ years’ experience of development of web applications using Drbaupal.

  • Experience of creating your own Drupal modules.

  • Experience updating Drupal CORE and contributions to Drupal modules a plus.

  • Experience using GIT SCM.

  • Experiences working with SASS and compiled styles.

  • Excellent mastery of web standards, cross-browser compatibility and building in accessibility from the ground up.

  • Familiar with jQuery, Backbone, Angular and node.js.

  • Comfortable debugging client-side issues with firebug, web developer and similar tools.

  • Experience architecting web solutions.

  • Strong server-side development skills -- primarily PHP (Python a plus).

  • Solid understanding of web technologies such as HTTP/S, REST, JSON, FTP, SSH, SMTP, SOAP and REST.

jobs.title: Growth Engineer - Full Stack
jobs.content:
Who We’re Looking For


The growth team is small, versatile, focused, data driven and aggressive group that works on our core and new products in a SaaS business model.  We are constantly pushing ourselves to learn new growth strategies, tactics, and techniques.  As part of the growth team you'll have the opportunity to be involved in growing a product or feature from thousands to millions of users.   


The growth team blends people with engineering, design, product, and marketing skills in one cohesive unit to work in quick iterative experiment cycles aimed at increasing growth rate and learning about our customer, product, and channels. 


You may be a good fit for the growth team if you have some of these qualities:



  • Done is better than perfect attitude

  • Aggressive and competitive mentality

  • Voracious learners

  • Resilient to failure and always looking to improve

  • Opinions and ideas on how to do things better

  • Bias towards action

  • Impact driven

  • Understands that communication is the biggest responsibility of your job but you need to focus on it to get it right.

  • Focuses on shipping software that matters to your users and that matters to the company you’re building it for.

  • Lastly, Everyone knows that when you take on a task regardless if it’s huge and scary or tiny and boring, you’re going to see it through to the best of your ability.


What You’ll Be Doing


Increasing growth rate by implementing and executing growth experiments across the entire product funnel (Acquisition, Activation, Retention, Revenue, Referral)


Tasks include:


As a member of the growth team you will decide the activities you work on to achieve the goals we have set as a team.  Here are some possible activities that you may be involved with:



  • Working with other growth team members to implement features activation, retention, and virality features associated with growth experiments 

  • Implementing analytics to gain deeper insights on how users are engaging with our product, where friction is occurring, and where users are leaking out of the funnel

  • Exploring code to find bugs and friction points that might be slowing down growth


What’s in it for you:



  • Passionate coworkers -- you’ll work with open-minded, enthusiastic people who will constantly challenge and motivate you to go above and beyond to produce great work and grow in your career.

  • Transparency -- you’ll experience an open door policy that gives you the unique opportunity of having direct and informal access to our entire team.

  • Individual ownership -- you’ll be empowered to take personal ownership of projects that can directly impact the future direction and overall success of our products.

  • Diversity of thought -- you’ll become part of a talented team with a wide range of skills, experience, and philosophy.


We are:



  • A communication and collaboration company used daily by tens of thousands of business locations to schedule hundreds of thousands of hourly workers around the world.

  • A well-funded ($15M Series B in June ‘16) 100+ person company growing at a fast rate.

  • A 2X Best Places to Work

  • Led by a CEO named to the 2016 Business Journal 40 under 40 and Inc.com 2014 list of 35 Under 35 Coolest Entrepreneurs

  • The 2013 Minnesota Cup High Tech Division Winner


From our employees:



  • “I work here because the team is awesome. There's no politics, there's no middle management second guessing everything or micro-managing my time, and everyone treats each other with respect.”

  • “There’s so much to do to make the app a world-class app, I’m anxious to get it there and I believe I know how to do it. I enjoy building things, so this is right up my alley!”

  • “What's cool about the work - The fact that I'm legitimately given the latitude to directly contribute to new initiatives and major product changes. I'm not micromanaged. I am empowered to determine what to do to help grow the company and to go do it.”

  • “The people who work here are a lot of fun! Even though we’ve grown to 100 employees it’s still easy to get to know people especially if you join in on the lunch room shenanigans ;) The company activities we do are always fun too.”


Benefits:



  • Medical and dental benefits

  • Paid vacation and holidays

  • Flexible work environment

  • Dynamic and dedicated team

  • Data/Cell (internet) stipend

  • Casual dress code

  • Most of all smart and driven team members that love to collaborate, seek feedback, and improve


Sound Like a Good Fit?


Check out our core values. If they excite you, we’d love to talk!  Please submit the following to apply:



  • Resume (including months/years of employment for each position)

  • Cover letter explaining why you’d like to work at When I Work, and not somewhere else.


Not looking right now for a new job?


That’s OK… we are going to be hiring through 2016. Let’s talk about what you may be looking for down the road.


*Must already be authorized to work in the United States on a full-time basis for any employer.

jobs.title: Android Lead Developer
jobs.content:
Surkus is a rapidly growing, well-funded, mobile-first platform where anyone can cast amazing people for events, parties, product launches, and a wide variety of exciting experiences. Surkus transcends traditional entertainment and on-demand staffing applications to allow clients nearly instant to talented, amazing people for real-world events.

An extraordinary user experience is paramount to our mission. We are leveraging advanced smartphone capabilities including geofencing, personalized notifications, hyper-targeting, and advanced UI/UX/interactions.

We are experiencing tremendous growth and driving significant technology innovations in our space. We are expanding our team with talented technology leaders in every area.

Our applications demand skill and vision to take advantage of the latest capabilities in the Android platforms. You will work with other top-notch developers with advanced skills in a variety of technologies that will be sure to complement your capabilities.

We currently have offices in Hollywood and Santa Monica.


Keywords: Android, Java, React, ReactNative


Benefits


Benefits include

  • Health insurance
  • Incentive stock options

jobs.title: Engineering Manager
jobs.content:
Who We’re Looking For


You love technology and really get excited about leading a technical team. You love to make sure all the trains run on time, any roadblocks are cleared and are constantly looking for ways to make the team and how they deliver products more efficient and predictable.


While you can talk technology and code, you also really enjoy spending your time leading a team, relying on their technical input and watching them produce code and products that are greater than the sum of their parts.  When hiring, you know when a candidate can raise the bar of the team and when they may not be a match. You also enjoy mentoring other developers through 1on1s, talking about their current challenges and their long and short term goals. You are pro-active and constantly looking for way to improve how your team builds software.


You'll work on everything from hiring to 1-on-1 meetings, from discussing technology to writing documents, from helping a product manager build a feature to helping support troubleshoot it. Sometimes all in the same day.


You are a leader who:



  • Focuses on shipping software that matters to your users and that matters to the company you’re building it for.

  • Experimented with and survived many different types of development and project methodologies, which has left you with a healthy appreciation for what works the “agile” methodologies and those that came before (and after) them. You know one size doesn’t fit all.

  • Loves creating an atmosphere where the team can thrive and growth through encouragement and mentorship.

  • Brings passion, innovation and problem solving to every endeavor and have fun doing it.

  • Has a strong desire to help your team get better each day and isn’t afraid to have the hard conversations needed to help point the team in the right direction.

  • Desires to be personally responsible for an engineering team that produces production level code. The buck stops with you.

  • Understands that communication is the biggest responsibility of your job but you need to focus on it to get it right. You care about how your work and attitude affects others around you.

  • Lastly, everyone knows that when you take on a task regardless if it’s huge and scary or tiny and boring, you’re going to see it through to the best of your ability.


What You’ll Be Doing


You’ll be working alongside our product team, building apps that make every piece of hourly workforce management - scheduling, time tracking, shift trading and more - easy and straightforward, for managers and employees alike. We not looking for you just to complete a task but build a product together with product management, designer, other developers and QA on a cross-functional team. You'll work on everything from hiring to mentoring, from 1on1s to performance reviews, from helping a Product Manager figure out how to get something shipped to helping support get there bugs in the pipeline to be fixed. Sometimes all in the same day.


Responsibilities include:



  • Establishing focus and execution of the team to build new features, and analyzing (and reacting) to the results you discover from our system services and user feedback. We love data and to aid us in making decisions.

  • Mentorship and growth of the team members.

  • Hiring a stand out team.

  • Constantly evaluating and building engineering processes that helps the team run efficiently and has fun doing it.


What’s in it for you:



  • Passionate coworkers -- you’ll work with open-minded, enthusiastic people who will constantly challenge and motivate you to go above and beyond to produce great work and grow in your career.

  • Transparency -- you’ll experience an open door policy that gives you the unique opportunity of having direct and informal access to our entire team.

  • Individual ownership -- you’ll be empowered to take personal ownership of projects that can directly impact the future direction and overall success of our products.

  • Diversity of thought -- you’ll become part of a talented team with a wide range of skills, experience, and philosophy.


We are:



  • A communication and collaboration company used daily by tens of thousands of business locations to schedule hundreds of thousands of hourly workers around the world.

  • A well-funded ($15M Series B in June ‘16) 100+ person company growing at a fast rate.

  • A 2X Best Places to Work

  • Led by a CEO named to the 2016 Business Journal 40 under 40 and Inc.com 2014 list of 35 Under 35 Coolest Entrepreneurs

  • The 2013 Minnesota Cup High Tech Division Winner


From our employees:



  • “I work here because the team is awesome. There's no politics, there's no middle management second guessing everything or micro-managing my time, and everyone treats each other with respect.”

  • “There’s so much to do to make the app a world-class app, I’m anxious to get it there and I believe I know how to do it. I enjoy building things, so this is right up my alley!”

  • “What's cool about the work - The fact that I'm legitimately given the latitude to directly contribute to new initiatives and major product changes. I'm not micromanaged. I am empowered to determine what to do to help grow the company and to go do it.”

  • “The people who work here are a lot of fun! Even though we’ve grown to 100 employees it’s still easy to get to know people especially if you join in on the lunch room shenanigans ;) The company activities we do are always fun too.”


Benefits:



  • Medical and dental benefits

  • Paid vacation and holidays

  • Flexible work environment

  • Dynamic and dedicated team

  • Data/Cell (internet) stipend

  • Casual dress code

  • Most of all smart and driven team members that love to collaborate, seek feedback, and improve


Sound Like a Good Fit?


Check out our core values. If they excite you, we’d love to talk!  Please submit the following to apply:



  • Resume (including months/years of employment for each position)

  • Cover letter explaining why you’d like to work at When I Work, and not somewhere else.


Not looking right now for a new job?


That’s OK… we are going to be hiring through 2016. Let’s talk about what you may be looking for down the road.

jobs.title: Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Toyon is seeking individuals capable of developing object-oriented software in the C++ programming language. Experience deploying software on graphics processing units (GPU), digital signal processors (DSP), and CPU devices is of particular interest. Experience writing software for image and/or signal processing applications is desired, but not required. Experience working in a collaborative environment with configuration management and version control tools is a plus. Strong math skills which provide the ability to understand advanced image and signal processing algorithms is also a plus.


Candidates with a Bachelor’s degree or higher in engineering, computer science, or a physical science are encouraged to apply.


U.S. Citizenship is Required. Ability to qualify for a US Department of Defense security clearance required. 


Please e-mail resume to:


employment@toyon.com


WE OFFER AN EXCEPTIONAL EMPLOYEE BENEFITS PACKAGE!


Toyon is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer Minorities/Females/Vet/Disability

jobs.title: Architect
jobs.content:
Who We’re Looking For


We're looking for an experienced (seriously, been there done that) architect to join our growing team. You’re still in the code (in PHP, and Native iOS/Android) day in and day out but also take time to work with others, both technical and non-technical, to help develop the appropriate technical solutions. You are humble enough to work with other frameworks, technologies, constraints, and people when that's the easiest and/or best thing to do.


You make pragmatic (often boring) technology choices but are always exploring other solutions. You are confident with a number of programming languages, operating systems, and architectures. You probably have one of each you prefer right now, but you’re neither dogmatic nor myopic in your focus on it.  You have experience building systems that scale. #growing


Finally, you love to teach and learn from your co-workers. You notice when someone is struggling or not grasping a concept and are eager to help them figure it out.  


You are a leader who:



  • Focuses on shipping software that matters to your users and that matters to the company you’re building it for.

  • Knows the right time to ask for help, get input or delegate a task

  • Has a working knowledge of the basics of agile (backlogs, estimation, progress updates and retrospectives).

  • Brings passion, innovation, problem solving and some fun to every endeavor.

  • Has a preoccupation with staying on top of industry trends and new technology.

  • Desires to be responsible for a team that produces performant production level code. The technical buck stops with you.

  • Understands that communication is the biggest responsibility of your job but you need to focus on it to get it right. You care about how your work and attitude affects others around you.

  • Lastly, Everyone knows that when you take on a task regardless if it’s huge and scary or tiny and boring, you’re going to see it through to the best of your ability.


What You’ll Be Doing


You’ll be working alongside our product team, building apps that make every piece of hourly workforce management - scheduling, time tracking, shift trading and more - easy and straightforward, for managers and employees alike. We not looking for you just to complete a task but build a product together with product management, designer, other developers and QA on a cross-functional team. You'll work on everything from hiring to mentoring, from writing code to code reviews, from helping a Product Manager architect a product to helping support troubleshoot it. Sometimes all in the same day.


Tasks include:



  • Establishing and documenting the technical direction of the team in partnership with product and design to build new features, and analyzing (and reacting) to the results you discover from our system and user feedback. We love data to aid us in making decisions.

  • Writing code, doing coding reviews, pairing and technical mentorship of team members

  • Assist with vetting and hiring great engineers

  • Constantly evaluating and building architectures that can scale and are performant that delight customers and others can tell you’re fun doing it.


What’s in it for you:



  • Passionate coworkers -- you’ll work with open-minded, enthusiastic people who will constantly challenge and motivate you to go above and beyond to produce great work and grow in your career.

  • Transparency -- you’ll experience an open door policy that gives you the unique opportunity of having direct and informal access to our entire team.

  • Individual ownership -- you’ll be empowered to take personal ownership of projects that can directly impact the future direction and overall success of our products.

  • Diversity of thought -- you’ll become part of a talented team with a wide range of skills, experience, and philosophy.


We are:



  • A communication and collaboration company used daily by tens of thousands of business locations to schedule hundreds of thousands of hourly workers around the world.

  • A 2X Best Places to Work

  • Led by a CEO named to the 2016 Business Journal 40 under 40 and Inc.com 2014 list of 35 Under 35 Coolest Entrepreneurs

  • The 2013 Minnesota Cup High Tech Division Winner


From our employees:



  • “I work here because the team is awesome. There's no politics, there's no middle management second guessing everything or micro-managing my time, and everyone treats each other with respect.”

  • “There’s so much to do to make the app a world-class app, I’m anxious to get it there and I believe I know how to do it. I enjoy building things, so this is right up my alley!”

  • “What's cool about the work - The fact that I'm legitimately given the latitude to directly contribute to new initiatives and major product changes. I'm not micromanaged. I am empowered to determine what to do to help grow the company and to go do it.”

jobs.title: Ruby On Rails Engineer
jobs.content:
We’re looking for a full-time Ruby on Rails engineer with a passion for collaboration, problem-solving, and happiness at work to join our growing team. As a Rails Engineer, you’d be responsible for owning features from start to finish while working with your scrum team to ensure we rapidly deliver excellent results. You’d develop on the full stack from the React front end all the way to the MongoDB database.


What you’ll do:



  • Collaborate with other team members to creatively solve problems ranging from scalability and performance to user interface and experience

  • Design and develop REST APIs to be used by our web client, mobile clients, and our customers

  • Write reliable tests and review others’ code to help keep the bugs out

  • Influence our product’s direction with your ideas

  • Support our customers by understanding their needs and improving our platform to meet them

jobs.title: Technical Lead Software Architect
jobs.content:
We are a software engineering group within HBO that develops and supports applications critical to the creation, marketing, distribution, and reselling of HBO products and are a fundamental part of HBO’s innovation and success, with offices in New York City and Los Angeles.
 
Realizing this mission requires a staff of highly motivated and technically flexible software professionals across a variety of disciplines: development, program management, test, and design. We are hiring people to build a team that can create engaging, high-quality solutions, platforms and interactive experiences.
 
We are looking for a Technical Leader with the knowledge, motivation, and energy to help build robust and flexible custom applications as well as implement third-party software packages. Our group supports departments such as Business Affairs, Creative Services, Enterprises, and Program Strategy and Planning. The applications we architect, develop, and support are critical to the creation, marketing, distribution, and reselling of HBO products and are a fundamental part of HBO’s innovation and success.

jobs.title: Marketing Manager - Digital and Operations
jobs.content:
Magnetic’s Marketing Manager of Digital and Operations is a key position responsible for optimizing our digital and demand generation campaigns, database and Marketo/Salesforce.com processes.  You will report directly into the Senior Manager, Digital and Demand Generation and will be supporting digital, demand generation and client marketing efforts by setting up end-to-end processes including the planning, execution and deep-dive reporting of campaigns including ROI analytics and metrics for strategic decision-making.

The goal of this position is to increase integrated marketing efficiency across digital and demand generation.  You will be responsible for reinforcing marketing decisions with planning, data accuracy, metrics, process and best practices via end-to-end marketing optimization.  We are looking for a go-getter who thinks independently and thrives in a fast-paced, get-things-done environment.

We believe in your ability to succeed at the following:

  • Support digital programs through execution of cross-channel campaigns spanning search (paid & earned), display, paid social, and sponsorships
  • Contribute to website development and layout, including website management (updates, new pages, SEO, etc.)
  • Derive insights and analysis of paid media efforts to inform larger team of key trends
  • Create emails, landing pages, forms, lists, workflows and reports in marketing automation tool
  • Assist in the creation of nurture programs including writing, implementing and analyzing
  • Own the database, including data cleansing, augmentation, and normalization. Responsible for growing the marketable database
  • Track ongoing marketing metrics, including digital and lead generation campaigns, effectiveness, event ROI, engagement levels and pipeline advancement
  • Support marketing campaigns with effective data segmentation and list building
  • Support MarCom team in event processes, including email sends, audience segmentation, list pulling and post-event list uploads with hand-off to sales for follow-up

What we’d want to attract in candidates for this role:

  • 2-4 years of experience in a marketing operations / digital / analytics role
  • Experience working with paid media tools (Google AdWords, LinkedIn Ads, Twitter Ads)
  • Experience working with tools that support websites such as Content Management Systems, Analytics and SEO tools (Wordpress, Google Analytics preferred)
  • Experience or strong interest in analyzing, interpreting and creating reports with strong spreadsheet, quantitative and forecasting skills
  • Love and thrive working in Marketing Automation tools (Marketo preferred)
  • Metrics-focused marketer who loves analyzing and understanding data to inform decisions
  • Emerging leader; Ability to think independently about a problem, create a project plan, take action and drive projects to completion
  • Highly organized, methodical and detail oriented
  • Effective time management skills and the ability to prioritize projects (we are busy!)
  • Ability to effectively communicate and collaborate with different business units

What we offer in return:

We are Magnetic. We’re full of independent thinkers who inspire our brand, products and culture everyday, and we have fun while we’re at it. Here’s what you should expect when you join Magnetic:

  • Competitive salaries
  • Employee stock options
  • Unlimited vacation days -- breathe easy and balance your life the way you want it!
  • Company and team volunteer days
  • Full benefits (medical/dental/vision) with Sherpaa and Health Advocate access
  • 401k plan, commuter benefits, and thousands of discounts and perks
  • A results-oriented startup mindset, with sane working hours and a stable business model
  • We love Mac + PC users, you choose how you want to work and with what operating system

About Magnetic

Magnetic is a technology company with a marketing platform for enterprises, brands and agencies. Our  prospecting, remarketing, and merchandising solutions help marketers find, keep and bring back customers across channels and devices. These solutions are powered by our unique data including purchase intent and behavioral insights.

Our corporate headquarters, located in Silicon Alley, includes a fully stocked kitchen, our very own pool hall for an afternoon billiards match, and a beautiful office space designed to showcase our culture of transparency and collaboration.  And if you’re an urban outdoors enthusiast, Madison Square Park and all it has to offer is just one block away!

ROXIMITY offers innovative beacon hardware, a robust SDK, and a full suite of targeted mobile messaging and analytics tools.

THE PERSON

You are excited and energized by a dynamic and fluid start-up environment. You are comfortable on a small team and don’t fear taking charge. You can make wise, strategic decisions despite ambiguity. You can communicate your ideas and understand others well. You focus on great results and getting things done. You produce innovative solutions to problems. You have strong opinions that are held lightly. You are constantly learning and improving. You are known for your candor and directness. You collaborate with others to solve hard problems. You must have a solid understanding of building large software systems and the potential trade-offs involved. You have a desire to learn and to mentor others.

Verve is a location-based mobile marketing platform that connects advertisers with consumers to deliver successful business outcomes. The company's proprietary location intelligence, patented technology, premium inventory, and analytics capabilities empower marketers to identify, reach and engage consumers with compelling advertising experiences. Headquartered in New York City, Verve has offices in Washington, D.C., Chicago, San Diego, Denver, San Francisco, Los Angeles, London, Eastern Europe, India and Southeast Asia. jobs.title: Opportunity for Faculty Position
jobs.company: Graduate School of Media Design, Keio University
jobs.content:
The Keio University Graduate School of Media Design, known as Keio Media Design or KMD, invites applications from qualified individuals for a tenure track faculty position. The preferred starting date is February 1, 2017, or as soon as possible thereafter.

KMD is a graduate program which educates creative global leaders who understand the core creative skills of design, technology, management, and policy. Education will take a practical, hands-on, and global approach by offering various projects grounded in practice by collaborating with international partner institutions and research facilities. KMD is planning to expand the current multi-location operation to incorporate transnational education. The formal languages are both English and Japanese, thus we welcome faculty, researchers, and students with English proficiency.

KMD invites collaboration-minded applicants with relevant qualifications, experience, and demonstrated excellence in innovative works combining two or more of the following areas:
・ Design Thinking
・ Experience Design
・ Fashion and Wearable Design
・ Food and Gastronomy
・ Health and Wellness Design
・ Hospitality Design
・ Information Aesthetics
・ Interaction Design
・ Responsive Architecture and Ambient Design
・ Multi-Sensory Design
・ Service Design
・ Singularity and Deep Learning
・ Smart Cities and Enchanted Homes
・ Sports Design
・ Transmedia Cinematography
・ Technology-based Agriculture
・ Cognitive Design

Qualified candidates should have a master’s and preferably a doctoral degree with a proven commitment to quality teaching at the graduate level, or professional equivalence in a related field. The salary is commensurate with experience, according to Keio University guidelines.

The successful candidate will undertake teaching duties, engage in projects (called “Real Projects”), and share some administrative tasks including joining committees and meetings. The successful applicant will be expected to teach theoretical and practical hands-on courses at the graduate level, build and lead a team of graduate students in collaborative projects, and secure corporate partnerships to conduct research that has social and economic impact. Education duties will be conducted mainly in Yokohama, Japan, with some additional teaching and project activities around Japan as well as overseas at international partner locations.

Interested individuals should include the following in their application package:
• Letter of application (please tell us why you are interested in this position, and how you see yourself fitting into the program)
• Curriculum Vitae
• Statement of teaching and/or research philosophy
• 3-5 examples of published works (papers, design works, commercial products/services)
• 3 letters of reference:
Please arrange to have three letters of reference submitted via email directly by the referees by the deadline to kmd-search@adst.keio.ac.jp.
The letter should be sent as a signed PDF file.

Please register your information on our website:
http://www.kmd.keio.ac.jp/en/information/2016/07/openposition.html

Applications should be received by September 22, 2016 to receive full consideration.
All application materials should be sent as PDF files via email to kmd-search@adst.keio.ac.jp.

For the second screening, short listed candidates will be invited to an interview session which can be arranged to be conducted remotely by a video conferencing system such as Polycom or Skype.

For more information about KMD, see http://www.kmd.keio.ac.jp/
Questions should be directed by email to the Search Committee at kmd-search@adst.keio.ac.jp.

jobs.title: Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Infogroup is looking for top talent to join our fast-paced and innovative team. We are seeking a Software Engineer to join our Papillion office. jobs.content:
We are looking for a Software Engineer in Data Science to join our team supporting research and development at a fast-paced agronomic solutions company. Mendel's goal is to be a global leader in delivering targeted, science-driven biological products that improve crop productivity.  As part of the Data Science group, the employee will work closely with Mendel's fermentation, high-throughput screening, chemistry and expression profiling groups.  Responsibilities include a wide range of data-driven programming tasks involving automation, analysis, and interfaces for proprietary and public databases, and data from internal laboratory information systems.  Excellent oral and written communication skills and a demonstrated ethic of documentation are required. 


A Day In The Life Typically Includes:



  • Data analysis: Support and develop server-side software for autonomous data collection, analysis and reporting from sources, such as, laboratory robots and scientific devices

  • Data visualization: Support and develop client-side data-driven web interfaces to data

  • Life cycle management: Interact with chemists, biologists and other scientists to define requirements and formal specifications, quickly build prototypes, and specify deliverable timelines for analysis pipelines and data interfaces 

  • Collaboration: Work cross-functionally within the business and with corporate IT support on small to large projects


If interested, please go to www.kochcareers.com and apply via Job Number 040538. You may also apply via the link below.

jobs.title: Senior Oracle Software Engineer
jobs.content:
It is an interesting time to be in enterprise IT. There's the old world and new world. There's the SAN + proprietary database world and there's Cloud + open data formats world. In the new world, you own your data and can process it any way you like, simultaneously. Hadoop with Spark, Storm, Flink, Phoenix, Presto, Hive, Impala or straight MapReduce - you choose. Modern software running in cloud, on commodity hardware, slowly eats the legacy world. However, the old world is not going away - any time soon. We've been around for long enough to know that. Enterprise data continues to be born in many different old world systems, where it will graduate to new world for modern analytics and processing. We connect the old and new worlds. We 'glue' them together.


We're looking for Senior Software Developers to join our team. Remote work offered if located in the US and open to travel.

jobs.title: Podcast-loving product managers, come shape the future of audio
jobs.content:
Slate Magazine helped pioneer podcasting back in 2005, but in the last 10 years, the technology powering on-demand audio has barely changed. 


But it’s about to.


In 2015, Slate launched Panoply, which brings millions of listeners the smartest conversations that podcasting has to offer through 50 shows from the New York Magazine, Wall Street Journal, Vox, Vulture, Gretchen Rubin, Tablet, Vanity Fair, Sports Illustrated and many more. 


Panoply is a tight knit group of some of the smartest engineers, producers, entrepreneurs and thinkers, and today we’re looking for a brilliant Product Manager to help us chart the future of podcasting. 


Working at Panoply means flexible office hours, casual dress, full benefits, competitive salaries, an office 20 steps from the Farragut North metro exit in Washington, DC, team happy hours, and working alongside our colleagues at Slate. We have a friendly work environment, but coolness under pressure, and comfort with short time horizons is a must. 


Responsibilities



  • Lead a cross-functional team of world-class engineers, designers, and podcast creators to conceptualize and build innovative best-in-class digital audio products.

  • Work closely with the Director of Product to shape the product roadmap and overall strategic direction with an eye towards maximizing customer acquisition, advertising revenue, and partner satisfaction.

  • Stay abreast of all changes in the rapidly evolving digital audio market, from new advertising formats to in-home audio APIs to app store requirements, share that learning across the organization, and adjust product strategy accordingly.

  • Define and analyze metrics that inform the success of new and existing products.

  • Integrate usability studies, market research and analysis, and customer feedback into product requirements.

  • Conduct testing to understand how potential UX modifications will influence core business metrics before deploying them broadly.

  • Proactively engage with stakeholders, including the editorial team and external content partners, the sales team, the Panoply executive team, and others throughout the organization, communicating with them on product cycles and strategic priorities.

  • Deliver products on time and on budget, working with a 7-person development team dedicated to audio.

  • Lead projects in a transparent and productive way, applying standard project management practices.

jobs.title: Senior Embedded Software Engineer
jobs.content:
OpenCar, recently acquired by INRIX, is powering the next generation of connected cars with unique, easy-to-use applications designed specifically to use behind the wheel. INRIX is the global leader in connected car services and intelligent movement, a new approach that leverages big data and the cloud to help manage urban mobility.


Our partners are automakers, governments, mobile operators, developers, advertisers, as well as enterprises large and small. We are literally everywhere with over 450 customers across 60 countries. INRIX has offices around the globe.


We’re looking for an experienced advanced C++ developer to join our team in Seattle. You will be part of a growing team building In-Vehicle Infotainment (IVI)integrations to support our JavaScript framework for in-car services and APIs used by automotive applications.


In this position, you will have the opportunity to collaborate with OEMs on integrating the INRIX/OpenCar framework to their key IVI features across operating systems and technologies through common interfaces and specifications.


Who we are looking for: 



  • You are an experienced embedded software engineer working with automotive IVI systems and devices from BSP to middleware to application layer, or similar from other industry.

  • You are fluent in C/C++, adept with Linux and Make / Autotools, debuggers, toolchains, and profiling tools.

  • You are proficient with board bring-up from one or more silicon vendors.

  • You are familiar with optimizing embedded systems.

  • You thrive on writing the adapter logic that ties functionality across API boundaries to match requirements.

  • You understand and are comfortable working with threads, sockets, services, and IPC.

  • You’ve delivered products in an iterative, agile software lifecycle

  • You have experience adapting existing functionality to meet service interface requirements.

  • You are collaborative, have a strong work ethic, are reliable and a self-starter.

  • You have a Bachelor’s or advanced degree in computer science or related discipline/


Extra bonus points if you:



  • Are familiar with Yocto.

  • Are familiar with Wayland and window management

  • Are familiar with GENIVI.

  • Are quite adept at JavaScript and have worked on significantly JavaScript-based projects. (Our platform is an HTML5 application platform.  Embedded engineers, do not let this deter you from applying).

  • Have background or knowledge with integrating an HTML5 runtime engine.

  • Have worked with automotive applications or stacks.

  • Have experience in QNX (for integrations).

  • Have experience in Windows and Mac (for SDK).


What you’re looking for:



  • A chance to work in a dynamic environment, learn new technologies and hone skills

  • Solve complex problems to develop software which delivers direct value to our customers

  • Ability to work at multiple levels in the technical stack and not get pigeonholed.

  • Ability to lead teams of external engineers working with automotive OEMs and tier-1 suppliers.

  • Be part of a team where fun, smart, passionate, ambitious engineers work together to build great systems

  • A fast–growing, global company where you’ll be challenged to think about things that no one has thought of yet

  • A position where you’re a critical voice in development


Are you ready to join a different kind of company? Exciting things are happening all the time. 


Come join us!

jobs.title: Senior Experience Designer, Lead
jobs.content:
Job Description: Senior Experience Designer, Lead-43404

Our company
At Adobe, we’re changing the world. How? We give people the tools to bring their ideas to life and create content that makes life more fun and work more meaningful. We give businesses and organizations the power to truly engage their customers. We're the ones behind the gorgeously designed content that streams across your laptop, TV, phone, and tablet every day—and we’re the ones who harness the massive power of big data to help companies move from data to insight and insight to action by delivering content that people crave most.

We’re a company that understands that product innovation comes from people innovation, and that’s why we invest in cultivating leaders throughout the organization.
If you’re passionate about leading from where you sit, join us.

The challenge
XD Studio is an internal incubator within Adobe’s Experience Design (XD) organization that employs an experience-first mindset coupled with a highly iterative, rapid prototyping process to develop new products and services. As a cross-disciplinary team of designers, developers, and product managers, we believe in examining and evaluating ideas through the respective lenses of design, engineering, and business. Currently, we are looking for someone to represent and champion the design perspective of this trifecta.

As a qualified candidate, you will have played a crucial and leading role in designing, delivering, and launching products. Bringing a high level of creative energy and strong design intuition to the team, you challenge teammates to think big and push beyond the obvious or first idea. You operate as a natural visionary, following technical and design trends in the industry and contributing strong ideas on how to influence or capitalize on the potential of those trends. You are both opinionated and a compassionate listener, willing to dive deep to understand a problem before jumping to conclusions and knowing how to ask the right questions. And, you define personal success as making a meaningful and unique contribution to the team’s success.

We are a team that is:
• Tasked with finding new growth opportunities for Adobe, often looking beyond the boundaries of the existing business.
• Passionate about tool making, and respectful of the responsibility that this practice entails.
• Constantly striving to help users create something that they would not have otherwise created.

What you’ll do:
• Lead a team of talented designers
• Seeding ideas and asking the questions that will help teammates iterate towards the best solution for their particular problem domain.
• Providing guidance on how to effectively prioritize design efforts.
• Giving insightful and actionable feedback.
• Facilitating moving past obstacles, disagreements, and tough choices encountered during the design process.
• Network and evangelize for the team within the company, seeking opportunities for collaboration with research, product, and other design teams.
• Provide mentorship to younger designers,
i.e. giving sound guidance on design career development, connect teammates with other design professionals to provide career insight, and serve as a strong example of where they might be in the future.

What you’ll need to succeed:
• Experience, appreciation, and passion for building tools and the services that support them.
• Ability to make progress in the midst of uncertainty, i.e. you know how to tackle discovering and answering unknowns through design thinking, research, and talking with the right people.
• Ability and willingness to design for users, products, and industries that may be unfamiliar.
• Work within business, organizational, and resource constraints.
• Negotiate situations where design intuition conflicts with user research.
• Knowledge of how to take the first step, coming up with a big idea as well as the first, most important experience to build.

Qualifications:
• 10+ years of design experience in software UX.
• Significant mentorship and design leadership experience, either acting as design team lead or design manager.
• Experience with and appreciation for building interactive prototypes, either using code or visual prototyping tools.
• Experience using Adobe's existing product ecosystem, with emphasis on core design tools (Illustrator, Photoshop, After Effects, InDesign, etc.)

Bonus:
• Experience with digital marketing tools, understanding both digital marketing and analytics problem domains.
• Experience in design for massively-multi touch user interfaces, spatial gesture interfaces, voice, virtual reality, augmented reality, and other "non-standard" interface modalities.


Making our technology accessible to all

We believe everyone should have equal access to technology and its benefits. To help achieve this, Adobe is focused on making software more accessible for everyone.

When we hire for engineering, development and design roles, we look for the following accessibility skills:
• Base knowledge of the W3C’s Web Content Accessibility Guidelines v2.0
• Exposure to current tools used by people with disabilities (screen readers and other assistive technologies)
• Experience with accessibility evaluation and validation software
• Understanding of input and output modes used by people with disabilities
• Familiarity with compliance requirements - state, Federal, international

At Adobe, you will be immersed in an exceptional work environment that is recognized throughout the world on Best Companies lists. You will also be surrounded by colleagues who are committed to helping each other grow through our unique Check-In approach where ongoing feedback flows freely.

If you’re looking to grow your career, Adobe’s the place for you. Discover what our employees are saying about their career experiences through the Adobe Life magazine.

Adobe is an equal opportunity employer. We welcome and encourage diversity in the workplace regardless of race, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or veteran status.

jobs.title: AngularJS Developer
jobs.content:
Summary


Vector Media Group is looking for a full-time AngularJS Developer to join our NYC team immediately. We’re seeking a candidate with a large amount of frontend JavaScript experience.


A typical day for you will include a mix of the following tasks:



  • Building large scale, high traffic web applications using the AngularJS framework

  • Interacting with REST APIs, both internally built and 3rd-party

  • Adding dynamic functionality to HTML/CSS markup created by the rest of our team

  • Working with our other frontend developers for site front-end build-out

  • Continually bringing industry best-practices around technique, load time, and libraries to our process

  • Crafting clean, quality, well-documented code to ensure long-term maintainability

  • Communicating with product owners to understand their vision, and our technical leads to advise on technical feasibility and recommend implementation strategies


 Required skills:



  • Strong knowledge of modern frontend technologies, best practices, and load speed optimization techniques

  • Advanced experience with JavaScript frameworks, specifically AngularJS

  • Expertise working as part of a team developing and delivering web applications

  • Ability to work with and coordinate other developers

  • Experience with version control tools, such as Git

  • Excellent command of written and spoken English


Benefits



  • Flexible hours and paid vacation policy

  • Free meals and snacks availalbe all day, every day

  • Health, Dental, and Vision insurance

  • Retirement plan with company matching

  • Perks and discounts from many stores and services-- cell phone bills, hotels, rental cars, gyms, etc...


Join Us!


If you’re interested please apply immediately, attention Ben Smith. Examples of your real-world work are more important than a perfect resume. If you’ve worked on a project with a team, please provide examples including an explanation of the parts you were responsible for.

jobs.title: Engineering Manager - Ecosystem Open Source
jobs.content:
DESCRIPTION

Contentful (https://www.contentful.com) is a content management developer platform that enables web and mobile developers to manage, integrate, and deliver digital content to any kind of device or service that can connect to an API - be it smart cars, VR, mobile, web, digital signage, or any new platform. We solve the complexities of content management for tens of thousands web and mobile developers, some independent and many working at enterprise customers that include Jack-in-the-box, Petsmart, Specialized, Fidelity Investments, and Urban Outfitters.

We're a fun team of more than 60 people from 28 nations with offices in Berlin and San Francisco, backed by top VCs (Benchmark, Trinity, Balderton, Point Nine), growing at an amazing pace, and looking for more amazing individuals to join our team!

ABOUT THE ROLE

At Contentful engineering is responsible for developing, running and maintaining the software that builds our highly available and scalable platform. Our engineering team grew to more than 30 people last year. We are now looking for an experienced engineering manager to work with our CTO on leading this fast-growing team.

As an Engineering Manager at Contentful, you are responsible for building and maintaining a healthy team, driving improvement of our development processes, and ensuring consistent delivery of high quality software that adds value for our customers.

You’ll collaborate regularly with engineers to gather feedback on topics ranging from project progress, technology choices, internal processes, career development, mentoring, and general happiness.

You’re already an engineering manager or you’re a development team lead ready to make a jump into management. You enjoy the idea of working in a developer-centric company where engineering is central and not only a support function. Catch this opportunity of taking care of the team who builds the material publicly available at https://github.com/contentful

REQUIREMENTS

  • You either already managed a team involved in developing Open Source SDK and libraries or you’ve been involved in similar projects as a developer previously in your career.
  • You already worked in an environment revolving around a publicly available API.
  • You know how to recruit and hire engineering talent and facilitate onboarding of new team members.
  • Provide technical and non-technical guidance to the team, both individually and as a group.
  • Experience in troubleshooting the software delivery process and continuously streamlining it.
  • You’re used to working with engineering teams to identify and anticipate changing requirements and opportunities to improve the development environment.
  • Proven experience managing or leading technical teams, setting goals and crafting plans to achieve them.
  • Solid, battle tested engineering background that allows you to establish credibility with brilliant engineers quickly.
  • You are used to collaborate with other functions of the company like product, support and marketing.
  • You are a strong communicator and you’re great in teasing out complex, conflictual situations bringing clarity when confusion and ambiguity creep in.

BENEFITS

  • Be in a fast-paced environment in a company that’s growing quickly. Garner responsibility and make a significant impact, instead of being just another cog in a machine.
  • Join a rapidly growing developer-centric company with lots of amazing international customers. We count people like Adam Wiggins (Heroku) and Francesco Cesarini (Erlang Solutions) as our advisors.
  • We have plenty of interesting engineering challenges, ranging from scale factors, global cache invalidation to multi tenant “bring your own schema” data. Use a diverse set of modern technologies, stay updated on best practices and help to create an effective and pragmatic organization.
  • Be part of a team of experts in a company where technology matters and is key.
  • We offer education budget and extra days off to be spent on your self-development.
  • Pick any tools you feel comfortable with. From hardware, to software, to your work environment, we've literally got your back.
  • Enjoy the flexibility of time and place of your work.
  • Brush up your language skills! Our team speaks more than 20 languages.
  • We fully support your move to Berlin with a relocation budget. We also get your back in terms of settling down in a new city.

jobs.title: Sr. DevOps Automation Engineer
jobs.content:
This role is highly versatile and a mix of self-directed work along with enabling the plans the team has with the application stack. The current roadmap involves continued decoupling - breaking our larger apps up into smaller independent services. You'll be responsible for supporting those efforts and leading the charge on all things infrastructure.


What We Care About:



  • Autonomy. The ability to make, own, and carry out decisions. The ability to determine what processes and best practices are most conducive to productivity, transparency, and coordination.

  • Building scalable and flexible systems to cater to continuous business improvement and growth

  • Writing clean and maintainable code with complete unit & integration tests when possible

  • Setting realistic estimations and meeting deadlines

  • Following up after deployments & analyzing system metrics to ensure that the systems work as intended

  • Collaboration and effective communication

  • Having a no-ego, humble team

  • Automation - we are looking for leverage

  • Influencing outcomes. Thinking big. Being paranoid. Speaking UP.


What You Will Be Responsible For:



  • Building out & managing our chef driven infrastructure on AWS

  • Evaluate, plan and rollout a more standardized build ecosystem (for example - the Hashicorp ecosystem)

  • Configuring and deploying Services including Redis, RabbitMQ for high availability

  • Managing and analyzing the different performance and availability monitoring that is in place (Nagios, ELK/Sumo/Splunk, Newrelic, PagerDuty)

  • Defining a proper monitoring, alerting and escalation plan for quickly resolving problems

  • Implementing compliance and security monitoring and reporting

  • Helping to plan and build out a standardized development environment for our engineering team

  • Working closely with the entire engineering team to develop infrastructure requirements for projects

  • Planning ways to help the engineering team automate where possible to improve productivity

  • Managing the relationship and projects with our current infrastructure management service provider


What We Offer:



  • The opportunity to make a massive impact on a team of passionate engineers

  • The opportunity to influence outcomes for an emerging company

  • Competitive salary, equity and full benefits (health/dental/vision insurance & 401k)

  • Work from home Tuesdays and Thursdays (what we call Maker Days)

  • Fresh pressed juices every morning, full-stocked fridge + snacks

  • Office located at Sansome & Bush in downtown San Francisco

jobs.title: Sr. Web Developer
jobs.content:
As a member of the Information Technology Development Team, a Senior Web Developer designs, develops, tests, implements, and maintains proprietary web based user interfaces for Empyrean and our clients. They are responsible for troubleshooting systems problems and issues and identifying ways to improve existing or developed applications.


To fulfill this role, the web developer will:



  • Create reusable and modular components using modern JavaScript frameworks (Aurelia, React, AngularJS).

  • Communicate to backend services (Orleans, OWIN, Service Stack) using Falcor and REST APIs.

  • Leverage functional programming to keep component state manageable.

  • Utilize PostCSS to compose reusable CSS styles.

  • Transition a legacy MVC application to a modern, single-page application (greenfield project).

  • Write unit and end-to-end tests based on system requirements.

  • Work within an agile development team working in sprints with deliverables and demonstration of results.

  • Participate in design meetings in order to create logical and innovative solutions to complex problems.

  • Design, develop, test, implement, and maintain client/user-facing self service tools for activities such as benefit elections, manage life events, beneficiary changes, etc.

  • Understand expectations that were set with product owner and recognize when issues/events may affect delivery.

  • Work closely with a variety stakeholders to ensure technical compatibility and user satisfaction.

  • Ensure that there is proper documentation of standard procedures.

jobs.title: Senior Web Developer  C#/.Net
jobs.content:
Crate and Barrel is one of America’s most exciting housewares specialty retailer with 100+ locations and over 6,500 associates nationwide. We are seeking a Senior Web Developer – C#/.Net to join our team in developing the next generation of our eCommerce architecture.  This position is located at our Northbrook, Illinois corporate offices.


As a Crate and Barrel Senior Web Developer – C#/.Net, you will join an innovative eCommerce team responsible for delivering solutions built for sustainability and performance.  You will collaborate closely with product managers, testers and other software engineers to design, test, code, deliver and maintain software modules within an Agile Scrum environment via website architecture built on a cloud infrastructure. 


Come be a part of our exciting fast paced team, proud of building the solutions that drive our websites seen by millions of Crate and Barrel customers.


Job Description:



  • Design, develop, and implement solutions using C#, ASP.NET (MVC and WebForms), and Javascript Frameworks as your tools and Visual Studio 2015 as your environment.

  • Conceive and build unit testable solutions for our website applications.

  • Participate in technical design meetings with other developers and assist in defining the system architecture and choosing technologies.

  • Work on a cross-disciplinary Agile team to develop, estimate, test, and maintain our websites, while collaborating with team members on product backlog grooming, sprint planning, execution, review, and retrospective.

  • Work directly with business stakeholders to understand requirements and communicate progress.

  • Be an active contributor to back-end development practices and code reviews.

  • Update and maintain site documentation.

  • Communicate effectively and efficiently with all associates and business contacts and promote a strong sense of teamwork.


Requirements:



  • You have been building websites for 5+ years with C#, ASP.NET, MVC with a preferred focus on e-commerce solutions.

  • Possess 5+ years experience with relational databases like SQLServer, NoSQL experience a plus.

  • You have strong communication skills and experience working with business stakeholders and web designers.

  • You can work with jQuery right away. You have some experience and knowledge of another script framework (e.g. AngularJS, node.js).

  • Real world problem solving and technology excites you.

  • Experience working in a web environment such as IIS administration.

  • You have worked in an Agile environment.

  • You can write unit tests and testable code.

  • Ability to work efficiently and meet project deadlines with minimal supervision.

  • Ability to analyze business problems and provide accurate development estimates

  • Experience in domain-driven development and cloud technologies is a plus.

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or comparable work experience.

  • You have good reading, written and verbal language skills (English).      


For immediate consideration please apply on-line at http://crateandbarrelcareers.silkroad.com/.

jobs.title: Front End Developer
jobs.content:
Crate and Barrel is one of America’s most exciting housewares specialty retailer with 100+ locations and over 6,500 associates nationwide. We are seeking a Front End Developer to join our team in developing the next generation of our eCommerce architecture. This position is located at our Northbrook, Illinois corporate offices.


As a Crate and Barrel Front End Developer, you will join an innovative eCommerce team responsible for delivering solutions built for sustainability and performance. You will collaborate closely with product managers, testers and other software engineers to design, test, code, deliver and maintain software modules within an Agile Scrum environment.



  • Design, develop, and implement solutions using HTML, CSS, and Javascript as your tools and ASP.NET (MVC) as your environment.

  • Conceive and build responsive and adaptive solutions for website applications.

  • Work on an Agile team to develop, test, deploy, and maintain, while collaborating with team members on product backlog grooming, sprint planning, execution, review, and retrospective.

  • Participate in technical design meetings with other developers and assist in definition of front end web architecture.

  • Work with product team and stakeholders to understand and communicate progress.

  • Update, maintain and adhere to pattern-libraries, styleguides, and site documentation.

  • Be an active contributor to front-end development best practices.


Requirements: 



  • You have been building websites using HTML/CSS/Javascript for 5+ years, and you can show it.

  • You can communicate to people in product management, design, user experience, and QA, and they will understand you.

  • You have excellent knowledge of CSS and Javascript coding best practices.

  • You can build responsive, cross-browser, highly-performant, and accessible applications.

  • You can work with jQuery right away. You have some experience and knowledge of another script framework (e.g. AngularJS, node.js).

  • You have worked with Twitter Bootstrap or Foundation or the like. You know about CSS preprocessors (LESS or SASS).

  • Maybe you’ve worked with C#, ASP.NET MVC, the .NET Framework, and VisualStudio.

  • You have basic knowledge of SQL language.

  • Bachelor’s degreein Computer Science, Graphic Design, or Visual Communication desired but not required.

  • You have good reading, written and verbal language skills (English).
