jobs.title: Software Release Engineer
jobs.content:
Advanced Systems Concepts, Inc. is a Systems Software Engineering company that has been creating software products of our own design for thirty-five years!

As we continue to grow, we are looking for a Software Release Engineer who is excited to learn and work with the latest software technologies and who enjoys the Software Engineering process using Agile/SCRUM methodologies.

The successful Software Release Engineer candidate would work on our flagship product, ActiveBatch®, a best-in-class Cross-Platform Enterprise Workload Automation and Job Scheduling system geared for high performance with customers running over 1 Million jobs per day. With over 1500 customers in over 46 countries and the strong demand for our products and services, the Software Release Engineer will help us to continue achieving our goals of producing the highest quality software using the most efficient processes.

Relationship and Roles:

Will be responsible for testing the implementation of Systems Software products on Microsoft Windows and UNIX platforms. Must be able to work independently as well as within a group.
Must show attention to detail, positive attitude, the ability to learn and be challenged, and take pride in quality and timeliness
Requirements:

Must have experience with Team Foundation Server. Must have experience with Microsoft Visual Studio 201x (or equivalent version). Must be knowledgeable in Powershell and/or Shell scripting. Must be very knowledgeable in latest .Net Framework (or later version) and C#. Job Specifications:

BS/MS in Computer Science or Computer Engineering (or equivalent work experience). Minimum requirements include 2 to 5 years engineering experience

Advanced Systems Concepts, Inc is an EEO Employer No VISA Sponsorships - Must be U.S. citizen or Permanent Resident

jobs.title: Data Architect
jobs.content:
The Twilio Architecture team is responsible for the architecture of Twilio’s platform. The Data Architect will be a core member of the team focusing on designing data topologies and pipelines for handling and storing the immense amount of data we capture every day.


About the job:


As an experienced software engineer, you will be developing the architecture that will be instrumental in operating globally available, resilient and highly performant services used by hundreds of thousands of developers and apps.

Successful candidates will be strong developers with deep experience in data modeling, data storage and Business Intelligence systems.


Responsibilities:



  • Drive the technologies and policies needed to store, manage and interact with Twilio's data.

  • Work with the engineering teams to help choose technologies, design system architecture and model data in a scalable and efficient way.

  • Develop proof of concepts, shared libraries and services that will be used across the product engineering organization.

  • Coordinate with Sales Operations, Marketing and Finance to help understand their data needs and how disparate systems will integrate.

  • Tackle some of the most challenging problems in distributed computing, data persistence, and more.

jobs.title: Back-end Developer
jobs.content:
Are you an experienced Back-end server and database technologist who is looking to apply your knowledge and skills to make a positive impact in people’s lives and society? Have you been searching to join a small fast paced team where you can make a difference? Do you enjoy working in a creative environment where we are creating innovative ways to share knowledge and help people make better and more educated decisions?

If so, VoteCircle wants you! VoteCircle is a hot, growing US startup based in Silicon Valley that is trying to make a difference in the world. We are looking for a Spring developer who is responsible for key server-side features in our evolving service. Your primary focus will be to design Cassandra data models and surface them through server APIs that power our web and mobile apps. You will work closely with the engineering, design, and product management teams to take functional requirements through the design and implementation process. While you are not directly responsible for the design or the front-end client applications, you will need to understand the feature and components from front to back.

Responsibilities

  • Deliver complete back end features from the database level to the server API
  • Deliver tested and documented RESTful API’s
  • Integrate external services and packages to build out a complete solution
  • Work closely with the design and product management teams
  • Join our team to do something different and make a difference in our society and the world!

Main requirements

  • Proficiency with Java, J2EE, and UNIX/Linux
  • Experience delivering and maintaining Spring-based applications in a production environment
  • Strong knowledge and working experience in distributed database technologies like Cassandra
  • Experience interfacing with external services, such as Amazon CloudSearch is preferred
  • Commitment to developing reusable and testable components
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills in English
  • Commitment to teamwork and respectful communication

Nice to have

  • Interest in politics, campaigns, and the election process is a major plus

jobs.title: Senior UX/UI Designer
jobs.content:
We are Ludopoli, an international design & development firm based in Zürich. Founded in 2008, we have worked on projects for some of the world’s most recognisable brands.

We build products for web, tablets, and mobile devices and specialise in content publishing and content tracking solutions for the media, as well as data visualisation and UX/UI design. Our products include Flowli, a powerful and innovative API-based publishing system.

We are looking for a Senior UX/UI Designer to complement our distributed team. You will play a crucial role between product owners and our development team and will be working on an exciting range of products and services for our clients, as well as our publishing system Flowli.

Please note that this position will start as a 6 months contract as a remote worker, which might then, if successful, be extended to a full-time position.

Main requirements

  • You have experience designing for web and mobile and understand the challenges of responsive design or a mobile-first approach
  • Product design experience (web or mobile) is a big plus
  • You are comfortable with production and prototyping tools such as Illustrator, Sketch, Balsamiq, InVision, or Flinto (if you have your own efficient toolset, that’s fine, too)
  • You are hands-on, self-motivated, and love finding creative solutions for complex problems
  • You are a pro-active communicator and are able to effectively present and explain your work and design decisions
  • You have a love for detail and have a solid knowledge of design fundamentals such as composition, hierarchy and typography
  • You are passionate about user-centred interaction design and regularly read and listen to the leading UX/UI blogs and podcasts
  • You have an excellent understanding of the entire interaction design workflow, including personas, user stories, information architecture, flows, wireframes, design style guides, final production assets, and documentation for developers
  • You are fluent in both written and spoken English

Nice to have

  • Ideally, you should have a good understanding of the possibilities and limits of frontend technologies such as HTML, CSS, and JavaScript
  • Actual coding abilities are a plus
  • UX & UI portfolio

Perks

  • A highly competitive pay package
  • The freedom to work from anywhere you choose (we don't have a permanent office)
  • Flexible working hours
  • Giving you creative ownership of an exciting range of projects and clients
  • Working with and learning from a super friendly, highly motivated and skilled international team

jobs.title: Full Stack Developer
jobs.content:
Are you a passionate, highly skilled full stack developer looking to work for a profitable startup in DTLA? Do you solve problems that no one else can?

We are looking for a Full Stack Developer to bring his or her extensive experience in software development to lead our growing engineering team. The right candidate is someone with technical chops as well as strong communication and leadership skills. Among other things, you'll have autonomy to architect and implement a real-time analytics tracking platform to help us unlock key insights about our customers' behavior.


WHAT YOU'LL BE DOING

  • Oversee the construction and maintenance of our real-time analytics tracking platform.
  • Manage the workflow of the engineering team and work with stakeholders to establish project priorities and timelines.
  • Lead the development of our mobile sites and app.
  • Help automate and streamline our operations and processes.
  • Build and maintain tools for deployment, monitoring and operations.
  • Troubleshoot and resolve issues in our dev, test and production environments.
  • Increase productivity and efficiency within our engineering team.

Benefits


  • Health insurance
  • Catered lunch everyday
  • Snacks/drinks available throughout the day
  • Paid vacation, sick days and holidays

jobs.title: Front-end Developer
jobs.content:
Note: Although this is a remote position, we are currently only seeking candidates in time zones between UTC-2 and UTC+4.

We are looking for exceptional and ambitious front-end developers who would love an opportunity to learn more and become full-stack developers. This role is ideal for somebody who is passionate about building great online apps and wants to use their skills to have a real impact on a product used by over 120,000 users from 184 different countries. We are looking for a developer who loves being part of a team but is also self-motivated and likes the idea of working remotely.

What skills are we looking for?

As a developer in the Hotjar tech team, you will be working on developing and improving features built primarily in JavaScript, AngularJS, Python and PostgreSQL. You will be creating production grade JavaScript code and will have the opportunity to implement solutions designed to handle incredibly high levels of traffic. Besides JavaScript, you will also be given training on back-end languages (primarily Python) allowing you to become a full-stack developer. You will need to be highly process driven and eager to learn new technologies and programming languages. You will also be communicating directly with our users on a regular basis to investigate issues and truly understand how your work is being used.

Main requirements

  • Strong background in benchmarking, optimization, scaling and dealing with high levels of traffic
  • Experience using HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and AngularJS
  • Familiarity with automated testing frameworks such as Selenium
  • Familiarity with distributed revision control systems such as Mercurial or Git
  • Fluent in English with excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Ability to work independently - accountable for your own actions and able to act with both urgency and integrity

Nice to have

  • Experience with any of the following: jQuery, Python (or any similar back-end language), PostgreSQL, Redis, Memcached, Lua, Linux, Nginx, Elasticsearch, and Amazon Web Services

Perks

  • Remote & flexible
  • Prestigious clients
  • Kindle + Personal development budget
  • Personal Home office budget
  • Make a difference
  • Only the best hardware and software
  • Work with a very talented team

jobs.title: Lead React.js Front-end Developer
jobs.company: React Js Front End In The Window
jobs.content:
In The Window™ is the social platform for design storytelling and curation. We were founded on the belief that the stories of great design need to be told.

Through an exceptionally immersive user experience, In The Window enables designers, makers, and brands to deeply engage a global community of design lovers with stories and curations. In The Window’s community can discover, experience, curate, and share the content.

We use React.js and React Native primarily, in addition to Node.js on the back-end.

We’re looking for a solid full-stack developer, with a love for developing breakthrough rich front-ends, to drive development, with a focus on the front-end. This is an influential role that will drive one of the most ambitious user experiences in social!

We have a fast-growing international community of high-caliber designers, in the areas of object and space design. The strong market validation that we're experiencing is quite thrilling.

Note: candidates from the EU will be highly preferred due to time zone reasons

Main requirements

  • Solid full-stack object-oriented coder, with love for the front-end
  • Strict about elegant, maintainable, scalable code. Rigorous on quality & testing
  • Strong in JavaScript
  • Familiar with React
  • Have a portfolio of awesome web products you’ve led/coded, on desktop or mobile
  • Super motivated to build awesome, delightful user experiences
  • Work fast. Positive energy
  • Have a university degree in Computer Science or proven expertise

Perks

  • Flexible schedule

jobs.title: Full-Stack Python Developer
jobs.content:
Hotjar is a rapidly growing startup that is giving thousands of website owners the tools needed to discover how their visitors are really using their website. We are looking for passionate and ambitious full-stack developers who can help us shape the product and company whilst growing with us.

Who are we looking for?

We are looking for exceptional and ambitious developers who enjoy working both on front-end and back-end development. This role is ideal for somebody who is passionate about building great online apps and wants to use their skills to have a real impact on a product used by 99,671 companies worldwide. We are looking for a developer who loves being part of a team but is also self-motivated and likes the idea of working remotely.

Although this is a remote position, we are currently only seeking candidates in timezones between UTC-2 and UTC+4.

What skills are we looking for?

As a full-stack developer in the Hotjar tech team, you will be working on developing and improving features built primarily in JavaScript, AngularJS, Python and PostgreSQL. You will be creating production grade JavaScript and Python code and will have the opportunity to implement solutions designed to handle incredibly high levels of traffic. You will need to be highly process driven and eager to learn new technologies and programming languages. You will also be communicating directly with our users on a regular basis to investigate issues and truly understand how your work is being used.

Main requirements

  • Strong background in benchmarking, optimization, scaling and dealing with high traffic
  • Experience using HTML, CSS, JavaScript, AngularJS and Python
  • Familiarity with automated testing frameworks such as Selenium
  • Familiarity with distributed revision control systems such as Mercurial or GitHub
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Ability to work independently - accountable for your own actions and able to act with both urgency and integrity

Nice to have

  • jQuery
  • PostgreSQL, Redis, Memcached, Elasticsearch
  • Lua, Linux, Nginx
  • Amazon Web Services (AWS)

Perks

  • Remote & flexible
  • Prestigious clients
  • Kindle + Personal development budget
  • Personal Home office budget
  • Make a difference
  • Only the best hardware and software
  • Work with a very talented team

jobs.title: Software Engineer -- C++, C#, Java
jobs.content:
Join a market leader providing automation solutions in hospitals to increase efficiency and enhance patient experience! Apply today and play an integral part of our automated material handling products and solutions.

In this role, you will design, develop, and implement software in the our Pneumatic Tube System (PTS) for new development and for existing applications.  This will involve collaboration and interaction with our engineering department (mechanical, electrical, software) to provide strategic solutions and enhance existing product for the PTS product line



  • Designs, modifies, develops, writes, and implements software programming applications

  • Supports and/or installs software applications and control systems

  • Participates in the testing process through test review and analysis, test witnessing, and certification of software

  • Assists, or leads, in the analysis, planning, scheduling, and coordination of detailed phases of the engineering work as a part of a major project or in a total project of moderate scope. 

  • Devises new approaches to problems encountered. 

  • Performs work which involves conventional engineering practices but includes a variety of complex features. 


Swisslog offers challenging work in a globally networked environment as well as competitive base salary, comprehensive benefits including health/dental and above-market 401K!

United efforts of our employees represent the basis for developing and delivering the best solutions for our customers.

Relocation assistance is available!

jobs.title: Cloud Architect
jobs.content:
Req ID: 121832

Passionate about Cloud and Virtualization?

Want to play a key role in defining the direction of Telecommunications Management?

Self-Motivated, Energetic & Innovative?

THE ROLE:

Cloud Architect

PDU OSS is the unit in Ericsson with responsibility for development of Management Systems Software for Mobile Broadband, Cloud & IP Networks.  Exciting opportunities exist for Cloud Architects within our R&D department; who are interested in shaping the future of the evolving Networked Society. 

The Cloud Architect is responsible for driving the vision for Network Management and Orchestration in a virtualized WebScale Ecosystem.

He/She will work with Product Management/ Senior Management and Customers to define and agree strategic direction. He/She will also be responsible for working with feature teams in an Agile Development Environment to bring products to market

THE PERSON:

  • Degree in Software Development/Electronics or related Science/Technology discipline.
  • 5+ years relevant Software Development experience.
  • Proficient in one or more of the following languages: Python, Java, C++ or Erlang.   
  • Experience deploying and managing Cloud environments based on Openstack and/or VMWare
  • Experience designing and building applications for deployment in a Cloud/PaaS environment
  • Experience building applications targeted at PaaS environments such as Openshift, Cloudfoundary
  • Understanding of the Network Function Virtualization Architecture
  • Understanding Management challenges of Cloud & IP Networks in terms of NFV & SDN is desirable.
  • Customer Focused, Strong Team Player with Excellent Communication Skills.
  • Experience of working across different organizations/teams within a multi-cultural & international environment.
  • Ability to drive technical discussion, analyse technical problems and steer new product development.

Here is a video of the Ericsson Software Campus: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZiyVS5_-Eg0

To apply, please email your CV to barry.vickers@ericsson.com or use the links here.

*LI-BV1

Also, please don’t hesitate to let us know in advance any reasonable accommodations we can provide during the interview process.

Ericsson complies with applicable country, state and all local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location across the world in which the company has facilities. In addition, Ericsson supports the UN Guiding Principles for Business and Human Rights and the United Nations Global Compact.

This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, training and development.

Ericsson expressly prohibits any form of workplace harassment based on race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, marital status, pregnancy, parental status, national origin, ethnic background, age, disability, political opinion, social status, veteran status, union membership or genetic information.

Primary country and city: Ireland (IE) || Westmeath || Athlone || R&D

jobs.title: Platform Engineer
jobs.content:
Strava is comprised of dedicated, fun-loving individuals, unified by our mission to build the most engaged community of athletes in the world. And it feels like we’re on to something big. Millions of athletes are already on Strava, with thousands more joining every day, and we’ve assembled an awesome team to keep us growing all around the world. Strava is the Swedish word for “strive,” which epitomizes our attitude and ambition: We’re a passionate community, committed to our athletes, each other, our business, and the deeply held belief that there’s always time for a run, ride, coffee, or all three.

About the role:

Strava is looking for a Platform Software Engineer to help us deliver highly scalable and reliable distributed systems powering the experience of millions of Strava athletes. Strava is on a steep growth curve. As an Infrastructure Engineer you will help ensure that Strava remains fast, available, and scalable under ever-increasing load.

We lean heavily on AWS and are moving towards a service-oriented architecture with components written in Ruby, Scala, and Go. In addition to handling web, mobile, and API traffic, we perform background data processing on a variety of workloads, from just-in-time upload processing to building heat maps for the world. You’ll be part of a team responsible for the design, evolution, and maintenance of this platform.

Responsibilities:

-Work with our platform engineering team and site reliability engineers to design, build, and maintain production systems and services.

-Proactively identify site scaling issues and help redesign systems to address them.

-Continually improve our internal infrastructure and tools.

-Provide technical feedback to other engineers through code reviews, engineering design reviews, and collaborative problem solving sessions.

-Participate in an on-call rotation.

Requirements:

-B.S. in computer science or equivalent experience.

-Experience with large, reliable, and scalable distributed systems.

-Experience with cloud-based services such as Amazon AWS.

-Experience with a relational data store such as MySQL and ideally one or more NoSQL data stores (e.g. Redis, Cassandra).

-Excellent programming skills with at least one language such as Ruby, Scala, or Go.

Desired skills:

-Experience with Ruby on Rails.

-Experience with open source technologies like Kafka, ZooKeeper, Finagle, Storm, Spark, Elasticsearch, Mesos, and Docker.

Backed by Sequoia Capital, Madrone Partners and Sigma Partners, Strava is expanding in order to exceed the needs of our growing community of global athletes. By joining our team, you will help push Strava forward in fresh, innovative ways. You will engage in interesting and challenging work that will improve the lives of our athletes every day. And in the same way that Strava is deeply committed to unlocking the potential of our athletes, we are dedicated to providing a world-class workplace where our employees can grow and thrive. Join us!

Strava is an equal opportunity employer. In keeping with the values of Strava, we make all employment decisions including hiring, evaluation, termination, promotional and training opportunities, without regard to race, religion, color, sex, age, national origin, ancestry, sexual orientation, physical handicap, mental disability, medical condition, disability, gender or identity or expression, pregnancy or pregnancy-related condition, marital status, height and/or weight.

jobs.title: Security Engineer
jobs.content:
As a security engineer on the technology team you will be responsible for helping developers create secure systems, testings those systems, and making sure that they are deployed securely to production environments.


You will have a broad understanding of modern application design and deployment best practices, be comfortable testing systems to ensure those best practices are followed and have the communication skills necessary to help the rest of the team understand what needs to be done. You should be able to quantify risk in a way which makes sense for the scale and importance of the campaign and be able to work with all levels of the campaign to ensure that things run securely.


Responsibilities



  • Advising teams on application/cloud-oriented security architecture and best-practices

  • Application security testing (pen testing)

  • Manage security controls in AWS and other third-party systems

  • Crafting policies and practices that balance safety with the rapid scaling of our infrastructure and organization

  • Identifying and evaluating threats to our internet presence and analytics systems

jobs.title: Network Application Developer
jobs.content:
Join our team and put your knowledge, skills, and passions to work as a software developer for a Network Applications group. The Division of Information Technology (DoIT), is seeking an enthusiastic and talented person for this position. The Network Applications group is responsible for applications development in support of Network Services, including software used to automate, configure maintain and monitor the network. Network Applications also develops a variety of video and voice applications, as well as interfacing with other groups in support of service delivery.



UW-Madison, founded in 1848, is a world-class institution offering a complete spectrum of liberal arts studies, professional programs and student activities to over 40,000 students.  Spanning 936 acres along the southern shore of Lake Mendota, the campus is located in the City of Madison.  Our highly ranked university is guided by The Wisconsin Idea; the principle that the university should improve people’s lives beyond the classroom through teaching, research, outreach and public service.


Enjoy robust benefits such as the State of Wisconsin Benefits Package, a beautiful Campus Setting and a competitive salary.

jobs.title: Senior Android Engineer
jobs.content:
There is a critical moment—between the news events, viral videos, speeches, and debate performances that captivate America—when a college student decides to phone bank, a veteran decides to canvas, or a grandparent decides to support the future we all want for the next generation. These people turn to Hillary For America's website, apps, and volunteers to learn more about how they can get involved.


Our tech team needs to produce reliable tools that empower our organizers, volunteers and analysts to work efficiently, while supporting the campaign's spirit of exploration as we search for new ways to engage every voter.


As a mobile engineer, you'll be part of a small agile team that will build a suite of apps that will raise the bar for mobile on presidential campaigns. You won't just be building single-purpose brick-and-mortar apps, you'll be crafting polished experiences like no campaign has seen before, that will be talked about for years to come.


Responsibilities



  • Work closely with product and design to help us build a suite of apps, both internal and public facing, for Android

  • Strong programming and engineering abilities and experience with Java and the Android SDK

  • Communicating effectively with your team, both by using natural language and by writing clear and concise code

  • Being ruthlessly pragmatic about what gets built and how it gets built, without compromising on quality

  • Take ownership and being responsible for some of the many projects we'll be building in the coming year

jobs.title: Graphic Designer (In-House Corporate)
jobs.content:
Purpose of Role
This role serves as the creative lead for North American marketing, supporting all industries, solutions and business partners. The graphic designer is responsible for working with the marketing team and internal clients to conceptualize and design all print and electronic marketing collateral for the region. Additionally, he/she manages the visual identity of North America, ensuring all materials produced in marketing are aligned with global standards.

Requirements
• Design and layout print and electronic (web-based) marketing and communications materials from concept to execution for North America marketing (e.g., brochures, slip sheets, direct mail, e-mail campaigns, event and webinar invitations, event materials, signage, ads etc.).
• Manage the North American brand identity (from a design perspective) for marketing/sales materials to ensure it is aligned with global standards.
• Serve as resource for brand-related questions to marketing staff and all North American employees.
• Communicate the latest brand updates to North American designers.
• Liaise with Global marketing to reconcile special circumstances in North American branding.
• Consult with marketing staff and internal clients to discuss project objectives/requirements and design concepts to coordinate creative process.
• Provide presentation support/consultation for conference presentations, large proposals/pitches and internal presentations that come through marketing.
• Art direct, project-manage and review design work of freelancers/external designers.
• Coordinate the production queue and design schedule of projects for all North American SBUs.
• Manage printers and the production process.
• Maintain image archive and stock imagery resources for North America.
• Work with global marketing team to improve Image World library to better meet the presentation needs.
• Manage design and print budget (subset of Marketing budget).

Skills & Core Competencies
• A thorough understanding of the principles of design, typography, use of color, corporate branding/brand identity and other graphic and design techniques.
• Proficiency in all design software (Adobe Creative Suite, html, Microsoft Office, etc.), as well as the print production process (building comps, writing specs, reviewing proofs).
• Ability to consult with marketing staff and clients to convert marketing concepts/client messages into a visually effective design in a manner that is consistent with GfK’s corporate brand.
• Capacity to visualize a design and come up with multiple concepts about a topic.
• Highly effective organizational skills to successfully manage and coordinate a number of projects simultaneously
• Ability to art direct and communicate brand standards and design instructions to outside designers and non-designers
• Graphic and PowerPoint support expertise in applying and designing templates, charts and graphs
• An eye for detail to provide accurate designs quickly and efficiently
• Ability to develop and provide training to support branding efforts
• Capacity to stay current with the latest design techniques, tools and technology

Education & Experience:
• BFA in Graphic Design or equivalent is required. MA or graduate coursework a plus
• Minimum of 2 years of experience in a graphic design role. 4 years in graphic design role, preferably in an in-house corporate environment a plus
• PC proficiency required in Adobe Creative Suite and Microsoft Office for print and web.
• Cross-platform Mac and PC proficiency in Adobe Creative Suite and Microsoft Office for print and web a plus.
• Experience working in-house in a corporate environment is preferred.

We offer a very competitive salary commensurate with your experience and excellent benefits.

EOE/M/F/V/D

jobs.title: Mid/Senior QA Engineer & Team Lead
jobs.content:
DataFinch Technologies is the leader in electronic data collection for the Autism and Special education fields. We have created a revolutionary, one of a kind, software product targeting: schools, physicians, in-home autism providers and non-profit organizations. Come work for a fast-paced, fun, technology company in a growing field and experience all the latest and greatest cutting edge technologies. Candidates for this role will be assisting in daily programming activities. The company has been bootstrapped completely organically and has been self funded by our executive team.


We are looking for a QA engineer to come in and head up our internal testing efforts and improve product quality.


Responsibilities

  • Manage the QA team
  • Interact with the business team to ensure the critical business needs have test coverage.
  • Institute strategies that encourage / enforce / enable developers to easily write tests to cover the acceptance criteria of tasks
  • Teach non-technical people how to think in terms of quality
  • Expand our definition of quality
  • Write test frameworks to support and energize test-writers in QA and devs
  • Get involved early in the process, ensuring quality is present throughout and not just slapped on immediately before release


Technologies

  • Protractor
  • Page Model
  • Selenium
  • Selenium Grid
  • SauceLabs
  • Jasmine (or Karma / Chai, but Jasmine preferred)
  • NPM
  • Node.js
  • Typescript
  • Xamarin TestCloud
  • Angular (Or at least have a playful quip about React)

Benefits


  • Health, Vision, Dental, 401(k) (Employee AND Family)
  • Catered Lunch every Friday
  • One click build & deployments
  • Collaborative Rooms with Docking Stations
  • Flex hours
  • Conference reimbursement
  • Choice of hardware & software tools
  • 25 days PTO
  • Laid back, enjoyable environment
  • Fully Stocked Breakroom
  • Video games/Cable TV and other Toys
  • Bean bags

jobs.title: Software Engineer
jobs.content:
As a Software Engineer at Agora (a subsidiary of Warner Bros.Interactive Entertainment), you will be working primarily on our online game services platform called "Hydra Studio”, in addition to some other internal technologies. You will be responsible for creating complex data processing and presentation tools that integrate tightly with some of the largest franchises in the games industry. You will work as part of a highly talented team of producers, engineers, and business specialists to expand our systems and add value to WB Games' catalogue of products.


We are looking for candidates with 2-3 years of experience as a software engineer and the ability to quickly learn new platforms. We use many different technologies within Hydra, and while we don’t expect you to know them all coming in, we need a candidate who can quickly learn and be proficient with them!

jobs.title: iCloud Software Engineer - San Francisco
jobs.content:
Join iCloud's CloudKit server engineering team to work on iCloud Photo Library and iCloud Photo Sharing. iCloud Photo Library stores every photo and video you take, and keeps them up to date on all your devices. Any edits you make are automatically updated everywhere. iCloud Photo Sharing makes it easy to share photos and videos with exactly the people you want to see them.


Key Qualifications



  • 5 or more years software engineering experience and responsibilities

  • Solid experience in Java on high-throughput applications

  • Experience designing, implementing and supporting scalable distributed systems

  • Ability to give and receive technical feedback in code and design reviews

  • Ability to thrive in a cross-functional team on high profile, critical projects

  • Excellent analytical and problem solving skills

  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills


Description


The CloudKit server team is looking for a software engineer with a passion for building large-scale Internet applications that can keep up with the demands of hundreds of millions of users. You should have demonstrable experience building high-performing systems that are scalable and extensible. Interest in some or all of the following is a bonus:


• Scripting languages such as Python


• Distributed database systems


• iOS and OS X application development


• Security and encryption


• Digital photography


Education


Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, or equivalent industry experience.

jobs.title: iCloud Software Engineer - Seattle
jobs.content:
Imagine what you could do here. At Apple, great ideas have a way of becoming great products, services, and customer experiences very quickly. Bring passion and dedication to your job and there's no telling what you could accomplish.


Key Qualifications



  • Experience designing, implementing and supporting highly scalable applications and web services

  • Experience with SQL and NoSQL database technologies

  • Multithreaded or event-driven programming

  • Excellent analytical and problem solving skills

  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills

  • Ability to thrive in a cross-functional team on high profile, critical projects

  • Preferred Experience:

  • Java, C, C++

  • NoSQL databases such as Cassandra, HBase

  • Linux


Description


Consider joining a small team writing the software which forms the foundation for some of our most exciting iCloud products and services. We are looking for an extremely capable engineer who has a strong background in web services development, and who has built high-performance, scalable and extensible systems. In this highly visible position, the successful candidate will collaborate with cross-functional engineering teams to define and implement some of the core backend platform frameworks and systems that will power next generation Apple web services.


Education


BS or MS in Computer Science or equivalent industry experience

jobs.title: Application Developer
jobs.content:
This mid-level, full stack developer will work within a fast-moving, agile environment as part of a development team dedicated to end-to-end design, development, and support of critical applications.


Key Duties & Responsibilities:



  • Work as part of a cross-functional team to analyze, design, build, deploy, and maintain internal and customer facing web applications 


Attributes: 



  • Embodies AEP Energy Values (Integrity, Candor, Accountability, Innovation, Passion, Humor, Humility)

  • Strong service and results orientation.

  • Effective problem-solving skills: ability to work from concept to analytics, identify alternatives and develop unique solutions.

  • High EQ-- superior interpersonal skills, win-win mindset, relationship-builder.

  • Excellent communication skills – written, spoken, listening with ability to explain and interpret complex issues clearly, mindful of audience.

  • High-energy, drive and ambition.

  • Ability to prioritize, plan proactively, manage conflicting priorities and multi-task effectively.

jobs.title: Senior Engineer - iOS Accessories
jobs.content:
Hello! We are looking for a software engineer to join our iOS Accessories Quality team - a community of accomplished engineers responsible for ensuring that our customers have a great experience with accessories and iPhone, iPod, or iPad. We’re a highly collaborative team looking for someone experienced and passionate about developing tools and building automation infrastructure. If you take pride in your past accomplishments and want to tell us about the tools and infrastructure you designed and built, we’d love to hear about it.


Key Qualifications



  • Strong programming skills in C, C++, or Objective-C

  • At least 3 years of experience developing tools or building automated frameworks.

  • Familiarity with hardware and software interaction of embedded systems

  • In-depth knowledge of iOS, OS X, or Linux

  • Ability to investigate and debug difficult bugs

  • Good understanding of SQA methodologies & practices

  • Proficient oral and written communication skills.

  • Collaborates well in a team environment.


Description


-Work closely with cross-functional teams to understand requirements for tools and automation infrastructure.


-Design and build test systems to support new and existing hardware designs


-Collaborate closely with software, hardware engineers to design appropriate tests


Education


Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or Electrical Engineering (or equivalent work experience)


Additional Requirements


Nice to have: Knowledge of low-level and system level serial bus and USB Knowledge of iPhone accessories and third party peripherals Experience testing consumer audio and video technologies Ability to read USB packet capture files, serial bus traces, and board schematics Experience with USB protocols on device and host sides, and Bluetooth protocols

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer
jobs.content:
This is your chance to join a great team with a passion for doing things right and making an impact. We deliver advanced toolsets to other engineering teams within Apple and Third parties. You will work with building tools that are vital (no kidding) to the success of Apple. You must be comfortable working in a fast-paced, collaborative environment. Developing and fostering partnerships with the cross-functional teams is key to your long-term success. You must be a hands-on, proactive, self-motivated developer with strong initiative and a desire to succeed in a challenging environment.


Key Qualifications



  • Seasoned developer in C, C++ and possibly Objective-C

  • Excellent communication skills

  • Understanding how to build sustainable code-bases

  • Results oriented

  • Enthusiastic about a broad spectrum of challenges

  • Convincing and convincible


Description


Apple is looking for a senior software engineer to build protocol analyzers to support Apple product development and the Apple eco-system. You will build Cocoa applications for both iOS and Mac OS X that solve a wide-range of problems for both software and hardware engineers. The tools are both internal and external. The tools play a key part in Apple engagements in various eco-systems.


Education


BS EE/CE/CS or equivalent (MS preferred)

jobs.title: JavaScript Developer - Full Time, Remote
jobs.content:
This is a remote, full-time position.  Due to travel requirements, at this time we are seeking candidates in the domestic US or Canada only who are willing and able to travel.


We’re looking for passionate JavaScript developers who identify with our mission.


We want someone who enjoys identifying the hard parts of application development and simplifying them, talking about software architecture, and teaching others. We also want someone who can lead others and be an integral part of a team, but can also vibe with the dev team after the workday.


Specifically, the following attributes are major positives, but not all hard requirements:



  • Has strong opinions about the right way to develop

  • Has a lot of JavaScript experience

  • Has some experience with back-end systems and databases

  • Enjoys working on client projects and can effectively interface with clients

  • Some experience contributing to (or at least using) open source projects

  • Doesn’t mind a bit of travel, averaging one week every month (hard requirement!)


THE JOB


As soon as you begin, we’ll train you to become an expert in JavaScript application design, front-end architecture, and our open source stack of tools. You’ll work with clients creating applications, discussing and designing architectures, reviewing code, and researching new front-end technologies.


In addition to client work, you’ll have the opportunity to shape a small and growing company by applying your talent and passion to the JavaScript community in your own way. Bitovi developers:



  • Present at conferences and to the Bitovi team

  • Give trainings

  • Plan and run meetups

  • Create and maintain open source projects

  • Write articles and contribute to the Bitovi blog

jobs.title: Senior Industrial Designer
jobs.content:
Position Overview
Oversee and create kitchenware products based on market research and retail strategies. Evolve concept designs through a systematic process of drawing, model making, testing and analysis. Works on a variety of projects simultaneously from concept throughout design process. Familiar with standard concepts, practices, and procedures within the field.

Essential Job Functions
• Act as the department go-to person for a specific division and/or account.
• Lead special projects.
• Train other designers.
• Assist and direct assigned design group on any given project and assist in the new staff’s learning curve and development relating to basic design challenges relative to our industry.

Requirements
• Education: Bachelor’s level degree in Industrial Design
• Experience: 5 – 7 years in the field or in a related area
• Specialized Knowledge, Licenses, etc.: Must have demonstrated exceptionally strong skills in Adobe Photoshop and Illustrator CS4, must have advanced skills with solid and surface modeling in either Solidworks 2012 or Creo 1.0, as well as relevant technical and illustrative abilities including sketching, ideation, and detailing technical drawings for manufacturing. Must be able to work independently.
• Other Skills/Abilities: Ability to interact with users in non-technical, clear terms. Highly creative with the ability to work within the requirements of an industrial manufacturing process.

jobs.title: Lead Software Engineer, iDTech.com
jobs.content:
Do you love to ship code that makes a tangible difference to people’s lives? Do you thrive on delivering experiences that are fluid and nuanced, but also fast and scalable? Do you have visions in your mind of what could happen if you combined the delightful user experience of Candy Crush with the optimized ecommerce magic of Amazon?

If so, then we’re looking for you.  


As we build out our digital team, we are seeking an experienced and daring individual to drive our small front-end software engineering team forward. In this role, you will be responsible for delivering the entire iDTech.com experience.


You will:



  • Enjoy the pressure that comes with knowing that your team’s code is ensuring that tens of thousands of children have a summer to remember, while generating tens of millions of dollars of revenue.

  • Work with the Product Manager to establish clear goals and success metrics for iDTech.com

  • Deliver and relentlessly iterate on an experience that:


    • Is distinct and optimized for both desktop web and mobile browsers

    • Is simple and intuitive for browsing, researching, purchasing, and account management

    • Anticipates and addresses users needs, such that our client services team starts wondering why the phones rarely ring.


  • Upgrade our front-end technology stack as necessary to meet both scale and experience demands.

  • Ensure that all components of the iDTech.com experience are modular and can be continuously tested and optimized.

jobs.title: Data Engineer
jobs.content:
We are seeking an exceptional data engineer to build and maintain big data infrastructure. This infrastructure supports the development of a strategic data asset and the execution of data projects, which include complex applications of machine learning, visualization, and data mining. This is an opportunity to join a growing team of talented individuals, with diverse backgrounds in applied math, computer science and physics, focused on using novel big data technology and to answer fundamental questions that directly impact the direction of the company and industry at large.


[Big Disclaimer:This is a pure engineering role. If you're interested in research, model development, etc., please visit our careers page for other opportunities.]


Essential Responsibilities



  • Design, build and measure data ingestion and integration pipelines for large volumes of temporal data from different sources. Examples include database extracts, application server logs, scanned images, voice recordings, Twitter streams, websites, and health sensor data. 

  • Design, build, and measure complex ETL jobs to process disparate, dirty data sources and form a high integrity, high quality, clean data asset. 

  • Support and scale big data infrastructure (Cloudera CDH 5, MongoDB, and HP Vertica) 

  • Monitor and track data quality and data flow dynamics 

  • Design and build web based APIs to facilitate easy access to data

jobs.title: Senior Information Technology Application Analyst
jobs.content:
Christiana Care Health System is currently seeking an application analyst to support existing and new applications within the Centricity/Ambulatory/VNA Team. We are looking for someone that has skills on the application platform to include client and server side.


Primary Functions:



  • Responsible for software implementations, upgrades, configuration and support of multiple Ambulatory/Clinical applications

  • Emphasis for this position will be on assisting with the management of the technical environments of Ambulatory/Clinical applications supporting our physician practices and home care agency

  • Responsible for troubleshooting technical issues within homecare and the Ambulatory practices and providing customer support for existing and new applications

  • Responsible for working directly with vendor and customer to log incidents and follow up with open issues

  • Engage directly with VNA mobile workforce on technical issues directly affecting the delivery of patient care

  • Participate in 24/7 on-call rotation with support team to support clinical and VNA EMR customers

  • Responsible for learning and supporting new clinical applications and business areas

  • Participate in RUSA (Reliability, Usability, Serviceability, and Availability) calls and follow downtime instructions for testing and communicating to team members and customers

  • Responsible for engaging in evaluation and testing of new technologies with emphasis on interoperability

  • Education & Experience:

  • Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Computer Science or Business Administration, or experience consistent with the Application/Senior Application Analyst job responsibilities

  • At least six years of experience planning and executing the technical installation or upgrade of new and existing enterprise software applications

  • At least four years of experience developing database queries (Oracle, MSSQL - including the ability to write complex queries using PL/SQL and/or T-SQL)

  • At least four years of experience working with clinical data developing metrics, dashboards and pivot tables is highly preferred

  • Experience working in a healthcare environment is preferred

jobs.title: Senior UX UI Designer
jobs.content:
We are Ludopoli, an international design & development firm based in ZÃ¼rich. Founded in 2008, we have worked on projects for some of the worldâs most recognisable brands.

We build products for web, tablets, and mobile devices and specialise in content publishing and content tracking solutions for the media, as well as data visualisation and UX/UI design. Our products include Flowli, a powerful and innovative API-based publishing system.

We are looking for a Senior UX/UI Designer to complement our distributed team. You will play a crucial role between product owners and our development team and will be working on an exciting range of products and services for our clients, as well as our publishing system Flowli.

Please note that this position will start as a 6 months contract as a remote worker, which might then, if successful, be extended to a full-time position.

__Main requirements__

* You have experience designing for web and mobile and understand the challenges of responsive design or a mobile-first approach
* Product design experience (web or mobile) is a big plus
* You are comfortable with production and prototyping tools such as Illustrator, Sketch, Balsamiq, InVision, or Flinto (if you have your own efficient toolset, thatâs fine, too)
* You are hands-on, self-motivated, and love finding creative solutions for complex problems
* You are a pro-active communicator and are able to effectively present and explain your work and design decisions
* You have a love for detail and have a solid knowledge of design fundamentals such as composition, hierarchy and typography
* You are passionate about user-centred interaction design and regularly read and listen to the leading UX/UI blogs and podcasts
* You have an excellent understanding of the entire interaction design workflow, including personas, user stories, information architecture, flows, wireframes, design style guides, final production assets, and documentation for developers
* You are fluent in both written and spoken English

__Nice to have__

* Ideally, you should have a good understanding of the possibilities and limits of frontend technologies such as HTML, CSS, and JavaScript
* Actual coding abilities are a plus
* UX & UI portfolio

__Perks__

* A highly competitive pay package
* The freedom to work from anywhere you choose (we don't have a permanent office)
* Flexible working hours
* Giving you creative ownership of an exciting range of projects and clients
* Working with and learning from a super friendly, highly motivated and skilled international team

jobs.title: Back end Developer
jobs.content:
Are you an experienced Back-end server and database technologist who is looking to apply your knowledge and skills to make a positive impact in peopleâs lives and society? Have you been searching to join a small fast paced team where you can make a difference? Do you enjoy working in a creative environment where we are creating innovative ways to share knowledge and help people make better and more educated decisions?

If so, VoteCircle wants you! VoteCircle is a hot, growing US startup based in Silicon Valley that is trying to make a difference in the world. We are looking for a Spring developer who is responsible for key server-side features in our evolving service. Your primary focus will be to design Cassandra data models and surface them through server APIs that power our web and mobile apps. You will work closely with the engineering, design, and product management teams to take functional requirements through the design and implementation process. While you are not directly responsible for the design or the front-end client applications, you will need to understand the feature and components from front to back.

Responsibilities

Deliver complete back end features from the database level to the server API
Deliver tested and documented RESTful APIâs
Integrate external services and packages to build out a complete solution
Work closely with the design and product management teams
Join our team to do something different and make a difference in our society and the world!

Main requirements

Proficiency with Java, J2EE, and UNIX/Linux
Experience delivering and maintaining Spring-based applications in a production environment
Strong knowledge and working experience in distributed database technologies like Cassandra
Experience interfacing with external services, such as Amazon CloudSearch is preferred
Commitment to developing reusable and testable components
Strong written and verbal communication skills in English
Commitment to teamwork and respectful communication

Nice to have

Interest in politics, campaigns, and the election process is a major plus

jobs.title: Technical Support Engineer
jobs.content:
Technical support engineers are responsible for providing support for Stardog via email, chat, and phone. You will troubleshoot, diagnose, and resolve issues for customers. In your spare time, you will improve documentation and training materials and work on internal software projects.


Responsibilities:



  • Provide technical support to customers

  • Recommend configuration changes to improve customer experience

  • Resolve issues directly, escalating to core team as needed

  • Extend and improve product documention and learning resources


Requirements:



  • Previous experience in technical support or other customer-facing positions

  • Proven technical background

  • Strong communication and problem-solving skills

  • 3+ years programming experience, ideally in Java

  • Experience with graph technologies or databases is a plus


We have offices in Washington, DC, Baltimore, and Boston. Remote working is also possible for qualified candidates.


Our culture is based on engineering excellence, mutual respect, collegiality in all things, rigor in design, research, implementation, and testing. We care deeply about work-life balance and productivity in the short and long run. In sum, if you remove the unnecessary, the distracting, and the tedious, what you're left with is a healthy 40 hour week full of wins


We are committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

jobs.title: Software Development job opportunities in Ericsson Hungary Research & Development
jobs.content:
Req ID: 126218

What does your future look like?

We are on the brink of the Networked Society - a technology revolution that will change the world for good through instant global connections and expanded freedom and opportunity.

Ericsson is a world leader in the rapidly changing environment of communications technology – providing equipment, software and services to enable transformation through mobility. Headquartered in Stockholm – Sweden, Ericsson is a publically listed company with more than 115,000 employees

More than 180 countries use Ericsson equipment and more than 40 percent of the world's mobile traffic passes through Ericsson networks. Technology is at the heart of our business. Ericsson engineers, researchers and scientists around the world are working on what’s next in information, communications and telecommunications (ICT).

A connected world is just the beginning. Your passion determines what comes next! Apply your ideas and insights to empowering people, business and society.

Come and discover what makes YOU + ERICSSON a powerful combination.

Business Unit Cloud & IP is responsible for driving Ericsson market leadership in the telecom core and data centre markets. This includes building a leadership position in Cloud Systems, expanding our IP Routing portfolio, transforming our portfolio of core products to the Cloud/SDN regime, and building an even stronger position in the network control layer (OSS/NMS, User data management, Analytics, SDN, etc.). We transform the networks of today into future cloud-based networks and plays a large role in the networked society. With more than 11,000 employees all over the world we drive the global transformation via cutting edge IP and Cloud technologies.

Ericsson’s Cloud & IP Research & Development Centre in Budapest, Hungary is currently looking for C++ and Java Software Developers across all experience levels. We welcome applications both local candidates and professionals outside of Hungary open for relocation and career move. Successful foreign candidates will be provided with an additional relocation package to start a local employment in Hungary. We strive for a gender diversity and encourage female candidates to apply.

Our innovative R&D Center in Budapest is focused on building Cloud and IP solutions that will help Ericsson attain a ICT technology leadership position.  A team of over 1200 gifted developers is fiercely focused on furthering our Cloud and IP portfolio. Budapest is also one of the most important global Research and Development hub, offering a diverse, performance-driven culture & an innovative & engaging environment where employees enhance their potential every day. Our employees live our vision & core values. They share a passion to win & a high responsiveness to customer needs that in turn makes us a desirable partner to our clients. To ensure professional growth, Ericsson offers a stimulating work experience, continuous learning & growth opportunities that allow you to acquire the knowledge & skills necessary to reach your career goals.

What We offer:

  • Flexible working hours
  • High standard working environment (recreation room, sauna, bicycle storage, parking lots…)
  • Easily accessible location
  • Competitive compensation package, wide range of cafeteria elements, annual bonus
  • International career opportunities
  • Great team spirit, fun events
  • Professional communities
  • Subsidized language courses
  • Mobile with 4G, laptop
  • Local medical service

Location:

Ericsson R&D Center Hungary

1117 Budapest, Irinyi József utca 4-20.

Ericsson provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, marital status, pregnancy, parental status, national origin, ethnic background, age, disability, political opinion, social status, veteran status, union membership or genetics.

Ericsson complies with applicable country, state and all local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location across the world in which the company has facilities. In addition, Ericsson supports the UN Guiding Principles for Business and Human Rights and the United Nations Global Compact.

This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, training and development.

Ericsson expressly prohibits any form of workplace harassment based on race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, marital status, pregnancy, parental status, national origin, ethnic background, age, disability, political opinion, social status, veteran status, union membership or genetic information.

Primary country and city: Hungary (HU) || Budapest || Budapest || R&D

jobs.title: Linux Systems Architect
jobs.content: The D. E. Shaw group seeks a Linux Engineer to join its IT team. This individual will be responsible for developing automation tools and managing the server environment which runs firm-wide applications and their supporting infrastructure. This environment includes physical and virtual servers, high-performance data and storage networks, and infrastructure to support a large scale Linux environment. The engineer will work with developers to integrate infrastructure with application development, and manage core infrastructure such as Kerberos and DNS.

jobs.title: Ruby on Rails Developer
jobs.content:
Headquarters: San Francisco
URL: http://bit.ly/29RiYbj

About Toptal
Toptal is one of the most innovative and rapidly expanding tech start-ups from Silicon Valley. With backing from investors such as Andreessen Horowitz and Adam D’Angelo, our platform is the fastest growing labor marketplace in the history of the Internet—connecting thousands of elite engineers all over the world. In the last four years, Toptal has become the #1 choice for tech companies requiring top-tier engineering talent and for the top 3% of freelancers looking for their next challenge.

Position Description
We are looking for a Ruby on Rails developer to be responsible for managing the interchange of data between the server and users. Your primary focus will be to develop all server-side logic, define and maintain the central database, and ensure high performance and responsiveness to requests from the front-end. You will also be responsible for integrating front-end elements built by other team members into the application, so a basic understanding of front-end technologies is necessary as well.

By joining the Toptal network, you’ll have the opportunity to work on many client projects, ranging from start-ups to Fortune 500s, with teams of highly skilled experts from around the world.

This is a remote position that can be done from anywhere.

Benefits:
  • Freedom to choose your own schedule and choose from a variety of hourly, part-time, and full-time projects.
  • The ability to work from wherever you want. Whether you prefer traveling and working from exotic beaches or spending time with your family and working from home, the choice is yours.
  • Access to a thriving, collaborative community of talented peers.
  • Invitations to frequent Toptal events going on around the world, including dinners, tech talks, conferences, and more.
  • Extremely competitive compensation.

Responsibilities:
  • Design, build, and maintain efficient, reusable, and reliable Ruby code.
  • Integrate data storage solutions, including databases, key-value stores, blob stores, etc.
  • Integrate user-facing elements built by your front-end developer teammates with server side logic.
  • Identify bottlenecks and bugs, and devise solutions to these problems.
  • Help maintain code quality, organization, and automation.
  • Optimize applications for speed and scalability.
  • Collaborate with other team members and stakeholders.
  • Take smart risks and champion new ideas.

Requirements:
  • Senior-level Ruby on Rails expertise, along with strong experience in common libraries such as RSpec and Resque.
  • Strong understanding of the syntax of Ruby and its nuances.
  • Strong understanding of object-oriented programming principles.
  • Experience with server-side templating languages such as Liquid, Slim, etc.
  • Experience with server-side CSS preprocessors such as Sass.
  • Basic understanding of front-end technologies, including JavaScript, HTML5, and CSS3.
  • Familiarity with MVC, Mocking, ORM, and RESTful principles and best practices.
  • A knack for writing clean, readable Ruby code.
  • Ability to integrate multiple data sources and databases into one system.
  • Understanding of fundamental design principles behind a scalable application.
  • Ability to create database schemas that represent and support business processes.
  • Ability to implement automated testing platforms and unit tests.
  • Proficient understanding of code versioning tools such as Git, Mercurial, or SVN.
  • Familiarity with tools to aid development such as Bower, Bundler, Rake, etc.
  • Familiarity with continuous integration.
  • Be willing to help your teammates, share your knowledge with them, and learn from them.
  • Be open to receiving feedback.

To apply: http://bit.ly/29RiYbj

jobs.title: Experienced Ruby on Rails Developer
jobs.content:
We're looking for an experienced Ruby on Rails Developer to join our scrum team of multiple developers, QA and DevOps Engineers. This is a remote position for US/Canadian candidates. Our platform features a responsive front-end built with Ember.js, and a well-designed Rails API that combines semantic databases, natural language processing, machine learning and search. 


You will be doing some or all of the following:



  • Developing scalable, highly-performant, customer-facing we applications with Ruby on Rails.

  • Building RESTful APIs. 

  • Improving system performance and reliability.  

  • Writing clean, efficient and maintainable code.

  • Helping us scale our rapidly growing web application. 


Ideally, you'd be local to our beautiful Upper Valley located on the border between Vermont and New Hampshire where we'd welcome you to our fancy new offices. We have a ping pong table, and are really excited about the craft brewery that just opened up the street. If you're not within a daily commute (we're about 100 miles northwest of Boston), we'll entertain remote. We'd ask you to travel to our offices (at our expense) once a quarter so we can get everyone face-to-face for some bonding and planning.

jobs.title: Performance Engineer
jobs.content:
If you are interested in pushing computer programs to run as efficiently as possible, squeezing every bit of performance out of the system, this is a job you will love.


Performance Engineers at MongoDB work with a very talented group of engineers to measure, analyze and improve the performance of MongoDB’s disruptive database technology. 


You will work on defining workloads that are appropriate for characterizing the performance of our revolutionary database engine, automate the measurement of these workloads, and conduct analysis to gain insights into how to make the system run faster and use resources more efficiently. You will be involved in building performance frameworks, creating and automating performance tools, and learning how our technology is deployed for various use cases.


Responsibilities



  • Workload creation: Design workloads that are appropriate to measure the performance MongoDB’s database engine

  • Performance tools: Work on tools that measure various aspect of the system performance, including throughput, response time from the database, as well as resource usage information such as CPU and IO statistics

  • Automation: Integrate the workload generation and data collection tools into an automated infrastructure that enables performance regression tracking across builds and allows developers to quickly assess performance implications from code changes

  • Analyze performance data to determine cause of performance regressions or identify areas for performance optimizations

jobs.title: Software Development Manager
jobs.content:
Quidsi Inc., is a subsidiary of Amazon and entrepreneurial parent company to Diapers.com, Soap.com, BeautyBar.com, Wag.com, Yoyo.com, Look.com, Afterschool.com, Casa.com and Vinemarket.com. We are a mom-centric retail technology company. We deliver delightful experiences, products, and expertise by offering a curated selection of products, lightning-fast delivery, incredible customer service, and an easy-to-navigate shopping experience.



Quidsi’s sites are host to millions of daily visitors and our warehouses are run by hundreds of autonomous Kiva robots. Our entire operation from our websites/apps, to our fulfillment centers and customer care center is focused on creating an enjoyable end-to-end customer experience. To get there, we need exceptionally talented, bright and driven people who are energized by what if (the meaning of Quidsi in Latin). If you'd like to help us build the place where people can find and buy anything online, come and innovate with us!



We are seeking a technical lead to manage various projects related to Quidsi's 9 retail ecommerce sites and customer experience. You'll have technical ownership of a functional area and manage a small team of talented engineers. This includes a curated site experience as our products and sites become increasingly diverse, expedited shipping and a team who is empowered. Projects will leverage Amazon’s technological capabilities and platform to make Quidsi’s solutions compelling, unique, and sustainable.



This is truly unique career opportunity for a technology leader who likes to invent as well as dive deep. You'll be the hands-on leader of a team, overseeing a broad range of platform integrations, improvements and customer-facing features. You'll partner with business leadership to initiate and prioritize key projects and work beyond our organization to tap into Operations capabilities. You'll operate at all levels of the technology stack, supporting a broad set of clients and collaborating with a wide range of service providers (internal and external).



Responsibilities:

·Guide web development teams and be responsible for overall systems development life cycle

· Translate of complex functional and technical requirements into detailed project plans and schedules; manage the day-to-day activities of the engineering team by defining, implementing and maintaining a coherent, progressive development strategy for our product line

· Manage process and quality of service improvements, planning, project management of software deliverables within the team, and management of resources across teams

· Work closely with the architects to develop the best technical design and approach for product development

· Maintain current technical knowledge to support rapidly changing technology

· Possess architectural depth to steer teams toward highly performing systems

· Strong technical vision

jobs.title: Software Development Engineer in Test
jobs.content:
At Workiva, we create best-in-class, next-generation collaborative solutions for enterprise productivity. We pride ourselves on bringing the consumer level user experience to business users. We love our customers, and they love us back. We hire smart, talented people with a wide range of skills who are excited to solve some of today’s most challenging problems. Workiva started with an idea, to make complex collaboration easy. Wdesk is an all in one platform that simplifies complex collaboration while keeping data in sync, thus reducing risk. Wdesk is used by thousands of companies globally and we boast a 96% customer satisfaction rating.

As a Software Development Engineer in Test (SDET), you'll build and utilize cutting-edge testing tools with agile processes to plan and conduct all aspects of testing our software products. SDETs are the predominant contributor for instilling a culture of quality within their team(s). You'll be a member of an agile development team using a number of test frameworks and methodologies to ensure that we provide the best possible experience to our customers through quality driven products and efficient delivery cycles.


What You'll Do:




  • Understand the purpose of the product and the customer’s workflow, advocating for quality practices that put the customer’s needs first

  • Contribute positively to the company and our culture

  • Collaborate closely with product teams and stakeholders to correctly identify issues

  • Involvement in planning, grooming, and designing discussions to ensure testable, quality products are built and necessary testing frameworks are identified

  • Understand and assist in defining acceptance criteria, and utilize that information to write test requirements. Apply that research and knowledge in the development and implementation of test plans.

  • Utilize analytics, telemetry, and other data to drive an understanding of our users

  • Create, review, and maintain robust automated testing using Dart, Python, Go, and/or Java

  • Engineer tests to verify and validate performance and scale

  • Understand and teach the appropriate application and execution of exploratory testing

  • Identify successful patterns for producing quality software from communication to release

  • Educate your team to understand the most effective & efficient ways to test the product and how to use the tools that have been implemented.

  • Break things so we know how to improve them
