jobs.title: Project Manager
jobs.content:
Overview:

We are looking for a project manager who enjoys working with clients and has been in a creative agency environment. At Duarte we call this special hybrid individual an Account Producer. By being at the heart of getting projects done, an Account Producer (AP) can appreciate the balance of keeping a client happy yet when costs are inflated or being channeled in the direction they can reconcile the two. They see the implications of what will or won’t affect the vision and if it matters. And communicate that. An Account Producer is a great critical thinker, who can manage the unknown.

The AP initiates, maintains and manages an account’s projects on an ongoing basis. The AP has overall responsibility for leading the client production effort. Within the agency, the Account Producer is the leader/coordinator for the client and works closely with all agency personnel in determining project scope, estimating, planning, executing and monitoring assigned projects and deliverables. Oversees and motivates project teams. Externally, the AP will have direct client contact with assigned agency clients.

The Role

The AP directs and coordinates the day-to-day agency efforts on assigned accounts. In this role, the AP insures that the agency ensures superior creative product is delivered every time.

  • Sound and responsible project management and planning.
  • Proper and innovative execution of work in all areas on schedule.
  • Communicate with client and has desire for career development deeper into accounts.
  • Motivates a cross-functional team across various stages of projects.

Duties include:

Planning:

  • Plan projects, drive them, evaluate progress and modify the plan as it unfolds
  • Develop workable budgets, work plans and realistic timetables.
  • Collaborate with the Account Team on strategies and actions for the client.
  • Manage creative projects, internal agency projects and new business projects.
  • Utilize information systems and update them on a regular basis
  • Define project scope, estimate and write scope in collaboration with account team on specifications
  • Educate account team and clients and manages their needs and expectations.
  • Determine project risk on an ongoing basis, escalates issues as needed.
  • Evaluate best team makeup for assigned projects.
  • Monitor out of scope requests, initiates additional estimates and approvals.
  • Anticipate and solve potential issues
  • Ensure work is getting produced against the objectives in the brief and have a point of view as to what’s right for the client’s business

Setting Expectations:

  • Educate clients and manage their needs and expectations.
  • Ensure client is delighted with the deliverables and experience
  • Help the team exceed client expectations
  • Help team see the value of the work and how what we do is worthwhile
  • Continue to focus on connecting projects back to client’s business objectives
  • Confidently manage external communication, solve problems, present work and ensure client and agency alignment
  • Maintain communications with appropriate agency and client personnel to ensure positive workflow.
  • Establish partnership and camaraderie with all team members on project

Communicating:

  • Own communication flow for assigned projects
  • Represent Duarte and the work externally
  • Represent the client internally
  • Partner with creative and strategic teams to present work to the client
  • Translate and synthesize the client’s feedback to the team
  • Ties executional feedback back to the objectives
  • Communicates clearly with clients on the phone and email.
  • Presents professionally and exudes the Duarte spirit
  • Is articulate in Duarte’s IP and methodology and is a client whisperer
  • Remains calm yet persistent under pressure
  • Be nurturing and tough, quick witted and patient

Managing Projects:

  • Escalate exceptions and issues to Director level as required
  • Provide leadership within the agency and monitors work scope against all variables.
  • Act as the project leader on all assigned projects Manage assigned projects, involved with client projects from start to finish, ensuring successful project completion against deadlines.
  • Provide and maintain projects status - liaising with development teams, designers and commercial staff to provide accurate updates of project statuses
  • Project quality assurance - testing and review of output, reviewing outputted deliverables against scope
  • Manage digital assets and sourcing through final delivery
  • Initiate and lead all appropriate project meetings.
  • Keep project status reports up to date
  • Monitor and enforce project constraints (schedule / scope / resources)
  • Champion internal systems for higher productivity working
  • Drive projects to final stages of completion by keeping the team both on track and highly motivated.

Financial & Administrative

  • Monitor all budget and production activity on assigned projects and communicates status of each project to appropriate agency and client personnel in order to meet project deadlines.
  • Monitor all internal and external costs for assigned projects.
  • Create and maintain projects, status reports, PO’s, estimates, schedules, change orders, etc.
  • Manage purchases, vendors and contractors on projects - create purchase orders, monitor actual vs. budgeted costs.
  • Manage the production of new business presentations and materials as assigned
  • Works with account executive to insure proper billing and invoicing.
  • Reviews WIP and final billing reports.
  • Strong business and personal ethics

Requirements

  • Bachelors Degree in Marketing, Advertising, Journalism, Digital or Broadcast production.
  • Interest in and aptitude for producing creative solutions
  • Minimum of 4 years experience as a project manager or producer in a creative agency
  • Client-facing experience
  • Great project management abilities
  • Self-motivated and life-long learner
  • Experience working with clients to develop and negotiate project scopes and budgets
  • Ability to self-manage while managing assigned teams and projects under tight deadlines.
  • Self-direct own work, be proactive
  • Focused on developing leadership skills

jobs.title: Recruiter
jobs.content:
Recruiting Associates know how to make the right connections with the right people. They focus on identifying top professionals who can provide industry insight and knowledge to our clients, the world’s leading financial investment firms, professional services firms, and corporations, as they seek to learn more about the world around us. Recruiting Associates explain to industry professionals what it means to work with GLG and recruit them into GLG’s professional membership network, the GLG Councils. In addition, they manage the relationships with new Council Members and serve as a liaison between them and research professionals within GLG.

Recruiting Associates thrive in a fast-paced environment, multitasking between various projects. They are curious individuals who are excited about a communication-driven role. Whether it is successfully communicating GLG’s business model to a current CEO of a major company or composing a professional biography to present to a client, the Recruiting Associate role is an exciting entry-level position in a growing global firm. GLG currently has the following Recruiting Associate openings:

Recruiting Associate – North America Clients

  • Recruiting Associates aligned with North American clients will work closely with GLG´s Research teams servicing Hedge Funds, Private Equity Firms, Venture Capital Firms and Investment Banks. 


Recruiting Associate – Asia Clients

  • Recruiting Associates aligned with Asia-based clients focus on identifying top professionals in North America to service clients in China, Hong Kong, Korea, Japan, Singapore, India and Australia. In this role, the Recruiting Associate will collaborate with international GLG teams and will be exposed to the research interests of clients´ respective regions. Must be willing to maintain an adjusted work schedule (11:00am - 8:00pm) in order to accommodate the time difference between US and Asia.

 

Recruiting Associate – Life Sciences Clients 

  • Recruiting Associates aligned with Life Sciences clients focus on identifying top professionals in the Americas to service clients in the Life Sciences industry. In this role, the Recruiting Associate will collaborate with GLG’s Life Sciences Research team and will be exposed to the research interests of respective clients. Must demonstrate interest in the life sciences and healthcare spaces.

Key Responsibilities:

As a Recruiting Associate, each day presents a variety of research objectives requiring critical thinking and creative problem-solving skills. You will learn to master a client relationship workflow while developing business acumen, time-management skills, professionalism, and communication skills. In our open and collaborative work space, you will communicate with colleagues across multiple GLG teams in a friendly, idea-sharing, and support-driven manner.

  • Complete a fast-paced training program that leads to client/end-market alignment
  • Communicate clearly and effectively the mission and business model of GLG to industry professionals and recruit Council Members into the GLG Councils
  • Work collaboratively in partnership with other GLG teammates to develop a deep understanding of the client’s needs  
  • Gain knowledge of industry dynamics across all verticals and sectors through the use of technology tools and other creative means
  • Learn GLG’s policies and procedures for protecting the integrity of all GLG engagements

The Ideal Candidate:

Across all of our positions, GLG seeks excellence, integrity, creativity, and professionalism. Specifically, we look for individuals who thrive in new environments and approach their work with precision and a drive to continually improve overall skill-set and performance.

For this position, we seek applicants with bachelor's or master’s degrees from top-tier colleges or universities, or equivalent work experience. The following factors will strengthen an applicant’s candidacy:

  • Strong written and verbal communication skills;
  • Demonstrated commitment and attention to detail, ideally in a high-volume, fast-paced environment;
  • Strong problem-solving skills;
  • Passion for fast-paced learning, especially in a technology-enabled environment;
  • Passion for recruiting, sales, and/or conversation, with a successful track record in phone sales or outreach preferred;
  • Ability to work effectively independently and/or collaboratively in a team;
  • Proficiency in Portuguese or Spanish is preferred, but not required;
  • Undergraduate or graduate GPA of 3.3 or better.

About GLG / Gerson Lehrman Group

GLG is the world's leading platform for professional learning. Business leaders, investors, consultants, social entrepreneurs, and other top professionals rely on GLG to learn in short- and long-term engagements from a membership of more than 425,000 experts. Clients partner with GLG to address their most complex strategic challenges, make better business decisions, and advance their careers through conversations, mentorships, small group convenings, surveys, and other interactions—all within a rigorous compliance framework. Global, technology-driven, and nimble, GLG’s 1,000 employees work in 22 offices in 12 countries.

We believe strongly in our mission- and values-driven culture. Our core values drive our success. They are: learning & curiosity, responsibility, courage, judgment, fresh perspective, service, and integrity. 

To learn more, visit www.GLG.it.

jobs.title: WAREHOUSE ASSOCIATE I -Orlando FL
jobs.content:
Overview

 

Mohawk Industries is the leading global flooring manufacturer that creates products to enhance residential and commercial spaces around the world. Mohawk’s vertically integrated manufacturing and distribution processes provide competitive advantages in the production of carpet, rugs, ceramic tile, laminate, wood, stone and vinyl flooring. Our industry-leading innovation has yielded products and technologies that differentiate our brands in the marketplace and satisfy all remodeling and new construction requirements. Our brands are among the most recognized in the industry and include American Olean, Bigelow, Daltile, Durkan, Karastan, Lees, Marazzi, Mohawk, Pergo, Unilin, Quick-Step and IVC. During the past decade, Mohawk has transformed its business from an American carpet manufacturer into the world’s largest flooring company with operations in Australia, Brazil, Canada, Europe, India, Malaysia, Mexico, New Zealand, Russia and the United States.

Mohawk Industries, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to an inclusive workplace and a proud Drugs Don’t Work participant.

 

EOE MINORITIES / FEMALES / PROTECTED VETERANS / DISABLED

jobs.title: Database Developer/Feed Integrator
jobs.content:
Markit Digital is looking for a mid-level software engineer to join a fast-paced, collaborative team, focused on building and Maintaining the back end data layers supporting financial web sites. The position requires a diverse set of data integration and database development skills, along with demonstrated excellence in problem solving and communication. 


Primary duties include the Following: 
• Database development: develop and maintain database objects: such as stored procedures, tables, views, and functions - Primarily using MS SQL Server 2008 or newer.  
• Production support:. Provide research and support for client-reported issues  
• Feed development: set up feeds to load a diverse range of formatted files and documents (eg XML, CSV, RIXML).  
• Script development: develop and maintain scripts using C# and other scripting languages.  
• Performance considerations: research performance issues and optimize objects we manage. 


Background and skills required: 


• minimum 3 years technical experience coding SQL within a relational database or coding in on application development language (preferably C#). 


• An undergraduate degree in a technical field: such as computer science or mathematics.


• Strong troubleshooting skills. 


• Attention to detail. 


• Excellent communication skills: ability to collaborate Effectively with technical and non-technical colleagues, vendors , and clients. 


• Willingness and ability to dig in and understand underlying data.  


• ability to manage risk in a highly sensitive production environment serving clients, over the Entire development life-cycle, across vendor components, infrastructure, and application code. 


• Experience with XML content using XSLT and / or scripting languages is a plus. 


• Experience with / knowledge of data Utilized in the finance industry is a plus. 


What you want to learn to do: 


• Use both industry-standard and proprietary technologies to integrate and distribute a wide of dataSources did power our high traffic, high visibility sites for the world's large largest financial firms and media outlets. 


• gain exposure to the stock market and other financial data. 


How we will compensate you: 


• A position with a growing, global enterprise 


• Salary - Commensurate with experience 


• Medical, dental, and vision insurance 


• Company paid life insurance 


• matching 401 (k) 


• Gym reimbursement 


• Three weeks paid holiday plus holidays, personal time, sick time and paid volunteer days 


Markit Digital is at EOE.

jobs.title: Senior Service Manager, Network Engineering
jobs.content:

This position manages the delivery of services in these and other technology areas by actively and proactively managing value from service providers, understanding best practices and current/evolving technology standards, identifying strategic opportunities and enabling processes solutions.

jobs.title: Performance Engineer
jobs.content:
Job Details






















Join us

As a member of Concur's Performance and Load team, you will lead and collaborate with other smart Engineers in the evolution of our SAS platform. Your work will benefit tens of millions of customers and gives you the opportunity to be in the driving seat as we move towards highly-efficient systems coupled to high-quality automation, and new performance and load strategies.


As a member of our agile teams, you will contribute to all aspects of the development process, including shipping features you develop (look Ma, I created that!).  You bring with you a special expertise in performance and load along with a strong sense of curiosity, a keen desire to learn new tools and methodologies daily.


What you bring with you…


At this stage of your career, you are not looking for a simple set of tasks or well-defined problems with a clear solution.  You are looking for a new technical and organizational challenge – assessing the environment, and creating your own path – working with others to solve key challenges you have identified. At heart, you are a strong, technical Engineer who continues to learn and grow - and grow those around you. If this sounds like you we’d love to start a conversation.

jobs.title: Senior Front End Web Developer
jobs.content:
Thomson Reuters is looking for a motivated, self-starting front-end developer. You will help us design and code industry-disruptive products with the latest tools and technologies. Your primary efforts will focus on Thomson Reuter's Data Fusion platform, a hybrid of big data and linked data technologies, which allow organization to put all their relevant structured and unstructured data in a larger context of Thomson Reuters knowledge graph.


You’ll need to bring all of your skills with HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript, and provide recommendations to the UX design team, the back-end development team, and product management on ways to make and keep the product nimble and fresh to consumers.


Your job will be to help us transform our product into a responsive, scalable interface and keep us on the forefront of technologies across all major platforms, browsers, and device form factors.

jobs.title: Principal Engineer
jobs.content:
Using C++ and other languages, you'll develop the next generation of security technology. We’ve used C++ to:



  • Accelerate device level forensics by more than 10x over existing technology

  • Implement new network protocols enabling collaborative defense against distributed attacks

  • Detect patterns of insider data theft in real-time through file system analytics


C++ is our language of choice for low level systems software. We write modern C++ (STL, RAII, and Boost). But, given our addiction to innovation and our position on its leading edge, our platforms and tools are always evolving. Therefore, a good fit requires that you thrive on learning new domains and tackling new challenges. Deep talent, problem solving, and a commitment to quality are more important than proficiency in any single language.


Our work straddles the fence between engineering and research. Like research, we’re inventing things that have never been done before. We thrive on discovery and are comfortable with risk. And our domain is never static. Yet, like engineering, we haven’t succeeded until we’ve produced well-built systems that people actually use.


We write code to be read. We’re looking for someone who cares deeply about clear, clean, well factored code. We emphasize architecture: the right architecture leads to a robust, simple, flexible implementation. Our project management is strong but hands off: you’ll be given clear goals and the support you need. From there it’s your job to deliver: you’ll be expected to solve problems independently and get the job done.


If this is the type of challenge you thrive on, we’d love to speak with you further. We’re located in Central Maryland, in between Columbia and Baltimore, about a half hour from the beautiful Chesapeake Bay. All day-to-day work can be done work remotely.


We offer competitive salary and benefits, including health, dental, and vision; 4 weeks paid vacation and holidays; opportunities to perform research, speak, and publish; unlimited technical books at our expense and whatever tools you need.


Grier Forensics is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

jobs.title: Experienced Full-Stack Developer
jobs.content:
Headquarters: New York, NY
URL: https://www.myfyx.com

MyFyx is looking for an experienced Full-Stack Developer to help connect people with music. MyFyx is a social music platform that amplifies the connective power of music in a unique way. MyFyx also provides artists with a novel distribution and funding model.

As a Full-Stack Developer at MyFyx, you'll be responsible for the day-to-day development and infrastructure operations. MyFyx maintains a variety of products; we have a pair of recently released iOS and Android mobile applications built with React Native, as well as a web site running on Ruby on Rails. We have a variety of backend services facilitating the mobile apps running on Google Cloud Platform with Kubernetes. We believe in using the right tool for the right job, and constant progression.

Our stack:
  • React Native with NuclearJS
  • Node.js
  • Golang
  • Elasticsearch
  • Redis
  • MongoDB
  • Ruby on Rails
  • AngularJS (1.x)
  • Kubernetes on GCP via Google Container Engine
  • Heroku

By joining MyFyx, you'll get significant input into production direction and features. We are a completely distributed company with flexible work hours.

About You:
  • Experience with modern Javascript (ES6 and beyond) and Javascript app architectures
  • Experience with Node.js
  • Experience designing and implementing backend services and APIs
  • Experience with managing deploys and infrastructure, monitoring
  • Experience with NoSQL datastores
  • Strong incite into user experience and interface design, awareness of standard iOS and Android component design patterns
  • Down to earth, easy to work with
  • Consider yourself a generalist engineer and are willing to wear many hats, sometimes at the same time
  • Comfortable with "owning" products / features and ideally have experience with being responsible for the entire end-to-end development process
  • Comfortable and willing to learn as you go. There's probably pieces of our stack you haven’t worked with before, and that's okay as long as you’re confident enough to learn as necessary.
  • Excited to work with a small team and have lots of input in product direction

It would be a big plus if you have had experience working with with some of the following:
  • Experience with any of the technologies used in our stack
  • Building products with React Native or React
  • Flux architecture. We use NuclearJS, but knowledge of Redux / Reflux / etc. will transfer easily
  • Functional Javascript libraries (e.g. Ramda, Immutable)
  • Swift, Objective C, and native iOS app development
  • Java and native Android app development
  • Prior experience working remotely

To apply: Send a resume and cover letter to hiring@myfyx.com

jobs.title: Generalist Software Engineer
jobs.content:
ABOUT LIVERAMP


LiveRamp is the leading data onboarder, enabling marketers to unify their customer database across disparate online marketing applications and leverage it for analytics, targeting, measurement, content optimization, and more.


ABOUT THIS JOB


Can't be tied down to a single specialty? This is the job for you. It's hard to say what tomorrow's challenge will be, but you'll be happy to hack away at it, whether it's a Ruby on Rails web UI, a distributed analysis Hadoop application in Java, or something completely new.


RESPONSIBILITIES



  • Design and build sophisticated systems to process and visualize massive amounts of data.

  • Make mistakes. Fix them; learn from them; make different ones next time.

  • Be at the forefront of technology innovation. Keep LiveRamp on the cutting edge of industry tools and best practices.

  • Push your teammates to become better engineers. They will do the same for you.

  • Work on your own great ideas for our company during Hackweeks.

  • Contribute towards building a great company


QUALIFICATIONS



  • Excited by the idea of building scalable and reliable products.

  • Comfort in multiple languages, frameworks, and environments.

  • Type S(tartup) personality: smart, ethical, friendly, hard-working and proactive (no exceptions).

  • Desire to work in San Francisco. We will relocate you if necessary.


EMPLOYEE BENEFITS



  • Own equity in the company. Every employee is a stakeholder in our future.

  • Work with talented, collaborative, and friendly people who love what they do.

  • Participate in a thriving culture. We host events such as weekly yoga, game nights, happy hour, and a two night camping trip.

  • Leverage our health insurance, dental insurance, vision insurance, 401K, and pre-tax commuter benefit.

  • Work in the heart of San Francisco - the best city in the world.

jobs.title: Senior Full Stack Engineer
jobs.content:
ABOUT THIS JOB


Do you aspire to make things as simple and intuitive as possible? Are you excited by the challenge of working on a hugely sophisticated data processing system, designing ways to turn data into information? Are you as humble as you are brilliant? Consider joining our team.


RESPONSIBILITIES



  • Design, build, test and operate the full stack from database through web application tier and user interface.

  • Translate customer and product requirements into technical designs and implementation.

  • Build highly performant web applications that interact with large data sets.

jobs.title: Senior/Lead Developer for Rails SaaS Product
jobs.content:
Hey. You there. I'm Jon, the founder and original developer of our SaaS platform. We're a small team now, but we're looking for a Rails developer who out-ships all of us.


You will become part of a growing team who's mission is to help small businesses--and the marketers and agencies who serve them--thrive in a world where the "voice of the customer" is everything. We're fighting the good fight.


Specifically, we're expanding our platform of marketing automation tools for managing, monitoring, and amplifying online customer feedback and reviews. We're looking for a strong Rails product developer who can drive the evolution of our product and capabilities around: data collection and manipulation, dashboard- and report-building, communication workflows, cross-site publishing, third-party API integrations, web-crawling, job-queueing and all kinds of automation.


We'd love to hear from Ruby on Rails developers who are passionate about building a product that users love. Ideally, you share our vision of empowering business owners to succeed. We are deeply customer-oriented but still maintain a strong bias for good design and engineering. You'll work directly with the company founder (a developer) as well as other developers, designers and a product manager.


You will be able to work remotely, but you should still be in the NYC metro area for our periodic in-person gatherings. Salary/equity is negotiable.

jobs.title: Client Architect, Partners (Channels) - US Remote
jobs.content:
About the Role:

The Global Partner Solutions Consulting team is seeking an Architect who can drive growth through API-led connectivity across the North America Partner business. Doing so requires a laser focus on collaborating with MuleSoft Partners to deliver game changing connectivity driven solutions to their customers. This includes the following:

  • Ideating, Architecting and executing joint solution capabilities with our strategic Partners
  • Mentoring and assisting partners through Pre Sales Engagements
  • Enabling partners on technical and architectural elements of MuleSoft platform

Position Deliverables:

  • Guide our strategic Partner Architects, CTOs, Engineers and Consultants through MuleSoft Point of View
  • Collaborate with brilliant minds from our strategic Partners to ideate, build and take joint solution capabilities to market
  • Create and execute the top notch products for MuleSoft Partner Technical and Architectural enablement
  • Execute Architectural Workshops/Engagements and PoCs with our Partners
  • Create and deliver high impact Technical, Architectural and business facing presentations
  • Respond quickly to functional and technical elements of RFIs/RFPs
  • Work cross functionally with Products, CTO and Engineering within the MuleSoft to drive new innovations and platform functionality
  • Represent MuleSoft and our joint capabilities with our strategic partners at Industry and Tech conferences

30 Day Goal:

  • Learn MuleSoft Anypoint Platform in your first two weeks
  • Get your hands dirty by building your first MuleSoft Partner enablement product using Anypoint platform

60 Day Goal:

  • Engage with Partner Managers and meet our strategic Partners and understand MuleSoft Partner business
  • Go through the existing Strategic Partner joint solution capabilities and develop a point of view on the approach, process, deliverables and seed assets
  • Fly solo and execute your first Partner engagement (e.g Technical or Architectural presentation/Workshop)
  • Build and deliver your second partner enablement product

90 Day Goal:

  • Execute your first joint solution capability with a Strategic Partner
  • Engage and collaborate cross functionally with MuleSoft Products, CTO and Engineering and drive one unique platform innovation 

About You:

  • Passion towards Architecture, Pre-Sales and Partners business
  • Middleware and Connectivity background
  • Experience in guiding a Customer/Partner through and architectural and technical point of view
  • Engineered and executed Enterprise Pre-Sales Cycles (Sales Engineering/Solution Consulting/Sales Consulting)
  • Demonstrated ability to grasp and learn new business models and technology paradigms
  • Deep interest in Enterprise software, cloud, and APIs
  • Experience with one or more of the following:
    • Enterprise Architecture
    • SaaS Integration
    • API Management 
    • PaaS and IaaS 
    • Ability to debug and code when needed
    • Understanding of ERP, CRM, HCM and related Application Software domain

This is a fast-paced, high-growth startup environment -- we are looking for smart, high energy candidates who are looking to make a big impact, and who want to work alongside a great team to do so. We work closely together and put in startup hours, so you must be a team player! The perfect candidate will thrive on the prospect of taking on huge challenges and will “move the needle” at MuleSoft by driving programs through feats of flawless execution.

About Our Benefits:

  • Pre-IPO equity
  • Competitive medical, dental, and vision insurance for you and your family
  • 401(k) and pre-tax health care, dependent care and commuter benefits (FSA)
  • “No policy” vacation policy
  • Mac or PC
  • Annual, all-company weeklong MeetUp trip for collaboration, learning and inspiration

jobs.title: Kiln Operator (Lead) - A shift
jobs.content:
Overview

 

 

A kiln  Monitors movement of tile through the kiln firing process.

 

Join the largest manufacturer of tile and natural stone in the United States and watch your career stand out with Dal-Tile, a subsidiary of Mohawk Industries.

 

Our close-knit team of dedicated professionals has made us the success we are today. In exchange for their hard work, we support our people with a family-friendly work environment, a commitment to promoting from within, unique benefits that go beyond just medical and dental, and a belief that every employee deserves a productive life outside of work. If this sounds outstanding to you, take the first step forward and explore a career with Dal-Tile.

 

Responsibilities

  • Monitors tile entering and exiting the kiln to ensure process is operating efficiently. 
  • Inspects tile for defects.
  • Records temperature of kiln every hour during shift.
  • Monitors equipment or processes and reports problems to supervisor.
  • Follows ISO operating procedures.
  • Keeps area safe, clean and organized.

  • Other Pertinent Job Information: While performing the duties of this job:

    • The associate is regularly required to stand, use hands, and reach with hands and arms. 
    • The associate is required to walk, stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl. 
    • The associate may be required to sometimes sit, climb or balance. 
    • The associate may lift and/or move up to 80 pounds.  Specific vision abilities required by this position includes close vision, peripheral vision, and ability to adjust focus. 
    • While performing the duties of this job, the associate is regularly exposed to moving mechanical parts.
    • The associate is occasionally exposed to fumes or airborne particles. 
    • The associate may be exposed to a wide range of temperatures. 
    • The noise level is usually loud. 
    • Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform essential functions.

Qualifications

Education and Knowledge:

 

High school diploma or equivalent experience.

 

 

Experience:

 

0 -1 year previous manufacturing/production experience.

 

 

Competencies:

 

Good oral and written communication skills.  Good record keeping skills. Good listening skills. Accurate measurement capability.  Ability to understand and speak basic English.

 

Other Pertitent Job Information:

 

While performing the duties of this job, the associate is regularly required to stand, use hands, and reach with hands and arms.  The associate is required to walk, stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl.  The associate may be required to sometimes sit, climb or balance.  The associate may lift and/or move up to 50 pounds.  Specific vision abilities required by this position includes close vision, peripheral vision, and ability to adjust focus.  While performing the duties of this job, the associate is regularly exposed to moving mechanical parts. The associate is occasionally exposed to fumes or airborne particles.  The associate may be exposed to a wide range of temperatures.  The noise level is usually loud. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform essential functions.

 

We offer competitive salary and a comprehensive benefits package, career opportunities, and an environment of creativity and growth.

Company Match on 401k
Employee Purchase Discount
Tuition Reimbursement

 

Dal-Tile is a proud supporter of our U.S. military, veterans and their families - Thank You for Your Service!

Active military, transitioning service members and veterans are strongly encouraged to apply.

 

Mohawk Industries, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to an inclusive workplace and a proud Drugs Don’t Work participant (EEO/AA M/F/D/V).

jobs.title: Ruby on Rails Developer
jobs.content:
How This Job is Different


As a developer looking for your next job, the world is your oyster.


Except that most job openings involve working for massive companies where you'll spend most of your time sitting in meetings, dealing with internal politics or refactoring an ancient codebase.


Or you might work for a consulting firm, where your shockingly original ideas will be managed into mediocrity by your clients.


We've done all of the above, and we'll never go back. That's why we started Drip...to build a company where phenomenally talented people want to work.


If you wind up working with us, you'll witness first-hand how a small SaaS team maintains double-digit growth every month (and how we scale our technology to handle it).


You'll learn the stuff that they don't teach in school or, frankly, at any other job you've had. We achieve better results than larger, highly-funded teams. Come learn how we pull it off...


Who We Are



  • Drip is a 3-year old SaaS product in the email marketing space, with an 8-person team. We’re part of a larger, well-funded company called Leadpages, that has 180 employees. 

  • Working with us gives you the best of both worlds: the intimacy, influence, and speed of a small development team (currently 3 developers), but all the perks of a well-funded parent company (stable, health insurance, stock options, 401(k), etc.).

  • Leadpages and Drip are well-known in the startup scene so having our name on your CV (and an endorsement from our founders) doesn't hurt, either.

  • Both of Drip’s team leads are developers, and everyone on the team has a technical bent. As such, we are a developer-focused team that's a haven for expanding your technical chops.


The Code



  • Our Ruby on Rails code base is meticulous; we have 2.5 lines of test code for every line of production code. Our technical debt is the lowest of any app I've worked with.

  • Everyone uses Macbook Pros + a high-quality external monitor.

  • The best part about being a product company (rather than consulting) is the freedom to work on super interesting issues, and to take the time to solve them right. Without a client rushing you or telling you to change it later.

  • We place a high emphasis on code quality, test coverage, and UI/UX. We spend a lot of time making Drip look gorgeous both inside and out..


What You'll Do



  • Build and launch a production feature your first week on the job.

  • Help us scale our Rails app, optimize performance of existing features, write Rails code and tests for new features, and perform dev ops work as needed.

  • Work directly with two SaaS founders on a kick-ass small software team.

jobs.title: Front End Web Developer
jobs.content:
Cambridge, MA


 Do you want to work on products that help make the world a better place?


 Would you enjoy working with a diverse, talented, and passionate team to make sure that researchers and policy makers around the world have the best data and insights for their communities to be successful?


 Do you love working with the latest technology and tools?


 If so, this is your opportunity to work on applications used around the world, in a position where your work can make a difference to improve the livelihoods of millions of people.


What we do


We take real world government data and research, and turn them into interactive data tools affecting policy at the highest levels and citizens worldwide. The Atlas of Economic Complexity is our current online tool that lets users interactively visualize a country’s trade and explore growth opportunities for more than a hundred countries worldwide. We build tools that can ultimately help many stakeholders eradicate poverty.


CID has partnered with countries and firms who for the first time are making their vast data sets available to create public goods and insights. We're now working with individual countries, like Colombia and Mexico, to take their biggest civic datasets and use them to drive regional development using network analysis and visualization.


What you’ll do



  • Work with our UI designer to implement designs in clean, modern cross-browser, mobile friendly, and standards-compliant HTML/ CSS / Javascript

  • Organize current code bases and optimize loading speed in coordination with the backend developer (Django / Python)

  • Help build and integrate new visualizations for large amounts of data into websites

The Data Scientist will join CIS' Data Science Practice, a central team of data experts who support a range of data-intensive projects across the university. The Data Scientist's primary role will be to collaborate with top researchers in economics at the Rhode Island Innovative Policy Lab (RIIPL) to design, maintain, and optimize secure database infrastructure that integrates sensitive data from various state agencies, and to develop predictive models that inform smart policy.


This is a 2 year fixed-term staff position, with the possibility of promotion to a permanent staff position contingent upon available funding.


Please note: Cover letters and resumes must be included with all candidate applications.

jobs.title: Software Developer
jobs.content:
The D. E. Shaw group brings together some of the best minds in computer science, mathematics, physics, and engineering to work at the intersection of finance and technology.  Members of our versatile technical staff exhibit a range of strong quantitative and programming abilities, with software developers and quantitative analysts collaborating on challenging problems that directly impact the firm's continued success.

Quality and innovation are imperative for creating computationally-intensive solutions for trading profitably in markets around the globe.  Developers bring strong analytical, mathematical, and software design skills to a variety of projects, including the formulation of statistical models for our computerized trading strategies, distributed system development, real-time data analysis, and the creation of tools for advanced mathematical modeling.  Technology is an integral part of virtually everything we do and our team enjoys access to some of the most advanced computing resources in the world.  Successful candidates have traditionally been the top students in their programs and have extensive software development experience.  We welcome outstanding candidates at all experience levels.

jobs.title: Principal Software Engineer- Scala

The Developer will be expected to possess the independence and people skills necessary to work across IT functional teams and directly with business units in order to accomplish their tasks. Although these tasks will be prioritized and assigned at the management level, the Developer will be expected to take ownership and show initiative in order to achieve resolution.


The Developer will be expected to demonstrate the ability to clearly and effectively communicate with the leadership of both technical and non-technical teams.


The Developer will be expected to thrive in an environment that stresses the value of innovation and proactive process optimization.


The Developer will take a lead role on significant projects, and will work closely with business stakeholders, project managers, and other IT teams to define and communicate effective strategies for project execution.


The Developer will at times be asked to lead troubleshooting and remediation efforts for significant production issues. He or she will be expected to demonstrate the ability to select an appropriate course of action, and take decisive measures to implement it, under the stress of a significant production crisis.


The Developer will be expected to take a proactive role in contributing to a knowledge base as they learn about the behavior of HBC’s existing systems, and define the behavior of new systems and subsystems.

jobs.title: Software Engineer III | Inbound Engineering
jobs.content:
Moz is looking for an experienced Software Engineer to join our web and inbound engineering team. The team is responsible for Moz.com (our main web property) and supporting services including: user authentication, signup process (including PCI compliance), customer tracking/engagement, mailing service, and a number of other services used by Moz products.

About the position

  • Work closely with the Engineering Manager, Technical Project Manager, and product owners to understand the function and system requirements.
  • Participate in testing process through unit testing and bug fixes.
  • Development of new applications by following a set of requirements from other departments to assure production of a quality product.
  • Responsible for monitoring and analysis of current applications including performance, diagnosis and troubleshooting of problem programs, and designing solutions to problematic programming.
  • Follow good development practices and software development life cycle methodologies throughout product development.
  • Assist in resource and time estimation in areas such as creating engineering designs, hiring, and mentoring the team.

Requirements:

  • 5+ years of professional software developing experience
  • Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science or Engineering or you love to code.
  • Expert knowledge of Node.js.
  • Strong understanding of Git, MySQL, Redis, Memcache.
  • Comfortable managing VMs and deployments, NGiNX, Varnish.
  • Promotes the agile process and methodology.
  • Experience converting from monolithic to microservice architecture.
  • Sense of humor.
  • Motivated by solving company/user problems, not just technical problems.
  • Strong interpersonal skills with emphasis on verbal and written communication.

About Moz

We develop an analytics software product to help people do better marketing. Behind the tool is a sea of Mozzers with a wide array of personalities, experiences, and expertise. We’re a startup with the ability to turn a profit, backed by a passionate community of followers, and with an exciting and hopefully VERY lucrative road ahead.

We’ve worked hard and deliberately to build a cultural roadmap. It’s not just about ping pong games and company parties (though we have those too!)— We’d love you to learn more about it below before you apply:

Moz believes in the TAGFEE tenets. As Mozzers, we strive to exemplify these core values.

Making the web a better place (http://moz.com/about) and watch how we do it (http://moz.com/products).

Not convinced we are awesome yet? Check out our video “Why we love Moz” and our amazing benefits package.

Sneak peek at the goodies

  • Competitive salary, 401K, stock options
  • Generous time off plus $3,000 per year towards your vacation!!

  • 150% charitable donation match

Moz is an equal opportunity employer and we are committed to providing a work environment that is free from any form of discrimination. Moz values diversity and fosters mutual respect among its employees.

jobs.title: Software Engineer III | Moz Local
jobs.content:
Moz Local is a service every business with a brick and mortar presence needs. Partnered with major search aggregators, it helps businesses manage their online listings to ensure Google, Apple Maps, Bing, and customers can find them. It is simple to use, and the value is simple to understand.

Simple doesn’t mean easy. Moz Local engineers, designers, and our sales group work to automate a tedious manual, error-prone process while creating tools to give customers insights into optimizing their data and reporting for local search success.

Simplicity requires tough choices, flashes of brilliance, novel engineering solutions, and persistence in building our business. And for our customers, simplicity is king. We’re a group of diverse interests and abilities, and we’re eager to work with others who share those qualities. We believe in using the best tools for the job at hand. For us, that’s the NodeJS ecosystem, ReactJS, NSQ, MySQL, RethinkDB, and Docker.

About You

  • You're an experienced (5+ yrs) software engineer.
  • You have a commitment to shipping software.
  • You love the product you work on and you want to work with other people who feel the same.
  • There aren't parts of the stack that is someone else's problem.
  • You have something to contribute but want to learn from your team.

About the Team

  • NodeJS / JavaScript development on Linux.
  • Advanced services based group.
  • Hard working, hard charging, and mostly self-sufficient.
  • We love open source and we want our team members to contribute as much as possible.

About Moz

We build analytics software that gives our users the technical edge towards better marketing on the web. We are dedicated to the future of marketing analytics. We’re obsessed with it. We’ve been at it for over 7 years and we’re in it for the long haul. We’re a leader in our space, growing fast and receiving frequent recognition for our accomplishments (2014 lists include: Inc 5000, Deloitte Fast 500, and the Puget Sound Business Journal's fastest growing private companies).

Behind our software is a sea of Mozzers with a wide array of personalities, experiences, and expertise. We’ve worked hard and deliberately to build a cultural roadmap. It’s not just about ping pong games and company parties (though we have those, too!). Learn more about it below before you apply:

TAGFEE is the glue that holds us together and binds how we do everything at Moz. As Mozzers, we aspire to live and breathe these values. We make the web a better place: (http://moz.com/about) and this is how we do it: (http://moz.com/products). Not convinced we are awesome yet? Check out our video “Why we love Moz” and our amazing benefits package.

Sneak Peak at the Goodies

  • Competitive salary, 401K, stock options
  • Generous time off plus $3,000 per year towards your vacation!!
  • Home internet and transportation subsidies
  • 150% charitable donation match
  • And so much more (feel free to grill us about the rest in the interview!)

Why Moz? Because we love what we do.

Moz is an equal opportunity employer and we are committed to providing a work environment that is free from any form of discrimination. Moz values diversity and fosters mutual respect among its employees.

jobs.title: Full-stack engineer
jobs.content:
Kaggle has a community of almost 600K data scientists who come to Kaggle to learn, compete, and collaborate on the cutting edge of machine learning. We are best known for running machine learning competitions with organizations like Facebook, NASA, and GE. 


In our next chapter, Kaggle is expanding to become the place where data scientists share code and analysis in a reproducible way. We're building this platform for data science collaboration (the closest analogy is Github for data science) around our thriving community. As part of our small team, you'll be a part of designing and building this platform in its early stages. We don't expect you to know everything coming in, so we'll pair you with mentors who will help you grow and develop your skills.


We like working remotely: a lot of our team is distributed. We prefer US-based timezones but will hire the right candidate anywhere in the world. If you’re in the San Francisco Bay Area or interested in relocating here, you’ll enjoy our easy-going office culture and all the beauty the Bay Area has to offer.


What you'll do



  • Architect and create new site features, ranging from discussing wireframes to creating the data model and deploying the end result.

  • Implement local tooling to facilitate users transferring their analytics between local environments and Kaggle's infrastructure.

  • Build features in our current web stack (C#, ASP.NET MVC,  TypeScript, React, SQL Server, and Azure).

  • Create and build on our services layer (which includes Linux,  Docker, and Python for running user code).

  • Measure, optimize, and scale Kaggle’s infrastructure.

  • Ship every day.

jobs.title: Delivery Lead - First Level
jobs.content:
The Opportunity


As Delivery Lead First Level you will lead our 24x7 monitoring team. Together with your team you are an essential part of the safety net, which ensures availability and operating of our systems. You will challenge the status quo and improve the availability and robustness of our systems together with our engineering teams.


You will have the freedom to launch your own open source projects, contribute to others’ projects, build internal community around your interests, and strengthen your personal brand, while receiving meaningful support at every step.


Your Responsibilities



  • Conceptualize and implement improvements for our 24x7 processes and procedures

  • Improvement of system reliability by implementing and facilitating an adaptive learning process

  • Organize and facilitate of postmortem analysis. Communicate status and follow up, provide statistics and regular reports to all stakeholders

  • Drive team mastery

  • Facilitate communication and decision-making between teams and stakeholders

  • Support people leads in developing people, coach and develop team members regarding technical expertise

  • Identify and share your knowledge of state-of-the-art technologies that will help us innovate faster

  • Represent Zalando at conferences and meetups, give technical talks and help to recruit great people

jobs.title: Software Engineer, SAP
jobs.content:
The success of Zalando is also the history of cooperation of our exceptional team. We always welcome new contributors, move things and want to work with us at the Best Fashion Experience the world. Zalando Technology is the base of our e-commerce platform. From Shop via internal systems to logistics software we build customized in-house developments and adapt our software in short cycles to our processes.


WHAT WE EXPECT FROM YOU



  • You verfügst for a university degree in computer science, software engineering or equivalent qualification

  • You have SAP development experience and proven knowledge in ABAP / 4, ABAP Objects, BSP and / or ABAP WebDynpro.

  • You have experience with SAP FI-CA or FI modules

  • You have more than knowledge of interface development

  • You are tested in the implementation of SAP projects

  • Analytical thinking and structured operation characterize yourself

  • You work autonomously

  • Even in critical situations keeping the overview


YOUR TASKS WITH US



  • You aquire solutions and IT concepts in SAP Financials and HCM

  • You verantwortest the functional support and development of the existing processes in the area of financials and human resources

  • You develop ABAP, interfaces, forms and the SAP Business Workflow

  • You lead by functional tests, take this off and are creating technical documentation

  • You lead failure analysis and fault repairs for existing SAP ABAP programs by

  • You work actively in the redesign of processes in existing SAP applications in cooperation with the application consultants and departments with


WHAT'S WAITING FOR YOU



  • Fast-boarding through our 4-week mentoring program

  • the plan A Tech Academy and personal development through training and technical "People Leads" with you your tour-Of-Mastery

  • Internal Tech Talks and professional exchange with successful start-ups

  • Powerful Computer hardware (8 GB of RAM, SSD hard drives, 2x 24 "monitor)

  • Community: hack weeks, movie nights, coder dojos, +40 self-organized guilds tech

  • 40% Zalando shopping discount

  • A corporate culture in which you are demonstrating competence solely by results - we live the motto: Wear sneakers, not ties

  • An international team of experts that will leave you inspired and supported

  • new innovative projects with the latest SAP products

  • international and creative SAP team with currently 15 employees


INTERESTED?


We look forward to your application. Do you still have questions? Then you hesitate to contact Matthias Rempel under jobs@zalando.de

jobs.title: Sr. Java Developer
jobs.content:
Sr. Software Developer


Seattle, WA


Overview


Rylem Consulting is a leading resource in the Northwest for talent management. We help dynamic companies- Fortune 500 companies as well as innovative and exciting startups- identify and recruit game-changing talent. We currently have new contract position for a Sr. Software Developer at a company that is a leader in retail and apparel.


Job Description:


Rylem is looking for a Sr. Software Developer who will take part in the development of large scale RESTful Web Services and customer facing applications in a retail space. Also be able to mentor junior developers to grow them to similar levels of technical expertise.


Requirements:

  • RESTful API

  • J2EE

  • SOA Environments

Benefits:

  • Cool Technology

jobs.title: Continuous Integration/Continuous Delivery DevOps Engineer
jobs.content:
The Opportunity


In order to empower our product teams to deploy their applications themselves, the continuous delivery team provides an infrastructure which builds, tests and deploys our applications automatically. The DevOps engineers in this team are automating every step of our delivery pipeline as well as they are supporting other teams to use this pipeline. The continuous delivery team is based in Berlin.


What You Are Going To Do



  • You will be working in an agile team which develops and maintains our delivery infrastructure

  • You are going to support our product teams in using our delivery infrastructure

  • You will take an active part in scaling our delivery infrastructure by using cloud services

jobs.title: UX Specialist - personalized eLearning for healthcare
jobs.content:
Role Purpose


Elsevier is building a new (and awesome) innovation team to develop a next generation learning experience and redefine healthcare education. To transform the business and company culture, we're creating a team in Philadelphia, PA to work boldly and collaboratively on concepts and designs for a user-centric suite of teaching and learning tools. Reporting to the UX Strategy Lead, we now require a UX Specialist to conduct user research, run usability studies and create concept wireframes for our education products.

jobs.title: Software Engineer, Frontend - Germany, Helsinki
jobs.content:
You Are Ready To Make An Impact


Zalando is transforming from Europe’s leading e-commerce company into a multi-service platform for fashion. From logistics, to big brands, to manufactures - we’re building the platform that connects all people and parts of the fashion ecosystem.


We live Radical Agility. With the set of principles that we give to you and your team - Autonomy, Mastery, Purpose - we entrust you to shape the future of Zalando. You will be the one changing the world’s opinion of tech and fashion in Europe.


Your individual impact at Zalando is limitless. It is not only about growth and improvement - it is about inventing new things. We strongly believe that providing useful code to the world is a virtue. We strive to learn from and contribute to open source software for the betterment of Zalando and the tech community.


You Are Setting Standards


Variety. From Fashion Store to Brand Solutions to Business Assurance and Smart Logistics, you will join one of our 90+ teams to build, scale and continuously improve a variety of web applications that re-define the user experience of our 18 million active customers and partners.


Autonomy. Based on our microservices architecture, you and your team will own your code, and decide together on the technologies and tools to deliver as well operate large-scale web applications on PaaS/SaaS cloud (AWS).


Ownership. You and your team will work truly cross-functional with an entrepreneurial mindset and take ownership for the whole development cycle - from architecture design to testing to implementation and maintenance.



Excellence. You will join a team that is dedicated to delivering the highest standards when it comes to the scalability, performance and user centricity of our software.  You will add value by leveraging current trends in software design, frameworks and RESTful web services.

jobs.title: BAMx Engineer
jobs.content:
The Job



  • Develop features across the stack


    • Front-ends include an Angular app, a Chrome extension and a JavaScript tag

    • Back-end is a RESTful API in Python using Flask

    • Infrastructure includes MySQL, Redshift, Redis, RabbitMQ, Docker and more


  • Collaborate with engineering, design and product management


    • Discuss and decide on approaches to solve technical challenges

    • Estimate the complexity of upcoming work

    • Use a branch-based, pull request process to submit code to the git repository


  • Keep the platform up and running


    • Consider potential impacts of features on production infrastructure

    • Participate in an on-call rotation

    • Respond to alerts and use monitoring to diagnose potential issues



You want to...



  • work with a large software system of highly interrelated components

  • help scale a platform past thousands of requests per minute

  • have a fundamental impact on the success of a startup

jobs.title: Partner Solutions Architect
jobs.content:
DataStax Enterprise is the database for Cloud Applications. As a Partner Solutions Architect, you will have the opportunity to interface with both developer and non-technical audiences, in a dynamic, high-energy environment.


Responsibilities will include supporting sales and technical integration efforts between DSE and various platforms; with a number of partners. This individual will have a deep understanding, and hands-on technical experience, with enterprise and Open Source technologies.


Essential Job Functions:




  • Qualifying customer requirements and effectively articulating DataStax’s ability to meet these requirements.




  • Ensuring the success of infrastructure, ecosystem and cloud partnerships through effective prioritization and management of technical integration efforts, joint customer support and jointly developed technical and marketing collateral.




  • Contribute to building a strong Go-To-Market (GTM) partner network through technical enablement and deal support




  • Developing and delivering exceptional company/product presentations and demonstrations 1:1 and 1:many




  • An active member of the field feedback process to the Product Management team




  • Engagement of the Cassandra community through attendance of community events and the delivery of DataStax content as required.




Job Requirements:




  • 2+ years customer-facing experience




  • 5+ years experience in traditional RDBMS and/or NoSQL databases, including Data Modeling




  • 5+ years experience with Linux and Java and/or JVM




  • 2+ years working in partner sales organizations (optional)




  • Strong communication and presentation skills with an ability to present complex solutions concisely 1:1 and to a large audience.  Direct exposure to Cassandra, Hadoop, Solr & Spark preferable but not required.  System automation and integration skills with the ability to communicate well to developer communities




  • Fluency in speaking to the full range of IT stakeholders including the IT Director / CIO level




  • Good knowledge of datacenter architecture particularly multi-datacenter and global deployments




  • Organized and analytical, able to thrive under pressure with outstanding time management skills




  • Creative and adaptive approach to removing obstacles and accelerating the sales cycle




  • Ability to travel up to 25% of the time is required - preferred location near a major airport




DataStax is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, protected veterans status, or any other characteristic protected by law. The following link provides more information regarding Federal laws prohibiting discrimination in employment: "EEO is the Law"

jobs.title: Integration Engineer
jobs.content:
An ops visibility tool is only as good as the data it collects. We pride ourselves on collecting everything from logs to system metrics to application metrics to API data in whatever environment our customers are using.


If you enjoy constantly getting to play with new tools, come help us connect to... everything. You'll be playing around with software packages from Apache to Zookeeper, APIs from AWS to, er, Azure. Much of your work will involve adding modules to our open-source Python-based agent. If you're interested, there's also room to help create dashboards and write guides to help engineers make sense of all the data that $PACKAGE_X generates.


You'll be working on our core engineering team and collaborate directly with our senior engineers and product designers.

jobs.title: SQL Server Database Administrator
jobs.content:
Our Database Team is lean and the individuals on the team wear many hats. Our daily responsibilities include everything from TSQL performance optimization, to automating SQL Server and Windows with PowerShell, to working closely with software developers and business leads to create high-quality database solutions.


The best candidates for this role will have an innate mindset for high-quality deliverables, creative solutions, a desire to automate repetitive tasks, and a drive to learn and do new things with SQL Server databases. This is a highly collaborative role with interactions throughout the software development organization on a regular basis. This role requires excellent communication and interpersonal skills along with the ability to navigate technical and organizational challenges with minimal direction.


Responsibilities:



  • Consistently strive for high quality database solutions and exhibit a strong sense of ownership

  • Develop and optimize stored procedures and functions using T-SQL

  • Review and modify new and existing stored procedures to enhance performance and incorporate best practices while encouraging and educating others

  • Assist in database maintenance, optimization, and replication in a 24/7 global database deployment

  • Assist in the physical and logical architecture and design of relational database schemas

  • Participate in multiple high priority projects simultaneously while interacting with peers to make the best technical decisions

  • Develop procedures and scripts for data migration

  • Provide off-hour support for production and development database environments as needed

jobs.title: Producer
jobs.content:
The Opportunity


As a producer you will be instrumental in supporting the development team in achieving excellence in terms of delivering software. You will help facilitate the lean development process, track progress against Key Performance Indicators and will help organize and support planning and other daily activities as the team requires. You will be expected to showcase your excellent organisational, problem solving and analytic skills.


What we are looking for



  • You have 4-5 years of Software Project Management or Software Product Management experience, ideally in an e-commerce company

  • You have sound knowledge and experience of managing and supporting software development using industry standard agile project management methodologies

  • You have effectively managed features and requirements documents, project management documents and team roadmaps.  You are able to bring a team together to craft a joined up plan, you understand risk mitigation and dependency management.

  • Activities such as Backlog grooming, Task Prioritization, Roadmap Management, Daily Standups, User stories, Jira, Product/Feature Mockups and Processes diagrams are in your DNA

  • You have strong communication skills and actively drive projects, breaking down complex problems into manageable, structured work packages. You effectively manage stakeholders and third party expectations and undertake periodic, appropriate reporting

  • You have drive and are you motivativated to get things done.  You lead by example, you talk data, you facilitate, you resolve, you negotiate and get things done

  • You thrive in an international environment and are fluent in verbal and written English 


Your Responsibilities



  • You will be the organizational engine of your team, responsible for managing product releases and executing the end-to-end integration plan

  • Your main focus will be on non-core-engineering tasks to enable successful end-to-end delivery and operation.  You will be expected to manage your team’s external project dependencies, external deliverables and roadmaps

  • You will refine requirements from Business KPIs, features and user stories

  • Your special focus will be on ensuring all end-to-end delivery tasks are completed for a successful product release

  • You will be part of an engineering team and you will play  key role in facilitating the team to take them forward. On a day-to-day basis, you will work very closely with the team and will facilitate taking decisions as a unit


What you can expect from us



  • Autonomy and trust to deliver using agile techniques in an entrepreneurial environment

  • A career development path developed jointly with you with potential for developing breadth and depth in skill set

  • A unique corporate culture where results are what matters, all within a relaxed office environment

  • A highly motivated international team of colleagues who will both inspire and support you


Want to join us? Then go ahead and apply!


If you need guidance or have any questions about our recruiting and hiring processes, please contact recruiter Manjuri Sinha at manjuri.sinha@zalando.de

jobs.title: Embedded Software, Firmware, and/or Hypervisor Engineer
jobs.content:
DornerWorks is currently seeking Embedded Software, Firmware, and/or Hypervisor Engineers to design various levels of software for novel and exciting embedded systems engineering projects.  We are not just another engineering services provider but instead we’re a growing, full-cycle embedded solutions engineering design firm specializing in many facets and levels of HW, SW, and FPGA development.  The technologically advanced products and services that DornerWorks is able to deliver are especially targeted towards safety-critical markets, to include the automotive, medical, defense, and aerospace industries; however, with the high speed at which consumer products are advancing, DornerWorks has also performed a lot of design work in that market, as well (especially in the IoT arena!).  Due to this wide range of abilities and customers, DornerWorks is able to offer its engineers new, exciting, and challenging project assignments not seen at many other companies!  DornerWorks is able to deliver advanced, whole-cycle, novel technology products and services in basically ALL facets of embedded system design and in just about any industry.  To accomplish this, DornerWorks employs only the best and brightest engineers to work in this fast-paced and dynamic design environment.  DornerWorks may have a casual, small-business atmosphere, but we are capable of delivering some of the most innovative and complex designs to some very big customers.  Once you’re here you’ll realize just how special of a place DornerWorks really is!



As an Embedded Software/Firmware Engineer at DornerWorks, you will typically be responsible for designing and testing software for cutting-edge embedded systems engineering projects.  The bulk of DornerWorks’ software development will require a particularly strong background using C to write low-level firmware, drivers, and other embedded software targeting the latest micro-controllers and processors (skills which we’re always looking for!). 



Additionally, we’re currently especially interested in finding software engineers with particular interests, aptitudes, and/or experiences in low-level software architecture, kernels, RTOSs, and/or embedded operating systems (namely Linux) that may be interested in potentially joining our growing embedded hypervisor team.  Since using hypervisors, Linux, and Xen for embedded applications are all relatively new, we’ll provide the training necessary to get up to speed; however, a very strong fundamental understanding of low-level embedded software and Linux WILL be immediately required to fill our current needs for Embedded Software Engineers.



If interested and already experienced in embedded hypervisor development and implementation (especially using Linux and/or Xen), you could quickly find yourself at the forefront of some new and exciting technology as one of our Embedded Hypervisor Engineers.  In such a role, we’d hope you could help mentor and grow our hypervisor team in a responsible, knowledgeable, and creative way.  You would participate in the full embedded engineering life-cycle from devising a system architecture and requirements to integrating and validating the entire system.  During this time, it would be the continued expectation to maintain a particular focus on the latest embedded applications of hypervisors, using embedded Linux and Xen, specifically.



To learn more about and to apply for these and other specific positions we have openings for, please navigate to www.DornerWorks.com/careers/job-openings.



Applicants selected for this position must meet the eligibility requirements for access to customer information regulated by the International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR). Therefore, only U.S. Citizens, Green Card holders, or U.S. Permanent Residents will be considered.



DornerWorks is an equal opportunity employer and participates in the E-Verify program. EEO/M/F/D/V
