jobs.title: SDK Engineer (iOS/Web)
jobs.content:
As an engineer on our Client Team, you’ll be responsible for designing and implementing Sharethrough’s SDK in native apps. The software you create will be used by top publishers to power their iOS and mobile web applications.

Let’s talk if…

You have 1 year of experience building complex mobile applications using Objective C, C++, JavaScript, or other frameworks You have knowledge of iOS SDK performance tools and optimization You have knowledge of the mobile web environment including design principles and best practices

Bonus Points if …

You have experience with Swift, React, or ES6

jobs.title: Product Manager, Product Designer, Feature Inventor.
jobs.content:
Product Manager, Product Designer, Feature Inventor. Newton wants to talk to you!

Newton develops cloud-based, software-as-a-service applicant tracking software for small and medium-sized businesses.

We are looking for a feature inventor! What does that mean? This role will reports to our Head of Products (Steve Hazelton). He is going to ask you to spec, product manage and build a new feature.

What is cool about this job:
This is a job for an inventor. You are perfect for this job if you like software and like building great things that people love. This is not a great job for someone who needs a lot of hand-holding and structure. 

Who will you work with:
You will report directly to our Head of Products. You will work with our design team (currently 1 person, growing) and our engineering team (about 25 people, going to 40 soon).

What you might not like:
We are not sentimental about features: if we don’t need them, we don’t ship them. You very well might design something that will never get implemented. Such is life.

You are a great fit for this role if:

  • If you have taken business workflows / concepts and turned them into software, then you are perfect for this job.

  • If you are good at making complicated things much simpler, then you are perfect for this job.

jobs.title: Senior iOS Developer
jobs.content:
Mango is looking for an awesome iOS Developer to join our team. Why join Mango? As the leading language-learning resource for libraries in North America, our Senior iOS Developer will shape the future of mobile learning for hundreds of thousands of our learners. This opportunity positions you at the heart of our flagship program, Mango Conversations, setting the direction for our mobile development.


As our Senior iOS Developer, you’ll work on products that connect millions of learners to our fun, effective language-learning resources. You’ll get to craft cutting-edge, user-friendly applications that will bring Mango’s core purpose to life: enriching lives with language and culture. Expect to collaborate with passionate, talented professionals from every corner of the globe and area of expertise - the Mango team is made up of linguists, programmers, teachers, beatboxers, librarians, writers, artists, and even a rocket scientist.


Mango is a fast-paced, innovative environment, and your work will positively impact users around the world. With courses in over 70 world languages and a deep catalogue of ESL offerings, our team is creating solutions to some of  the greatest challenges facing language-learning and mobility today. Care to join us?  Here is a quick look at some of the work you will be tackling... in bullet form!



  • Write scalable, extensible, and clean code

  • Develop new features, from prototype to full product

  • Develop and maintain API’s and libraries for our iOS Client

  • Help identify business needs and provide technical solutions and recommendations

  • Mentor junior developers

jobs.title: UX Designer Mobile-Senior
jobs.content: YouVisit is hiring an UX Designer Mobile-Senior in New York

jobs.title: JavaScript Developer - Front End Web
jobs.content:
At ChefSteps, we’re not just cooks—we are engineers and designers; it’s as much a tech company as it is a culinary one. We believe the future will be better when software helps cooks to learn from each other and powers the tools that put them in control of the kitchen.


You could play a key role in making that vision a reality. See this blog post for some of the areas we are working on.


We are looking for an experienced developer with a passion for frontend work. You have built complex web apps using AngularJS or another modern Javascript framework. You wouldn't dream of writing jQuery spaghetti in 2014. You create structured, modular CSS. You play nicely with designers and care about implementing pixel-perfect, responsive, jank-free interfaces - and you can send us the URLs to prove it. Bonus points if you've also built native-wrapped HTML5 apps using Cordova. You might be the right fit if you love food, are self-directed, enjoy refactoring, and are experienced enough to know how and when to ship.

jobs.title: Front End Engineer
jobs.content:
About the Engineering Team


We work together in a pretty novel fashion - team leaders are elected by their teammates, and responsibilities normally held by a single manager are distributed across multiple roles. We have very open discussions about our product, our organization, and shared priorities.



We’re always iterating on how we work and what we build. We’re growing fast and we know that what may have worked a year ago won’t necessarily work a year from now. This applies to both the technology and the organization of our teams. We want to provide the best analytics experience for developers and co-create the best work environment for each other - willingness to evolve is essential.



About the Job


Keen is building the future of analytics-by-API. Our team is focused on shaping the interactive environment where anyone can put our APIs to work and get value out of our platform. We do this through apps and interfaces like our Explorer, Dashboards, and Dataviz SDK. Our customers' expectations for both technical capability and quality have never been higher than they are right now.



To meet these challenges we have to work efficiently and effectively, both as individuals and as a collaborative team. You will help us be thoughtful and deliberate about tackling the right problems at the right time. You’ll help make building and maintaining our projects easier. You’ll have the opportunity to gain deep understanding of every aspect of our service and teach others! Most importantly, you will collaborate with some pretty amazing humans.

jobs.title: Innovation Architect, Health Suite Digital Platform
jobs.content:
*This position can be located in Cambridge, MA OR Foster City, CA OR Bothell, WA


The Health Suite Digital Platform


The Health Suite Digital Platform is a highly scalable, cloud-architected PaaS that abstracts the complexities of technology from the solution of distributed healthcare that is patient focused.  The HSDP leverages advanced industry best practices and novel solutions for authorization and authentication; data modeling, ingestion, and normalization using various technologies; federation; rules and workflow engines; continuous monitoring and support – essentially a high performance, cloud-architected, highly scalable open eco-system delivering time-sensitive mission critical solutions for patient care both within the healthcare environment and in the ambulatory space.  Among the solutions hosted are imaging, pharmacology, laboratory, pathology, genomics, patient management, compliance, health coaching and continuous monitoring.


We are seeking a small set of individuals to form a core team of highly motivated, goal driven architects that will work with advanced IT solutions and/or complex clinical, data or process orchestration problems.  This team is responsible for designing and/or refactoring solutions to be compatible with the HSDP and produces the backlog to be consumed by a closely coupled development organization of over 500 engineers.


Your Role:



  • Refactor complex technical and domain solutions into a cloud-ready architecture compatible with the Health Suite Digital Platform.

  • Design and document architectural solutions to complex problems in multiple domains related to IT and healthcare.

  • Identify the impact of the business architecture on the assigned domain through identification of commonalities and conflicting issues in management and operations of the information systems and the supported processes in order to develop and maintain the architecture framework.

  • Develop and deploy architecture framework by developing principles, guidelines, standards and policies that serve as direction in choosing technology solutions for global programs or specific projects and keep the consistency of the different architecture solutions.

  • Develop specific architecture and solutions, plan the deployment (POMP process), define guidelines for implementation and governance and keep the architecture up-to-date, within the assigned domain and specialization.

  • Contribute to the governance of the business architecture through participation in solution shaping of new concepts, program & project development, release and change management.

  • Ensures that the organization is continually aware of new IT functionality.

jobs.title: Embedded Systems Engineer
jobs.content:
Philips Oral Healthcare is committed to bringing our customers the best in-mouth experience we can provide while providing them with the oral healthcare they deserve.  With the strong link between oral health and heart health, we are helping people to live longer, healthier lives.  Philips Oral Healthcare is also committed to helping each employee reach their own personal goals for development.  With the mentoring/coaching programs, stretch assignments, etc., offered to employees, you design your own career path.


Philips Oral HealthCare I&D Product Development Embedded Systems Team is seeking an embedded engineer with experience in the wireless domains.  The embedded systems team is made up of electrical and software engineers and is responsible mainly for the electronics/SW/FW in our products.  We support the development of new technologies for I&D and provide input into the User Interface with other groups in the company as well. Through your expertise you will be expected to help decrease the time to market and improve the quality of the embedded team's contribution to the Innovation-to-Market process.


As an Embedded Systems Engineer III for high-volume consumer medical devices, you should be capable of architecting, designing, documenting, and implementing high quality embedded firmware/software/electronics on multiple platforms across multiple product ranges. This includes but is not limited to:



  • Embedded software development in the C and assembly programming languages on 8-bit micro-controllers up to 32 bit microcontrollers.

  • Document, manage, and help to define/obtain/refine requirements, design docs, design reviews and verification procedures,

  • Help establish consistent ways of working with respect to embedded system electronics/software/firmware

jobs.title: Senior CloudOps Engineer
jobs.content:
This position can be located in Foster City, CA OR Cambridge, MA



Why this role on this team?


You will be part of a highly skilled cloud operations team responsible for overall IaaS and PaaS management at a global scale. This pivotal role will provide you the opportunity to leverage your diverse IT background including Linux, scripting, security, networking and cloud knowledge to deliver our healthcare platform services to a broad set of internal and external customers. Take your technical skills to the next level working on diverse and complex technical challenges in a dynamic and fast paced environment. As a part of this new organization you will have a unique opportunity to broaden your technical knowledge and problem solving skills while being at the forefront of healthcare innovation working on our advanced healthcare digital platform.


No other organization has the breadth and depth of the extended portfolio of health care solutions that Philips has across the entire health continuum, from the hospital into the home.  Philips is uniquely positioned as a health technology leader. We’ve been doing this for over 100 years, and leading the confluence of clinical and informatics is in our DNA.


What is the HealthSuite Digital Platform?


The HealthSuite Digital Platform is an open, cloud-based healthcare platform that will support data collection across the spectrum from clinical to consumer lifestyle, allowing for integration and analysis of ‘big’ data from multiple sources worldwide, including electronic medical records, diagnostic and treatment information, images, reports, notes, wearables and Philips connected consumer lifestyle products. The platform will utilize Philips’ clinical data models and medical device interoperability and is designed to be highly scalable with built-in comprehensive data security and privacy/permission control.


Why is the HealthSuite Digital Platform important?


The HealthSuite Digital Platform will enhance clinical decision making and care coordination (collaboration and workflow). It will allow caregivers to improve patient outcomes by allowing them to collaborate closely in support of their patients by enabling patients to take a more active role in managing their personal health across the ‘health continuum’ from self-care and prevention, to diagnosis and treatment through recovery and wellness. It also enables a vibrant ecosystem of third party created applications (via SDKs and API’s) to allow for open innovation in both clinical and consumer realms. This will support a patient-centric transformation of both professional healthcare delivery and continuous personal health.


Responsibilities:



  • Deploy multiple digital propositions SaaS applications via automation & orchestration platforms.

  • Handle the creating /patching and managing Windows and Linux (RHEL/CentOS) operating systems.

  • Responsible for creating / versioning / testing of scripts (Bash, PowerShell), Chef, Nagios, Maven / Ant, Git, Jenkins, Perl, Python (Boto) and Ruby to achieve high-level of automation.

  • Duties include automation of installation / configuration / management of Apache Tomcat, Solr Cloud, IIS, MySQL and SQL Server – J2EE and .NET applications in a secure deployment.

  • Responsible in building / maintaining / updating the monitoring tools to monitor systems, applications, databases as well as business transactions.

  • Oversee implementation /support and identity management, authentication, authorization, Token Services for federated single sign-on using technologies, such as SAML, OAuth, LDAP, Active Directory.

  • Troubleshoot production SaaS events / issues, including cloud infrastructure and application components.

  • Development Operations, provision, running scripts and performing UAT / validation testing on staging environments.

  • Collaborate with Software Development to maintain test / staging / production environments to meet uptime, performance, cost, and security goals.

  • Build and maintain enterprise monitoring platforms and scripts, including basic infrastructure checks and synthetic transactions.

  • Deliver on S.L.A. to both internal and external customers.

jobs.title: Principal Front-End Engineer
jobs.content:
Your challenge:


If you love mobile/web applications and love thinking outside the box, coming up with new ideas, brainstorming, and using your creativity to find solutions, then please read on and apply!


Your responsibilities:



  • Translating business requirements into component designs

  • Utilize OO design principles to create software components, or modify and integrate third party libraries and packages.

  • Develop applications using Test driven development methodologies and experience in creating unit and functional tests.

  • Develop solutions to ensure it’s designed for highly scalable, available, and best user experience in mind

  • Participate in design and code reviews for the team deliverables

  • Participate in scrum team activities, effort estimation, project planning, and daily standups

  • Researching and prototyping new solutions using mobile, cloud, NoSQL and web technology


Your team:


The Philips' Enterprise Imaging and Clinical Informatics Business Unit provide a comprehensive solution for medical image storage and enterprise distribution.  Our Software as a Service solution stores images for millions of patients across hundreds of hospitals across the country and helps clinicians acquire, analyze, and interpret clinical data so they have the care-specific information they need to make informed decisions with confidence.  You’ll join the R&D team responsible for building and maintaining this software.

jobs.title: Senior Embedded Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Your Challenge


The Senior Embedded Software Development Engineer position provides the successful candidate with an immediate opportunity to be involved with the development of technology that is helping to save lives, improve patient outcomes and reduce the cost of medicine across the globe. The technology is a cornerstone in the Philips HealthTech portfolio and has proven to be elusive to our competitors. As an international organization, Philips is well placed to offer a broad range of technical and leadership opportunities in various organizations throughout the world.


Your Responsibilities


In this role as a Senior Embedded Software Development Engineer, you will design, implement and test ultrasound components which integrate with the overall feature design and implementation. These tasks will encompass, as necessary, a broad range of software development disciplines including application, infrastructure, and signal path development. You will own the successful delivery of the software components as well as all associated multi-phase software process deliverables including software test and requirements management. Development will be completed in object-oriented C++ in a Microsoft Windows Embedded environment.

jobs.title: Wireless Software Engineer
jobs.content:
At Philips Health we are finding more and more that our name is only as strong as the Engineers behind it. Driving an industry becomes attainable only when the development is brought to life. You may not be aware but Patient experience in a clinical setting has become a major focal point, and we support that cause. Imagine creating a product that; allows a person to be mobile for critical appointments, allows doctors receive vitals in 1/10 of second, and have it all viewable via device or application.


Smart Patient Worn Monitoring related devices - instrumental in heart disease monitoring. This product is all about the freedom of movement and continuous ECG monitoring, pulse oximetry (non-invasive oxygen monitoring), and thoracic impedance ski electrodes to measure change)


The Intellivue product is a wearable device and a great example can be seen here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6GY7099Tc2o 


To move forward a Embedded SW or Firmware engineer is a key addition. For someone to bring knowledge to the team around RTOS and how everything communicates at a low level technology is the technology but also technical knowledge we need more of. It will be challenging, however with a supporting team and impacting the world’s healthcare, the growth is rewarding and unlimited.


Perform WLAN module integration into complex medical devices, with deep involvement in detailed embedded software development, working within the WLAN module and within the Product application space. Desire unique challenges at the forefront of new medical product design. Design and development of our Clinical Solution based on industry standard 802.11 WLAN protocols and components. The role requires excellent knowledge of 802.11 Wi-Fi radio chipsets, modules and solutions to allow our Clinical Product to operate on standard enterprise class WLAN networks while achieving industry leading performance.


Keys to success in this role are intimate understanding of Industry WLAN radio chipsets & modules, strong embedded software skills, an imaginative translation of needs to product design, a disciplined adherence to regulatory mandated product development processes and commitment to thoroughness in the exaction of plans.

jobs.title: Ruby on Rails Developer
jobs.content:
Streetline is seeking Ruby on Rails Developers at all levels to be responsible for the design and implementation of Streetline’s SaaS platform for enterprise and consumer-facing applications.


We’re looking for Ruby on Rails Developers with a broad set of skills who is ready to work at the intersection of big data, mobile, and the Internet of Things. Streetline’s systems span embedded sensor hardware, mesh networking, and signal processing all the way up to Cloud-based SaaS/web and mobile user applications — this position calls for very strong problem solving, systems thinking, technical breadth and creative innovations well beyond the typical web or desktop applications.


Responsibilities


You will contribute to the design of software architecture, data collection and infrastructure that support the entire suite of Streetline products and services. You will translate customer and business requirements into high quality software designs. You will also contribute to the design and implementation of internal and external web applications.

jobs.title: Software Engineering Manager
jobs.content:
We are looking for a creative and experienced Software Engineering Manager who has a knack for leadership and an understanding of the latest technologies. You've spent a number of years rising through increasing roles of responsibilities in engineering, and now you're an effective manager of a full-sized team. We will look to you to help drive our product roadmap and introduce best practices.



  • Use your leadership acumen and technical expertise to enable and manage team of Software Architects, Web Developers, Mobile Developers, UI/UX and QE Automation team members

  • Take personal responsibility as the delivery manager and set clear expectations for downstream teams

  • Defining, documenting, and presenting strategy and roadmap for the engineering support of our products

  • Work directly with development leads and product owners to track velocity and plan sprints for the engineering team.

  • Coaching team members on agile development techniques and process

  • Work closely with Talent Acquisition to attract and retain top talent. Hire winners who want to own their work, think way outside the typical, and want to create amazing interactive experiences by building software viewed through the lens of the customer.

  • Ensure your team has the tools and training to take it to the next level; excite them with new challenges and opportunities; coach and unblock them on a daily basis

  • Working closely with the product, engineering and design teams to ensure alignment, define scope, milestones, deliverables and the resources needed

  • Remove roadblocks and develop highly maintainable performant applications by collaborating with product owners, engineers, and stakeholders across the organization

  • Hold your own technical discussions and be a subject matter expert on our strategic direction

  • Remain involved in all stages of product development, from architecture to final testing

  • Define and promote internal standards, such as code documentation, unit testing, software reliability, build automation, and software configuration management, to create and improve our processes

jobs.title: Test Automation Lead
jobs.content:
Job Summary:

At Chatham, testers do not wait for features to be complete before testing.  In fact, the goal is for the beginning of a sprint to be test busiest time for testers – busier than the end of the sprint.  Testers do this by being heavily involved with all aspects of development.  Testers work closely with business users and developers to create testable user stories, develop automated acceptance tests that the developers can use before they complete coding, and make sure that we fully test regression test our code stack every day using our automated test suites.

Members of the test team at Chatham are expected to be technical problem solvers.  This is a technical position.  You will be expected to be able to program automated tests and to develop tools to assist with testing and to improve efficiencies.

jobs.title: DevOps Engineer
jobs.content:
Job Summary:
Our Engineering group is responsible for developing, monitoring and maintaining our core application platform services and infrastructure components that are relied on to deliver our SaaS products. Infrastructure automation and configuration management is a critical function within our Engineering group. You will be responsible for building tools, creating and tuning processes, integrating open source components, and working with all teams within our Technology group to deliver our software faster, with higher quality and better insight across our entire application stack.  


Qualifications:
Excellent candidates will be well rounded individuals, with an ability to learn quickly.  Candidates should be highly motivated self-starters with a passion for developing high quality software. Accordingly, strong technical and logical thinking skills are essential. Good written and verbal communication skills are required, as developers must interact with other team members in various departments.  Excellent object-oriented programming skills, problem solving abilities and attention to detail are a must.

jobs.title: Senior Data Engineer, Analytics
jobs.content:
As a software engineer in analytics team at Celtra, you will build, maintain and improve all parts of our data processing pipeline, processing 2B+ analytics events per day, producing insights used by top brands, publishers and agencies.


Why you should care


We are not your typical "Ad tech" company. We were one of the early adopters of Apache Spark. (use in production since 0.5, long before it became well known), one of the first three companies to start using Databricks and are early adopters of SnowflakeDB, a new cloud data warehouse. Also, we are looking into streaming solutions (Kinesis). We’re constantly re-evaluating our technical infrastructure to deliver faster, better, and more reliable software.


We use Scala for ad serving and data processing and PHP for REST API.


What we’re looking for


You care about proper engineering and clean code. You write consistently high-quality, maintainable code and are aware of industry best practices and trends. You proactively identify and clean up technical debt before it turns into a long-term problem and encourage others to do the same.


Your code runs in production somewhere. You have production experience with some of the parts of our stack: AWS, Spark/Akka, Scala, MySQL, DynamoDB, Snowflake, etc. and for the parts you don’t, you are excited to learn.


You have something to teach us. You have had exposure to other big data technologies that we do not use in production. Whether it be streaming solutions (Kinesis, Kafka, Storm, Samza) or storage/databases (Vertica, Teradata, Redshift, BigQuery), we go by saying: “Be conservative in what you use, be liberal in what you learn.”


You own what you do. You have owned larger parts of codebase before and have had the phone ring on you because something went wrong.


What a great candidate looks like



  • Experience with AWS or another cloud computing platform

  • Good knowledge of Scala or knowledge of Java with interest in functional programming

  • JVM ecosystem experience

  • Exposure to Snowflake, BigQuery, Redshift, Vertica, Teradata or other MPP columnar databases

  • Experience in analyzing and manipulating complex, high dimensionality data sets using tools such as Spark, Pig, Hive (or other Hadoop tools)

  • Strong SQL experience


Nice to have



  • Open-source involvement


Our culture



  • We care about product, company and its people.

  • We believe in high standards and long term code quality.

  • We ship. Features and fixes are deployed weekly.

  • We believe in an open and proactive culture where engineers are expected to learn and contribute in ways outside the usual coding assignments.


We take good care of our people. This is what we offer



  • Receive a highly competitive base salary, benefits and quarterly bonuses for performance.

  • Enjoy a generous education budget for conferences, classes, literature or studies.

  • Choose your equipment.

  • Work in our cosy office in San Francisco, CA.

  • Our fridge is always full and we drink the best coffee.

  • Travel between US and Europe.

  • Not from around here? No problem: If you are the right person, we are more than willing to help you relocate.

jobs.content:
Looking for a good programmer.

Must be good technically and have good verbal and written communication skill.

Must be able to research, learn and figure out new programming and development technologies quickly.

This position is at a small software development company that is growing. The job can be done remotely.

The position requires programming solutions with Python, Java, Java Swing and databases such as MySQL and SQL Server.

You will learn a software platform called Ignition to implement custom software solutions for manufacturing companies. 
More information here: http://www.perfectabstractions.com/about-ignition.html

Please complete the following test:
Requirements:
1. Below is some data in a text format called Format 1. Below that is some data in a text format called Format 2. Write a program that converts the data from Format 1 to Format 2.
2. Format 2 is valid JSON.
3. The data in Format 1 can be a string value in the program.
4. The program should print out the data in Format 2.
5. The program should be written in such a way that if different data in Format 1 was input into the program the program would convert and print out successfully that data in Format 2.
6. The program must be written in Python, using Jython 2.5.3

The quality of your code will be judged by these factors:
1. Does the program meet the requirements?
2. How simple, readable and understandable it is.
3. How much code is used (less code is better).
4. How much duplicate code exists (less duplicate code is better)
5. Correctly uses built-in functionality and capabilities of Python and/or Java.
6. How efficient the code is (space and time).

Respond to this post if you have questions about the requirements.

After completing the test respond with information about yourself and/or a resume and send the complete test program you wrote.

S2F3 
accept reply: true
L,3

gets to the next line

jobs.title: QA Automation Engineer
jobs.content:
A strong QA is like a hunter, looking for ways to stress and test a system. By using your unique perspective as QA Engineer you break the code to forge a better product. 

__As [QA Automation Engineer](https://moduscreate.applytojob.com/apply/53RHCF/Qa-Automation-Engineer?source=wfh.io) You Will__

* Define test plans and processes for new products
* Perform manual testing as necessary
* Create automated tests
* Participate in daily stand ups.

__For this role, You Must Have__

* Experience testing mobile apps 
* Familiarity with automation tools that use Selenium-Webdriver
â* Current experience programming with JavaScript
* Have experience with CI tools such as Jenkins and CircleCi
* Clear written communication skills in order to document concise bug reports and test cases
* Experience testing in a SCRUM environment
* A good understanding of cross browser testing, typical vulnerabilities
* Prior automation experience - both good and bad!

__Not required, but priority will be given to candidates who__

* Have experience with Siesta 
* Have MySQL experience
* Have prior experience setting up and installing VMs
* Have experience using command line
* Have an understanding of how app development works and how an app is constructed

__[Apply to be our newest QA Automation Engineer!](https://moduscreate.applytojob.com/apply/53RHCF/Qa-Automation-Engineer?source=wfh.io) Discover what is possible at [Modus Create](http://www.moduscreate.com) - named one of the fastest growing companies in the United States. [Modus Create](http://www.moduscreate.com) is a global, tight-knit, dedicated team of engineers and designers doing lots of fun things in the Mobile application space. Please explore our work, <http://www.ModusCreate.com>. Be part of the best remote team in the industry.__

jobs.title: Lead .NET Developer
jobs.content:
Calling all .NET Developers! Chamberlain Group is seeking a dedicated worker to supervise the workflow process, maintenance, and development of existing .NET web apps as well as the development of new software.


The Lead .NET Application Developer is responsible for developing and maintaining Chamberlains MyQ IoT middleware system. MyQ is a cutting edge distributed enterprise solution that scales up to connect millions of devices with millions of users. MyQ partners with class leading technology partners (Apple, Google, Samsung etc.) to provide integrated solutions to customers. The lead position will be responsible for the middleware technology, help define the software and system architecture, interface with other departments and lead a team of highly skilled consultants and employees.


MyQ is the brand name of Chamberlain’s connectivity solution and is an “Internet of Things” application, which allows everyday consumers to interact with Chamberlain’s products from mobile phones and web capable devices over the Internet.


The Lead .Net Developer will work directly with other developers, product architects and leads (such as engineering, marketing, etc.) to translate requirements and the business product roadmap into code and a successful solution. Based in C# and .NET, the back-end comprises a Middleware, REST based Web Service APIs, Couchbase and Microsoft SQL Database repositories, MessageSight and RabbitMQ message brokers.

jobs.title: Senior Full-stack Developer
jobs.content:
Entre Computer Services has several openings for a Senior Full Stack Developer.  Entre provides a fast-paced team-oriented environment. We follow the Agile methodology and use JIRA for issue tracking and Git for source control.  We develop using modern Continuous Integration and Deployment practices.  We take on a large variety of work including web applications, web sites and mobile/desktop apps. We also have a ping pong table which can be a great way to get the creative juices flowing when working on a challenging programming problem!


The ideal candidate is detailed oriented and is as comfortable on the front end as they are the on back end.  They thrive in a team environment and have experience building single-page applications and multi-page web applications.  They should be able to look at a design and turn into HTML and CSS and profile SQL queries.

jobs.title: Sr Quality Assurance
jobs.content:
Do you have more to offer than the average QA engineer? Can you learn quickly, think critically and pivot twice before breakfast? Do your hobbies include criticizing the user experience in any new application that you use? Do you have an interest in cyber security? Have you ever wanted to work with cutting-edge cloud & web technologies from the comfort of your own home?


Swimlane is looking for an exceptional senior QA engineer to design and execute test plans, develop automated test and monitoring systems, assist in duplication and analysis of customer technical issues, and work closely with product designers and developers to maximize product quality, performance, and reliability.

jobs.title: Application Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Are you looking for an exciting opportunity working hands on with the latest technologies providing broadband connectivity for airborne and mobile platforms?


This is your chance to make a difference with technology and support a variety of commercial and DoD initiatives throughout the world. We are looking for an application software engineer with a passion for Java development and ability to quickly learn a large and complex system that is being installed worldwide. You will work independently, but also have the guidance of more experienced systems and software engineering team members, to design, implement and test additional functionality to our existing complex software system.


The Java developer will be working on the complete software lifecycle with Global Mobile Broadband team. The Java developer will require collaboration with other team member within ViaSat.

jobs.title: .NET Developer in Food Service Tech
jobs.content:
NEXTEP SYSTEMS is looking for an experienced developer to join our fast growing team, headquartered in Troy, MI.   The experienced developer will responsible for the ongoing development of our foodservice technology product suite.   


Responsibilities



  • Development and testing of Client/Server communication software

  • Development of Web Services and User Interfaces for self order kiosks, POS system, mobile ordering, etc

  • Writing requirement and design specifications

  • Writing interfaces to third-party systems, typically SOAP/XML

  • Writing Software to integrate with different user interface themes

  • Unit and integration testing 

  • Participation in design and architecture meetings

  • Propose technical and design improvements

  • Demonstrate adaptability and forward thinking in the face of technological or organizational change

  • Initiate and drive projects to improve customer experience, efficiency, and sensible cost avoidance

  • Other responsibilities as required

jobs.title: Execution Developer
jobs.content:
We're seeking highly driven, production-oriented developers who possess strong technical skills and the ability to work in a fast-paced collaborative environment. 


Primary Responsibilities



  • Develop and support multi-threaded applications with a strong emphasis on high performance.

  • Optimize our multi-faceted low latency global trade execution platform using network and systems programming.

  • Create tools to process, store and analyze quote and order data.

  • Work closely with our quantitative research analysts, engineers and other groups to provide software solutions.


Requirements



  • A minimum of three years professional-level C++ programming experience in a Linux environment.

  • A Computer Science or Mathematics degree.

  • Outstanding problem solving skills.

  • Knowledge of shell scripts and other languages including Java, Python or Perl is a plus.

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer, Test
jobs.content:
Summary


As our Senior Software Engineer in Test you will be influential in helping to set the vision on where to take our Automation Framework. You will work within our Innovation team focused on Research and Development and immediately contribute to critical and challenging problems within the QA/Engineering environment. We’re looking for a proactive SSET who has passion and desire to work with a highly collaborative, start-up mentality focused team.


Role and Responsibilities:



  • The candidate must have proven experience as a senior engineer with project leadership experience

  • Must be able to lead a small automation team to ensure automation project work is designed, developed, reviewed, tested and delivered on time

  • Be a leader in all phases of the Agile software development lifecycle while working with cross-functional team members - Development Leads, Architects, Quality Assurance, DBAs, Product - in a highly collaborative development environment

  • Evangelize newly developed best practices, quality assurance techniques, and automation frameworks with other teams within the organization

  • Responsible for designing and developing re-usable architectures and frameworks for use in black-box test automation

  • Responsible for resolving issues that arise within the automation frameworks

  • Responsible for planning and automating functional and system level tests across diverse platforms using industry standard technologies

  • Responsible for building efficiency and ensuring daily automation runs occur as scheduled

  • Must be able to create automation tests using test plans and cases as requirements

  • Must be able to test open-source solutions (Java-based) running on a Cloud-based infrastructure

  • Continually build the technical skills of colleagues through peer collaboration, mentoring and training


Experience - Qualifications - and Education:



  • Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or related field of study



  • Requires at least 7 years of combined Development & Quality Assurance experience in an Enterprise environment

  • Requires experience automating test cases using Selenium

  • Requires experience querying data in relational databases; greatly beneficial to have experience with Big Data in Hadoop or MongoDB

  • Requires experience with RESTful web services that meet industry standard maturity models



  • Requires in-depth knowledge of software development lifecycles and their utilization in software projects

  • Requires solid communication and interpersonal skills; with the ability to work constructively in a collaborative Agile team environment

  • Familiarity with Object Oriented Programming techniques and methodologies in Java

  • Greatly beneficial to have previous experience in the healthcare industry

  • Greatly beneficial to have hands-on experience in the Cloud; specifically AWS

  • Greatly beneficial to have hands-on experience with Open-Source projects

jobs.title: Full Stack Software Engineer
jobs.content:
• Responsible for designing and developing the presentation and data layer based on open-source technologies and techniques

  • The candidate will participate in all phases of the Agile software development lifecycle while working with cross-functional team members - Development Leads, Architects, Quality Engineers and DBAs - in a highly collaborative development environment

  • Responsible for implementation of the middleware tier using Java frameworks

  • Responsible for implementation of RESTful web-services in a Service-Oriented Architecture

  • Responsible for implementation of the data access layer that interfaces with relational and NoSQL data stores 

  • Responsible for unit and performance testing software under load to ensure reliability and scalability

  • Adhere to industry best practices for software development

  • Lead the way by developing company standards for software development

  • Continually build the skills of colleagues through peer collaboration and training






Experience - Qualifications - and Education:






  • Minimum of a Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or equivalent job related experience

  • Requires at least 3 years development experience in an Enterprise development environment

  • Requires mastery of Object Oriented Programming techniques and methodologies in Java; greatly beneficial to have experience in C#

  • Requires knowledge of web MVC frameworks; greatly beneficial to have experience in Spring Frameworks

  • Requires knowledge of schema design and data access methodologies in both relational databases and NoSQL databases; greatly beneficial to have experience in Hadoop or MongoDB

  • Requires knowledge of software development lifecycles and their utilization in software projects

  • Requires solid communication and interpersonal skills; with the ability to work constructively in a collaborative team environment

  • Requires strong problem solving ability, analytical, and design skills

  • Greatly beneficial to have experience in Responsive web design

  • Greatly beneficial to have experience in RESTful web services meeting industry standard maturity models

  • Greatly beneficial to have previous experience in the healthcare industry

  • Greatly beneficial to have working experience within an Agile environment

  • Greatly beneficial to have hands-on experience in the Cloud; specifically AWS

  • Greatly beneficial to have hands-on experience with Open-Source projects

jobs.title: Web Software Developer
jobs.content:
The Web Software Developer designs and implements computing systems and associated web applications and services supporting large geospatial data storage, management, processing and retrieval from cloud and internally-hosted infrastructure.


This role requires the ability to administer Microsoft Windows Workstation and Server Environments (AD, SQL Server, IIS) and develop software using ASP .net, C#, GNU/Linux w/bash shell scripting, relational DBMS with geospatial data extensions.


Job Responsibilities



  • Works with internal stakeholders to understand, construct and support developed systems

  • Builds and implements required components of core infrastructure from designs

  • Completes up-front requirements analysis and documentation for all tasks

  • Communicates, documents and shares progress and findings throughout development cycle

  • Maintains and applies working knowledge of current technologies and trends

  • Builds security features into development of all systems

jobs.title: Senior Stellar Web Developer
jobs.content:
ThinkUp Technologies is looking for a LAMP Stack web developer to join our team.


If you are feeling the following, you need to apply now:

  • Do you feel you don't have enough say in the creative process?
  • Are you not having enough fun with your current position?
  • Do you feel your company is stale and not going anywhere?
  • Do you feel you have more to offer than just coding?
  • Are you looking for a better opportunity?

If any of the above, apply now.


ThinkUp Technologies, invents, designs, builds, sells, services, and maintains its own SaaS applications. We are a unique and established company with solid leadership, productive sales staff, and an innovative customer service department. We are five-years old and have a solid and growing customer base. We are not a start up. We have a fantastic strategy and business model. All of our employees agree this is the most fun they've had in their career. And we're just getting started.


Initially you will be assisting the lead developer in day-to-day development of product improvement with a bulk of the workload connecting to various APIs. Eventually, we see this position managing the development department which includes overseeing various projects whether in-house or outsourced.


Our main products we sell are service are:

www.contractorscloud.com

www.paradecloud.com

Many others in the works, but need your help!


Benefits


No benefits at this time but higher salary. This is due to the ever changing landscape of the healthcare industry. Eventual profit sharing for the right candidate based on performance and loyalty to the opportunity.

jobs.title: Frontend Developer
jobs.content:
At Fielmann Ventures, we design the future of the optical industry. As a Frontend Developer, you will be part of a multi-disciplinary team and help us develop components for both innovative customer-facing and internal products. Your focus lies on implementing reusable web components and creating extensible frontend technologies.


The perfect applicant shares our passion for functional design, holistic design thinking and is an expert in web front-end development with a focus on JavaScript and single-page apps.


Responsibilities



  • Implement state-of-the-art reusable web frontend components

  • Educate developers and evangelize new technologies

  • Understand and bridge the gap between typical back-end and front-end challenges

jobs.title: Agile Coach
jobs.company: Newport News Shipbuilding-A Division of Huntington Ingalls Industries
jobs.content:
The IT Division at Newport News Shipbuilding is in the second year of implementing an agile methodology. To continue to grow and mature agile capabilities, we are seeking an experienced agileist who can train and coach new teams, as well as improve the discipline and maturity of the nine existing teams. The candidate should be familiar with one or more agile varieties and had previous work experience as an agile team member. Experience leading agile transformation at a programmatic and team level is preferred.



  • Regarding Enterprise Maturity Advancement – Assist with the advancement of organizational agile maturity through the following:

  • Be responsible for maintaining and making improvements to the current agile process, as well as development and roll-out of new agile techniques (such as KanBan).

  • Spread awareness of the benefits of agile thinking and practices throughout the IT organization and the business;

  • Pursue/grow top down support of the agile transition initiative;

  • Assess, at regular intervals, organizational maturity and utilize the results to build action plans for improvement;

  • Improve maturity awareness by publishing the results of the assessments and action planning throughout the organization;

  • Lead cross-team collaboration efforts, knowledge sharing, and action plan completion;

  • Provide recommendations to leadership on all actions necessary to measure and advance our organizational agile maturity;

  • Regarding Team Coaching – Enable teams to mature their agile practice through consistent and timely coaching on basic and advanced agile principles and concepts.

  • Work with new agile teams intensely for approximately 3 months to ensure good practices and principals are adopted.

  • Continue to provide support to teams on an on-going basis;

  • Regularly attend team ceremonies for each assigned team;

  • Ensure team roles are well understood;

  • Provide additional guidance/recommendations for specific team needs (upon request and based on analysis/observation);

  • Lead, at regular intervals, team maturity assessments and utilize results to build action plans for improvement;

  • Analyze industry best practice and bring awareness to applicable practices within individual teams or through organization level training;

  • Guide best practices and ensure adoption

  • Regarding Training – Conduct new team, advanced, and “agile essential” training courses.

  • Perform technical planning, system integration, verification and validation, cost and risk, and supportability and effectiveness analyses for total systems, including: concept, design, fabrication, test, installation, operation, maintenance and disposal.

  • Ensure the logical and systematic conversion of customer or product requirements into total systems solutions that acknowledge technical, schedule, and cost constraints.

  • Perform functional analysis, timeline analysis, detail trade studies, requirements allocation and interface definition studies to translate customer requirements into hardware and software specifications.

jobs.title: Ruby on Rails Developer
jobs.content:
When they aren’t building our developer sandbox, creating V.2 of LevelUp analytics, working to optimize our payment processing, or designing time-based advertising campaigns for our merchants, our Rails engineers are thinking of innovative and epic ways to make LevelUp even better.


Curious about current projects?


Here are some of the challenges that drive development for the Platform team:


- How can we empower businesses to excite and reward their customers in new ways?


- What interesting things can we do with SKU-level data when a user places an order?


- Why should businesses keep using LevelUp or run more campaigns? How can we help them reach those conclusions more easily?


- Who might want to build on top of our platform and how can we make sure our API supports their needs?


- When will our system reach its breaking point? What must be done now to push back that date?

jobs.title: iOS Developer
jobs.content:
LevelUp is looking for an iOS Developer who is self-directed and passionate about innovation and mobile technologies.


You'll be a part of a small, elite team developing iOS consumer-facing apps for our multimillion dollar partners that will run on millions of devices and handle billions of transactions.

jobs.title: Android Developer
jobs.content: Our team is looking for an Android Engineer who is self-directed and passionate about innovation and mobile technologies. This position will develop consumer facing apps for our multimillion dollar partners that will run on millions of devices and handle billions of transactions. Ideally, you've built a native Android app in the past, enjoy working with talented folks and love a good technical challenge

jobs.title: Software Engineer - Fullstack
jobs.content:
Axcient is looking for a full stack Front-end Developer/Architect who will optimize, advance and maintain the code that serves Axcient’s rapidly growing customer base. We are building our next generation Disaster Recovery as a Service cloud platform, which is sweeping industry awards for its innovative approach to eliminating business downtime and data loss. Our ideal candidate is someone who thrives off of form, function, and creating an intuitive and cutting-edge user experience.


Some of what you’ll be doing:



  • Provide technical leadership for the development and support of Axcient’s Service.

  • Architect full end-to-end features, from UI to backend.

  • Create APIs to be consumed/used by internal and external customers.

  • Write unit tests that support your development.

  • Generate a tight, efficient, high quality code base.

jobs.title: Automated Test Engineer
jobs.content:
iXara is looking for a software tester to help construct, expand and maintain a suite of automatic tests for our new cloud-based products. The position will also include work on automatic tests for Xara’s Designer product range and some manual testing, particularly using mobile devices. 



  • The position is suitable for someone who is keen to become an expert in the field of automated testing of web based products.

  • Collaborate closely with the development team to develop test strategies and help to isolate and reproduce bugs.

  • Innovate to find ways to effectively automate tests that would otherwise have to be executed manually.

  • Monitor and maintain the regression test suite in a continuous integration environment, alerting the development team to problems found with the software.

  • Continually improve the test suit in terms of adding tests to increase test coverage, improving the robustness of existing automatic tests and increasing test execution speed, again in collaboration with the product developers.

  • Keep up to date with the latest test automation technologies for web and mobile testing.


This is a permanent position, based in iXara's country mansion HQ in Hemel Hempstead. 


Competitive salary dependent on experience, plus benefits including company pension contributions & private medical insurance.

jobs.title: Senior/Lead UX/UI designer with impact...
jobs.company: Senior Lead Ux Ui Impact Compucorp
jobs.content:
About

We like to build stuff… sometimes complicated stuff… for Non Profits, Charities and Art Galleries. We’ve been growing fast over the past few years and so we’re on the lookout for a confident and ambitious Senior/Lead UX/UI designer to join our distributed team in a unique position to help us work on the improved user design for a product that is used by tens of thousands of non profit organsiations wordwide.

About CiviCRM and CiviHR

CiviCRM is an open source CRM application that is used by tens of thousands of organisations worldwide.

Compucorp are being funded by a charitable foundation in the UK to develop CiviHR. CiviHR is an HR system for non profit organisations based on the open source CRM system "CiviCRM" and "Drupal" an open source CMS framework.

More details on CiviCRM and CiviHR can be found here:

https://civicrm.org/

https://civihr.org/

As part of the development of CiviHR one workstream is dedicated to redeveloping the user interface for CiviCRM (and therefore CiviHR!). Work has started and the designs so far can be seen here:

https://invis.io/MU4RTI1S5 - toolkit

https://invis.io/KD4KSB2H7

The role:

We have a unique opportunity for a Lead UI / UX designer to join the team and really help us take the UX design of CiviCRM and CiviHR to the next level. We want to make these applications into beautiful and immediately familiar applications that people love to use.

The new Lead designer will set overall direction on these projects to our mid level designers who are working on this and other projects, and also help us to develop a clear design and approval process.

The ideal candidate will be comfortable designing in a browser (HTML/CSS) (as most user interface challenges relate to fluid design) as well as in Photoshop/Sketch, will have existing experience developing UI for complex applications and giving direction to more junior members of a team.

Key skills we are looking for are:

  • Strong HTML/CSS skills and ability to prototype quickly
  • Strong knowledge of UX component libraries
  • Expert experience with fluid design principles and best practices
  • Comfortable with Photoshop and/or Sketch
  • Demonstrable experience creating user interface toolkits for web applications
  • Comfortable working with and leading a team of other designers

We anticipate this being a part time role for a number of hours per week, but may ramp up or down depending on the impact that the person is able to have on the project and other projects in the team.

A bit about us:

We do things a little differently, basing all our solutions on open source products, having flexible working hours and real team mentality. Our work covers web design, app development and branding for Charities and non-profit organisations across the country. Our clients include Charities such as Wikimedia and Farm Africa, galleries such as the Photographers Gallery and Craft Central but also companies, trade associations and government bodies. We're a distributed team with our head office in London. What were looking for is someone who can grasp concepts quickly, has great attention to detail, and most importantly loves a tech challenge. In short, we’re a team of self confessed geeks who love tinkering and tweaking until something is just right, and we’re looking for someone with a similar attitude to join our growing team.

jobs.title: Cloud Engineering - Global Rockstars!
jobs.content:
Job description


ING Bank Infra is looking for Cloud Engineers. Global top developers (“Rockstars”) who want to pioneer the frontiers of Cloud infrastructure services. 

Purpose
ING Bank Infra’s purpose is to accelerate the possible.
We are a greenfield, lean and agile global organization providing consumer-centered infrastructure services enabling ING to ensure its customers stay ahead in life and business. At Bank Infra, we are a purpose-driven organization driven to accelerate the possible in all areas of our work. We have a passion for growth and always look for opportunities to innovate. We are truly in service to our internal business consumers and have a strong focus on maintaining meaningful relationships with them to align what we do to their needs, and to actively learn from them.

We are looking for professionals who want to pioneer the frontiers of IT infrastructure services.

We want to put together an elite team of engineering rockstars, who are experimenters and shapers and whose motto is to lead by example. You have a "makers" mind-set where you believe that prototypes are there to "fall forward" and learn fast.

Job Description: 
Main responsibilities and tasks for a Top Cloud Engineer:
Work with private cloud & public cloud platforms to create new and innovative application services that enable application engineers across ING to accelerate the possible.
Work within an agile & devop environment to deliver high quality services. Take leading roles with agile teams
Explore and define the cloud brokerage space for ING through powerful portable services and intelligent policy
Take ownership top to bottom of challenging deliveries that span operational always on concerns to deeply specific application demands of our users.
Own contribution of services to the global ING cloud service catalogue
Have positive and lasting cultural impact in our way of working – be an ambassador for agile delivery, have a strong sense of ‘right’ when it comes to technical implementation
 


Your work environment
As a Cloud Engineer your role in this organization is crucial as we enable a global catalogue of services from the ING Private Cloud and future Public Cloud platforms. You will have a hand in shaping how we form as a team and define our ways of working as an engineering team. You will seed agile devop teams with influence over tool-chains, working methods, system design and technologies. You will be a cultural ambassador for ‘web speed’ delivery within the engineering team and be passionate about ‘doing things the right way’ for cloud delivery, cloud consumption and cloud service engineering.

ING cloud engineering holds the following technical principles paramount:
1. Evolvable platforms – transparent to consumers
2. Failure oriented – expect it, all of the time
3. Primitives not frameworks – enable innovation not presume it
4. Automation, always – SDx with best people on tools
5. APIs forever – they will outlive the service implementation
6. Data everywhere, enable decisions – information centric delivery
7. Security inside – not just around

Who are we looking for?
You are an experienced Software Engineer & Cloud Native who is an up-start professional who is capable of working in a global environment, who is flexible, pro-active and a team player.
You are a loyal, driven individual with great English and Dutch communication skills and love to work across countries. You are able to work autonomously and in collaboration with your colleagues and be across multiple activities at the same time, set priorities and integrate tasks effectively.
You care about people and their wellbeing and creating strong and long-lasting relationships with people and your team. You proactively support others and enable them to be their best. You think creatively about how to solve problems and address challenges and have a high attention to detail.

Working and thinking level:
Academic working and thinking level;
Proven agile experience, strong track record of service (SaaS/Cloud) software delivery and operations
Global orientation;
Fluently in English and Dutch (verbal and written);
Deep exposure to cloud platform such as AWS, Azure, Openstack & VMWare;
Fluent in API delivery, microservices, highly available architectures & foundational services such big data platforms & cloud middleware services
Willing to travel occasionally to be part of delivery teams based in other ING countries
 


Competencies/levels:
Makes complex analysis;
Uses direct influence;
understands the political relationships within the company
Leads engineers by example;
Uses knowledge of the state of the art of technology to formulate the right approach
Addresses potential customer (consumer) requirements in proactive engagement
Thinking in strategic (future oriented) terms – understands the cloud brokerage vision
Resistance to stress – knows where energies should be expended for maximum return
Team player; Cultural influencer
 


The cloud engineer should demonstrate: 
A Customer obsession
A bias for action
Being vocally self-critical
Ability to think big & have a vision
Invent & simplify where complexity exists
Dive deep when needed
Have an opinion, but commit fully as a team
Insist on high standards
 


What do we offer? 
a very good salary
Excellent other terms
Work/Life balance #2 rated at Glassdoor
For 36 hours a week
Based in Amsterdam with travel globally
a part of one of the most impressive fintech cloud development journeys
Very strong technical colleagues & managers
Rockstar IT culture. Global Cloud awareness.
 


Interested? 
Apply directly online or contact Global IT Recruiter Rob van Elburg via rob.van.elburg@ing.nl. For more information about ING check: http://www.ing.nl/.

jobs.title: Senior UX Designer
Talented UI/UX Designer Needed
jobs.content:
PLEASE! No agencies or recruiters. Only individuals should apply.

FireDaemon Technologies Limited develops software for Microsoft Windows. We deliver traditional rich Windows applications as well as web based ones. We are wanting to engage with a talented UI/UX designer to help us spruce up existing product and design new product.

Deliverables will be​ usability centred design,​ layouts, ​styles, ​flow and prototypes in the form of wire frame through to fully interactive UI mockups based on product requirements using the tools of your choice. What you deliver will become ​a ​living breathing product. You will be working with the following technologies:

  • MFC and BGSoft common controls
  • jQuery UI
  • Qt GUI and QML
  • UWP

Additionally, if you know​ the following you can help us in our development efforts!

  • Visual Studio 2015
  • C++
  • Git
  • Continua
  • FinalBuilder

You will be reporting to the Software Engineering Director. The engagement will be on a per project basis at an agreed hourly rate. Other requirements are perfect written and spoken English​, we will need to see previous examples of your work and that you are comfortable working remotely with a virtual team spread around the globe.

jobs.title: Back End developer - Big Data
jobs.content:
Twitter counter is a savvy and mature SaaS business and a young, hungry startup - all in one.


As the first developer to create the backend heart of our new product line, you will be the forerunner of the startup that is Twitter Counter. Your job will be to define, architect, set up and deliver the big-data-centric core of our next products.


Our next generation products will deliver smarter social media insights and recommendations to our many users and customers, integrating data from several social media platforms and then analizing and processing that data.


The system you will build will be responsible for logging and processing huge amounts of  data in order to supply users with timely insights and recommendations which will lead them to greater social media success.


To deliver this we will be relying increasingly on the use of data science and ML.


The goal is for the next generation platform to eventually take over from the existing one as the leading heart of our business.


This will put you in a unique position as the trailblazer for our future success.


Eager to build great products? Can you deliver from business idea to working product and into maturity? Are you passionate about Technology and work doing what you love doing anyway? Most importantly - are you here to work hard in a fast-paced environment and to win in the global market? Read on...


What we offer



  • An amazing opportunity to join us in this accelerated growth period as one of the core members.

  • Having a significant impact on what we do and how we do it. Your opinion and abilities would not only matter, they will determine how successful we’ll be!

  • You'll have the best consultants and technical mentors to be found in this space.

  • A small, international and FUN team. To us, it’s more than just a work place… it’s a passion and a mission.

  • You would be able to occasionally work remotely or at flexible hours.

jobs.title: Associate Director, Branded Content
jobs.content:
W - Associate Director, Branded Content
Overview/Purpose:

W Magazine is completely blowing up its digital strategy.
Why work at W?
W is an escape from the ordinary, a place where outsized dreams and unprecedented access inspire, surprise and delight. Unbound by convention, W is an industry leader creating groundbreaking and award-winning stories about Fashion, Film and Art.

  • W is one of the most innovative and creative storytellers in the world
  • Unconventional in everything we do – from our work style to our content philosophies
  • We maintain a structure where the best ideas win instead of seniority
  • Join the world-class organization of Conde Nast and contribute to the development of the future of the media industry

Storytelling is the currency of our brand, at every facet and across every discipline. As such, the Branded Content role is designed to be both an editorial and marketing position. Integration between teams is essential for W’s mission and none more so than in the realm of branded content. As the demand for our unique vision and voice has increased, we have found the need for a position that is able to think creatively and critically during both our ideations and negotiations. Maintaining a presence on both sides means that organization and focus are perhaps the most important qualities. Additionally, understanding the creative process and knowing how to facilitate creative ideation are paramount to success in this position. The role reports into both the Director, Digital Content and the Executive Director, Marketing and Creative Services so that there is coverage and communication across the teams. Through this dual-reporting structure there is access to all manner of editorial support and sales/marketing power to insure that our branded stories meet the criteria of excellence for which W is known.

  • Self-starter with experience developing new processes
  • Capable of a fast-paced and high-energy environment
  • Strong interpersonal communication skills
  • Proven record of creative development and ideation
  • Aware of the ever-changing nuances of the branded content space
  • Experience pitching and closing branded partnership deals
  • Minimum 3 years experience working in this role or similar
  • The role reports to both the Executive Digital Director and Associate Publisher – Marketing

About Condé Nast

Condé Nast is a premier media company renowned for producing the highest quality content for the world's most influential audiences. Attracting 126 million consumers across its industry-leading print, digital and video brands, the company’s portfolio includes some of the most iconic titles in media: Vogue, Vanity Fair, Glamour, Brides, Self, GQ, The New Yorker, Condé Nast Traveler, Details, Allure, Architectural Digest, Bon Appétit, Epicurious, Wired, W, Golf Digest, Golf World, Teen Vogue, Ars Technica, The Scene and Pitchfork. The company’s newest division, Condé Nast Entertainment, was launched in 2011 to develop film, television and premium digital video programming.

Over the past twenty years, Condé Nast has reached record profits, tripling its topline growth and exponentially expanding its content distribution. During the same period, the company earned more editorial, design, digital, advertising, video and business awards than any competitor in the industry. In 2014, the corporation was recognized as one of the fastest-growing companies in the digital video business and was one of LinkedIn’s Top 25 Most In-Demand Employers. The company has recently relocated to its new global headquarters at 1 World Trade Center, where it plays a leading role in the resurgence of Lower Manhattan.

For more information, please visit condenast.com and follow @CondeNast on Twitter.

Condé Nast is an equal opportunity workplace.
Duties and responsibilities may be adjusted based on years of experience.
Salary is also commensurate with experience.
