jobs.title: Software Engineer
jobs.content:
As a Software Engineer you’ll be responsible for developing new services for M3's physician and patient users, including projects such as:
- Full system renewal of m3.com Career, Japan's #1 job search site for physicians
- Electronic health record (EHR) development
- Developing authentication and other APIs to enable use of M3's services by 3rd party developers
- Renewal of our largest consumer-oriented service, AskDoctors
We are traditionally a Java shop, but we are proactive about incorporating new technologies into our development process - our main service offering for Japanese physicians is implemented using a microservice architecture and Play 2 / Scala, and we have teams that develop services with the newest Rails / Ruby also. Our business communication is mostly in Japanese, but we are always looking for talented foreigner/expat developers, to increase the international flavor of our Japanese team.


If you’re based in Tokyo already, we’d love to have talk to you over lunch any day, any time. If you’re not based in Japan yet but you’re an outstanding developer with visible accomplishments (i.e. contributions to open source projects, projects on GitHub, etc.), that’s OK too! If you’re the right person, we can help relocate you here, or remote work may also be a possibility.

jobs.title: Senior Developer - ERP Systems
jobs.content:
The hiring of a Enterprise Resources Planning Software Engineer is a new position within our growing team.


As a Enterprise Resources Planning Software Engineer, you will be a part of the team responsible for providing and optimizing IT resources to improve operational efficiency within the company. You will constantly be involved in new and existing projects whose objectives are to facilitate growing business requirements and customer satisfaction.


Responsibilities


- Participate in full Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) for our technology solutions


- Optimize and re-architecture existing solutions for scalability and extensibility.


- Strong experience in designing web services with optimal security and performance.


- Assist in designing and building data channels between enterprise systems.


- Collaborate with cross-functional teams to assess impact of decisions in each of the functional areas and facilitate proposal of recommendations.


- Add value to a team that practices Test Driven Development, Continuous Integration pipeline, Agile development framework, manual and automated peer reviews.


- Influence and enhance our development culture.


- Prior experience working with SAP is a plus.

jobs.title: Software Developer - React, Elixir
jobs.content:
Curadora is on a mission to create new, innovative tools for people to plan for an event - from music festivals to sporting events and more, and we’re in need of the smartest developers that Philadelphia has to offer. If you’re a seasoned developer that wants to see code go live in days rather than months while overseeing all technical aspects of a cutting edge product, then we’re looking for you.


Your new day-to-day


You’ll have the opportunity to contribute from design, to code, to test, to deployment. That includes working collaboratively with like-minded teammates to plan development cycles, break down feature requests into a series of tasks, and remove blocks. You’ll be integrating with multiple third parties to build a robust and scalable web application for consumers. As a senior developer, you’ll play a critical role in the direction of our product by prioritizing needs, analyzing usage data and researching new technologies. You’ll need to face complex problems and turn them into sophisticated solutions.


Technology you will work with



  • Elixir with Phoenix (the main "engine")

  • React with Redux

  • Ruby on Rails (really only one part of the engine)

  • SQL databases

  • Node.JS (sunsetting this in favor of Elixir)

  • CSS

  • Redis and Elasticsearch


Experience with all of these technologies is not a must, but a willingness to learn is.

jobs.title: Senior Front End Developer
jobs.content: Rubicon Project is looking for talented, passionate, experienced, and entrepreneurial engineers in high performance Web based front-end applications. You will responsible for Architecting, Building, Testing scalable, high performance Web Applications and Web services. You’ll be working within a small but rapidly growing team to build the next generation advertising automation platform. As we grow, leadership opportunities will become available so there are opportunities for career growth.

jobs.title: Senior Systems Engineer
jobs.content:
The mission of the Technical Operations team is to build and operate data centers containing thousands of servers across several continents. We are responsible for the building and maintenance of data centers, inventory management, monitoring services development, platform integration and management, capacity planning, global traffic management, release management, application and development support, network support and troubleshooting.


A member of the DevOps team must be able to ask the right questions, understand the business and technical requirements of internal and external clients, and then translate those needs into actionable items for execution in conjunction with other cross-functional team members. Members of the DevOps team are embedded with the application development teams they support, working directly with them using scrum methodologies. The goal is to support the needs of the customer, while ensuring the standards and best practices of the TechOps group are used and enforced. We are geared to support stability, scalability and outstanding service across the entire organization.


Systems Engineers support our global high performance infrastructure in a DevOps environment. Our requirement for low latency networking requires understanding and passion for high performance computing. You will be part of a team that supports real time, high volume complex advertising and bidding network, jobs running on a large Hadoop data warehouse and a host of other technical problems waiting to be solved.

Responsibilities:



  • Ensure the operational integrity of the global infrastructure

  • Build and expand infrastructure capacity at remote Data Centers

  • Perform deployments and maintenance to implement code, architecture and configurations changes

  • Provide support and diagnose issues to other teams related to our infrastructure

  • Participate in 24/7 on-call rotation

  • Develop and maintain new health checks for system and application-level monitoring

jobs.title: Software Engineer
jobs.content: HeadSpin develops a software platform that runs on AWS and hardware distributed around the world. The platform manages access to real cell networks through a unique container system. The platform has building blocks of reliable communication, real-time events, and data analysis.

jobs.title: Mobile Engineer
jobs.content:
Mobile software is completely integrated into the HeadSpin infrastructure. On one end, HeadSpin provides apps to configure access to remote cell networks. On the other end, HeadSpin apps run on every device in the HeadSpin infrastructure to provide monitoring and partner management interfaces.


A mobile engineer at HeadSpin builds these apps. Mobile engineers at HeadSpin are also involved in connecting mobile devices (Android, iOS) to Linux servers via USB, and writing Python wrappers.

jobs.title: Software Architect, SaaS
jobs.content:
Software Architect, SaaS

Who We Are:

CareerBuilder is the global leader in human capital solutions as we help people target and attract their most important asset - their people. From candidate sourcing solutions, to comprehensive workforce data, to software that streamlines your recruiting process, our focus is always about making your recruitment strategy simple, fast and effective.

As we continue rapid growth of our global HR Software as a Service operation that is fueled by cutting edge technology, we provide a technical environment that encourages:
  • Scrum and truly Lean/Agile Software development principles
  • Coding philosophies that align with SOLID principles and Clean Code embodies our culture
  • Working in a highly collaborative merit-based environment where everyone is encouraged to share their ideas
  • Bringing your code to life using your choice of a MacBook Pro, Air, or a Windows laptop if you prefer


Job Summary:

As a SaaS Architect at CareerBuilder, you'll have the opportunity to build something extraordinary and work with awesome people. We are seeking a SaaS Architect to guide our development efforts for our TalentStream Technologies team. As a member of the TalentStream Technologies team, you will have the opportunity to modernize a legacy system and scale it. This team works in a multi-language and creative environment including technologies such as: .NET, Go, Node.js, PHP and much more. We also experiment with new technologies to find the perfect solution for the task at hand.



What we need from you:
  • A passion for technology and bringing your visions to reality through code and leveraging state of the art technologies
  • Take ownership of goals, issues and challenges and deliver solutions that will achieve results
  • Active participant and contributor to a culture of learning, collaboration and innovation
  • A minimum of 2 years in an Architect role
  • Experience with building and scaling platforms
  • Experience with 3rd party API integration(outlook, google)
  • Experience working on a SAAS product and/or other paid service site.
  • Experience with a wide variety of technologies, coding tools, and techniques such as Go, .NET/C#, PHP, Go & Node.js (you do not have to have all of these)
  • Publications in academic and industry conferences (preferred but not required)
  • BS in Computer Science or related field (preferred but not required)


What you will receive:

When you're focused on the goal, not the path - you can be more flexible, and that translates into more productive and satisfied employees. From flexible hours to volunteering during work hours to diverse education opportunities, CareerBuilder.com is committed to helping employees strike a balance.
  • Training that positions you to continuously grow with ongoing learning and development courses; we never stop investing in our people.
  • Summer Hours! Enjoy 1/2 day paid Fridays during Summer Hours
  • Quarterly 24 hour Hackathons and bi-weekly personal development time to learn new skills
  • Paid volunteer time and coordinated opportunities to give back to the community
  • Bagel Fridays!
  • Casual Dress Code and laid back environment; don't worry about buying new suits and dry cleaning bills!
  • Comprehensive Medical, Dental & Vision Programs
  • Education Reimbursement Program allowing up to $5k per year towards completion of a Bachelor's and non-MBA graduate degree, and up to $10K per year towards completion of an MBA! No strings attached!
  • $400 Annual Reimbursement for Wellness Activities, including your gym membership!
  • 401(k) Program with Strong Employer Match and 2 year vesting schedule!

jobs.title: System Engineer
jobs.content:
HeadSpin deploys and manages custom enclosures to a global partner network. Inside the enclosure is a Linux server and Linux router that runs part of the HeadSpin platform. The enclosure connects to our platform in AWS and may be connected site-to-site with other enclosures.


A system engineer at HeadSpin is involved in all parts of the enclosure - deployment, security audits, debugging, router configuration, automation, Linux administration, and extending the HeadSpin software. A system engineer may also need to test new hardware configurations to improve stability, to upgrade components, to meet regional needs, or based on partner feedback.

jobs.title: Lead Front end Developer
jobs.content:
90 Seconds is the world’s leading cloud video production platform, allowing brands to purchase, plan, shoot, edit and review video anywhere in the world, online and on mobile. Having just completed our Series A capital raise with Sequoia as the lead investor, we are planning for the growth and expansion of 90 Seconds globally.

90 Seconds is seeking a Senior Front end Developer to join our team and be a foundational member of 90 Seconds next big iteration. We are now building the "Next Generation" of 90 Seconds' products and require someone with experience building up products from scratch, up to date with the latest technologies and with the ability to work independently or lead a high-performing engineering team.

90 Seconds development roadmap is diverse as it is comprehensive and coming onboard now will allow you to grow and control your front-end development career. As part of the team you will be responsible for delivering an amazing experience to both our brands and our creator community. We are looking for people who are passionate about creating cutting edge, performance applications using current technology.

This is your opportunity to be a be part of a hyper growth tech start up and be a pioneer in building a next generation product that will disrupt the video production industry.

jobs.title: Technical Support Representative
jobs.content:
HackerOne is looking for a tier 1 technical support representative to triage all support tickets and to help resolve tier 1 issues from our customers and hackers.  


The role requires that you serve as the primary interface for our platform and provide stellar support and an unforgettable customer and hacker experience for our users.


About HackerOne


HackerOne connects companies and the hacker community to build a safer Internet. HackerOne powers the leading vulnerability coordination platform, tapping into the power of the hacker community to reveal live vulnerabilities that require a company’s immediate attention. Vulnerabilities surfaced by hackers help protect a company’s brand and its user’s information and data. With over 500 companies and more than 2,000 contributing hackers, HackerOne has the world’s largest platform and community of its kind.


As a company, we believe in transparency, trust, collaboration and community. We work together to make our customers successful, and act with a sense of urgency in our work. We believe in the positive power of hackers.


The ideal candidate will be a self-starter, a problem solver, a great communicator, and detail oriented.


To apply, please send your resume to the email careers@hackerone.com and tell us about a time you’ve received outstanding customer service.

jobs.title: Lead Software Engineer - Manager, Software Development
jobs.content:
Aurico

Lead Software Engineer - Manager, Software Development

Job Description

Software engineering professionals, are you looking for a rewarding career opportunity working with an industry-leading organization? Join us at Aurico! This is an exciting time for us, as we have joined the CareerBuilder family. We are one of the leading background screening, drug testing, and occupational health service companies in the world - rapidly pursuing our goal of creating a user-focused screening platform that is simple, dynamic, and easy to use. Quite simply, we dig deeper than many of our competitors. By providing accurate and in-depth information in our reports, we help our customers retain the "A" players and lead them to a higher performing organization.

Due to our continued growth, we are seeking a Lead Software Engineer or Software Engineering Manager to join our team. In this position, you will play a key leadership role serving as a subject matter expert developing and testing new applications for our next generation background screening platform. We are passionate about creating quality software through the practice of user-input design, automated and manual tests, and clean code principles. If you are interested in joining an innovative company that will both reward and challenge your expertise, then Aurico may be the perfect fit for you. Contact us today!

Job Responsibilities

As a leader over our Software Engineering team, you will be responsible for overseeing and supporting the complete life-cycle development of new features for our WebACE platform, from requirement gathering and deployment, to ultimately deliver a product that will produce business value along the way. This will involve influencing the prioritization of product backlogs, mentoring junior engineers, and being an active contributor to the code base.

Additional responsibilities for this research operations coach role include, but are not limited to:
  • Leading the development of new features, bug fixes and system integrations, as well as providing architectural and systems-design expertise to the solution.
  • Following established coding standards and practices
  • Applying your subject matter expertise to a variety of web development tools and technologies, such as .NET, JavaScript frameworks, HTML, CSS, Responsive Design, relational and non-relational databases, or other related technologies within modern web application frameworks
  • Working with the Product Owner in scoping and prioritizing product backlog items
  • Providing support to your Agile Project Manager to optimize process, planning, and execution for the team




Job Requirements

We are looking for a passionate Lead Software Engineer who combines exceptional leadership and coaching abilities, with a demonstrated knowledge of Software Engineering principles and Object Oriented concepts. You should also be highly organized and detail-oriented, with the ability to convey highly technical information to internal staff as well as external clients. It is also important that you display verbal and written communication, interpersonal and presentation skills, with the ability to work well both independently or as part of a team within a fast-paced deadline-driven environment.

Specific qualifications for this senior IT engineering role include:
  • Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or equivalent technical education
  • Minimum 5+ years of professional software development experience
  • Extensive experience with object-oriented programming with C# or .Net
  • Experience mentoring and leading engineers towards software solutions
  • Experience with automated testing to insure product integrity
  • A practical understanding of agile development methodologies
  • Proficiency with MS Office products


Join Aurico - experience the difference. Take the challenge.



Apply now!

jobs.title: Senior Full Stack Developer

Rubicon Project is hiring a talented senior software developer with a background in web application development. We look for developers who are passionate and see software creation as a craft. jobs.title: Project Manager
jobs.content:
Airspace Technologies is looking for a Project Manager in Carlsbad, CA. We specialize in Next Flight Out logistics and are working on bringing the entire market out of the stone age. From organs to airplane engines, we calculate the critical path for the order and manage its chain of custody using a combination of web and mobile applications.


Calculating an optimum path using real world transit is very much easier said than done. It takes an army of drivers, operations professionals, and engineers all working together to ensure that no shipment is compromised. As we grow, it is becoming more and more important that our engineers are meeting the needs of both our customers and operations team. We are looking for a project manager who can bridge the gap between all of these groups and ensure project deadlines are being met.



Responsibilities:


Create issues in Pivotal Tracker


Ensure those issues are being delivered in a reasonable time frame


Split large issues into epics


Report on releases


Track velocity


Be a developer advocate

jobs.title: Full Stack Developer for Tech Non-profit
jobs.content:
For Immediate Hire

Location: Los Angeles, California


Job Type: Full-Time Employee


About Nexleaf
At Nexleaf Analytics, we use sensors and real-time data to help find what global public health interventions work and fix what doesn't. Partnering with leading institutions such as Qualcomm, Vodafone Americas Foundation, Google.org, and the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation, Nexleaf helps deliver safe vaccines to over 6 million children and connect 1,000 rural homes with mobile money payments for reducing carbon emissions through cleaner cooking in 7 countries, including India, Mozambique, and Kenya.


Our wireless sensor devices use the cellular network to send temperature data from vaccine storage refrigerators and improved cookstoves to our cloud-based web dashboard, where our clients (governments, health care workers, and NGOs) access metrics, data analytics, and reports. We help our partners analyze data to drive change and achieve sustainable, large-scale public health and environmental interventions.


About the Position
We have a small team at Nexleaf, and we work together to define priorities and plan implementations. Any new addition to the team will play a critical role in helping achieve scale and impact. We do a lot of iteration on software features with our staff and customers before bringing them into production. This job will cover the whole cycle of implementing new features, revising existing features, thorough testing, and production deployment.


The major responsibilities of the position include:



  • Programming the frontend and backend (full stack) of our web service and analytics platform, using Python, Django, Python-RQ, MongoDB, HTML, JavaScript, CSS and other related languages and tools.

  • Work on new features and enhancements to the system.

  • Developing the API access to the data and reports available in our system.

  • Rework existing data models and storage strategies for efficiency and speed.

  • Evaluation and implementation of strategies to scale our services to support tens of thousands of sensors.

  • Grow to a position of architecting and owning major components in the system. 


Nexleaf Analytics is an Equal Opportunity Employer. jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer, Informatics
jobs.content:
Abbott is a global healthcare company devoted to improving life through the development of products and technologies that span the breadth of healthcare. With a portfolio of leading, science-based offerings in diagnostics, medical devices, nutritionals and branded generic pharmaceuticals, Abbott serves people in more than 150 countries and employs approximately 73,000 people. Please note that candidates need to be eligible to work in the U.S. without Abbott sponsorship.

JOB DESCRIPTION:

Primary Job Function
* This is a technical role with the candidate expected to be a critical contributor to building compelling informatics products within Abbotts Diagnostics Division.
* The individual will develop software on informatics programs from concept through launch. She/he will also be responsible for supporting on-market products post-launch.
* She/he will be responsible for defining, developing and documenting either presentation tier, application tier, services tier of desktop, mobile or cloud hosted informatics products.

Core Job Responsibilities

Responsible for implementing and maintaining the effectiveness of the quality system.
* The individual will be responsible for design and development of applications using contemporary platform architectures such as SOA (Service Oriented Architectures), Cloud Computing, Big Data, Web, Mobile, other.
* The individual is responsible for executing the various software development lifecycle (SDLC) activities user stories, use cases, software requirements, design, development and design verification (incl. unit, functional and system testing).
* She/he is responsible for developing test plans and test cases for software components.
* The individual is responsible for root cause analysis including troubleshooting of informatics work products during development and for on-market products.
* She/he will be responsible for creating and maintaining documentation for the artifacts created during the SDLC.
* The individual will be responsible for ensuring the continuous improvement and evolution of software work products.
* The individual should independently conceive plans and implement development artifacts (requirements, analysis, design, documentation and software work products) as-needed to meet program goals.
* The individual may travel occasionally per needs of the assigned project.

Position Accountability / Scope
* The individual is responsible for the design, development and commercialization of informatics products in compliance with internal policies and procedures, both US and Foreign regulatory standards and requirements.
* The individual will participate in development efforts using Agile development frameworks such as Scrum or Kanban.
* The individual will interact with project managers and R&D leadership on project scope, timeline, risks and budget.
* She/he is accountable for the development of one or more informatics modules as assigned on individual programs.
* The individual will work as part of cross-functional teams in Global Marketing, Research & Development, Information Technology, Quality, Operations, Regulatory and Business Development to deliver informatics products.
* She/he will work with a broad range of technologists and support personnel both within and outside of Abbott.

Minimum Education

Bachelors degree in one or more following disciplines: Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Software Engineering, Decision Sciences, Symbolic Systems, Informatics, Mathematics, Physics or Information Systems. An advanced degree in one of the above disciplines is preferred.

Minimum Experience / Training Required

Minimum of 5-8 years of experience at a startup, mid- to large-sized...

jobs.title: Technical Project Manager - Cloud-based sales intelligence platform
jobs.content:
Come join one of the fastest growing and most exciting technology companies in the Northwest. We're looking for a talented Technical Project Manager to help us solve some of the biggest and most interesting problems in the modern inside sales landscape. At DiscoverOrg you'll be joining a tight-knit team of "A" players working together to build innovative products that set the gold standard for the entire sales intelligence industry.


KEY RESPONSIBILITIES



  • Interact with Project Sponsors, Project Stakeholders and multiple business and technical teams to define and deliver complex features

  • Anticipate bottlenecks, provide escalation management, anticipate and make tradeoffs, and balance the business needs versus technical constraints

  • Plan and manage multiple parallel projects

  • Maximize resources for the greater good of the organization

  • Identify, assess, track and mitigate issues and risks at multiple levels

  • Create, maintain and disseminate project information to stakeholders

  • Drive effective teamwork, communication, collaboration and commitment across multiple disparate groups with competing priorities.

  • Be the glue that is able to understand, plan, and manage the cross-team interdependencies for complex systems

  • Communicate project issues and status in a concise, accurate, and professional manner

  • Apply best practices to the software development lifecycle (SDLC) for projects based on experiences with a number of agile and blended approaches, as well effectively coordinating the implementations across teams using very different approaches

  • Build and maintain integrated project schedules that account for internal/external dependencies, differing SDLC approaches, numerous constraints, and adequately factors in some contingency for some unplanned delays while still be aggressive

  • Remain flexible to changing priorities

jobs.title: Web Developer
jobs.content:
Description of position:


This role is responsible for developing and supporting application components using JavaScript, HTML5 and CSS3. You will work closely with team members including: development, business analysts, team leads, quality assurance, infrastructure, and project management. The person that fills this role must have the ability to work independently on assignments with minimal supervision while remaining highly collaborative.


Background:



  • Education: Bachelor's Degree; Masters of Science in Computer Science preferred.

  • Years of Experience: Minimum 5 years of experience as a web developer

  • Proven ability to design fresh, unique and professional websites

  • Superior analytical and problem solving ability

  • Aesthetic sensibility

  • Team player that can deliver in a high pressure demanding environment

jobs.title: Front End, Back End, or Full Stack Developer
jobs.content:
We are looking for full-time front end, back end, and full stack developers.


The ideal hacker has:



  • Expertise in our technology stack: Python, Django, React, jQuery, Javascript/HTML/CSS, Postgres, Docker, Jenkins, Github, AWS

  • 2+ years of software development experience

  • Strong foundation in computer science and software engineering including competency with data structures, algorithms, databases, and DevOps

  • Strong ability to work with a team and communicate effectively

  • Passion for tinkering and building awesome things

  • Strong motivation and initiative


You are interested in:



  • Writing code (not going to meetings all day)

  • Contributing from day one

  • Learning all about farms and cows

  • Fast-paced small team making a huge impact

  • Contributing to the direction and outcome of the products


Milker offers competitive salaries, meaningful equity, a comprehensive benefits package -- health, dental, vision, life, 401k matching and more. We have an amazing office facility (come visit!) with a stocked break room, foosball table, Tesla charging stalls, and a subsidized cafe-teria with delicious local, organic meal options. We have offices (not cubicles) and provide all the hardware you need including a NextDesk sit/stand desk, MacBook Pro, and 4K monitors.

jobs.title: Software Development Engineer - Database Services
jobs.content:
This is an excellent opportunity to join Amazon's world class technical team in either Seattle, WA or Herndon, VA, working with some of the best and brightest engineers and technical managers while also developing your skills and furthering your career within one of the most innovative and progressive technology companies anywhere.



Amazon Web Service is building some of the largest distributed systems in the world. Amazon's database offerings like Aurora, DynamoDB, ElastiCache, EMR, RDS, RedShift are massively scaled services that make up a critical piece of the internet today.



A successful Engineer joining the team will do much more than write code and triage problems. They will work with Amazon's largest and most demanding customers to address specific needs across a full suite of services. They will dive deeply into technical issues and work relentlessly to improve the customer experience. The ideal candidate will...



Be great fun to work with. Our company credo is Work hard. Have fun. Make history. The right candidate will love what they do and instinctively know how to make work fun.



Have strong Linux & Networking Fu. The ideal candidate will have deep experience working with Linux, preferably in a large scale, distributed environment. You understand networking technology and how servers and networks inter-relate. You regularly take part in deep-dive troubleshooting and conduct technical post-mortem discussions to identify the root cause of complex issues.



Love to code. Whether its building tools in Java or solving complex system problems in Python, the ideal candidate will love using technology to solve problems. You have a solid understanding of software development methodology and know how to use the right tool for the right job.



Think Big. The ideal candidate will build and deploy solutions across thousands of devices. You will strive to improve and streamline processes to allow for work on a massive scale.

- B.S. or M.S. degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or equivalent experience

- Minimum 3 years overall development experience

- Proficiency developing in a modern programming language, such as C++, Java, C#, Python, or Ruby

- Proficiency in design and analysis of algorithms and data structures

- Ability to work in a fast paced and agile development environment

- Excellent communication, prioritization, and analytical skills



This position requires the applicant selected to obtain and maintain a Top Secret security clearance with Sensitive Compartmented Information (TS/SCI) eligibility and access. A US Government administered polygraph examination will be required. TS/SCI eligibility is not required to start; however, the applicant selected will be subject to a Single-Scope Background Investigation (SSBI) and must meet eligibility requirements for access to classified national security information. Applicants with a current SSBI, SBPR, or PPR, may be eligible for crossover in accordance with ICPG 704.4.



- Experience operating large scale systems

- Familiarity with Linux

- Solid grasp of networking fundamentals

- Experience in a 24/7 production environment

- Knowledge of databases like MySQL, Oracle, SQLServer, or MongoDB

- Must be able to see opportunities for improvement, take ownership and closely work with development team to drive product improvement.

- Passion for providing a great customer experience



Please email (michelko@amazon.com) if you have any questions about this opportunity. Thank you for your interest!



For more information on Amazon Web Services please visit: http://aws.amazon.com/



*LI-PG1



aws-support-na



*MVP221982

jobs.title: Senior Web Developer
jobs.content:
As a result of business growth, PDHI is looking for an experienced web developer to join our Transactional Services Team in the Bernardsville, NJ office.  The Senior Web Developer will work as part of a team designing, implementing and maintaining mobile friendly web based applications using responsive design techniques.


Reporting to the VP, Transactional Services the Senior Web Developer will be part of the development team responsible for delivering web based applications hosted in our Des Moines, IA data center. Duties will include the following:



  • Working as part of a team to develop software to meet defined requirements and following the agile, scrum based software development lifecycle.

  • Updating job knowledge by studying state-of-the-art development tools, programming techniques, and computing equipment; participating in educational opportunities; reading professional publications; maintaining personal networks; participating in professional organizations.

  • Providing tier-2 support to the Client Services group to assist in the identification and correction of problems encountered by clients using PDHI applications.


Access to PHI will not be granted until the applicant satisfactorily completes a background check and substance abuse screening.

jobs.title: Front End Web Developer
jobs.content:
ZergNet builds tools for publishers to help them better grow, analyze, and monetize their properties through content recommendation. Our custom designed modules appear across many of the world's largest websites serving over 13,000 article recommendations a second.


As a team of just 30 people, we are working at massive scale on fun and challenging projects.


Our ideal candidate is someone who is comfortable working on a small team and understands the complexity surrounding front-end performance optimization, responsive layouts, and cross-device compliance.


We also receive over 50 million unique visitors a month to our own websites allowing for diverse projects beyond content recommendation.


We are headquartered in NYC, but we will also consider remote US based candidates. Please include a portfolio or some examples of your front end skills.

jobs.title: Java Cloud Software Engineer for IoT
jobs.content:
• Design, implement, and maintain customer facing APIs

  • Participate in significant architectural decisions and strategy development

  • Provide the technical expertise to determine, understand, and technically translate requirements into technical specifications for delivery of cloud-based services

  • Database administration (experience with NoSQL is a plus)

jobs.title: Software Engineer
jobs.content:
We are seeking software engineers to join the Broadcast team to build a global video platform. As an engineer, you will work on challenging technical problems for global video delivery. You will build and optimize the video platform for video playback, geographic optimizations, accessibility, and search optimization. Our team's mission is to provide the best video platform for employee learning, training, and communication.



We provide a global video broadcasting platform used daily for on-demand video and real-time video streams. We build solutions that impact the front-end user experience, and backend solutions for video processing workflows. Every day users upload gigabytes of new videos, which our systems transcode, distribute, and publish on the site to users. Our algorithms route users and videos through the best cache location to each country around the world. Our analytics solutions capture how videos are played to help video producers improve their video content.



We're looking for engineers to innovate and scale this valuable platform. You will be applying core software engineering skill daily -OO, systems design, distributed computing, and algorithm design. You will also be heavily involved in a multitude of diverse web, video, and storage technologies, including but not limited to HTML5 video, DynamoDB, S3, and pull and push systems, request and event driven services, webservers, HTTP, and many other technologies that are used in a Service Oriented Architecture.



Key Responsibilities:

  • Participate in the full development life cycle, working within broadly defined parameters, ultimately delivering the software to the customer.

  • Code in Ruby, HTML5, JS and deploy onto AWS

    Manage and execute against project plans and delivery commitments.

  • Work closely with engineers to develop the best technical design and approach for new product development.

  • Design and define the interactions between various systems or components.

  • Create and execute appropriate quality plans, project plans, test strategies and processes for development activities in concert with business and project management efforts.




  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or a related field.

  • Experience with Object Oriented Design (OOD) and Design Patterns in one dynamic language such as Ruby/Python/PHP/Perl/JavaScript and one compiled language such as Java/C#/C++

  • Experience with web technologies such as CSS/HTML/JavaScript

  • CS fundamentals (data structures, algorithms and programming languages)

  • Experience with messaging and asynchronous architectures.

  • Experience with performance/space tradeoffs and browser compatibility issues.




  • 2-5 years of software development experience building full-stack web applications with high traffic primarily serving video content.

  • Building solutions with Ruby on Rails, HTML5, JavaScript, ES6, ReactJS, Ember, and AJAX.

  • Building data-drive MVC and OO full-stack web applications.

  • Building event-driven asynchronous workflow systems by using available technology including including Amazon Web Services (AWS) Simple Workflow Service, Kinesis, or Lamba.

  • Building digital web-based video playback solutions using available technology including HTML5 video, Adobe Media Services, HLS, and VTT captioning.

  • Experience building data storage solutions with Amazon Web Services (AWS) S3, DynamoDB, and RDS.

  • Experience optimizing webserver architectures and global caching using CloudFront or CDN solutions.

  • Strong project-management skills, sense of ownership, urgency, and drive.

jobs.title: Senior Scala Developer
jobs.content:
Our Opportunity:


Chewy is hiring a Senior Scala Developer to join our Ecommerce Software Team based in Dania, Beach, FL, to enhance and innovate our internal pricing tools. You’ll be working directly with key leaders of business and development to create elegant solutions on our Scala/Play/Postgres stack for our Pricing team.


What you’ll do:


In addition to being an expert at Scala and software development, you must be independent, driven, creative, like to take ownership, participate in all phases of product development, and have excellent organization and communication skills. Additionally, you will be expected to understand the pricing methodologies from the business team, be able to conceptualize the strategies into coding algorithms, and propose new ideas from collaborative brainstorming sessions.


This is a small but centrally critical team for Chewy business and software, so you’ll be involved in all phases of development, from requirements gathering, feature chartering, development, deployment, testing, and user support. 


You will write simple and sustainable code that reflects a constant understanding of the business impacts. This is a terrific opportunity to join a thriving startup and have a significant role in its success. There is a tremendous opportunity to grow professionally and to be a part of a dynamic and successful team.

jobs.title: DevOps Engineer
jobs.content:
Our Opportunity:


We are looking to build a forward thinking team that appreciates and has the desire to help build an IT organization.  The DevOps Engineer is responsible for designing, implementing and maintaining production systems as part of the Technical Operations team in Dania Beach, FL. These duties include release management, automation, system maintenance, and must have experience in the configuration and use of source code management systems and code build systems. Selected candidate will also serve as a technical lead on strategic, infrastructure related projects to provide insight and direction. Flexibility, adaptability and the ability to learn quickly in various technical and creative environments, are key attributes.


What you'll do:



  • Design, build and implement Linux based server infrastructure, creating a standardized reference architecture.

  • Writing scripts to automate the provisioning and maintenance of systems in a geographically distributed environment.

  • Work in an agile development environment, collaborating with Application Development and Architecture teams.

  • Take an active role in developing the long-range technical infrastructure and architecture plans.

  • Experiment with new technologies to optimize the reliability and performance of our infrastructure automation.

  • Design and implement proactive monitoring to ensure health, performance and security of our production and non-production virtualized infrastructure.

  • Plan automated backups and disaster recovery/fail-over configurations.

  • Work with other development team to profile and optimize reference architectures.

  • Develop capacity plans for new & existing clusters.

  • Produce high quality systems documents.

jobs.title: Senior Java Developer  Search Platform Engineer
jobs.content:
Our Opportunity:


Chewy is hiring a Senior Java Developer – Search Platform Engineer for our Ecommerce Systems team in Dania Beach, FL. You will be a key member responsible for building, scaling, and maintaining our search platform to deliver solutions and features for the leading online pet retailer in the US.


What you’ll do:


You will lead a team that is responsible for the vision, strategy, product roadmap, and development of Chewy’s core ecommerce Solr search platform. You will have significant influence over the vision, features, and design of this critical platform.


This is a high-profile position that will have exposure across the entire business.


You will write simple and sustainable code that reflects a constant understanding of the business impacts. This is a terrific opportunity to join a thriving startup and have a significant role in its success. There is a tremendous opportunity to grow professionally and to be a part of a dynamic and successful team.

jobs.title: Enterprise QA Manager
jobs.content:
Rally Health (rallyhealth.com) is a startup that's revolutionizing health and the face of healthcare. We’re looking for a top-notch leader to manage a growing team of client-facing QA professionals. As Manager of Enterprise QA, you will drive process and efficiency across multiple internal organizations as well as interface with external partners. Being part of the Rally Health team means your contributions will directly improve the lives of millions of people trying to live healthier lifestyles.

The EQA Manager is responsible for driving and ensuring overall product quality for Rally’s Enterprise partners and clients. This person must be highly motivated to ensure we're creating the right processes to help us succeed as an organization, which includes development of solid metrics. The manager role will interact directly with internal and external stakeholders to ensure requirements are being set and risks are being identified and mitigated. This person will partner with the Enterprise Delivery team and help bridge the gap between the Engineering, Operations and Product sides of the organization to ensure needs are being met, while executing and pushing our platform to the highest quality levels possible.

jobs.title: Sr. Sales Engineer
jobs.content:
We are seeking talented Sales Engineers to work with clients to understand how our software can bring value to their organizations. The Sr. Sales Engineer is a critical role as the technical face of Synopsys. This is a great opportunity to build something new, consult with clients, and develop a market strategy to integrate our recent acquisitions.


Responsibilities


Sales Support
Develop and deliver high-quality product presentations/demonstrations for Synopsys products, services, and solutions to potential customers.
Conduct on-site evaluations at prospective clients
Participate in seminars and trade shows

Account Management

Work with existing clients to maximize effectiveness of deployments
Communicate new features and enhancement requests to Product Marketing and Engineering
Travel to meet new and existing clients

jobs.title: Cloud Software Engineer - CA, CO, MA OR REMOTE WORK!
jobs.content:
From Denali to Uluru, JFK to SFO, and everywhere in between, ViaSat technology delivers Internet access no matter where life’s journeys take you. We provide satellite broadband connections to homes, business, airlines, and more across the globe.


The Cloud Engineering squad provides network and security services to every program at ViaSat, from development through production, with a focus on utilizing public and private cloud platforms. We engage hands-on with other engineering teams to help them get to the cloud. We also build the network services platform these groups use to meet their operational, security, and regulatory requirements.


On any given day, you may be walking colleagues through the finer points of VPC design, helping a product team debug a critical failure in production, or presenting a workshop on developing against our internal APIs. You might be adding DNSSEC to our DNS service, writing automation to validate TLS configurations across the entire network, or expanding our platform into São Paulo. Our work and our products are always evolving, which leaves little chance you'll ever get bored.

jobs.title: Software Developer, Systems Integration
jobs.content:
Every member of the C Spire Team is charged with bringing our strategic vision of diversified technology to life and having a Passion to learn new technologies. Work in the Brand Services & Commerce department, Systems Integration group to provide and maintain highly specialized service-oriented solutions and other applications. Perform a variety of technical work in the development of new service-oriented applications including analysis, design, coding, testing, debugging, and documenting as well as support of current applications and systems. Provide on-call support. Respond to System Support team with escalation requests in a timely manner that ensures customer satisfaction. Track issues from production support to ensure long-term resolutions are achieved.


This position is available as a Software Developer I, Software Developer II, or Software Developer III; depending on experience. 


ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:


Actively engaged as an employee advocate and fully committed to supporting our strategic vision to be and become known as the BEST in our industry(s) through:



  • Integrity

  • Putting our customer at the center of everything we do

  • A relentless passion to be the best

  • Being competitive, bold, innovative and adding value

  • An ownership mentality, behavior and accountability

  • An unyielding commitment to quality

  • Respect for our internal and external customers

  • Continuous improvement

  • Being resourceful, productive and efficient

  • Maximum dedication and effort with high energy, enthusiasm and urgency


Possess familiarity with or demonstrate the ability to learn the C Spire business processes and technical environment. This includes environments, tools, policies and procedures.


Development: Demonstrated ability and solid work ethic to perform technical tasks including analysis, design, coding, debugging, and implementation of software applications. Write new programs or create modifications to existing applications as necessary based on project requirements. Follow established standards for the design, coding, and testing of software.


Testing: Assist in performing unit and integration testing, present final test results, and obtain agreement and approval. Work with users to validate system testing and conformity with functional requirements.


Implementation and Support: Follow appropriate change management and implementation procedures. Research, propose, and implement solutions to production issues and trouble tickets as assigned by Systems Analyst and/or Manager.


Prepare program and/or process documentation.


Perform additional duties as assigned by Systems Analyst and/or Manager.

jobs.title: Sr. Security Solutions Architect
jobs.content:
The Senior Solution Architect works together with regional sales teams, in collaboration with Sales Engineers, to provide expert support in understanding customer problems and formulating solutions for some of the most strategic enterprise accounts which Synopsys is engaged with.
Senior Solution Architects are drawn from the ranks of thought leaders in the space of:

Software security testing
Secure development lifecycle
Software quality and robustness analysis
In addition, Senior Solution Architects play a defining role in expanding the knowledge base for the Synopsys technical field organization through mentoring, marketing participation, and other thought leadership activities.

Key activities for the Solution Architecture team include:



Sales cycle with strategic enterprise accounts
Discovery: Assisting sales teams in better understanding customer's situation, problems and requirements in large and complex enterprise accounts
Solution architecture: Guiding sales teams to design innovative combinations of products, services, and technical support to provide maximum customer value


Thought leadership and evangelism
Externally facing: Building awareness of current industry trends and best practices in software integrity. This may be achieved, in collaboration with the marketing team, through papers, blog posts, and speaking at events as well as evangelism with private customer audiences - and mapping to specific vertical problems, to set the foundation for the Synopsys Software Integrity solution proposition
Internally facing: Enabling the Synopsys technical field to achieve their maximum potential and become individual experts in Software Integrity solutions and software sign-off


Post-sales for complex enterprise customer situations

Program management: Oversight of major customer technical engagements, to ensure harmony with the designed solution and strategy - in collaboration with other teams such as Professional Services, Sales Engineering, Customer Success, and Technical Support
Knowledge transfer and delivery support: Supporting the wider team in creating re-usable solutions, through imparting expert knowledge, and providing mentoring and knowledge transfer through supporting key project deliveries

jobs.title: Software Engineering Practice Manager
jobs.content:
Why You’ll Love Working Here:


Working at TechSmith gives you a chance to hone your skills in an open, collaborative, and innovative environment where you can be excited to come into work every single day.


We are a technological melting pot, comprised of nearly 300 uniquely skilled human beings that will continue to stretch your comfort zone – but in a good way. And speaking of comfort, who doesn’t love to show up to work in jeans, eat free snacks, and drink free pop?


With great products and great people behind them, we are always looking for passionate, fun, and, hard working individuals who truly enjoy coming to work and doing what they love. Sounds like you? We’d love to chat.


Position Overview:


The Software Engineering Practice Manager is a leader and technology guru committed to creating high-performance software development teams. You will help the company train, mentor and coach TechSmithies to become self-sufficient team members that will excel in their primary skill areas. You must have a passion for helping others realize their full potential as software engineers.


Responsibilities:



  • Performs supervisory duties for software engineers

  • Set stretch performance goals for yourself and your staff

  • Give clear feedback to mentor, coach and motivate your staff to their optimum performance

  • Drive communities of practice. Level-up critical competencies needed by the company

  • Hire and develop talent for software engineering positions

  • Stay current with the latest software engineering practices and methodologies

  • Other duties as assigned


Compensation and Perks:


At TechSmith, we love our employees and are always looking for ways to reward outstanding performance. Our compensation is competitive and based on skills and experience. As a full-time employee you will receive the standard TechSmith benefits package including health insurance, paid time off, 401(k) program, etc. We offer you a unique and growing company culture where you can enjoy your work and advance your career. We wear jeans, drink free pop, and enjoy company-sponsored events. If this sounds like a place you would like to work, please submit your resume and cover letter along with your salary requirements.

jobs.title: Full Stack Software Engineer
jobs.content:
At Generation Tux, we take pleasure in Software Design. We believe that velocity comes from a commitment to clean code and SOLID engineering principles. We deliver innovative products through rapid, continuous development. If you are excited by constantly challenging engineering processes and can deliver exceptional quality in a fast-paced, agile environment, we'd like to meet you.


Generation Tux is looking for experienced, impact-driven Full-Stack Engineers to join our team.  We’re innovating online tuxedo rental and need to staff up so we can move fast!  In this high-profile startup (with visibility from our CEO George Zimmer) you’ll work with our product management, user experience, UI design, DevOps and dedicated full-stack engineering team to extend our micro-services architecture, helping Generation Tux scale to renting millions of tuxedos in a seamless online experience.


The right individual will be deeply familiar with how other leading companies have built scalable, resilient micro-service platforms, and will be excited to bring these concepts and techniques to Generation Tux.

jobs.title: Software Engineer II
jobs.content:
Coolfire Solutions is seeking an entry level software engineer who is highly motivated with a passion for creating great software.  The SEII will focus on a single facet of an application or system and will work under the direct guidance of more senior engineers. 


We are looking for smart candidates who are able to learn multiple technologies. Serious candidates won't be limited by their resume. If you're a developer who has some knowledge/interest in mobile and you aren't defined by a single skill or language then we want to meet you!


Responsibilities:



  • Implement features defined in project.

  • Participate in Agile planning and estimating.

  • Participate in quality assurance and testing.

  • Write Unit Tests.

jobs.title: Graphical Engineer
jobs.content: We are in need of a graphical engineer with experience in DirectX and OpenGL.  Primarily, this is a graphical rendering position, but we would like someone who is comfortable enough to work in other areas of the game such as collisions and fluid/rigid body interactions.

jobs.title: Lead Front End Developer
jobs.content:
• Define, code, test and deploy new features with an emphasis on extensibility and performance.

jobs.title: Full-Stack Ruby on Rails Web Developer
jobs.content:
(relocation preferred, remote considered)


You...



  • Have been using Ruby on Rails for 2+ years and can’t imagine going back to PHP

  • Love the startup culture in which a single person can make a big difference

  • Thrive in a laid-back, fun atmosphere

  • Want to do meaningful work that helps save lives

  • Believe in the mantra of moving quickly (and trying not to break too much)

  • Learning and growing professionally by taking time every week to read articles or books from our bookshelf to better yourself

jobs.title: Java +  Scala Developer
jobs.content: We crunch, sanitize and store data, then charge businesses to access it in real-time through a RESTful API. Our toolchain and most of our services our written in scala. You'll help us maintain and improve our platform, starting with its public launch this summer. This will involve writing lots of clean, functional scala code.

jobs.title: Senior Full Stack Web Developer
jobs.content:
We’re looking for a well-rounded and passionate senior full stack developer to join our team in creating an amazing client experience. If you’re interested in working on all layers of a system from developing new UI controls to creating flexible and scalable data architectures with the latest technologies and tools then Market Track is for you.


This person should be self-motivated. We’re not big on constant oversight and micro management. We’re looking for engineers that can take a task, get clarity as needed, and run with it to produce well designed quality code. You need to love to code and care about quality and design.


We understand that iteration is important to good design and development. We need a person who can take iterative steps toward delivering a solution. Working with the business the entire way to stay on target and deliver amazing results.

jobs.title: Java Developer
jobs.content:
LHLIC is looking to recruit a qualified and experienced Java Developer to take part in all aspects of the Software Development Lifecycle. This position is located at our home office at 4343 E Camelback Rd, Phoenix, AZ 85018 near downtown Phoenix, AZ.


Candidates should have:
• A bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or a related discipline.
• 3+ years of professional Java software development experience.


Candidates will be responsible for:
• Designing, developing, and maintaining new and existing web based systems.
• Working with front end developers to integrate back-end code with front-end UI design.
• Writing high quality, maintainable code optimized for speed and scalability.
• Solving problems using technical solutions.
• Communicating effectively with technical and non-technical personnel

jobs.title: Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Are you a perfectionist? Do you like to preoccupy yourself with difficult problems? Are you the kind who will not sleep until a problem is solved not just correctly, but also elegantly?


Noodle is a different kind of educational technology company. We want to provide people with transformative experiences when it comes to managing something we do everyday: learning. We cannot do it alone. We cannot do it overnight. And we need a hand.


And so we are looking for a different kind of programmer, particularly someone with a strong background in mathematics and computer science. Your primary task will be to write high-quality code. While you may have dabbled in many different languages, you must have a deep expertise in at least one. If you are fluent in F#, OCaml or another functional language, we would love to hear from you.


We seek those who are quick to see connections between concepts that others miss. Those who have the ability to filter specious information and apply uncommon sense to some uncommon problems, thereby creating mathematical and algorithmic patterns of great beauty. When it comes to painting the fence, you are Daniel-san, not Tom Sawyer.

jobs.title: Software Development Engineer
jobs.content:
Amazon’s Optimal Sourcing Systems (OSS) is looking for experienced software development engineers who want to build Amazon’s next generation of inventory management systems. As part of Amazon’s Supply Chain Optimization Technology (SCOT) group, OSS designs and builds systems that measure and manage Amazon’s supplier capabilities, identify and react to supply disruptions, and prioritizes inbound freight for our global network. Our software is used by every country Amazon services, and is a critical link to ensuring Amazon offers the products our customers want, at the lowest possible cost.

As an SDE in OSS, you’ll work closely some of the brightest software engineers, scientists, economists, and product managers to solve highly complex supply chain challenges. You and your fellow engineers are responsible for designing the architecture, building the software, and working with the team to deploy your solutions across the globe. OSS is a unique opportunity to both create and see the direct impact of your work on billions of dollars’ worth of inventory in one of the world’s most advanced supply chains, and at massive scale.

You should be comfortable diving deep into technical architectures and requirements, be able to quickly identify solutions to challenges discovered during development, and ready to work with some of the latest cloud computing technology. Prior experience building stable, scalable, solutions is required. Prior experience with data mining, databases, building usable interfaces, using ML and other learning techniques, as well as massively parallel systems is a plus. Successful candidates will thrive in fast-paced environments that leverage agile planning techniques, encourage and reward creative design, intelligent risk taking, and find innovative ways to leverage cutting edge technology.

#SCOT #OSS

BA/BS in Computer Science or related degree.

- 5+ years of professional experience developing software.

- Fluency in Java or other OOPLs such as C++ and C#.

- Working knowledge of databases, SQL desired.



MS or PhD in Computer Science.

- 3+ years of experience developing for a Linux or UNIX environment.

- Experience with object-relational mapping software (ORM, including Hibernate, Carbonado, etc)

- Experience designing, developing, and deploying large-scale distributed systems.

- Experience with data mining software and techniques (Hadoop).

- Experience leading and mentoring junior engineers on good software development practices and design reviews.

- Understanding of supply chain fundamentals, including inventory management and optimization.

- Excellent communication skills.

jobs.title: Senior Rails Developer
jobs.content: Spreemo is a fast growing digital health company reshaping the way we evaluate and select our doctors. Today, we’re doing this in radiology, tomorrow, the greater healthcare ecosystem. We’re looking for a Sr. Rails Engineer who will help re-architect and develop our core healthcare marketplace platform. We are committed to following Rails best practices around enabling continuous deployment with comprehensive testing. We are recruiting for an experienced, full-stack developer who has deployed numerous production Rails applications and has well-thought-through opinions on which gems to rely on, coding style, and best practices for rapid iteration and maintainability.

jobs.title: Website Speed and Performance, Software Development Engineer
jobs.content:
As part of the consumer retail platform excellence team, the Website Performance Team measures and optimizes the Amazon website for SPEED. Our team builds tools to measure and track the performance of our website from a user perspective - in essence, how fast are pages loading? When we find latency issues, we lead projects to correct them. We also champion fast web practices across the company constantly reducing latency to give customers the snappy web performance they love.



We're seeking a software developer who gets excited optimizing for speed. Our engineers become experts in how browsers, servers, page frameworks, internet protocols, and traffic patterns impact performance.



#platform-excellence


  • Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or related field

  • Equivalent experience to a Bachelor's degree based on 3 years of work experience for every 1 year of education

  • 2+ years professional experience in software development

  • Computer Science fundamentals in object-oriented design

  • Computer Science fundamentals in data structure

  • Computer Science fundamentals in algorithm design, problem solving, and complexity analysis

  • Proficiency in, at least, one modern programming language such as C++, Java, or Ruby




  • Experience developing Ruby on Rails

  • Experience with RedShift and Amazon Web Services

  • Knowledge of Web Browsers and Internet Protocols

  • Experience with Relational and Non Relational Data Stores

  • Experience building complex software systems that have been successfully delivered to customers

  • Knowledge of professional software engineering practices & best practices for the full software development life cycle, including coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build processes, testing, and operations

  • Ability to take a project from scoping requirements through actual launch of the project

  • Experience in communicating with users, other technical teams, and management to collect requirements, describe software product features, and technical designs.

jobs.title: Machine Learning Engineer
jobs.content:
HyperScience is a general purpose AI company, partnering with Fortune 500 leaders' to most expensive and critical problems through automation and machine learning. We believe AI is destined to be the biggest event in the history of human labor since the industrial revolution. There are already many applications, ranging from self-driving cars to medical software that diagnoses patients, where AI gets the job done faster, better and cheaper. However, HyperScience makes that kind of AI available to the worlds leading enterprises.

Working at HyperScience, you will advance the state of the art by developing novel machine learning approaches, you will build self-configuring, self-healing, self-tuning distributed systems and you will deliver developer-centric tools you’d love using yourself. Additionally, you’ll see your code matter by working directly with customers. We already work with a number of recognizable global businesses that are paying to use HyperScience in production to solve problems like:


  • Which user of my online community is going to commit a violent crime in the next 48 hours?

  • Our HD satellite doesn't come into orbit for another 2 hours, we need HyperScience to identify that object in these low-res shots.

  • Which of my employees is going to to steal a trove of sensitive documents?

  • Which of my customers would have been the most valuable if only we'd invested in them a little more?

  • Detect whether someone has gained unauthorized access to one of my buildings using a stolen badge.




We’re backed by top tier investors.

The team consists exclusively of engineers who have experience working on machine learning and internet-scale apps. All candidates for this role should have at least 5 years professional experience outside of academia and a proven track record of accomplishment. Entry-level candidates will not be considered.

jobs.title: Web Developer Programmer
jobs.content:
Working in concert with Development team in writing, maintaining, and facilitating core PHP web applications and integrating them within new frameworks and other third party services.



Roles and Responsibilities:




  • Develop robust user-friendly web applications.

  • Routine daily maintenance of existing applications and sites.

  • Application/Framework design as needed.

  • Stay up to date on latest trends and emerging technologies

jobs.title: Operations Engineer
jobs.content:
WE NEED:
An experienced Ops Engineer or Systems Administrator who can hit the ground running and help the admin team tackle a substantial list of projects. Projects examples include: maintenance of networks built on managed hardware, optimizing existing services, and ground-up solution definition for bespoke applications.

Is this you?

YOU CAN:
-Design and document solutions before a single line of code is written
-Create solutions that include testing, risk analysis, and long-term maintenance planning
-Work in a cross-discipline team and embrace diversity
-Design HA systems and build them
-Define and follow procedures

-Adapt rapidly to change

-Diagnose systematically
-Find the root cause
-Communicate with clients and coworkers from a variety of technical and non-technical backgrounds

jobs.title: Front End Developer
jobs.content:
We are a fast paced team where developers are responsible for all aspects of feature design and development.  Our ideal candidate would bring ideas to the table and be able to quickly iterate on them. 

Our application, https://www.stream.me, is in a space where innovation and new technology is important; we expect team members to be able to explore novel tasks and pragmatically build out the features.

We are looking from someone with strong Front-End skills who has experience working with a full Javascript stack.  We use React and Express to render views on both the front and back end.  Many of our components are built in house and we are often experimenting with new and unexplored technologies.  We expect our developers to be able to use existing open source tools as well as judge when a custom component should be made. All team members participate in code reviews, helping improve the teams work as well as knowledge of the code base.  We release to production multiple times a day and developers are responsible for getting their features into production. Visual design capabilities are a plus but not required.  

Experience in the following is required: * Javascript * Node * SCSS Experience in the following is a plus: * Express * React * Redis * API Design

jobs.title: Ruby on Rails Developer
jobs.content:
We are looking for a talented individual to help us refine and expand our product offerings as we continue to grow! You will work closely with our team to ensure quality product development all they way from initial feature design through implementation and deployment to customers. 


You will be responsible for helping us improve the overall user experience by fine tuning the UI, optimizing portions of our current code base, and building value added features. In just 2 short years we have grown from having our product in one city to a network that encompasses nearly 40 states. Growing our team with the right individuals will help us continue to grow our market share.

jobs.title: Front End Developer  UI / UX
jobs.content:
Join our team and actively shape the technical future of the world’s largest online hotel search. Enjoy the freedom to question established processes, work with top-notch technologies and develop new tools to impress our 120 million users per month!

Support us in bringing our website’s complex user interface to life through a compelling display, paramount quality, astonishing speed and compatibility with any device or browser out there! Are you constantly seeking new challenges and want to work within a cutting edge and creativity-enhancing setting? Then we’re the right company for you! Become part of our team and actively shape the technical future of the world’s largest online hotel search. Work with top-notch technologies in a unique work environment with exciting career perspectives. Enjoy the freedom to question established processes, broaden your horizons and develop new designs and effects.


Your responsibilities:



  • You are responsible for the development of our high traffic web applications (i.e. price comparison, Community and B2B applications).

  • As a mediator between our designers and back end developers your knowledge and expertise in these two domains will be required.

  • With the implementation of modern designs, you make sure that our front end is always a step ahead.

  • Using pre-processors, code efficient, maintainable, scalable and cross-browser compatible CSS.

  • You support the design and development process through creation and improvement of style guides and pattern libraries.

  • You make sure trivago maintains its trendsetter status by familiarizing yourself with new technologies and keeping an eye out for upcoming trends and their applicability to our site.

jobs.title: Software Quality Assurance Lead
jobs.content:
__About Brave__

The web has become a different place. With the adÂ­tech ecosystem out of control, users have
revolted and blocking ads has become the new weapon of choice for improving their browsing
speed, safety and privacy. Unfortunately, blocking alone results in a race to the bottom where
nobody wins. Without the ability for content creators to earn money for their efforts, users could
be left with fewer sites to browse, relegated to handÂ­picked content from controlled sources.
Brave aims to transform the online ad ecosystem with micropayments and a new
revenueÂ­sharing solution to give users and publishers a better deal, where fast, safe browsing is
the path to a better future for the open web.

__The Challenge__

Brave is looking for an experienced Quality Assurance Lead who can grow and refine our SQA
process across both mobile and desktop platforms. Strong communication skills will be key in
orchestrating testers from various sources as well as communicating with endÂ­users to triage
bugs and assist in STR. This is a highÂ­profile and impactful, handsÂ­on position in an early stage
startup.

__Requirements__

* 5+ years relevant experience
* Strong understanding of white and black box testing methods
* Proficient in manual and exploratory testing of native mobile applications on both iOS
and Android platforms
* Proficient in testing of native desktop applications on macOS, Windows and Linux
* Solid grasp of how to test effectively within an agile development process
* Strong ability to work well with engineering, product, design and marketing teams to
validate requirements and collect user feedback
* Experience with software development via distributed development teams
* Comfortable working in an open source setting
* A passion for helping protect usersâ privacy and security
* Written and verbal communication skills in English
* Proven record of getting things done

__Responsibilities__

* Bug management: triage, organize, reproduce, improve STR, determine scope,
communicate with reporters
* Release management: testing of release candidates, ensuring quality is sufficient for
release, monitor releases for crash reports
* Coordinate testing with our Beta test groups
* Ownership of bug reporting tools and methods, including advisement and setup or
migration when needed

__Benefits__

* Competitive salary
* 4 weeks (20 days) of paid vacation per year
* Excellent medical coverage
* Generous 401k plan
* Stock option grant
* Travel and conference budgets
* Commuters benefit (OnÂ­site only)
* Hip office in the SoMA neighborhood of SF

Candidates must be legally authorized to work in the United States or Canada.

_At Brave, we are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color,
ancestry, religion, sex, age, marital status, disability, national origin, sexual orientation, gender,
gender identity or expression, or veteran status. We are proud to be an equal opportunity
workplace, and value a team that is as diverse as our target user base â the entire world._

jobs.title: Software Engineering Team Lead
jobs.content:
About Cake Solutions Inc


Using the very latest technologies, Cake Solutions helps organisations take innovative and disruptive ideas and develop them into reactive software solutions. Cake’s success is underpinned by our unique One Team® approach that allows for standalone projects or close collaboration with the clients’ technology teams. Cake provides mentors to guide the entire organisation through modern software engineering, continually transferring skills and knowledge to client teams in the process. This enables Cake to deliver not just software but to transform the way organisations think about and execute software delivery.


As an early adopter of change in the IT industry, Cake embraces the use of the latest bleeding edge programming languages and tools to implement system components including big data, machine learning and the Internet of Things. Cake delivers the appropriate technical solution to a business problem and can transform the way organisations think about and deliver production-ready high quality systems safely and predictably.


Our experienced, cross-functional agile teams enable the delivery of entire solutions not just lines of code. They appreciate the importance of continuous integration, continuous delivery, DevOps and rigorous testing.


Cake team members are published authors, prolific bloggers and experienced speakers. They have extensive experience in designing, building and implementing scalable Reactive Applications and are encouraged to continually research and innovate and to publish thought leading insights.


We make the most of messaging infrastructures, modern DBMSs, and all other services that make up today's enterprise systems. Automated provisioning, testing, integration and delivery allow us to release high quality systems safely and predictably.
