Cake are looking for a passionate and skilled Operations Developer with a real passion for on-going learning and continual skills development.  The role will involve maintaining and creating Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery pipelines, to ensure the development process is automated and repeatable.  You will be helping to build and deploy system infrastructure in a cloud focused environment while providing operational advice to developers when appropriate.Another responsibility will be monitoring existing clusters of deployed instances in the Cloud maintaining backups and performance (manually scaling where appropriate), identifying errors, troubleshooting, improving alerting on failure and also deploying new code releases to those environments.

We would also be delighted to see & discuss your published works (blogs, articles, books, contributions to open source projects).

jobs.title: Javascript Developer  Frontend
jobs.content:
For our frontend, we use modern javascript frameworks like TypeScript and ES6/ES2015.
Our current focus lies on the development of reusable components on top of React and publishing our mobile apps based on React Native. We are also experimenting more and more with functional languages, like Elixir.  


We are looking for a talented Javascript Developer - Frontend (m/f) to help us reach the next level.


Your responsibilities 



  • You conceptualize and develop new user-facing features 

  • You are responsible for creating the user experience of our web and mobile applications

  • You ensure the technical feasibility of UI/UX designs by working hand in hand with our design and product management 

  • You ensure the technical success and support further enhancement of askCharlie 

  • You leave your footprint as we build our highly complex platform 

  • You share your knowledge and experiences with your team

jobs.title: Architect - Technical Product Management for FastConnect Cloud Network
jobs.content:
(Internet/Network Service Provider Background)


Oracle Public Cloud is experiencing significant growth resulting in rapid expansion of the underlying network infrastructure to support that growth.  Our team is building a suite of solutions to facilitate secure interconnects with customers and network service providers. 


We are looking for an exceptional leader with a strong technical product background in the internet or network service provider industry who will own end-to-end service definition and delivery for network connectivity services. 


Working alongside a team of network architects, sales consultants, and software development team, you will own service definition, roadmap and detailed product requirements for a set of cloud connectivity services to enhance the Oracle cloud service offerings.


As the service lead you will:



  • drive the strategy, direction and plans to deliver high quality features at a fast pace in alignment with customer as well organizational expectations;

  • build strong partnerships with global service providers to expand our connectivity service offerings for cloud customers and aggressively drive the connectivity ecosystem through its life-cycle across multiple global datacenters;

  • define the requirements and specifications for API-based integration, automated self-service capabilities, automated provisioning, reporting and any additional functionality  to create an excellent user experience by creatively leveraging software development and network architecture teams. 


In collaboration with the sales and marketing teams you will deliver high quality product collateral, influence pricing decisions as well as create the right positioning for the various options and services. 


The role requires you to continuously monitor the evolving trends in cloud connectivity and network services and support the pre-sale as well as consulting teams as the SME on customer connectivity into Oracle cloud services.

jobs.title: .NET Web Developer
jobs.content:
We plan to broaden our product offerings by building out our web ‘chrome’ to better surface our capabilities to our clients.


Therefore we want to establish a new web development team to carry out these plans.

jobs.title: Software Engineer - iOS
jobs.content:
Our Mobile Software Engineering Team work on the cutting edge to produce high-quality mobile apps for both iOS and Android. We are now on the lookout for an iOS Software Engineer to join this dynamic team. If your heart beats a bit faster when you are writing clean code and if you have a natural instinct for spotting new trends or technologies then we want to hear from you. Our Software Engineering teams help to shape the future of the world’s largest hotel search. With around 3 billion requests per month, we are operating on a large scale, complex and rapidly evolving IT landscape. We encourage all team members to question established processes and give them the freedom to experiment with new technologies in order to drive trivago to the next level.


Your responsibilities:



  • Develop our mobile apps in an agile environment.

  • Use your expert knowledge to bring fresh new ideas to the table.

  • Analyze feature requests and then plan & implement them in a test-driven way.

  • Create and review pull requests in order to achieve the best possible solution.

  • Contribute to the maintenance and development of new and existing open source components.

  • Exchange ideas and share your knowledge with the rest of the team and participate in pair programming.

jobs.title: Senior Javascript Engineer
jobs.content:
Help us revolutionize E-commerce by building real-time 3D customization tools with a world class team of creative, smart and passionate people in the heart of Berlin!


mycs is changing the way we buy things online. Our vision is to revolutionize E-commerce. All our products are sold using photorealistic, real-time 3D customization tools. In the past, we have built Massivkonzept, the leading online shop for customized furniture. mycs builds on this experience and is currently building a team in Berlin, focusing on building cutting edge technology and improving the E-commerce customer experience.


We are looking for a enthusiastic


Senior JavaScript Developers (AngularJS/Node.js) (m/f)


As one of our Senior JavaScript Developer (m/f) you will play a major role in our development team and help us create a fabulous E-commerce platform with cutting edge 3D customization tools.



YOUR TASKS



  • You design and implement efficient and reusable software and web-applications for our Ecommerce platform with its demanding real-time 3D customization tools

  • You work closely with our international, highly skilled and professional development team in an agile development environment

  • You identify and address performance issues

  • You train yourself continuously to ensure that your skills are up to date


OUR OFFER


Join a creative, smart, self-motivated, and experienced group of people at a successful company where your input will make a real difference. We offer a competitive compensation package, flexible working times, and great opportunity for advancement and long-term career building. We invest in the personal development of our people and provide high-end equipment for their work.


We work in short cycles in order to adapt our software continuously to our business needs. We like to use the newest available technologies and mainly use open source solutions when it comes to development. We work in small, agile teams using methodologies such as SCRUM, Kanban, pair programming, TDD/BDD and continuous integration/deployment. Your ideas are always welcome, even if they mean that we have to change a lot of code to make things better. Besides a dynamic, highly motivated international team, you will find minimal hierarchies, quick decision-making and a pleasant working atmosphere.


For more details: https://de.mycs.com/career

jobs.title: Software Development Engineer  Middle Tier/Backend Services
jobs.content:
Software Development Engineer – Middle Tier/Backend Services Contract-to-hire or direct placement


Are you an experienced Developer looking for a growth company in a hot market? Are you interested in developing cutting-edge technology that delivers live video streaming over the Internet?  Live streaming is exploding like never before and now is the time to capitalize on this opportunity. We partner with top broadcasters around the world to deliver high-quality, live sporting events for cable “cord-cutters” while also powering traditional TV channels.  If you viewed any of the past several Olympics, SuperBowls, EPL soccer matches, NASCAR races, PGA tournaments or other large-scale live events online, you’ve witnessed firsthand how we are powering next-generation internet broadcasting


We are the leader in online live events and OTT live linear broadcasting and we are looking for strong Linux and Windows Developers to help us enable advanced broadcast TV workflows in the context of over-the-top (OTT) video delivery. Our flagship product is built from the ground up for the cloud…running on commodity hardware and virtualized environments. Unlike traditional Internet broadcasting solutions that take weeks/months to setup for a single channel of video, Our solution uses the power of public clouds to stand-up a channel in less than 15 minutes and at a fraction of the cost.
 
If you are self-motivated, a quick learner, breathe technical excellence, are energized by collaborative environments, embraces the challenges of building high-impact products and are passionate about delivering premier scalable services then you’ve found the right place.  You will play a significant role in the design and implementation of web services supporting distributed computing that are scalable, reliable and highly performant.

jobs.title: Sr. Software Engineer - Systems
jobs.content:
Software Development Engineer – Systems Contract-to-hire or direct hire


Are you an experienced developer looking for a small, stable, and rapidly growing company in a hot market? Are you interested in developing cutting-edge technology that delivers live television broadcasts over the Internet?  Live streaming is exploding like never before, and now is the time to capitalize on this opportunity.  We partner with top broadcasters around the world to deliver high-quality, live sporting events for cable “cord-cutters” while also powering traditional TV channels.  If you viewed any of the past several Olympics, SuperBowls, EPL soccer matches, NASCAR races, PGA tournaments or other large-scale live events online, you’ve witnessed firsthand how we are powering next-generation internet broadcasting.
 
Is your preferred language C++?  Are you passionate about shipping innovative products to a discerning customer base, and do you want to have fun doing so?  Then you might have what it takes to become a part of our engineering team!
 
We are the leader in online live events and internet-delivered traditional broadcast. To deliver great customer experiences, we are looking for strong C++ developers who can help us advance broadcast TV workflows for “over-the-top” video delivery. Our cloud-based live video streaming platform is custom-built to scale across commodity hardware and virtualized environments. Traditional Internet broadcasting solutions can require weeks or months to configure for a single channel of video, whereas our solution uses public cloud infrastructure and reduces this time to less than 15 minutes. Customers also love what we build because it operates at a fraction of the cost.
 
If you are self-motivated, a quick learner, breathe technical excellence, are energized by collaborative environments where things get done, embrace the challenges of building products from the ground up and are passionate about delivering best-in-class, scalable services, then you’ve found the right place.  Here, you will play a major role in the design and implementation of a world-class media workflow platform which controls up to thousands of broadcast channels.

jobs.title: Sr. Software Developer for Hulu's Website!
jobs.content:
SUMMARY


At Hulu we have a million things we have to do to redefine TV, and all of them manifest on the web site in some way. The site team builds the hulu.com mobile and desktop web experiences using cutting-edge front end technologies. We are a group of fast-moving but detail-oriented engineers who sweat every pixel and obsess over every line of code to provide an immaculate user experience. Working closely with product, user experience, design and program management teams we work relentlessly to deliver industry-changing features and business models, while optimizing and enhancing the entire media watching experience for our users. We also have a ton of fun along the way.


WHAT YOU’LL DO



  • Mentor and guide team through process and architectural improvements to drive quality, speed and agility

  • Work on Hulu’s full-stack web framework

  • Monitor, measure and improve Hulu.com’s performance

  • Interact with millions of viewers to create the best possible media experience

  • Collaborate with researchers, program managers, and product designers in an open, creative environment

  • Recruit, hire and mentor developers

jobs.title: Senior Lead Performance Engineer - Embedded Systems and Networking
jobs.content:
Broadcom Limited is seeking a system performance expert to work in our Software organization at a Master Engineer level.


A successful candidate will have deep system knowledge and a enthusiasm for exploring performance characteristics, and defining/automating performance benchmarking methodolgy. The position being filled will lead a performance team that measures and optimizes Broadcom's networking and embedded solutions.  The position will involve leadership of a focused performance team, and close interaction with Software and Hardware architecture and development teams.

jobs.title: Back-end Engineer
jobs.content:
LiveSafe is looking for a very talented back-end (full-stack) engineer to join our team. The LiveSafe platform is a robust 24/7/365 cloud-based system built using Scala and Akka and we are looking for an engineer who is passionate about developing world-class, highly scalable API services and systems. The ideal candidate has built enterprise-grade public and private APIs and services within a scalable, cloud-based architecture (preferably AWS).


You most likely identify as a:



  • Talented software engineer that loves building highly-scalable service-based applications

  • Polyglot that readily picks up new languages, frameworks, and tools

  • Maker that does not relent until finding an elegant and practical solution to a problem

  • Linux master who understands the value of automation and infrastructure as code

  • Collaborator that thrives in a social atmosphere and actively contributes to improving processes, workflows, and communication

  • Person who cares deeply that your work realizes positive outcomes for our world

jobs.title: Full Stack Javascript Developer
jobs.content:
We are looking for a kick-ass developer who has the chops to crank out elegant production quality javascript for both the front and backend of Virtru's digital privacy products. Together with the team, you will spend your days building Node.js backed APIs, web-based administrative dashboards, browser extensions, and native apps for both Google and Office365. You'll also have an opportunity to apply or gain operations experience keeping a production scale web service on AWS up and running smoothly 24/7. The ideal candidate will have a natural passion for digital privacy, software development, and great user experiences.


We are a fun group and want to keep it that way, which means you should be comfortable speaking your mind, drinking a few beers, eating ramen, and geeking out about side projects. Anyone who has trouble self-motivating is going to have a hard time. We don't want anyone that needs to be managed, so if you have trouble self-organizing with the assistance of a sprint board you shouldn't apply.


At this time we are not accepting applications from outside the continental USA.

jobs.title: Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Company Description


NAUTO is on a mission to make cities safer and more efficient with better drivers. If you like building robust systems that could benefit millions, we'd love to talk to you. We're looking for software engineers who love to design, build, and continuously improve high-performing and scalable systems.  If building these kinds of real time distributed systems appeals, we'd love to talk to you. You'll be part of a team of engineers that learns together, laughs together and loves to get real systems into customer's hands.


Job Description


You are an Mobile Software Engineer with solid experience building complex Android applications. You apply best computer science and object oriented design principles to creating an elegant mobile user experience and sophisticated functionality. You develop unit tests and integration tests to ensure quality and efficiency of the application. You participate in architecture, design and code reviews.

jobs.title: Sr. Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Company Description


NAUTO is on a mission to make cities safer and more efficient with better drivers. If you like building robust systems that could benefit millions, we'd love to talk to you. We're looking for software engineers who love to design, build, and continuously improve high-performing and scalable systems.  If building these kinds of real time distributed systems appeals, we'd love to talk to you. You'll be part of a team of engineers that learns together, laughs together and loves to get real systems into customer's hands.


Job Description


You are an Mobile Software Engineer with solid experience building complex Android system applications. You apply best computer science and object oriented design principles to creating sophisticated functionality and building highly efficient, robust, and scalable application at both native and JVM level. You develop unit tests and integration tests to ensure quality and efficiency of the application. You participate in architecture, design and code reviews.

jobs.title: Senior Full Stack Developer
jobs.content:
As an integral part of a small team, you will have the opportunity to introduce new technologies and solve unique problems. Your goal is to be efficient by coming up with elegant solutions and writing as little code as possible (work smarter, not harder).

  • Education: Bachelors degree desired
  • Benefits: Health care, paid vacation, work-from-home
  • Salary: Competitive, depending on experience

Some of our current technologies: PHP, Laravel, CodeIgnitor, WordPress, MySQL, Apache, ExtJS, Pentaho Kettle, NodeJS, Visual Studio, JQuery, AWS (S3, EMR, EC2, ElastiCache), Bootstrap

You will build and enhance our search marketing platform that is used by online marketers focused on search engines – SEM and SEO, social media, local search, mobile search, and shopping engines. Reporting provides marketers with competitive intelligence, brand policing, and policing of affiliate marketers.

jobs.title: Automation Engineer
jobs.content:
Vertex Inc is currently looking for an Automation Engineer will be responsible for designing, implementing and supporting the use of software development and testing operational frameworks. Employing DevOps concepts and approaches, the Automation Engineer will work with IT, development and testing personnel to maximize agility and minimize delays while maintaining an appropriate level of control and cost.

The candidate must demonstrate prior success in driving the implementation of virtual/cloud solutions (both private and hybrid) in support of software development and testing efforts, as well as success in leveraging process and governance automation to reduce cost and risk.

In addition, the candidate must demonstrate a strong knowledge of software development, testing and hosted deployment practices, including unit testing, building and packaging, build validation, software configuration management, functional and non-functional testing, user acceptance testing, product and release change management, code and data change promotion, and hosted solutions deployment coordination. 
 
Essential Job Functions & Responsibilities:


 
•    Manage the operational infrastructure supporting core software development, testing and operations using DevOps concepts and practices.
•    Interact with product managers, enterprise architecture, software development and operations to understand customer requirements and build large scale infrastructure automation and toolsets.
•    Design and develop hybrid cloud automation features in support of development, testing and operational objectives.
•    Develop a deep understanding of cloud architectures and ensure that product performs and scales
•    Support, troubleshoot, and maintain production and multiple environments across multiple data centers and providers
•    Design and manage a flexible, automated resource provisioning framework that facilitates the rapid expansion and contraction of resources as needed.  
•    Define and govern configuration and change management practices for such frameworks as outlined above.
•    Introduce and foster DevOps concepts and approaches to improve business agility and release quality.
•    Mentor and train others on concepts, practices, and tools related to the above.
•    Other functions may be assigned and management retains the right to add or change the duties at any time.

jobs.title: Sr. Systems Engineer/DevOps Engineer
jobs.content:
Vertex Inc. is currently looking for a Sr. Systems Engineer to provide technical leadership to the Test Infrastructure Engineers, Systems Engineers, Automation Engineers, and related personnel engaged in Development and Test Engineering Support at Vertex. Work with the group in a way that assures effective and efficient communications, collaboration, and integration between development, testing, information technology, product support, sales, consulting, and online operations. Insure integrated solutions across the business in support of in-market and emerging products and services. Interface with Strategy Teams, Work Center Leadership, and Key Focus Areas as necessary to understand and deliver infrastructure, automation, solutions, service and support in line with business priorities, budget, and investment objectives.


Essential Job Functions & Responsibilities: 



  • Provide leadership to support in-market solutions 

  • Provide guidance and oversight of troubleshooting activities on cross-functional issues;

  • Provide technical support for Vertex’s existing services and solutions in support of development and testing activities;

  • Investigate any reported problems with the existing automation or solutions;

  • Ensure that full documentation exists for all services and solutions in place.  Author documentation or modify existing documentation where gaps exist;

  • Manage system changes in accordance with established asset, configuration, and change management policies and procedure.

  • Provide leadership in the architecture and design of new and emerging solutions

  • Lead the service and support efforts required by business and technical stakeholders of product teams, consulting, product support, and online operations;

  • Ensure that established SLA's are met or exceeded;

  • Collaborate with business and technical stakeholders on planning and status updates as necessary;

  • Document options and tradeoffs (both functional and technical) as well as estimated development effort as requested;

  • Implement new and enhanced solutions as necessary in response to new or existing business objectives and time lines. 

  • Deliver information technology expertise to Vertex business initiatives

  • Build and maintain a deep working knowledge of all technical and business imperatives  of business stakeholders across Vertex, including key integration points and functionality;

  • Identify relevant application system information, alternatives and solutions based upon subject-matter expertise and experience;

  • Manage process and procedure development, representing technical and infrastructure support needs;

  • Provide thought leadership on new initiatives. Insure that new services, solutions, or automation is deployed in a manner consistent with Vertex’s existing infrastructure standards and practices;

  • Participate on, and lead, Vertex project teams as required;

  • Represent technology-area knowledge as it relates to matters at hand;

  • Manage user expectations and deliverables using project management methodologies;

  • Be responsible for delivery against commitments.

  • Lead or participate in other projects or duties.  

  • Occasional travel may be required. 

  • Other functions may be assigned and management retains the right to add or change the duties at any time.

jobs.content:
Want to make a Difference?


Market6 is seeking a versatile Software Engineer to help us build out a solution pipeline for ingesting interesting data sources, cleaning and analyzing that data, and powering business insights for our customers through Market6’s REST API.



  • Collaborating with other Market6 technical leaders to design scalable solutions for ingesting and processing external data sources

  • Develop and evolve Market6’s REST API

  • Utilize Agile practices to deliver value to Market6 customers in a timely manner

  • Cultivate best practices within the engineering groups

jobs.title: Software Engineer
jobs.content: We're looking for super smart, talented software engineers to work on crazy hard problems.  We're most interested in people who have strong backgrounds in Computer Science theory, are good with algorithms, and are generally quick on their feet (err... keyboards).  Above all, we want people who love data and lots of it!

jobs.title: Android Sensor SDK Engineer
jobs.content: Today's smartphones have as many as twenty different sensors, opening up new possibilities for intelligent applications. Factual is seeking a talented engineer to help us leverage these modern smartphone capabilities into an SDK building on top of our industry-leading location platform. Far from being mere API glue, our work touches interesting areas such as signal analysis algorithms and functional programming helping to power the next generation of location-enabled apps.

jobs.title: Node / Angular / Javascript Engineer
jobs.content:
As we rebuild many of our core experiences, we are seeking talented people who are excited to join our team. This is a rare opportunity to join a company embracing a modern Technology culture, where you will have the ability to improve peoples lives in a very meaningful way and have a major impact on Weight Watchers offerings to our members. As reliance on health and wellness awareness increases, you can be be part of the team that is leading the way.

To help us achieve our goals, we are seeking Node Software Engineers to join our team. You will leverage your knowledge to develop new consumer focused products using modern Engineering such as Continuous Integration and Deployment. As a developer at Weight Watcher, your code, designs and decisions will be highly visible, and will directly impact and delight lots of users. 



What you will do: 




  • Program daily in node.js, AngularJS, Express, Jade, Bootstrap and others.

  • Build out restful endpoints and lightweight aggregation layers.

  • Build out unit tests and other automated tests.

  • Build out new features and iterate on existing features.

  • Design and implement low-latency, high-availability and performant applications 

  • Enable analytics via tag management and logs.

  • Help define architectures and design patterns.

  • Participate in code reviews.

  • Answer technical inquiries on code base and product Lead the way with writing programmatic unit tests.

jobs.title: Technical Product Manager
jobs.content:
Live who you are. That’s our philosophy. At Corcoran we build our business around this very human truth — making every effort to understand the hopes, dreams, and unique personalities of our clients. Then we use that understanding, and all our resources, to find homes that go beyond the checklist, and even the wish list, to that wonderful feeling you get when something just feels right.


The Agent Experience team builds features and mobile-first products that empower agents with best-in-class technology to deepen their relationships with customers, improve their workflow and efficiency, and expand their business. Corcoran is dedicated to nurturing, supporting and attracting the top real estate agents in our markets. You will be at the center of that mission.

jobs.title: Sr. Software Developer
jobs.content:
Reporting to the Development Manager, the Senior Developer is responsible for designing and implementing new development projects as well completing and augmenting the current solutions and services. They will collaborate with Technical Product Managers, Developers, Technical Writing and Quality Assurance throughout the development process to ensure the product is functionally complete and well-engineered. This is an excellent opportunity to join a rapidly growing innovator in a technically challenging and rewarding role. Through our training and mentoring program, you will develop deep technical expertise and gain valuable business and industry related experience. Responsibilities



  • Analyze, design, prototype, develop , test and support – complete software

  • lifecycle in your hands

  • Work with clients, prospects, implementation partners, and Dayforce personnel to envision and deliver the required functionality

  • Create and enhance a scalable enterprise application

  • Assess risks and impacts on the existing system as new functions are added

  • Ability to do effective code reviews of peer work

  • Mentor other developers and share knowledge

jobs.title: Senior Ruby Developer
jobs.content:
WeCounsel is a high growth startup here is beautiful Chattanooga, TN. We just closed our Series A funding round and are rapidly growing our team to meet demand for our product. We value hard work and a "whatever it takes" mentality. You have the opportunity to get in on the bottom floor, have significant input on the final product, and make a meaningful impact on the company. This is a golden opportunity to gain valued development/startup experience.


Your primary responsibilities will include maintaining and developing new features for a thoroughly unit-tested Rails application. Most work will be on the server-side, but knowledge of JavaScript and CSS is required. You will need to write readable, secure, and well-performing Ruby and JavaScript code. You should be able to understand business requirements and translate them creatively into software solutions, using best practices of object-oriented design. Familiarity with developing a JSON API is helpful. Experience developing native Android and iPhone apps would be advantageous.


Benefits


Stock option incentive

Bonus based on performance metrics

Health benefits

jobs.title: .Net Developer
jobs.content:
Live who you are. That’s our philosophy. At Corcoran we build our business around this very human truth — making every effort to understand the hopes, dreams, and unique personalities of our clients. Then we use that understanding, and all our resources, to find homes that go beyond the checklist, and even the wish list, to that wonderful feeling you get when something just feels right.


The Agent Experience team builds features and products that empower agents with best-in-class technology to deepen their relationships with customers, improve their workflow and efficiency, and expand their business. Corcoran is dedicated to nurturing, supporting and attracting the top real estate agents in our markets. You will be at the center of that mission.


We are looking for a C# Developer responsible for building C# applications, including anything from back-end services to their client-end counterparts. Your primary responsibilities will be to design and develop these applications, and to coordinate with the rest of the team working on different layers of the infrastructure. Therefore, a commitment to collaborative problem solving, sophisticated design, and quality product is essential.


Responsibilities will include:



  • Translating application user stories and use cases into functional applications

  • Designing, building, and maintaining efficient, reusable, and reliable C# code

  • Ensuring the best possible performance, quality, and responsiveness of applications

  • Identifying bottlenecks and bugs, and devise solutions to these problems

  • Helping to maintain code quality, organization, and automatization

jobs.title: Senior Rails Engineer
jobs.content: Everything we do involves maps and data, with a focus on usability and simplicity. We build geospatial technology products with an intense focus on solving real world problems. We help governments make better decisions by thinking spatially, streamline mobile workforces for commercial energy markets, and build tools for companies large and small to manage their data with ruthless efficiency. You would be joining a team of motivated engineers, geographers, and designers who spend everyday learning, teaching, and advancing the state of the art in geospatial technology.

jobs.title: Senior Front End Developer
jobs.content:
Live who you are. That’s our philosophy. At Corcoran we build our business around this very human truth — making every effort to understand the hopes, dreams, and unique personalities of our clients. Then we use that understanding, and all our resources, to find homes that go beyond the checklist, and even the wish list, to that wonderful feeling you get when something just feels right.


The Agent Experience team builds features and products that empower agents with best-in-class technology to deepen their relationships with customers, improve their workflow and efficiency, and expand their business. Corcoran is dedicated to nurturing, supporting and attracting the top real estate agents in our markets. You will be at the center of that mission.


As a Senior End Software Developer, you will specialize in building responsive and elegant web UIs with AJAX, bleeding edge HTML/CSS specs, advanced JavaScript libraries and similar technologies.


Responsibilities will include:



  • Creating maintainable front end AngularJS applications that implement the designs and interactions desired by the product owners.

  • Laying out what would be required of the back end API to be used by the web application.

  • Working with an API Developer to optimize calls based on how it is used by the web application.

  • Working with 3rd party libraries, primarily Google Maps API, to work and integrate with the web application.

  • Providing alternatives and solutions for issues that arise.

jobs.title: Web Application Developer
jobs.content:
The development team at onPeak is looking for a developer who loves all things database.  We don’t just want someone to administer backups and configure user accounts.  We want someone who can do low level performance tuning and optimization of stored procs.  Someone who sits in the land between devops and development with a mind for databases.  Automation surrounding the deployment of schema changes, performance optimization in AWS EC2, caching layer optimizations are all examples of responsibilities of the job.  This person should swim in SQL, marathon in mongo, and relish in redis and not be afraid of some complexity and getting their hands dirty.


The Database Developer (Web Application Developer) role first and foremost responsibility is the performance, scalability and reliability of our data layer.  This is primarily our MSSQL cluster which drives multiple high availability web applications, but also includes redis caching layers, Amazon Redshift datawarehouses, and mongoDB session databases.   This position would also be deeply involved in database versioning systems and automated deployment of schema changes.


This position will report to the Director of Software Development.


Our small team of 10 is super casual.  Even Jake from State Farm is a little formal for our office.  Our team is all friendly and enjoy regular game nights, movie outtings, cook offs, etc.  But if you are the loner type that is fine by us as well - nothing social is ever manditory.  We all think it's a top priority to actually like coming to work.  


Our prevailing technological philosophy is a combination of simplicity and automation.  Never do by hand what a machine can do better and with fewer errors.  Pair programming for newer devs, and code reviews through pull requests are some of the ways we like to introduce and teach people about our application stack.

jobs.title: Web Developer
jobs.content:
Please note: NO VISA SPONSORSHIP is available for this position


Universal Laser Systems is a world-class leader, pioneering the future of laser technology by creating innovative solutions that enable people to bring ideas which positively impact the world, to life.  Be a key part of Universal’s dynamic Marketing team.  We are looking for an exceptional Web Architect/Sr. Developer who will lead in this role.


Are you a Web Architect/Sr. Developer, looking for a phenomenal and exciting opportunity? Do you love the upbeat feeling and excitement of a start up with the security of a tenured company? Do you enjoy working with a collaborative team of developers AND working on your own as well?

If this sounds like you, keep reading...

We are targeting a highly-motivated Web Architect/ Sr. Developer to join a high-performance team to build out a brand-new, next-generation corporate web presence.  You must be a strong contributor with a high-quality mindset, be able to adapt quickly to leverage emerging technologies, and utilize your demonstrable experience and dedication to ensure that our customers are delighted by and excited about our products. The Web Architect /Sr. Developer will work closely with the Marketing Operations Manager, other designers and developers, and IT as part of an agile team.

jobs.title: Senior Full-Stack Developer
jobs.content:
Ansira is looking for a multi-talented full stack developer/engineer to join our growing team. In this role you will work closely with our development leads and project managers in a fast paced environment to plan, develop, test, and deploy client-based web projects. These projects range from responsive and mobile websites/apps to custom CMS’s and full-featured web applications.


The engineer we are looking for is a full stack developer with a focus on Javascript – someone who can comfortably work in both server side and client side technologies such as Node.js and AngularJS, as well as HTML and CSS. The “stack” we usually develop in varies between traditional LAMP stacks to a more progressive Nginx/Node.js web stack (think MEAN). We do not work exclusively in a single framework, but rather use the one best suited for each project’s needs – open source or custom.


In this role, you would be responsible for helping our lead engineer to develop both the front end and back end for feature requirements; engineering technical solutions both functional and visual. You must have a strong passion for learning new things, exploring new ways of doing things, and staying up to date with the latest technologies. Creative problem solving, attention to detail, and clean code is a must. Collaboration is also a large part of our team culture so the ability to work with others is important.




What You Will Do:



  • Build both front-end and back-end solutions using the latest web technologies

  • Participate in all aspects of development (planning, architecture, development and deployment)

  • Collaborate with development leads and other developers/engineers to solve problems and complete projects successfully and on time

  • Participate in peer code reviews and pair-programming

  • Refactor and optimize code

  • Share knowledge with and mentor junior developers

jobs.title: Full Stack Engineer - Online Travel Technology
jobs.content:
You'll be a core member of our team -


Help guide the company and technology in a direction you find exciting. From day 1, software you write will be used by people from all over the world. You'll also grow as a developer: teaching each other about concepts and technologies is a core part of our culture. We even schedule time every week to explore an interest or learn something new. There's no risk of stagnation in this job - in a few years you'll still have cutting edge programming skills.


We're a close-knit team located in the gorgeous Flatiron building in Atlanta and have a variety of challenging work on our plates. A typical day can consist of everything from optimizing the fare prediction system in the morning to putting the finishing touches on a CSS animation in the afternoon. Our work spans multiple technologies, cultures, and languages (both programming and spoken), so we value high quality communication and a continuous process of learning from each other.



Make travelling easier -

Volantio improves the end-to-end airfare marketing/search/purchase process for some of the worlds biggest airlines, from being honest about prices in ads, to delivering emails that only contain real fares that you actually care about. If you've ever seen an anger-inducing email from an airline with prices that are a blatant lie: we fix that, and even make the recipient happy to see our messages. 


Our airline partners like what we do so much that some have even made tv advertisements to promote their use of our software.

jobs.title: Seeking a UI and API Engineer for DF Studio's Great Redesign.
jobs.content:
Ah, the dreaded job description.  Believe it or not, it’s actually as difficult to write a good job description to catch your interest as it is to write a catchy resume and cover letter that catches our interest.


So why don’t we just get right to it.  Here’s the 6 item tl;dr checklist before you hit the apply button:



  1. Read this: We’re hiring! and Personal Hints for Resume and Cover Letter Writing

  2. Have you done work in Java?

  3. Have you done work on the front end?

  4. Are you employable in the US and live in one of these states: CA, OR, WA, NE.

  5. Write a cover letter telling us about your favorite project.


Completed those tasks?  Now let me tell you about the job.


After a decade of our current UI, we're ready to make an upgrade to a more responsive, modern UI to help improve our clients' workflow. Are you up for that challenge?


The product, DF Studio (www.dfstudio.com), is a professional photo asset management tool used by industry professionals (from small studios to the likes of HBO, Fox, and A&E) for their day to day asset management. Their work is data heavy, image heavy, and fast.


Our (you included) focus will be to navigate the waters of client needs and their established workflow to help improve the experience and efficiency of using DF Studio. We’re looking for ways to redesign with clean, functional, fast, and elegant UI/UX paradigms to allow our clients to get their jobs done even better than now, whether on a desktop, laptop, phone, or a tablet and even watches. Basically if it has a screen (or even something without a screen), we want to make sure they can use it to get their work done better.


Your tools? We’re just starting now so the sooner you can get in the door, the sooner we can hear what you have to suggest. We're exploring frameworks including AngularJS and Aurelia, libraries such as Knockout, and different CSS systems such as Bootstrap and Semantic UI. Keep in mind that we're looking for responsiveness, ability to package and build pages uniformly and easily, and creating clean and reusable code.


Our backend is written in Java/Kotlin so there will be responsibilities to create new APIs and modify existing backend code. We are a small team so you may need to get comfortable with accessing the full stack: AWS/EC2, Postgres, Linux command line, JSPs, Java/Kotlin, Javascript, Tomcat as well as taking on client facing duties: social postings, support, client training, etc. It’s everything in one job. You’ll learn a lot.


Are you still interested? If you are, so are we. This is a full-time, remote position with light (3-4 times a year) travel requirements to the main office in Culver City, CA. At this time though, we can only accept US residents and our list of preferred states are: California, Oregon, Washington, and Nebraska. Something about taxes and employment laws our lawyer and accountant asked us to mention.


If you've gotten this far, go ahead and hit the Apply button and send us your CV and cover letter. Actually, in lieu of a cover letter (which I’m sure wasn’t going to be a generic one right?), give us a short story about your favorite project (paid or unpaid, we all have our side projects that mean a lot to us). Keep in mind what we wrote above and find the relevance. Think of this as our test of your writing skills.  Our development team is small and spread out across various states so clear and concise communication is crucial.


Oh, and be sure to address your cover letter to Michael.  This is a small test to make sure you actually read and understand what it is we're asking of you, which is another crucial aspect of this job.  You'll be surprised how many people don't.  Consider yourself an exception.


Good luck, but it’s not luck that will get you through :)


      6. Now go ahead and hit the Apply button.

jobs.title: Javascript Automation Engineer
jobs.content:
This is a great opportunity to have a highly visible position within the company as you will be a key contributor to improving our software quality and development processes. You will NOT be "the QA person" who runs tests all day or has new untested code thrown your way and told to write tests for it. You will work collaboratively with the rest of the development team to introduce new tools/processes to improve software quality and improve team productivity.

jobs.title: Senior Java Developer and Cybercrime Fighter
jobs.content:
Hi! We're looking for a Software Developer to join our growing development team. If you've ever wanted to work for an innovative software company, in great environment with great people, this is your chance. We’re a security software-as-a-service company so you’ll be involved both in our day-to-day software development as well as getting exposure to our security efforts.


Q: Ok.  Who are you guys?


A: We’re Wombat Security Technologies. We’re comprised of a some really smart white hat security hackers, researchers from CMU, software developers and lot of hard working and friendly faces. We also really like pie.


Q: What would I be working on?


A: You know all those data breaches your hear about in the news? Most of them started when a bad guy targeted an employee with a phishing attack. You’ll be working on our cloud-based SaaS user risk management and training service. Our customers are mostly large enterprise organizations that are under attack by some pretty nasty bad guys. They use our platform to deliver security education to their employees and figure out who needs extra help.Your job will be to make our customers' experience of securing their users from attack delightful and beautiful.


Q: Can you tell me a little more about your product?


A: Sure, we have several different ways that we can deliver security training to end users as well as several different ways to assess the their security knowledge. One of the really fun ways we test the user is thinking like the bad guys. We send the end users a simulated phishing message. If they fall for it (they click our link, open our attachment, etc.), we show them training right away. It's an unconventional approach to changing user behavior and it works (hint: we have data). Wombat is in a growing space to say the least. If you ever wanted to learn more about cybersecurity and cutting-edge attacks, this is the where to do it. You’ll get to help simulate evil, figure out how to fight evil, and give our customers data that they can use to protect their organization.


Q: Where is this position located?


A: Pittsburgh, PA where our HQ office is located in the Strip District. But don’t let that fool you--we don’t value butts in seats over productivity.


Q: What will my day-to-day be like as a developer on the team?


A: You’ll be working on a key component that have high value and visibility to the organization. It’s a polyglot environment but you’ll do mostly java but you’ll also work on our web app using javascript and ember.js. You’ll keep in touch with the team using Slack, Google Hangouts, and even an ol' IP phone if you’d prefer.


Q: What tools do I have at my disposal?


A: Whatever enables you to do your best work (Within reason. A Tesla won’t help your write code faster, sorry). Most of our developers use a Mac or an Ubuntu laptop.


Q: What hours will I work?


A: We work typical office hours —  but value productivity, performance, and results: happy customers and code shipped. We’re in a competitive space, so sometimes there are long hours. But we all have families so we aim for a good work-life balance. Yes, we know everyone says that but seriously, many people here have kids or super likable dogs (or the rare acceptable cat). There are occasional late nights, but we get the balance thing.



Q: What technology do you use?


A: We're built entirely within Amazon Web Services. Sample of our stack: Linux, load balancers, auto-scaling, sidekiq, redis, ansible, git, Splunk, HIDS, two-factor auth, disk encryption, and a lot of cool security stuff that you probably aren't used to seeing. Also coffee (optional but recommended).


Q: What benefits do you offer?


A: The salary is competitive and depends on your experience. We offer the following:



  • Medical, dental, and vision insurance

  • 401k with company match

  • Time off for vacations, illness and holidays

jobs.title: Search Engineer
jobs.content:
Why is search important for stubhub.

Stubhub search serves millions of requests per day, to discover and explore new events and tickets across the world.

Our team owns everything from infrastructure, to ranking, to search api for internal and external customers.We are a diverse team with a wide variety of skills and expertise.We are creating the next generation platform to power the future of search and discovery experience at Stubhub.


Stubhub is looking for engineers across a wide variety of areas - Rest API, Indexing Platform, Ranking and Relevance with Solr/Lucene.People who will especially enjoy this position are those who like designing/architecting and developing scalable, highly available, fault tolerant distributed systems for processing large volumes of data and search queries.

Bonus points for experience

You will be responsible for ensuring the organization’s continuing adherence to applicable standards and regulations. jobs.title: Senior/Lead Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Join our dynamic team of innovators hard at work building the future of education. From our offices in Seattle and San Francisco, we make it possible for people everywhere to learn what they want and do what they love.


Founded with the belief that world-class education can (and should) be available to everyone, CreativeLive connects photographers, crafters, musicians, and entrepreneurs of all walks of life with top-notch learning from industry leaders. Whether a weekend warrior or the newly full-time freelancer, CreativeLive gives students the tools and the encouragement to make it happen, whatever "it" might be for them..


CreativeLive is looking for talented lead and senior engineers with at least five years of professional experience to build a new agile team in our Seattle office operating under a principle of "aligned autonomy" with our San Francisco technical teams.  You and your team will be forging a new frontier in learning applications, leveraging and contributing to open source technology.


Our platform is built on Node.js and Angular.js, and the ideal candidate will be excited about applying their strong coding and architecture skills to an end-to-end JavaScript stack. 


Along with your fellow engineers, you'll be working with design and product to continuously improve the CreativeLive site and internal tools by:



  • iterating on prototypes

  • architecting modules and applications

  • refactoring existing parts of the site

  • extending our content management system

  • interfacing with (and creating) web services 

  • improving the scalability and fault tolerance of our distributed systems

  • extending our container-based deployment system

  • actively contributing to refining our Agile development processes


Lead engineer responsibilities additionally include:



  • taking ownership of definition, scoping, and timely implementation by the team

  • identifying and escalating risk

  • leading by example, not by words

  • mentoring and leveling up the team


Some of the things that would make you a great fit for our team:



  • You embody creativity, positivity, and exploration, and are inspired by our mission.

  • You are an active contributor in the technical community.

  • You care deeply about code quality, performance and execution.

  • You understand that software engineering is a team sport.

  • You're passionate about learning and sharing what you've learned.

jobs.title: Sr. Software Engineer, HubSpot CRM Backend
jobs.content:
HubSpot CRM is our fast-growing free CRM product. We’re changing the way salespeople sell to be more like the way people want to buy. High-pressure, pushy sales tactics are on the way out and HubSpot CRM is the tool that helps salespeople work with buyers, not against them.


Help us un-suck sales.


We have a ton of technical challenges on our plate and need talented engineers with experience in Java to help us out. In the last few months, we’ve:



  • Integrated HubSpot CRM with Google Apps to automatically track conversations

  • Designed sales pipelines to help sales-people track their deals the way we use trello

  • Continued to develop our scalable, relational database using HBase and Elasticsearch


We want HubSpot CRM to be like the “Gmail” of CRM. The free CRM that every small and medium sized business can use with no hassle. Today we have tens of thousands of users. To get to hundreds of thousands, or even millions of users, we have our work cut out for us. We need a system that works no matter what. A backend that’s built for scale. A product that’s so damn easy to use because we do all the hard work for the user.

jobs.title: Software Engineer- Javascript
jobs.content:
The Video Cloud Studio is a sophisticated suite of web applications for uploading, managing and publishing video.  We're looking for smart, passionate developers to build the world's best front-end web application experience and the services around it.


We are a young and rapidly growing product looking to expand our team. We are looking for an accomplished developer who wants to be a technical leader for video on the web, and a critical contributor to our online service. We’re looking for someone smart and nice. Someone who learns quickly. Someone who has an entrepreneurial spirit, and the drive to take a product from great to amazing.



About You We don’t care much about years of experience or knowledge of particular technologies. We do care that we enjoy working with you, and that you will write high quality, resilient features, and will delight our customers no matter what it takes.


We use a Backbone.js, React.js, Node.js and Mongo stack, hosted in AWS, so either experience or interest in learning these technologies is important.



Responsibilities




  • Contributing to the Video Cloud studio, a modern and sophisticated family of Single Page Applications.




  • Experimenting with, evaluating, and building on emerging web technologies




  • Researching and experimenting with new web technologies as they emerge




  • Producing software that will be used by a wide range of companies and passionate users





Qualifications




  • MS/BS in Computer Science or related background




  • 2-3 years of front-end development experience with HTML, CSS, and JavaScript, and related JavaScript frameworks such as Backbone, React, or similar technologies




  • Strong communication skills




  • History of disciplined test-driven development




  • Experience building scalable web applications





The Perks


We offer a fun work environment, competitive compensation, stock options, 401k matching, and tuition reimbursement. We also offer unlimited vacation — and expect you to use it.


We look forward to hearing from you!

jobs.title: Android Software Development Engineer II -comiXology
jobs.content:
Android Development Engineer



ComiXology, has revolutionized the comic book and graphic novel industry by delivering a cloud-based digital comics platform that makes discovering, buying, and reading comics more fun than ever before.



We are looking for an Android Development Engineer to join our mobile Android development team to help us undergo a refactor of our current Android and Kindle Fire/Fire Phone apps, and thereafter work on integration projects with Amazon’s systems and help to implement innovative consumer features. Our goal is to provide exciting, innovative and diverse work to keep both our staff and consumers engaged. We promise you will not be bored; in fact your efforts will directly impact our millions of users who rave about our products as much as we do.



What You’ll Do:

· Join a team of software engineers responsible for the design, development, and testing of the comiXology Android and Kindle apps, and participate in the design of underlying RESTful APIs

· Help define UI/UX and promote best practices within the Android ecosystem

· Take on daily challenges providing creative problem solving recommendations

· Mentor and contribute knowledge to the rest of the team and the organization

 

Who You Are and What You Do:

- 3+ years experience working with the following technologies:

- Java and the JDK

-Extensive knowledge of the Android Developers Kit

-Advanced Android UI Skills (Fragments, Custom view components)

- Writing multi-threaded apps

- Eclipse, IntelliJ or Android Studio

- Application submission/provisioning process

- Debugging and analysis skills using ADB

- Proficiency in object oriented development and ability to apply OO concepts

- Excellent interpersonal, business management, time management, and developmental skills.

Experience with version control - Git preferred

- Demonstrated ability to meet or beat assigned targets and deadlines under normal circumstances, and ability to make trade-offs and when needed to optimize outcome when conditions change -

Ability to communicate with other employees in the company in both technical and non-technical roles.

- Degree in computer science or equivalent degree



Would Be Great, But Not Required:

· Have designed and developed a complete Android app from top to bottom

· Have worked with OpenGL or the NDK and high performance graphics code

· Web Services experience as it relates to mobile apps

· Solid understanding of Android UI paradigms from Gingerbread to Lollipop and Amazon Mobile SDK (Kindle Fire, Fire Phone)

· Experience with protocol buffers

· You tell great jokes

· You enjoy Bagel Breakfast Wednesdays

· You have some experience developing for other mobile platforms (iOS, Windows Phone, etc.)

· You’re a fan of comics!

· Are an inspiration for innovation



About Us:

ComiXology, an Amazon.com, Inc. subsidiary (NASDAQ:AMZN), has revolutionized the comic book and graphic novel industry by delivering a cloud-based digital comics platform that makes discovering, buying, and reading comics more fun than ever before. ComiXology’s Guided View reading technology transforms the comic book medium into an immersive and cinematic experience, helping comiXology become a top ten grossing iPad app in 2011 and 2012 and the top grossing non-game iPad app in 2012 and 2013. Offering the broadest library of comic book content from over 75 publishers - and independent creators as well - comiXology will not stop until everyone on the face of the planet has become a comic book fan.



comiXology is an EEO/AAP employer.

jobs.title: IT Technical Associate
jobs.content:
The Department of Psychiatry is seeking to hire an Information Technology Technical Associate to be involved in all aspects of design, coordination, development and implementation of a SQL server database incorporating data for the Clinical Services in Psychopharmacology consent consultation program and payment data from the IL Department of Healthcare and Family Services. This large system is used for consultation and research of the utilization of psychotropic medication for children in the custody of the Department of children and Family Services of Illinois.  This software system is developed based on C# .Net and SQL server focusing on Database Normalization, Indexing, Triggers, Views and Reporting in an agile methodology for advance system analysis and flexible solutions.


These positions provide technical expertise and support for operating systems and equipment configurations. This includes the implementation and maintenance of operating systems and software components, providing assistance in the development and assessment of hardware and software components, recommending optimum equipment and software configurations, and providing technical guidance with regard to proper data processing methods, performance standards, security measures, and systems analysis.


Contract positions are positions where work is performed away from the main campus location and/or a primary campus site assigned to a primary funding source. This position has a primary funding source.


Characteristic Duties and Responsibilities


Duties may include designing data processing systems and/or hardware configurations, developing system assessment and testing criteria, evaluating user needs, programming systems and subsystems, developing documentation to support any new systems or system modifications, and developing/monitoring security protocols. Also included may be some supervisory activities or team leader responsibilities for more complex projects and training of user groups or other IT staff.


Database Administration


Assist in designing, development, and maintenance of a SQL server database.


Computer Programming


Working with the Illinois Department of Children and Family Services to design a web-based interface for the entry of clinical information required for medication consent requests.


Telecommunications


Designing programs for android mobile platforms that would allow consultants evaluating the psychotropic medication consent requests to complete their work while away from their office.


Supervision


Primary advisor and provides training to a multidisciplinary team on accurately utilizing the research Clinical Services in Psychopharmacology database and application.  Provides support for all database, computer, server and webpage functions for this team.


Quality Assurance


Design automation tests to continuously monitor the health of the software application, web pages and mobile application and address the potential issues in a timely manner. Audit multiple aspects of manual data entry to test for fidelity and will compare correspondence between reported data with actual payment data.


Reporting


Evaluate all functions of the Clinical Services in Psychopharmacology database and develop crystal reports to summarize data for multiple stakeholders in Illinois.


Research


Research and data analysis, writing queries to pull data for specific research and administrative projects and work with statisticians to generate data in ways that allow it to be statistically analyzed.

jobs.title: Software Engineer
jobs.content:
The Software Engineer will help design and implement features in a cloud-based web architecture.  Must be able to participate in a highly collaborated and innovative team.  The Software Engineer is expected to be results-driven and self-motivated, and he or she should have experience with JavaScript, HTML, and software engineering principles (GR 42)

This person will design and implement web user interfaces that are functional, intuitive, and elegant.  These user interfaces will be in a single-page application that is part of a new cloud-based solution that uses Javascript, Typescript, CSS, HTML, ReST services, Java, AWS, and other emergent technologies.


Major Responsibilities/Activities



  • Work with team members to create innovative solutions to various feature requests.

  • Jump into various complex code-bases, understand them quickly, and develop features in a fast-past environment.

  • Work with stakeholders to refine the requirements for new features with an emphasis on creating a great user experience.

  • Actively participate in a highly collaborative Agile development process to meet delivery dates and other goals.

  • Demonstrate the ability to be thorough and detailed oriented in looking at all aspects of the solution including: localization, licensing, scalability, memory management, bandwidth, latency, automated testing, security and compliance.

  • Write unit tests and work with QA team to ensure quality testing.

  • Stay current with industry developments and new trends.

  • Understand & comply with HIPAA Security and Privacy Law

  • Adhere to Interactive Intelligence Code of Business Conduct and Ethics

jobs.title: Teamwork Desk Software Engineer
jobs.content:
The Job


Come help us build the best HelpDesk software in the world. The product we built handles millions of support emails a month for thousands of companies. Join a small team of talented developers, doing what we love every day. You will be writing code most of your day :)



What started out initially as a single web app has evolved into an architecture with many small services working with message queues, in-depth metrics, monitoring and logging. We need you to help us build some of the incredible new features we have planned and continue developing this architecture.


Our Tech Stack

Meet some of the Team

Some things published by the Team
