jobs.title: Software Engineer
jobs.content:
About this position


Skuid has one of the best culture’s that you will ever experience.  And we have a rapidly growing, international, fanatic customer base developing custom enterprise applications with Skuid to drive their businesses. Skuid is growing a phenomenal pace  and we are looking for exceptional software engineers to develop one of the most leading edge products in the market.


What is Skuid? Skuid is a cloud user experience platform to rapidly create bespoke web apps without writing code.  Our mission, "Interface forward," describes our belief that human-machine interactions should be adaptable — constantly evolving to empower people to do more with less. Enterprise software should not dehumanize. Instead of "enduring" a painful interface, use Skuid to interface forward, making your work more productive, meaningful and enjoyable.


As a Skuid Product Engineer you will be responsible for developing world-class software products that will be used directly by customers and partners across every major vertical.  We are changing an industry and are experiencing massive growth and adoption.  If you are an exceptional, innovative software engineer in either San Francisco or Chattanooga, please contact us to discuss how you can to help continue to drive the growth of a product that is creating significant value for enterprises businesses.


Skuid hires for the long term, invests in employee growth and development, and offers an environment of shared goals and values, rich experiences and opportunities.  Employees take the ownership of projects and responsibilities seriously and thrive on innovation. We are looking for individuals whose talents and accomplishments will contribute to a thriving company.


Responsibilities



  • Individual contributor role in a product engineering team to develop well designed, testable, code for software products sold to customers across all major industries around the world.

  • Contribute in all phases of an agile development lifecycle.

  • Support continuous improvement by investigating alternatives and technologies and presenting these for architectural review.

  • Build in quality, reusable code and processes to all development activity.

  • Develop with reusable, scalable design.

  • Maintain and address issues.

  • Work closely with the Skuid Technical Support team to assist with customer issues as needed.

  • Create technical documentation as needed.

jobs.title: Web Application Developer
jobs.content:
Web Application Developer (IT)
Arizona State University
Journalism & Mass Communication
Campus: Downtown Phoenix
Requisition Id# 24165BR


Salary Range:  
Depends on experience


Close Date:  
04-August-2016


Job Description:  
The Walter Cronkite School of Journalism and Mass Communication, a national leader in journalism education, is seeking a Technologist in Residence for Cronkite News, a multi-platform daily news organization and innovation hub based in Phoenix.

This newsroom-based position requires deep technical skills with an eye toward innovative storytelling. The successful candidate will be able to build and administer web applications and work with our award-winning student journalists to tell stories in a variety of formats. We are looking for someone with technical expertise who loves working with cross-platform teams and has the people skills to meld with our team.  This is a year-round position that includes working in Cronkite News during the spring and fall semesters and in Carnegie-Knight News21 during the summers.
 
The News21 program brings together the nation’s best journalism students each year to report and produce an investigative multimedia reporting project on a topic of national import. Cronkite News is the news division of Arizona PBS and is comprised of more than a dozen full-time, award-winning professional editors and more than 100 journalism students each semester. Students produce rich multimedia content – both daily and enterprise – under the guidance of top professionals in an immersive learning environment. The content is delivered on CronkiteNews.azpbs.org. Cronkite News also is designed to be a test bed for innovation, serving as a model for the news industry to try new forms of storytelling, audience engagement, digital interactivity, data visualization, audience analytics and revenue models.

Days and Schedule:  8:00 AM-5:00 PM, to include some nights and weekends.


Essential Duties:  
•     Build and maintain web applications related to the Cronkite News digital site, cronkitenews.azpgs.org, which is built on WordPress, as well as News21 project sites.
•    Work with student teams to develop innovative web, mobile, data and mapping applications.
•    Code innovative digital media products, such as native smartphone and web applications.
•    Develop and maintain back-end databases for digital media products.
•    Work with Cronkite IT department to configure server space to house products developed by Cronkite News.
•    Remain abreast of technology directions, initiatives and trends within scope of expertise to provide ideas, guidance and recommendations to Cronkite News and Cronkite leadership.

jobs.title: Back-end Web Developer
jobs.content:
TradeKing Group, Inc. (www.tradeking.com) consists of companies that provide online brokerage services, education and social collaboration channels for investors, and more. Its subsidiary, TradeKing Securities, LLC, is a nationally licensed online broker/dealer dedicated to empowering the independent, self- directed investor. TradeKing Advisors, Inc. is an SEC registered investment advisor. Brokerage accounts are serviced and securities offered through TradeKing Securities, LLC, member FINRA and SIPC.


Position Description


You aren't satisfied with simply knowing that things work. You want to know the how and why and its impact on security, performance, and maintainability. You are excited about the latest language features and frameworks but you have the maturity to know when to introduce them into a project. You love having the freedom to innovate and take responsibility but you value doing that in the context of a team. The more you learn the more you realize you don't know and you need others and they need you. You test everything and let the data drive your decisions. You love what you do!


Job Responsibilities


You will be an integral part of a small cross-functional Scrum team (2-4 Developers, 1-2 QA, 1 Product Owner). The team analyzes requirements, makes design recommendations, designs the architecture, develops the code, creates the documentation, develops automated tests, performs manual testing, and ultimately deploys the code. Through all of this you are considering the impact your decisions have on security, performance, and maintainability. You design and implement the best solution given the constraints, and identify technical debt to be addressed.

jobs.title: Software Developer - Content Platform for Hulu!
jobs.content:
SUMMARY


The ingestion, review, management and syndication of content is core to Hulu’s business and success. The Content Platform technology team is responsible for the end-to-end technology needs to acquire content from over 500 partners and deliver the highest quality video to tens of millions of users. We’re looking for sharp, motivated individuals to help build the technology backbone of Hulu.


WHAT YOU’LL DO



  • Content ingestion systems and APIs

  • Content publishing tools and workflows

  • Caption editing format manipulation to support every platform

  • A state-of-the-art Content Partner portal

  • Scaling our CDN distribution technologies

jobs.title: Site Reliability Engineer
jobs.content:
Who we are


ATTN: is a news and media company focused on empowering a generation to make social impact. We do so by creating engaging experiences around original content.


As an engineering team: 



  • We have a passion for helping people

  • We are fans, consumers, and contributors to open source software

  • We believe in code quality and testing

  • We encourage creativity and exploration


The role


We are looking to bring on an experienced SRE to help us mature infrastructure and tooling here at ATTN:. As a site reliability engineer, you will be responsible for the overall reliability of our infrastructure, internal tools, and public-facing products. You will lead the design and implementation of tools for automating, managing, and monitoring our systems.
 
A Site Reliability Engineer will:



  • Work with engineers to design and implement distributed systems at scale

  • Standardize core infrastructure components with best practices in mind

  • Design a process for on-call engineers to respond to infrastructure issues

  • Help bring new ideas into production rapidly

  • Automate and improve existing systems in production

jobs.title: Software Developer - Encoding Video For Hulu
jobs.content:
SUMMARY


The Video Encoding team is responsible for having the best looking video on the Internet with the least amount of bits and takes ownership for the different renditions of video- everything from mobile to TV. The team is responsible for the packaging of content, both DRM and protocol delivery formats. Delivering video to an iOS device is much different then delivering video to a XBOX One. The team is responsible for end-to-end UX for video delivery. It is a small big data problem. Our players collect information about user’s playback experience, these key metrics are aggregated near real time and use them to make decisions on how we route traffic to clients.We are looking for a talented Software Developer to help us build the most sophisticated powerful video transcoding engine in the industry. Hulu is all about high quality video content, and that begins with reliable, efficient, and high-quality transcoding.


WHAT YOU’LL DO



  • Drive the digital video transcoding and delivery pipeline for the world’s premium online video service

  • Improve storage efficiency of a multi Petabyte distributed file system

  • Design tools to perform automated analysis of videos

  • Sweat every millisecond of latency

  • Dream of the next big thing in video streaming

jobs.title: .NET Developer
jobs.content:
Ansira is the leader in modeling and activating 1st, 2nd and 3rd party data, delivering performance marketing programs at a national and local level with unprecedented results and long-term profitability. 


Ansira’s development focuses on development and support of various marketing solutions using Microsoft technologies as applied to a multitude of business environments. Flexibility and a positive attitude in an ever-changing environment are important attributes for this position.


Due to client growth, we are seeking a .NET Developer to join our awesome team of developers.  This position will be responsible for development, implementation and support of various proprietary applications utilized by both external and internal clients.


Selected candidate will interface with clients, account management, application development, QA and IM teams. This is an exciting position demanding a strong aptitude for application development and Software Development Life Cycles.


Essential Duties and Responsibilities:



  • Build and support applications in production, pre-production environments and coordinate QA and UAT cycles

  • Managing production support, stability and maintenance

  • Identifying, troubleshooting and debugging defects

  • Design, development and deployment of UI and functional features for web applications

  • Perform database and application operations

  • Provide application support to internal and external clients

  • Identify, analyze and articulate problem areas and work with others to devise solutions focusing on stability, performance and scalability

  • Working with a fair degree of independence on concurrent implementations

  • Follow internal processes for project management, change management and defect management

jobs.title: Software Engineer - .NET
jobs.content:
Ascend RMS is a complex, multi-tier application providing a retail management solution to independent bicycle dealers.  This position reports to the Ascend RMS manager of Software Development and provides expertise in developing, designing, enhancing, and maintaining applications.  


The position is focused, but not limited to, developing software for Microsoft .NET Web Applications using ASP.NET MVC deployed to Windows Azure Services. 


 The successful Software Engineer will:



  • Design, code, create test plans, test, debug and document applications

  • Communicate face-to-face with their peers and customers in a participatory environment

  • Ensure architectural, business, coding, design, and quality standards are adhered to

  • Be responsible for the quality and timeliness of their own work

  • Stay current with the latest technologies, methods and toolsBe self-motivated and require minimal supervision

jobs.title: Sr Architect -
jobs.content:
HERE is the leading global provider of maps, and location-based services. We are developing technology that will make personalized navigation, autonomous driving and augmented reality part of everyday life.


HERE is looking for a solutions architect to help design and build the next generation of the HERE Platform. Essential requirements include a proven track record of the development, deployment and the support of large scale distributed services.


Key Responsibilities



  • As part of the Architecture Team, within Platform Operations & IT (POIT) organisation you shape the future of the HERE platforms as well as Production and Corporate IT services

  • Enable product teams to develop, launch and operate high-quality services in a fast-paced environment

  • Interface with the extended architecture community within HERE to develop standard solutions to common requirements

  • Rapid prototyping of new technologies in areas all the way from datacenter infrastructure to development tooling and the business intelligence area

  • Support senior management with reliable and consise analysis of a broad spectrum of technology areas

  • Continuous alignment of the POIT offering to the needs of the internal customer-base

  • Provide architecture support and expertise to Software Engineers and Systems Engineers to ensure infrastructure and software standards and security standards are met for new and existing applications, products and Infrastructure

  • Lead programs to build solutions across many departments within HERE while ensuring the progress and stakeholder satisfaction

  • Lead cross-disciplinary teams to dig into the hardest, most impactful problems and solve them

  • Plan and carry out POC (Proofs of Concept) for POIT services


Skills Required


Excellent background in Systems and Software Architecture and Engineering, understanding of the components of infrastructure as code, public Cloud (AWS), distributed systems theory and design, and big data concepts and systems, but also feel at home in strategy discussions, budget planning, project management as well as software development. 



  • Prior experience with deep knowledge in software development/engineering and managing large-scale server cloud infrastructure

  • Big Data analysis and machine learning experience are a plus

  • Experience with systems management platforms at scale

  • Automation and CI/CD systems experience required

  • Good understanding of networking and storage technologies and concepts.

  • Solid understanding and experience with Cloud technologies and public Cloud services (particularly AWS)

  • Excellent organisational, analytical, problem-solving and presentation skills

  • Communication of technical issues to a wide and varied audience, from engineers to executives

  • Working with remote teams and across time zones globally

  • Desire and capability to continuously learn new things in all areas (technology, communication, business, culture, …)


HERE is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, age, gender identity, sexual orientation, marital status, parental status, religion, sex, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other legally protected characteristics.

jobs.title: Web-based Collaborative Geographic Information Systems Developer
jobs.content:
About:


The Landscape Spatial Analytics section is part of the Habitat Science Division in the Washington Dept. of Fish & Wildlife. This group has created a successful program mapping land-cover change through a mixture of machine-learning methods, automating spatial processing and innovative user-interface optimization for accuracy assessment. Current projects seek to complement their successful remote sensing approach with crowd source data and collaborative knowledge capture tools. 


You'll work in the Habitat Science division of the Washington Dept. of Fish and Wildlife on developing a collaborative GIS system to help the public and professionals track multiple natural resource issues in an online dataservice. The Geospatial Land Activities Dataservice will combine the data binding magic of angularjs and d3 with custom mapping tools developed through the ESRI javascript api. You'll develop a set of tools to facilitate mapping and discussion about ecosystem restoration projects, wetlands, shoreline armoring and more that will grow to help the Dept. of Fish & Wildlife, state and federal agencies, tribal nations, NGOs and the citizens of Washington track and achieve a sustainable future for the area we have come to know and love. You'll be a key player in a small team helping craft a new set of tools to bring increased transparency and effectiveness to natural resource management in one of the nations most important estuary complexes, Puget Sound.


As a member of our team you will have the opportunity to bring your creative skills to bear on solving real world problems. As an innovative team we encourage continuous learning and you'll have access to Lynda.com and time to delve into new topics as we grow and build. You can even help us get our Joel test score up to 12!

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Barkly has an awesome opportunity for an exceptional engineer.  You will join an incredible team where everyone holds themselves to the highest standards of excellence, raising our caliber as a group to greater than the sum of its parts. You will collaborate, work hard, have fun, and build something game-changing while learning from your teammates.   


What you’ll do every day:



  • Design, develop, test and deploy highly scalable, complex applications

  • Define and solve logical problems for highly technical applications

jobs.title: Senior Java Software Development Engineer
jobs.content:
As a core member of the development team, you will build innovations for our flagship product, Concur Expense. With a user base of over 30 million business travelers with year-over-year growth exceeding 30%, Concur Expense is the key component of Concur’s product delivery and growth.


In the first 12 months you will be involved in:



•Creating REST based Web Services: Creating highly scalable services that leverage Concur’s internal cloud as well as other commercial cloud platforms such as AWS to build and scale.

•Transforming our product into services based architecture: Moving our product into a more modular and scalable solution.

•Owning the software lifecycle from design to delivery: We run small agile teams with a mission, so that our engineers have full visibility and ownership of the product, including full-stack service development and operations. (11324)

jobs.title: PHP Developer
jobs.content:
Ansira is the leader in modeling and activating 1st, 2nd and 3rd party data, delivering performance marketing programs at a national and local level with unprecedented results and long-term profitability.  We have a great opportunity for a PHP Developer to join our team in our Addison, TX office.  


This role will be responsible for supporting the development and maintenance of client and internal web applications. This position requires a deep understanding of PHP, extensive knowledge of web application architecture, application frameworks and LAMP environments. Analysis and problem solving skills are required along with excellent communication skills. The ideal candidate will be comfortable working in a fast-paced environment on several projects concurrently. Preference is given to candidates who can demonstrate resourcefulness in creating technical solutions leveraging production quality open-source libraries and services.


What You Will Do



  • Work as a part of an on-site development team, which will coordinate with other internal departments.

  • Maintain and introduce functionality to existing systems.

  • Collaborate with leads to develop solutions and complete projects successfully and on time.

  • Work on multiple projects simultaneously.

  • Contribute to the quality of code through participation in code reviews, refactoring, and unit testing.

jobs.title: Senior Back-End Engineer
jobs.content:
Senior Backend Engineer



Empirical is a digital product design agency headquartered in beautiful Portland, Oregon. We incorporate research & design to create great user experiences for our well-known clients – eg Jaguar Land Rover, Intel, Samsung, Dreamworks, etc.



Up to this point, our current development services have been mainly front-end, but we recently added full-stack development to our menu of offerings. We need you and your skills in back-end development to help get us there.



You will be a Sr. Engineer, working with our front-end developers on projects that require full stack development. You will interface with our client engineers, shore up our current development processes, work with internal and contract developers, help estimate projects, and generally be a technical badass.



Of course this means that you have a wide range of talents, skills and perspectives. Not only are you an amazing at back end dev but also have a great understanding of how the two-worlds of front-end & back-end interact. And let's not forget your voracious, never-ending appetite for new tech and how quickly you learn them, sometimes in a matter of days.



Here are some bullet lists for those of you that like them.



You will:



  • Work with our designers to create kickass user experiences in a wide array of industries and cutting edge technologies

  • Build solid solutions for our clients

  • Live in Portland and work out of our Portland offices



You have:



  • 5+ years of development experience (preferably in both agency AND product environments) with a track record of shipping clean code that other engineers might regard as poetry.

  • Some experience in Python

  • Some experience with Python web frameworks like Django and Flask

  • Experience working with cloud technologies

  • Understanding of modern web services and SOA

  • Knowledge of testing and continuous integration

  • Exposure to other languages and their ecosystems, especially Ruby and modern JavaScript

  • Experience communicating with clients in a manner which is honest, clear & respectful

  • Skills to organize yourself and projects so that nothing will fall through the cracks



You have experience in one or all of the following:



  • Ruby, JavaScript, C#, TypeScript, Elixir, etc

  • Apache, nginx, haproxy, node, etc

  • Celery, Beanstalk, SQS, etc

  • MongoDB, MySQL, Redis, memcache, etc

  • Heroku, Google App Engine, AWS, Docker, etc

  • Jenkins, Capistrano, Ansible, etc

  • Basecamp, Lighthouse, JIRA, Trac, Redmine, etc

  • Extreme Programming, Kanban, Scrum, etc

  • Command, Decorator, Actor, Template, Promise, Facade, etc




We offer:




  • The opportunity to work with a variety of clients and tech on interesting projects – eg, IoT, IVI systems, big data, etc. many projects will be cutting edge and secretive (seriously secretive! though not quite FBI-level, but you will be under NDA)

  • A very supportive environment with people who aren't afraid to tell you that you're awesome (well, because you are awesome.)

  • A flat hierarchy without micro-management. we want to get out of your way so you and others can operate at your best

  • A team of smart, talented people who work together to get stuff done. if we had egos, we would check them at the door

  • No cubicles, nor time cards, nor set hours – seriously, ...none ...never ...ever. just flexibility when you need it because Life Happens

  • A beautiful, hip office with views

  • A stocked refrigerator with snacks and drinks, and Friday happy hour

  • A freakin' fast Mac laptop and a big ol' monitor



When responding, be sure to include your github account (or similar) so we can see all of the cool projects to which you've been contributing. Also include a link to one of your favorite pages from xkcd.com or theoatmeal.com (we won't judge).


Thank you!

jobs.title: WEB DEVELOPER & SYSTEMS ADMINISTRATOR
jobs.content: Under direction, manage web servers and develop web applications to support the operational requirements of the Student Health and Counseling Services and Student Disability Center administrative and clinical staff. Perform systems administration functions in a complex Microsoft Active Directory domain-based network with a mix of Windows and Macintosh client computers. Provide second-tier computer, application, clinical device, and network technical support services via telephone, email, and in person.

jobs.title: Software Engineer - Cambridge, MA
jobs.content:
Hopper is a travel startup based in Cambridge, MA and Montreal, QC.

We combine insightful research on massive data sets with intuitive design to help travellers make informed decisions about air travel.

We launched the Hopper app (iOS) at the end of January 2015. Since then, the app has been featured in outlets such as Mashable, TIME, Travel + Leisure, and Buzzfeed. In February, Apple featured Hopper in the App Store ("best new apps").

As a Software Engineer you'll work directly with Product Designers, other Developers and the CTO. You'll be part of a small team with big ambitions: delivering a delightful and powerful product that empowers travellers. We are a versatile full-stack development team. Were always looking for smart, adaptable engineers to help us build great things throughout our stack, which includes:

  • Mobile application development for iOS (Objective-C and Swift) and Android (Java).
  • Middle tier APIs, processing pipelines (Kafka, Storm, Spark) & web services (Finagle) in Scala.
  • Analytics on big data sets (trillions of rows) using Spark (Scala and Python), Hive and Hadoop.
  • Internal web applications using Play (Scala) and Javascript (AngularJS).
  • Development Operations (DevOps) for all of the above, using Mesos, Marathon and Ansible.

What youll do:

  • Write beautiful code: well designed, testable, efficient and maintainable.
  • Learn new languages, technologies and frameworks from one project to the next.
  • Work on a problem from design through to deployment and operations.
  • Collaborate with everyone in the company to solve tough technical and product problems.

***Please note: We are hiring for this position in both Montreal and Cambridge, this application is specifically for the Cambridge-based position. If you are applying for the position in Montreal, please click 'All Jobs' at the top of this page and select the Montreal opening.


Benefits


Compensation will be competitive including equity in an early stage startup backed by top-tier VCs (Atlas Venture, Brightspark and OMERS Ventures).

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

jobs.title: Web App UI/UX Designer
jobs.content:
You will be a key role in helping us build beautiful usable software that runs fast and gets out of the customer's way.  You'll be responsible for the design and aesthetic of every piece of our software.  We are currently the easiest system in the market to use and need to maintain that offering. In addition to the UI/UX we need someone to build and maintain our style sheets.


Here are some recent projects our development team has finished up:


Recent Projects



  • Marketing module with a powerful email designer that enables golf courses to build effective marketing campaigns. This module is used by hundreds of golf courses to send millions of emails per month.

  • Custom reporting system that allows users to build reports with any combination of filters and sorting to get the data they need.

  • Food and beverage module that allows our customers to design their own custom restaurant table layout and complete sales with lightning speed.


What You'll Do



  • In your first week you'll mock up a ui/ux for an existing module

  • In your first month after user testing you'll ship a new design for a module

  • In your first 6 months you'll have prepared a business theme, structured the css, and much more.

jobs.title: Digital Designer
jobs.company: University of California Office of the President
jobs.content: You’re looking for a small group at a large organization where you can make a huge impact. We’re looking for versatile and critical thinkers to tackle the wide variety of work we see — from conc...

jobs.title: Sheriff
jobs.content:
Our engineers build systems that catch bad guys.  Using all available payment, user, and machine data, we have to separate legitimate credit card transactions from fraudulent in under 400ms.  That means doing just-in-time mash-ups of internal data with external APIs and reducing it all into a single score with a few critical insights for end-users.


To solve this problem, we're looking for world-class engineers who are eager to learn, adopt, and contribute to a reactive style of programming.  The position is for a backend engineer and will involve architecting and building scalable, event-driven fraud detection systems.


Signifyd is a VC-backed startup (yet has a real business model :-) ).  We most recently raised $20 million in Series B funding in February 2016 from Menlo Ventures, Allegis Capital, IA Ventures, and QED Investors.

jobs.title: Senior Web Developer
jobs.content:
Description


The mission of BitTorrent is to build technologies and platforms that democratize creativity and empower the world’s creative communities. We are a team of passionate individuals who are building the definitive ecosystem for brave, original, and emerging media.


Do you like building and shipping code in a fast-paced environment? Do you geek out over APIS, CSS frameworks and the latest Javascript specification updates? Do you want to build something reaches millions of people around the globe?


BitTorrent is looking for an experienced Senior Web Developer to join us in our San Francisco office. As our Senior Web Developer, you will be responsible for building responsive and elegant websites that reach millions of people every day.


What you will do:



  • Work closely with team members (visual designers, operations, PMM) to deliver responsive, beautiful and engaging web experiences.

  • Provide ideas, input and expertise on all things web

  • Build brand new websites using best practices

  • Maintain and debug existing websites (php)

  • Be a subject matter expert and provide assistance and direction for Jr Web Developers

jobs.title: Software Engineer (m/f)
jobs.content:
Giant Swarm is providing a programmable and fully managed container platform to allow developers to easily deploy, run and scale their containerized microservices.

We are looking for a Software Engineer (m/f)

Your Job:

  • You will be responsible for architecting and building distributed systems
  • You will use a wide variety of open source technologies and tools
  • You take part for testing, metrics, continuous integration

Requirements:

  • You have experience with more than one language and a strong architectural background. One of these languages is Go.
  • You love to automate things and you are used to deploy in production multiple times a day
  • You are a profound Linux user
  • You have worked with docker, experiences with kubernetes, prometheus are a bonus point
  • You prefer to build your applicatinons as multiple services instead of a monolith
  • You know the concepts of CAP theorem, paxos/raft concensus, distributed databases and message passing

WHY US?

We like to give you a glimpse on how working with is like:

Self-organization

Creative work needs freedom and openness. We encourage you to do your work wherever and whenever you want. We expect passion and encourage sustainability. If you need rest, take it. We don't count holidays - we count outcome.

Teamwork

Our ambitious goals are only achievable as a team. Everybody’s input is highly welcome and appreciated. Although sometimes rules and processes are necessary, we try to keep them as lean as possible. Always question the status quo and find new ways of collaboration and team work.

Learning

Learning is mandatory and fun at the same time. If you realize you want to expand your knowledge in a specific area, we support you with conferences, books etc.

Basics

We offer fair (transparent and open) salaries with benefits like choosing your own laptop, jobticket, coffee flat, mate etc.. And you will participate in our stock options program. Currently our team members have more children than we are employees. So family friendliness is a must.

jobs.title: Sheriff
jobs.content:
Headquarters: San Jose, CA.
URL: www.signifyd.com

Our engineers build systems that catch bad guys.  Using all available payment, user, and machine data, we have to separate legitimate credit card transactions from fraudulent in under 400ms.  That means doing just-in-time mash-ups of internal data with external APIs and reducing it all into a single score with a few critical insights for end-users.
To solve this problem, we're looking for world-class engineers who are eager to learn, adopt, and contribute to a reactive style of programming.  The position is for a backend engineer and will involve architecting and building scalable, event-driven fraud detection systems.

Required Skills:
  • Excellent programming skills in Java or similar language
  • Experience with scripting languages and SQL
  • Analytical problem solving skills
Bonus Skills:
  • Experience building large-scale high-performance systems
  • Startup experience
  • Payments or risk experience
  • Machine learning or related knowledge
Typical Education:
  • B.S., M.S., or Ph.D. in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Math, or other technical field
  • Alternatively, an excellent open-source contribution history (highlight in application)
Our stack:
  • Java, Python, Cassandra, MySQL, Solr, Apache Spark, Play! framework, Docker, fleet, AWS
Who We Are

Signifyd was founded on the belief that e-commerce businesses should be able to grow without fear of fraud. Signifyd solves the challenges that growing e-commerce businesses persistently face: billions of dollars lost in chargebacks, customer dissatisfaction from mistaken declines, and operational costs due to tedious, manual transaction investigation. E-Commerce Assurance, Signifyd’s financial guarantee protecting online retailers in case of chargebacks, is supported by a full-service cloud platform that automates fraud prevention allowing businesses to increase sales and open new markets while reducing risk. Signifyd is in use by multiple companies on the Fortune 1000 and Internet Retailer Top 500 list. Signifyd is headquartered in San Jose, CA.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

To apply: You can apply directly at our careers page, https://www.signifyd.com/careers/?gh_jid=44015

jobs.title: Driven JavaScript / Node.js Developer
jobs.content:
Headquarters: New York City
URL: why.clevertech.biz

About You
You're comfortable with Node.js and front-end development in general.

You love trying out new languages, frameworks, libraries, and leveraging them off, whenever necessary.

You’re looking for projects that you'll be proud to share with your friends and family, and you're interested in scaling large projects that disrupt markets and build business.

You know when to ask more questions and where to look for answers.

If you're not looking to advance your skills and work along Senior Developers committed to helping you do that, this isn't for you!

About Clevertech
15 years developing apps has taught us this: Build people, then products.

We’re aware that solid engineering practices and our love of Agile principles aren’t enough to ensure that we translate our clients’ dreams into software that shapes the world.

Our team of nearly 100 developers and designers are what make it possible.

They’ve rejected offers from Google and Twitter. They’re parents, travelers, or aspiring entrepreneurs. Some are in the planning stages of launching their own startups. Here’s what they have in common:

They’re all invested in becoming better together and we support their constant learning.

For more on how we do this, check out why.clevertech.biz. Some of the great things we do together are captured in cleverte.ch/bloomberg and visualcaptcha.net.

About the Job
At Clevertech, we understand why it’s great to be part of the gig economy—we also understand some of the challenges it can present.

By offering ongoing, full-time roles, we eliminate the burnout and guesswork involved in being a contract worker. We’re also interested in making it possible for our team to focus on what they do best. Busy work that gets in the way of high-quality code is our worst enemy!

Here’s how it works:

  • We work with quality clients who have brilliant ideas they want to scale, scale, scale :)
  • You can be located anywhere. This is a remote position. (And you're excited about it!)
  • Schedules are flexible—you work when you're in flow
  • You focus on one client at a time; when you're finished with one, we provide another
  • We use the latest tools and streamline every workflow imaginable
  • Everyone on our team shares your culture, irrespective of where they are physically

To apply: Sounds like you? Apply at https://clevertech.biz/careers/54cf696f2b393e216ee20936

jobs.title: Business Relationship Manager
jobs.content:
The IT Department at Christiana Care Health System is currently recruiting for a Business Relationship Manager to join their team!


The Business Relationship Manager (BRM) is accountable to establish a strong collaborative partnership with various leader and departments across the Health System to deliver strategic information technology (IT) enabled business imperatives to achieve its business goals. This role will be highly strategic and will help drive innovation, collaboration, and integration across CCHS. The BRM will be partnering with physician and executive leadership on a regular basis and driving CCHS strategy and success. In addition, the BRM will help to drive reliable and cost effective solutions for the assigned functions through the strategic deployment of IT. This position will be the customer facing lead into IT and shall establish and maintain an IT investment roadmap focused on aligning IT investments to the most strategic and impactful business outcomes.


Principal duties and responsibilities for this role based on the key tenets of an IT Service Management Organization (ITSM) include the following:



  • Drive and improve processes through adoption of IT best practices and harmonized business processes

  • Establish a rolling 2-3 years business aligned IT investment plan and roadmap

  • Maximize investments made in existing technologies, shape future blueprints (business capabilities) and ensure IT is appropriately applied to each stage of the Service Line processes to achieve maximum efficiency and effectiveness

  • Participate in the development of the service strategy with IT leadership, architects, and other IT service managers (e.g. implementations, operations, “keeping the lights on” for assigned systems and services) for all assigned IT services

  • Collaborate with the larger IT organization (e.g. Project Management Office, Information Security, Service Leads, Architects) to deliver appropriate technology solutions

  • Single point of engagement for IT demand planning and demand management conversations with stakeholders

jobs.title: Senior Android Developer
jobs.content:
Location: Gospel Oak, London

Type: Full Time

Experience: Senior (2+ years)

We are looking for a senior developer with experience in creating innovative Android apps or games.

Our flagship games including Zombies, Run!, Superhero Workout, and The Walk, combine innovative real-world gameplay with captivating stories and design. We want to find someone who can help us improve our existing games and develop new games that are just as revolutionary and innovative as Zombies, Run!

We are open to candidates working remotely.

Primary Responsibilities

  • Developing new features for our existing games, and maintaining them to take advantage of new OS-level features
  • Developing and designing new apps and games

Additional Responsibilities

  • Working with our web developer to ensure good communication with our online services
  • Working with our iOS developers (several of our games are available on both platforms)

Requirements

  • At least two years of experience developing Android applications.
  • An enthusiasm for quickly learning and applying new and emerging technologies.
  • An interest in games and game design, and a tenacious approach to problem-solving.

Also, highly desirable:

  • Experience in a related field (e.g. any of: web development, UI/UX design, sound engineering, iOS development, hardware hacking, etc.)
  • Experience adapting or 'porting' games or apps from one platform to another

jobs.title: Full Stack Web Developer
jobs.content:
Location: Gospel Oak, London

Type: Full Time

Experience: 2+ years

We are looking for a full stack web developer.

Our flagship games, Zombies, Run! and The Walk, combine innovative real-world gameplay with captivating stories and design. We want to find someone who can help us improve our existing games and develop new games that are just as revolutionary and innovative as Zombies, Run!

We are open to candidates working remotely.

As web developer at Six to Start, you will be primarily responsible for sustaining and improving the infrastructure that powers Zombies, Run!, a popular fitness app with over 2.5 million downloads.

You’ll be enabling the native mobile clients, along with maintaining and developing independent user-facing applications. You’ll need to be able to work independently and be happy taking initiatives on features. Most importantly, it’ll be very important to manage complexity and technical debt with confidence while developing at a rapid pace.

While there is a lot of responsibility in the role, you will have an abundant amount of freedom in implementation and if wanted, a strong voice in the outcome of finished products that will roll into the arms of the product’s many fans.

Responsibilities and Requirements

  • Comfortable developing functional websites using modern JavaScript practices
  • Experience implementing and consuming traditional REST services
  • Strong knowledge of RDBMS (Postgres is used primarily), and some knowledge or a keen attitude to learn noSQL databases
  • Must be comfortable administrating and caring for linux servers

jobs.title: Technical Content Creator
jobs.content:
At Compose, we're looking for strong writers with technical backgrounds to join our eclectic writing team. Do you find yourself writing and reading technical blogs for enjoyment? Maybe you've squashed your last 4AM bug and want to step out of the fire and share your wisdom with others? Or, perhaps you're an experienced fan of a particular database and want to share your praises (...or foreboding...) with the masses?

If you're technically inclined - programming, analytics, technical marketing - and want to stay comfortably plugged in to the software world, we would love to hear from you. At Compose, quality technical content is a major part of what we do. Our articles, how-tos, case studies and marketing materials are a crucial piece of our overall puzzle. If you'd love to spend your days growing with a fantastic, casual and close-knit team, we have an unbelievable spot for you.

Compose has grown into a vibrant work environment where folks can feel comfortable being themselves, living a balanced life. We welcome you to enjoy comfort when taking risks, collaborate with spirited peers, and to unleash your creative personality.

**Technical things we hope you're good at (or can become excellent at):**

* Databases: We provide databases as a service. We'd love for you to have all sorts of experience with different types of data-storage.
* Dev-y Things: It would be helpful if you can git, script, code things, and work with common software tools like Slack, Ghost, Google Analytics and Segment. The more technical know-how and experience, the better. Our stack is built with Ruby/Go and it would be excellent if you could contribute to that, too.
* Tech Talk: Distill complicated technical ideas to any audience. It's a tough thing to do!

**We're excited to see what sort of character will wind up in this role... a few helpful traits include:**

* Driven: We're a self-managing organization that gives you the respect, trust and responsibility to operate with minimal oversight.
* Compassionate: Compose is stuffed with many great hearts, minds, and spirits. We'd love for you to want to collaborate and grow with them.
* Inventive: You'll need buckets of creativity to help you solve a wide range of (sometimes vague) conundrums.
* Accepting: Freedom to fail! Things won't always work, but things will always iterate. This is a fun role and should feel that way.

**Think you're a match?**

Compose implements blind-hiring! Merit based, objectively graded work samples are the first step. We have worked hard to minimize our own biases as much as possible and find the best possible humans for the team. We respect a fancy education or a list of spectacular previous accomplishments, but nothing is more impressive than the right combination of ingredients - which you can objectively demonstrate.

At any time during the process, we are available to chat (email, video, whatever you like) to ensure you are comfortable with the process and feel that you're being treated fairly and with respect.

Good luck, and have fun!

**Please note: At this time we are only able to accept candidates in the United States, Canada, and the UK.**

jobs.title: Platform Engineer
jobs.content:
Developing software appeals to those who love to solve puzzles and apply their creative energy -- and also to those, in our experience, who like working from home in their pyjamas. It is often said that one of the trickiest accomplishments in the development world is imagining, building and maintaining a complex and interconnected mental model of your entire infrastructure within your working memory. If you have experience applying this mental feat within some type of Software-as-a-Service and want to grow into something new, we have a tremendous challenge for you and a terrific team willing and able to support you through it.

We need crafty humans to help expand the Compose vision. Compose has grown into a vibrant work environment where folks can feel comfortable being themselves, living a balanced life. We welcome you to enjoy comfort when taking risks, collaborate with spirited peers, and to unleash your creative personality.

**Technical things we hope you're good at (or can become excellent at):**

* Databases: We provide databases as a service. We'd love for you to have interest within different types of data-storage.
* Ruby: Ruby is common. Ruby on Rails, too, for presentation layers.
* Go: We love Go-lang!

**We're excited to see what sort of character will wind up in this role... a few helpful traits include:**

* Driven: We're a self-managing organization that gives you the respect, trust and responsibility to make your own decisions.
* Compassionate: Compose is stuffed with many great hearts, minds, and spirits. We'd love for you to want to collaborate and grow with them.
* Inventive: You'll need buckets of creativity to help you solve a wide range of (sometimes vague) conundrums.
* Accepting: Freedom to fail! Things won't always work, but things will always iterate. This is a fun role and should feel that way.

**Think you're a match?**

Compose implements blind-hiring! Merit based, objectively graded work samples are the first step. We have worked hard to minimize our own biases as much as possible and find the best possible humans for the team. We respect a fancy education or a list of spectacular previous accomplishments, but nothing is more impressive than the right combination of ingredients - which you can objectively demonstrate.

At any time during the process, we are available to chat (email, video, whatever you like) to ensure you are comfortable with the process and feel that you're being treated fairly and with respect.

We look forward to meeting you!

**Please note: At this time we are only able to accept candidates in the United States, Canada, and the UK.**

jobs.title: Application Developer
jobs.content:
In the present world of application development it's difficult to determine where the front-end stops and the back-end begins. While we don't feel wise enough to define where this point may be, we feel the right candidate will be adventurous enough to focus more on how to provide the strongest and cleanest user experience. We're seeking someone familiar with Rails and JavaScript who is interested in creating beautiful and functional work. Compose will lead you to opportunities to learn and grow, while providing excellent conventions (like our internal framework Megatron) to comfortably work within.

As an Application Developer with Compose, you'll contribute your creative flair to the design, function and user experience of our product. You will be supported be a talented in a self-managing and open organization. We're remote first and have a diverse group of friendly people located all over the world.

Compose has grown into a vibrant work environment where folks can feel comfortable being themselves, living a balanced life. We welcome you to enjoy comfort when taking risks, collaborate with spirited peers, and to unleash your creativity personality. If you love making beautiful and functional things and want to have some fun, we'd love to see what you can cook up for us.

**Technical things we hope you're good at (or can become excellent at):**

* Rails and JavaScript: Fluent in Rails/JavaScript. We use a lot of Go within our infrastructure, but this role doesn't require it. An idiomatic and structured approach to your work is appreciated.
* Utility: You'll run into bugs. A handy stable of useful tools and a keen eye for broken things is essential.
* API: A pragmatic and thorough understanding of API as a database-like source of data.
* Testing: Able to write tests and specs for new features and offer insight to improve existing specs.
* Databases: We provide Databases-as-a-Service; a solid fundamental understanding of good practices and various management systems would be helpful.
* Security: Awareness of security vulnerabilities and protection techniques.

**We're excited to see what sort of character will wind up in this role... a few helpful traits include:**

* Driven: We're a self-managing organization that gives you the respect, trust and responsibility to operate with minimal oversight.
* Compassionate: Compose is stuffed with many great hearts, minds, and spirits. We'd love for you to want to collaborate and grow with them.
* Inventive: You'll need buckets of creativity to help you solve a wide range of (sometimes vague) conundrums.
* Accepting: Freedom to fail! Things won't always work, but things will always iterate. This is a fun role and should feel that way.

**Think you're a match?**

Compose implements blind-hiring! Merit based, objectively graded work samples are the first step. We have worked hard to minimize our own biases as much as possible and find the best possible humans for the team. We respect a fancy education or a list of spectacular previous accomplishments, but nothing is more impressive than the right combination of ingredients - which you can objectively demonstrate.

At any time during the process, we are available to chat (email, video, whatever you like) to ensure you are comfortable with the process and feel that you're being treated fairly and with respect.

We look forward to meeting you!

**Please note: At this time we are only able to accept candidates in the United States, Canada, and the UK.**

jobs.title: Support Engineer
jobs.content:
Our customer base is growing quickly, and we want your combination of sharp technical and warm people skills to help our customers solve problems and get the most out of their databases at Compose. We operate a fleet of various databases, so there is something for everyone: MongoDB, PostgreSQL, Redis, Elasticsearch, RethinkDB, and likely many more!

If you are a developer, DevOps/SRE magician, or database junkie and know how to help developers with technical questions, we want to talk to you. You will be most effective if you have an inquisitive nature, are technically-inclined and love to learn. We are not just looking to fight fires, we are looking to prevent them. We pride ourselves in providing top-notch support and guidance, so being able to communicate effectively with empathy and compassion is a must.

This is the perfect position for a motivated learner who wants to gain experience within a vibrant team focused on building an intuitive and customer-focused product. Spending time with our customers and product will let you interact with all sorts of interesting characters and will help you grow into a high-end distributed systems engineering position (we need those too, so if you start on support and do a great job, there is a huge amount of room for growth).

We're a distributed team and we work across many different time zones. If you're a night owl, an early riser, or somewhere in between, we're happy to accommodate untraditional work schedules -- our worldwide customers often need help at odd hours!

**Technical bits we hope you're good at (or can become good at):**

* Databases: We provide production-grade databases to our customers. Hopefully you've navigated a few, even if it was Visual FoxPro.
* Linux: You'll want to know vmstat from sysstat and iftop from iotop. You should be comfortable with a text editor (vi, emacs, nano, makes no difference) and be able to grep | sed | awk your way through a mess of log files.
* A language: They're not just for humans anymore! Ruby, Go, Python, JavaScript, Haskell... chicken!? Whatever works. We interface with developers every day, and the support team itself is a team of devops, system engineer, and developers. You'll be happiest if you can poke through someone else's code, and maybe hack out a little bit of your own.
* Communication: You should like to communicate with people. Human-focused communication of technical things - it's a delicate balance!
* Creative Problem-Solving: You'll face a wide range of weird, wild problems.

**We're excited to see what sort of character will wind up in this role... a few helpful traits include:**

* Patient: You'll deal with many crisis-like situations. Being able to stay cool under fire is essential.
* Driven: We're a self-managing organization that gives you the respect, trust and responsibility to operate with minimal oversight.
* Compassionate: Compose is stuffed with many great hearts, minds, and spirits. We'd love for you to want to collaborate and grow with them.
* Inventive: You'll need buckets of creativity to help you solve a wide range of (sometimes vague) conundrums.
* Accepting: Freedom to fail! Things won't always work, but things will always iterate. This is a fun role and should feel that way.

Compose implements blind-hiring! Merit based, objectively graded work samples are the first step. We have worked hard to minimize our own biases as much as possible and find the best possible humans for the team. We respect a fancy education or a list of spectacular previous accomplishments, but nothing is more impressive than the right combination of ingredients - which you can objectively demonstrate.

At any time during the process, we are available to chat (email, video, whatever you like) to ensure you are comfortable with the process and feel that you're being treated fairly and with respect.

We look forward to meeting you!

**Please note: At this time we are only able to accept candidates in the United States, Canada, and the UK.**

jobs.title: Experienced Backend Engineer
jobs.content:
Headquarters: Los Angeles & New York, United States
URL: http://careers.citrusbyte.com/apply/tPTZOv/Experienced-Backend-Engineer

Citrusbyte is a software development company which believes in using simple tools to solve all types of problems. We work closely with designers, engineers and our clients to create and improve products of great quality. We have considerable experience building custom systems for both startups and enterprises - check out our portfolio for more information about our clients.

We strongly advocate minimalism and this is represented in the tools we choose to work with. Every team gets to decide their own stack depending on the requirements of the project.

Our main offices are in Los Angeles and New York, but we work remotely with people from all around the world.

Our engineers have experience in a consultative environment, excellent communication skills and a desire to work with talented teams building innovative products. We work closely with our clients, sharing our experience to help them better define their products.

Most of our projects are written in Ruby, so experience in this language is required.

We believe that less is more and value simplicity above all else. This is reflected in the tools we choose to work with. For this reason we tend to avoid using big frameworks like Rails and instead use smaller tools like Sinatra, Roda or Cuba.

We have also done projects in Node.js, Go, Python, Lua, etc. And strive to learn new tools and languages everyday. We believe in always choosing the right tool for the job and we are very open minded about trying different technologies.

Skills & Requirements:
  • Smart, gets things done.
  • Passionate about software development.
  • Excellent communication / consulting experience.
  • Open minded and always learning
  • Experience working in a distributed company
Duties & Responsibilities:
  • Architect and build web applications.
  • Work with product designers and clients to clarify requirements.
  • Plan and prioritize work in a collaborative remote team.

To apply: You can apply directly at our careers page: http://careers.citrusbyte.com/apply/tPTZOv/Experienced-Backend-Engineer

jobs.title: Full Stack Web Developer
jobs.content:
__Location:__ Gospel Oak, London

__Type:__ Full Time

__Experience:__ 2+ years

We are looking for a full stack web developer.

Our flagship games, Zombies, Run! and The Walk, combine innovative real-world gameplay with captivating stories and design. We want to find someone who can help us improve our existing games and develop new games that are just as revolutionary and innovative as Zombies, Run!

___We are open to candidates working remotely.___

As web developer at Six to Start, you will be primarily responsible for sustaining and improving the infrastructure that powers Zombies, Run!, a popular fitness app with over 2.5 million downloads.

Youâll be enabling the native mobile clients, along with maintaining and developing independent user-facing applications. Youâll need to be able to work independently and be happy taking initiatives on features. Most importantly, itâll be very important to manage complexity and technical debt with confidence while developing at a rapid pace.

While there is a lot of responsibility in the role, you will have an abundant amount of freedom in implementation and if wanted, a strong voice in the outcome of finished products that will roll into the arms of the productâs many fans.

__Responsibilities and Requirements__

* Comfortable developing functional websites using modern JavaScript practices
* Experience implementing and consuming traditional REST services
* Strong knowledge of RDBMS (Postgres is used primarily), and some knowledge or a keen attitude to learn noSQL databases
* Must be comfortable administrating and caring for linux servers

jobs.title: Senior Android Developer
jobs.content:
__Location:__ Gospel Oak, London

__Type:__ Full Time

__Experience:__ Senior (2+ years)

We are looking for a senior developer with experience in creating innovative Android apps or games.

Our flagship games including Zombies, Run!, Superhero Workout, and The Walk, combine innovative real-world gameplay with captivating stories and design. We want to find someone who can help us improve our existing games and develop new games that are just as revolutionary and innovative as Zombies, Run!

___We are open to candidates working remotely.___

__Primary Responsibilities__

* Developing new features for our existing games, and maintaining them to take advantage of new OS-level features
* Developing and designing new apps and games

__Additional Responsibilities__

* Working with our web developer to ensure good communication with our online services
* Working with our iOS developers (several of our games are available on both platforms)

__Requirements__

* At least two years of experience developing Android applications.
* An enthusiasm for quickly learning and applying new and emerging technologies.
* An interest in games and game design, and a tenacious approach to problem-solving.

__Also, highly desirable:__

* Experience in a related field (e.g. any of: web development, UI/UX design, sound engineering, iOS development, hardware hacking, etc.)
* Experience adapting or 'porting' games or apps from one platform to another

jobs.title: Java Chief Software Architect
jobs.content:
Are you one of top Software Architects in the world? Do enjoy solving the incredibly complex problems that no one else has been able to complete? Are you 10x more productive than the typical developer? Are you interested in earning $100,000 USD while working for the best companies from the comfort of your home? Eager to join a network of the most talented remote workers in the world? If so, this role is for you.


Company Description:

Crossover is redefining the way people work. Brick and mortar offices are history. The future of our global workforce will be built from teams collaborating from every corner of the world. We have embarked on an expedition to find and engage with that talent. Crossover has developed a unique method of finding, curating, and managing remote contractors. Our platform connects customers to the worlds best talent for both technical and non-technical jobs. But we dont just find the best, we also provide the tools, training, and relationship building support to ensure success for long term growth.


Job Description:

You will play a dynamic leadership role in our fast-paced environment. You will be responsible for developing solutions to complex architecture problems, designing and delivering real enterprise-class software products to customers and being a hands-on peer leader of top development resources. As the owner for the architecture and technical delivery of a multi-million dollar revenue per year enterprise software product, you will effectively work as the CTO of the engagement with a startup mindset, wearing multiple hats from lead architect and developer on the most complex elements of the product to technical team leader to solution evangelist ensuring that the customers are blown away by the technical differentiation and quality of the product.


Key Responsibilities:

Developing expertise in one or more of our proprietary enterprise software products.

Leveraging your broad technology capability set and maintain a level of excitement in using various technologies to architect, develop, and iteratively deploy real enterprise class software

Achieving an expert level understanding of our customers environments and their use of our products.

Architecting and leading weekly technical delivery of one or more products in a way that maintains an unyielding focus on quality while matching the needs of the target customer base.

Creating solutions architecture, algorithms, and designs for solutions that scale to the customers enterprise/global requirements

Leading a small team of Software Engineers to apply software engineering practices and implement automations across all elements of solution delivery

Manage accountability of team members, with pinpoint focus on quality; Personally accountable for resolution of the most technically challenging issues

Ensuring our customers are supremely confident in the adv

jobs.title: Experienced Mobile (Ionic, Angular) Developer
jobs.content:
You write clean code and care about its quality.
Self-education is your primary personal strength.
You want to keep up with the latest technology.
You are excited about JavaScript as we are.
Then we are happy to bring you aboard!

About us

Ruby Cluster is a small team, crafting useful web apps, helping small business and startups.
With the technology of bleeding edge, we deliver business value for our clients. Worldwide.

Our approach

Our workflow is tuned. We use source control (git), we make daily builds, we track features/bugs (in trello),
we fix bugs before writing new code, we write specs before development, we use best tools, we have testers,
we run usability testing, we meet daily on stand-ups, we over communicate issues, we keep improving ourselves.

Skills required

  • Ionic
  • Angular
  • Vanilla JS
  • CoffeeScript
  • Jade
  • Stylus
  • Git

We follow industry best practices

  • DRY, KISS, GIYF
  • Simple, Modular, Decoupled, Events-driven code
  • Functional programming and Prototyping inheritance
  • git flow (branches, pull requests, merge and rebase)
  • Code quality guides, running code linters
  • CI servers, automated deployments
  • Agile, Scrum, Trello
  • Stand-ups, Pair Programming

About You

Your overall experience

  • 5+ years of hacking in web development
  • 2+ years of poking JavaScript
  • 2+ years of stashing in GIT (pull-requests, git flow)
  • 1+ years of building on Ionic or Angular

Personal skills

  • Reliable and responsible person
  • English: good verbal and writing skills
  • Good team player
  • Team workflow follower
  • Experience in working with a globally distributed team
  • Constant self-improvement
  • Strong work ethic
  • Sense of humor

What we offer

  • Long terms working relationship
  • Part-time to full-time workload
  • Interesting projects and problems
  • Usage of technologies on cutting edge
  • Opportunity to level up your skills
  • Support of highly skilled team members
  • Compensation based on experience

We prefer working with the best developers worldwide with good verbal and written English communication skills.
