jobs.title: Back-end dev for marketing science startup in Stockholm
jobs.content:
Join an amazing team consisting of data science geeks and developers in the heart of Stockholm. Together we are creating a kick-ass solution within retail data science. We are using some of the latest thinking within Bayesian statistics to optimize our customers’ retail promotions. We want a great, fun-to-work-with– back-end–expert to join us on a fantastic journey ahead!


You will have big role in a fantastic (small, 5) team and work closely with our solutions architect and the data science guys. You will build back-end in the system, create database structures, share and implement ideas to scale the business using restfulAPIs.

jobs.title: Healthcare-Improving UX Design Lead
jobs.content:
Greenhouse link

Make An Impact On Healthcare

More than 250,000 Americans died last year as a result of medical error1. Sadly, many of these deaths could have been prevented with existing best practices for quality and patient safety. A hospital’s best tool for standardizing and implementing these life-saving improvements are their written policies and procedures. PolicyStat’s mission is to improve healthcare delivery by making those policies and procedures easier to find, access, and manage. Our clients (across 46/50 states) use our SaaS application to ensure that their policies are correct, their staff can find and implement those policies, and that their policies support regulatory compliance.

You deserve an environment with clear goals, problems that are meaningful and challenging, the autonomy necessary for creativity, and the support/resources necessary to make a dent in the universe. We want to provide you with that environment so that together, we can improve healthcare.

Help Us Collaborate Towards Awesome

We need a senior UX designer to lead our design process and help us take our product to the next level. Our product team understands the importance of good design and we need someone to help us, guide us, and teach us. We’re a process-driven team looking for a fellow process nerd with strong opinions about how to bake good UX design into iterative product development. We’ve recently been freed from the tyranny of supporting Old IE, and we’re excited for the opportunity to improve interaction for the hundreds of thousands of people that rely on PolicyStat.

How You’ll Help Further PolicyStat’s Mission

  • You’ll work with the rest of the product team to make our clients more successful by iterating on existing design, completely reworking systems, designing new features, and improving our processes.
  • You’ll establish, document, and “own” a design system to standardize and improve our design practices.
  • You’ll work with our engineers to write and run usability tests towards improving our product.
  • You’ll design interactions, build mockups, write copy, perform design reviews, and collaborate as part of our product enhancement workflow.

Totally Strict Job Requirements

The Perfect Candidate™ will have:

  • Strength in Structure and Interaction design, according to the 4-layer design taxonomy2
  • A hunger for information on entrepreneurship and user experience
  • Experience improving design in a continuous delivery environment (we deployed ~500 times last year)
  • A portfolio demonstrating some of their design work
  • A process-oriented approach to design
  • Technical expertise with at least one prototyping/wireframing tool (e.g. Sketch, Balsamiq, UXPin)
  • Expertise in creating and administering usability tests towards improving design (we use Validately)
  • Expertise in clarifying data, indicating relationships, and hinting at behavior using using color, style, iconography, web typography, information design, and visual hierarchy
  • Experience implementing incremental design changes using a UI framework (e.g. Twitter Bootstrap)
  • Experience using responsive design to deliver great experiences across a range of devices

About PolicyStat

PolicyStat is a rapidly-growing SaaS company ( >50% yearly growth for 6+ years) with a product our clients love (>99% renewal rate). Our company has been named one of the Best Places to Work in Indiana for the past 3 years and we’re on the INC 5000 list of America’s fastest-growing private companies.

We pay market rate, provide full benefits, equity, flexible hours/PTO, conference/travel budget, and excellent hardware/tools.

We welcome candidates of all genders, creeds, races, and sexual orientations!

jobs.title: PHP/Magento/Zend Framework Developer
jobs.content:
We're a small group of (debatably) cool people who like to build software tools that simplify and improve processes and applications in our warehouse, office, and online. We are seeking a passionate programmer - perhaps with a self-taught mentality - who works hard and enjoys exploring the unknown. Of course, we also want someone who likes to have fun. We're all about the work-life balance.


When you land this gig, you'll receive an awesome health/dental benefits package, 401k matching, the computer of your dreams, and the opportunity to make a significant impact on your first day.

jobs.title: Senior Data Scientist
jobs.content:
Discovering new music can happen at anytime so whether its over a morning coffee or tagging the number one on your weekly shop, we bring a unique brand of magic to millions of our users every day. Making this a reality has been achieved through our most important asset, our people. So come and share your talent with us and help determine how the world will Shazam next, be the reason all our users stop, smile and say ‘wow’.


Role Scenario


We are looking for a creative, detailed-orientated and experienced Senior Data Scientist with solid scientific knowledge and engineering skills. You will be passionate about music and the music industry and contribute to our data-driven music features like our music recommendations and content generation algorithms by analyzing our massive datasets, interpreting trends and identifying actionable insights and opportunities. You will utilize statistical models and machine learning methods to help take these features to the next level. 


Where Does The Role Sit? 


The role is a Senior Data Science position and will be based in our Data Engineering team who are responsible for our data platform and building our data driven features. The team is based in our Redwood City office.


What Will You Do?



  • Analyse large, complex datasets to reveal underlying patterns, correlations and trends.

  • Assist with the implementation and scale-up of Shazam’s machine learning models

  • Drive development of machine learning techniques to model customer behaviour and preferences.

  • Create prototypes for new personalisation features and turn machine-learning outputs into operational data products.

  • Set up and conduct large-scale experiments to test hypotheses and drive product development.

  • Research and leverage new machine learning methodologies to improve current products and influence the future roadmap.

  • Use historic data to forecast key trends and predict events of interest.

  • Leverage quantitative techniques to answer non-routine business problems.

jobs.title: Solutions Engineer
jobs.content:
We’re looking for a seasoned Ruby developer with a passion for technical problem-solving and customer relations to join our growing team. As a Solutions Engineer, you’d leverage your technical expertise and coding skills to solve our customers’ problems. You’d investigate, develop, automate, and communicate to get the job done.  


What you’ll do:



  • Spend 50% of your time coding creative solutions to customers’ needs

  • Develop time-saving tools and automated processes to reduce integration setup overhead

  • Work with customers’ technical teams to plan, coordinate, and execute on integrations with 3rd party systems

  • Present YouEarnedIt’s technical capabilities and security features to customers in a pre-sales capacity

  • Work with our Customer Success team to triage, investigate, and resolve customer support issues

  • Influence our product’s direction with your ideas and insight into our customers’ needs

jobs.title: Web Application Developer
jobs.content:
Independent School Management (ISM) is seeking a highly motivated and talented Web Application Developer to join our Software Development Team and help implement a wide variety of cutting-edge web applications.



Who we’re looking for



  • A person who is excited to start new projects, and is passionate about Web Development

  • A team-oriented developer who knows that open communication should be the only form of communication

  • A flexible developer who is organized and can manage multiple projects and timelines on any given day

  • Someone who is willing to dive in and help out the team with every opportunity

  • A forward-thinking developer who thinks that thorough comments and documentation are equally important as readable code

  • A person who can help take a project from design to launch

  • Someone who can help gather and interpret project requirements and bring them to life

  • An eager developer who wants to expand their web chops by experimenting, reading, and asking questions, in that order

  • Someone who wants to research, share, learn, and teach the newest ideas and technologies

  • A developer who enjoys solving difficult problems through careful thought and deliberation with others

  • A person who loves to discuss nerdy things



The perks



  • Competitive compensation package

  • Open, relaxed atmosphere

  • Casual dress code

  • Industry standard and modern development tools and environments

  • Professional development opportunities



The technical stuff



  • B.A. or B.S. in a related field preferred

  • At least 2 years experience in the field

  • Experience working in a team

  • Experience with relational databases and server-side programming required

  • Experience with Javascript

  • A firm understanding of Object-Oriented Programming

  • Experience with version control



Other things we’d love to see



  • Experience with PHP and MySQL

  • Experience with or knowledge of RESTful web services

  • Experience with HTML5 and CSS3

  • Experience with Git, Vagrant, Grunt/Gulp

  • Experience with CSS/Sass, jQuery, AngularJS

  • Experience with Linux servers



Want to join our team? — we want to hear from you!

jobs.title: Developer (Data and Usage Analytics)
jobs.company: Data Analytics Digital Public Library Of America
jobs.content:
The Digital Public Library of America seeks a full-time Developer to support large-scale processing and analysis of descriptions of and usage data about open access materials from libraries, archives, and museums across the United States. This position will be directly involved in improving DPLA's ingestion and extract, transform, and load processes, in addition to helping develop processes and platforms to identify usage patterns of content aggregated by DPLA across user-facing platforms, social media, and APIs.

We are seeking a curious and enthusiastic individual who recognizes both their technical strengths and areas for growth, who can help us work effectively to further DPLA's mission to bring together the riches of America's libraries, archives, and museums, and make them freely available to all. A belief in this mission, and the drive to accomplish it over time in a collaborative spirit within and beyond the organization, is essential.

Responsibilities

Reporting to the Director for Technology, the Developer:

  • Improves DPLA's metadata ingestion and ETL processes to generate RDF metadata and address data quality issues at scale in a repeatable manner over time.
  • Implements hooks and workflows for data collection, analysis and reporting on data quality and usage metrics throughout DPLA's infrastructure.
  • Collaborates closely with internal and external stakeholders in data management and reuse of DPLA content, including the DPLA Data Services Coordinator, DPLA engagement and use staff, and staff at DPLA partner institutions.
  • Actively contributes to the development of staff- and partner-facing tools for data analysis and business intelligence.

  • Performs other related duties and participates in special projects as assigned. As a member of the DPLA Technology Team, the Developer:

  • Contributes to design, development, testing, integration, support, and documentation of user-facing applications and back-end systems.

  • Supports content management policies, process, and workflows, and contributes to the development of new ones.

  • Collaborates with internal and external stakeholders in planning and implementation of applications supporting DPLA's mission, strategic plan, and special initiatives.

  • Maintains knowledge of emerging technologies to support the DPLA's evolving services.

  • Embodies and promotes the philosophy of open source, shared, and community-built software and technologies.

  • Ensures both high quality and reasonable throughput in data processing.

  • Brings creative vision around possibilities for work with data that we haven't yet imagined.

Requirements

  • 5+ years professional experience in software development or a related discipline.
  • A proven ability to build large, reliable, and scalable infrastructure.
  • Experience with data integration to support analytics and business intelligence.
  • Demonstrated experience with REST API design.
  • Demonstrated experience working effectively in a team environment and the ability to interact well with stakeholders.
  • Desire and enthusiasm about learning new toolsets, programming languages, or methods to support software development.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • Excellent problem-solving and organizational skills.

Preferred Qualifications

  • Experience with extract-transform-load workflows with varying input sources.
  • Broad experience and understanding of analysis and aggregation of metrics from heterogenous sources, including usage analytics
  • Experience developing visualizations, dashboards, or other user-facing tools to support business intelligence.
  • Advanced knowledge of semantic web technologies such as RDF, SPARQL, and LDP, and semantic enrichment and reconciliation processes.
  • Demonstrated experience with standards, data models, and protocols including Dublin Core, MODS, METS, MARCXML, IIIF, OAI-PMH, OAI-ORE, and ResourceSync.
  • A successful history of working effectively in a geographically-distributed organization.

This position is full-time. DPLA is a geographically-distributed organization, with headquarters in Boston, Massachusetts. Ideally, this position would be situated in the Northeast Corridor between Washington and Boston, but remote work based in other locations will also be considered.

Like its collection, DPLA is strongly committed to diversity in all of its forms. We provide a full set of benefits, including health care, life and disability insurance, and a retirement plan. Starting salary is commensurate with experience.

About DPLA

The Digital Public Library of America strives to contain the full breadth of human expression, from the written word, to works of art and culture, to records of America's heritage, to the efforts and data of science. Since launching in April 2013, it has aggregated more than 13 million items from 2,000 institutions. DPLA is a registered 501(c)(3) non-profit.

jobs.title: Java Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Job listings do not always do justice to a company's environment and who would work well inside that culture and environment. If you would take the time to read this short article, besides the listing of skills below, it does an excellent job of describing who we are looking for. If the article speaks to you and what you are seeking in your career, please contact me. 


The Best Job Description for an Engineer Ever Written



Asynchrony Labs, a subsidiary of World Wide Technology, Inc. has opportunities for Java Software Developers to assist in the analysis of business, engineering and scientific problems, as well as the documentation and development of well-defined methods, procedures and programs in the delivery of practical systems solutions.

jobs.title: Growth Hacker
jobs.content:
[Greenhouse link](http://grnh.se/cutdi4)

# Make An Impact, Grow Your Skills

You deserve an environment with clear goals, challenging problems, the autonomy necessary for creativity, and the support/resources necessary to make a dent in the universe. We can provide you with that environment.

Your goal will be both clear and challenging: fuel growth [1]. Youâll use the growth hacking toolkit to optimize and scale up lead generation outside of our core market, translating an ad-hoc strategy of periodically picking up non-hospital companies via our website into a well-polished, data-informed growth engine. You will be equal part entrepreneur, product marketer, mad scientist, inbound marketer, and sales strategist. You will wield a budget and have the direct support of PolicyStatâs CEO, VP of Product, and VP of Business Development.

# Help Us Collaborate Towards Awesome

We're a self-funding (cash flow positive), rapidly-growing company (>50% annually for 6+ years) with a product our clients love (>99% renewal rate, clients in 45/50 states). We work with our clients to improve healthcare delivery via their organizational playbook: policies and procedures. Our hands-on implementation and support teams help our clients use the PolicyStat web app to improve the quality of their policies, to ensure their staff can find and use those policies, and to ensure that their policies support regulatory compliance.

Until now, our sales and marketing efforts have been almost entirely focused on hospitals and integrated healthcare systems. Despite that, weâve acquired a diverse set of customers outside that core market. To continue our growth, weâre ready to broaden our focus to include some of these other markets, and weâre looking for a growth hacker to lead the charge.

# Your Objective

Your âtrue northâ will be growth, but some of the tactics to achieve that goal will probably include PPC, landing page optimization, customer development interviews, content marketing, SEO, direct sales, and social media.

# Totally Strict Job Requirements

There are none! But The Perfect Candidateâ¢ will have:

- An innate hunger for information on entrepreneurship and digital marketing
- T-shaped [2] web marketing skills
- A deep understanding of analytics, running experiments, and data-driven decision making
- Experience performing customer development
- Experience crafting go-to-market strategy
- Experience in B2B sales

jobs.title: Healthcare Improving UX Design Lead
jobs.content:
[Greenhouse link](http://grnh.se/a5mi7w)

# Make An Impact On Healthcare

More than 250,000 Americans died last year as a result of medical error[1]. Sadly, many of these deaths could have been prevented with existing best practices for quality and patient safety. A hospitalâs best tool for standardizing and implementing these life-saving improvements are their written policies and procedures. PolicyStatâs mission is to improve healthcare delivery by making those policies and procedures easier to find, access, and manage. Our clients (across 46/50 states) use our SaaS application to ensure that their policies are correct, their staff can find and implement those policies, and that their policies support regulatory compliance.

You deserve an environment with clear goals, problems that are meaningful and challenging, the autonomy necessary for creativity, and the support/resources necessary to make a dent in the universe. We want to provide you with that environment so that together, we can improve healthcare.

# Help Us Collaborate Towards Awesome

We need a senior UX designer to lead our design process and help us take our product to the next level. Our product team understands the importance of good design and we need someone to help us, guide us, and teach us. Weâre a process-driven team looking for a fellow process nerd with strong opinions about how to bake good UX design into iterative product development. Weâve recently been freed from the tyranny of supporting Old IE, and weâre excited for the opportunity to improve interaction for the hundreds of thousands of people that rely on PolicyStat.

# How Youâll Help Further PolicyStatâs Mission

Youâll work with the rest of the product team to make our clients more successful by iterating on existing design, completely reworking systems, designing new features, and improving our processes.
Youâll establish, document, and âownâ a design system to standardize and improve our design practices.
Youâll work with our engineers to write and run usability tests towards improving our product.
Youâll design interactions, build mockups, write copy, perform design reviews, and collaborate as part of our product enhancement workflow.
Totally Strict Job Requirements

# The Perfect Candidateâ¢ will have:

Strength in Structure and Interaction design, according to the 4-layer design taxonomy[2]
A hunger for information on entrepreneurship and user experience
Experience improving design in a continuous delivery environment (we deployed ~500 times last year)
A portfolio demonstrating some of their design work
A process-oriented approach to design
Technical expertise with at least one prototyping/wireframing tool (e.g. Sketch, Balsamiq, UXPin)
Expertise in creating and administering usability tests towards improving design (we use Validately)
Expertise in clarifying data, indicating relationships, and hinting at behavior using using color, style, iconography, web typography, information design, and visual hierarchy
Experience implementing incremental design changes using a UI framework (e.g. Twitter Bootstrap)
Experience using responsive design to deliver great experiences across a range of devices
About PolicyStat

PolicyStat is a rapidly-growing SaaS company ( >50% yearly growth for 6+ years) with a product our clients love (>99% renewal rate). Our company has been named one of the Best Places to Work in Indiana for the past 3 years and weâre on the INC 5000 list of Americaâs fastest-growing private companies.

We pay market rate, provide full benefits, equity, flexible hours/PTO, conference/travel budget, and excellent hardware/tools.

We welcome candidates of all genders, creeds, races, and sexual orientations!

[1]: https://hub.jhu.edu/2016/05/03/medical-errors-third-leading-cause-of-death

[2]: https://blog.intercom.io/wp-content/uploads/2013/09/DribbblePostImage7.png

jobs.title: Software
jobs.content:
Company Overview



uShip is the world's first and largest shipping marketplace. Consumers and businesses can compare and book bids from hundreds of thousands of customer-reviewed transportation service providers, ranging from independent owner-operators to the largest freight carriers and brokers. Customers save money and service providers use their empty cargo space - everyone wins! We're an Internet company focused on solving a real-world problem and having loads (pun intended) of fun along the way. Our service providers are even featured in A&E's real life drama, 'Shipping Wars.'



Since launching uShip in 2004, our mission has been to be the world's leading online solution for shipping anything, anytime, anywhere. We are passionate about empowering buyers and providers of transportation services to efficiently conduct business on an unbiased, transparent and competitive platform.  uShip is headquartered in Austin, TX .



If you are a motivated, smart, and driven individual who wants to work in an energetic and entrepreneurial environment with outstanding career and growth opportunities, then this is the career opportunity for you!



What you'll be doing:




  • Developing web applications using Microsoft .Net and open source technologies.

  • Creating and enhancing product features in MVC 4 and WebAPI 2 with C#, as well as some ASP.Net Webforms using VB.Net

  • Working directly with Product Managers, Developers and Quality Assurance to deliver new products and features.

  • Modifying existing applications and features to improve performance, code readability etc.

  • Communicating your ideas across a team of 30 developers



Skills you have include:




  • 3+ year experience and fluency in one or more object oriented languages

  • Experience working with a relational database platform like SQL Server or Oracle, both using stored procedures and an ORM like Entity Framework or NHibernate

  • Building web applications using an MVC framework

  • Writing automated tests using NUnit, JUnit or an equivalent

  • Using distributed version control, preferably Git or Mercurial

  • Breaking down user stories into actionable tasks

  • The ability to communicate cross-functionally among other departments



Ideally, you also:




  • Have built or worked on a RESTful API. Experience with Microsoft WebAPI is a plus.

  • Understand and can recognize design patterns

  • Have worked with at least one NoSQL platform

  • Have implemented responsive design techniques for mobile-friendly applications

  • Have client-side experience in one or more JavaScript frameworks

  • Have worked with a CSS framework like Bootstrap or Foundation

  • Know how to write code that's safe to deploy in a Continuous Integration environment



Why work at uShip?




  • Competitive Salary

  • 100% Paid health and dental insurance

  • Pre-IPO Stock Options

  • Annual uShip Free Shipping Allowance ($500)

  • Free lunch, snacks, and drinks

  • Dog friendly

  • Casual dress code

  • And so much more!



This position is located in Austin, TX.  Please check out our culture page (http://about.uship.com/culture/) to learn more about the perks and benefits of working at uShip!



Hear what our developers have to say about working at uShip...https://youtu.be/Ys-t6_s3PhA

jobs.title: Junior Developer
jobs.content:
We're looking for a junior full-stack JavaScript programmer to help expand the feature set for our database application builder product. Knack is a huge product that touches on all things data: you'll have a huge developer playground to dive right in and make a major impact.

__What You'll Do__

Contribute! We want our engineers to make an impact on the Knack product. This means you're not just implementing features that have been specified to death. It includes developing ideas, making suggestions, and keeping on top of new tech to understand how we can best leverage those to constantly improve the product.

Engage your passion! We have enough areas of need where we want to leverage what you're excited about and use that to make Knack a better product.

Program every day and publish many times every week.

Evaluate existing code and redesign for increased performance and reliability.

Help develop features missing from the current app to make Knack the go-to place for building online databases.

__Our Stack__
* Node.js
* MongoDB
* Solr
* jQuery, Backbone
* AWS
* Github

__What We're Looking For__

Efficiency and productivity, i.e. the ability to get sh!# done.

Great communication. If you like to go off to your bunker and only pop up on occasion this won't work.

An independent and versatile hacker, with the ability to pick up different languages, frameworks and techniques with relative ease.

A practical understanding of what programming is for. Hint: it's our customers.

A very strong foundation of client-side Javascript and Node.js.

A desire to be givin big responsibilites and to make the most of those opportunities to jump start your career

jobs.title: Senior Back End Focused Full Stack .NET Developer
jobs.content:
We want to work with people that thrive in an unstructured, startup environment who are creative and independent – folks who solve problems they haven’t even been asked to solve.  As important you'll need to have the ambition and eagerness to learn new skills and new technologies.


We value the ability to get things done. We don’t keep track of how much or when you work, just what you accomplish. At Venga you’ll need to speak up and be heard, pitch in wherever and whenever needed. And in return, you’ll have the most rewarding (in many ways) work experience of your life.

jobs.title: Implementation Engineer
jobs.content:
InFlight is looking for an Implementation Engineer who understands the root causes of the problem, delivers a full resolution to the customer, and makes strategic recommendations to the developers. A hybrid support person who does so much more, including work on other development and process-improvement projects as needed. 


What we do


At InFlight, we believe that multimillion dollar enterprise software can and should be every bit as easy-to-use as a $1 smartphone app.


InFlight modernizes and mobilizes business critical enterprise applications for Fortune 500 customers, giving them full control over the user experience.


Our technology is unique in the market and enables customers to completely re-imagine cumbersome and complicated applications to put users first and make it easier for them to complete tasks.


Thanks to InFlight, there are currently over 1 million users who are now more productive and more engaged with the software they rely on to do their jobs.


So what do we need? Someone who wants to:



  • Participate in our team-based sales process (setting up compelling customer-specific demo environments, analyzing customer requirements to determine our product’s suitability, etc.)

  • Install and configure InFlight products in customer environments

  • Help build installer scripts (or helping augment customer-provided installer scripts) for migrations to Production and pre-Production environments

  • Manage the InFlight customer support portal and associated processes

  • Take ownership of customer reported issues and resolving them without the need for escalation

  • Document troubleshooting and problem resolution steps

  • Provide training to customers as needed

  • Champion best-practices to help make InFlight “harder, better, faster, stronger”

jobs.title: Senior Customer Support Engineer

  • Act as the primary point of contact for customers regarding software product support during post-sales and selected pre-sales situations

jobs.title: Ruby on Rails Full Stack Developer — Europe
jobs.content:
Headquarters: Lyon, France
URL: https://emailhunter.workable.com/jobs/287671

Email Hunter crunches the web's data to allow businesses to connect to each other. More than one hundred thousand users are using our products every week. And our growth continues! We focus on building a powerful, simple and efficient service. We're looking for a Full Stack Developer to help us create the perfect experience for our users.

At Email Hunter, we prefer to spend most of our energy building the best possible product. We believe in systems and processes that let us scale our impact to be larger than ourselves.

We're looking for a passionate developer to work on the application and help all sales and recruiting people dream of. You will work both on the back-end (in particular our API) and the front facing part of our service. Our service is expanding and you'll be part of building this future.

On a daily basis, you obsess over details. You know that small changes in UI or copywriting can make a big difference on thousands of users using Email Hunter every day. At the same time, you're searching for efficiency. You like to focus on what's essential and solve technical problems with elegant solutions. Simplicity is reflected in both your code and the features you build.

REQUIREMENTS

  • You are based in Europe
  • You write high quality, maintainable and testable code in Ruby on Rails
  • You're very comfortable with JavaScript (bonus points for familiarities with Backbone.js)
  • You have strong English communication skills
  • You are detail-oriented and want to deliver the best experience possible to Email Hunter's users!

BENEFITS

We love working at Email Hunter. We're psyched by what we're building and the context we're doing it in. You'll get the chance to feel the same and take part in the adventure with us. The perks you'll get to enjoy:

  • Remote & flexible work
  • 3 company-paid annual retreats to amazing places
  • Profit sharing

jobs.title: Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Giant Swarmâs mission is to give developers the power and freedom to build the software that runs the world.

Developers use Giant Swarm to easily deploy, run, and scale their applications as well as easily collaborate on and share their infrastructure stacks with the community.


# We are looking for a Software Engineer (m/f)#
**Your Job:**

* You will be responsible for architecting and building distributed systems
* You will use a wide variety of open source technologies and tools
* You take part for testing, metrics, continuous integration

**Requirements:**

* You have experience with more than one language and a strong architectural background. One of these languages is Go.
* You love to automate things and you are used to deploy in production multiple times a day
* You are a profound Linux user
* You have worked with docker, experiences with kubernetes, prometheus are a bonus point
* You prefer to build your applicatinons as multiple services instead of a monolith
* You know the concepts of CAP theorem, paxos/raft concensus, distributed databases and message passing

**WHY US?**

We like to give you a glimpse on how working with is like:

**Self-organization**

Creative work needs freedom and openness. We encourage you to do your work wherever and whenever you want. We expect passion and encourage sustainability. If you need rest, take it. We don't count holidays - we count outcome.

**Teamwork**

Our ambitious goals are only achievable as a team. Everybodyâs input is highly welcome and appreciated. Although sometimes rules and processes are necessary, we try to keep them as lean as possible. Always question the status quo and find new ways of collaboration and team work.

**Learning**

Learning is mandatory and fun at the same time. If you realize you want to expand your knowledge in a specific area, we support you with conferences, books etc.

**Basics**

We offer fair (transparent and open) salaries with benefits like choosing your own laptop, jobticket, coffee flat, mate etc.. And you will participate in our stock options program. Currently our team members have more children than we are employees. So family friendliness is a must.

jobs.title: Principal Web Developer
jobs.content:
Comcast brings together the best in media and technology. We drive innovation to create the world's best entertainment and online experiences. As a Fortune 50 leader, we set the pace in a variety of innovative and fascinating businesses and create career opportunities across a wide range of locations and disciplines. We are at the forefront of change and move at an amazing pace, thanks to our remarkable people, who bring cutting-edge products and services to life for millions of customers every day. If you share in our passion for teamwork, our vision to revolutionize industries and our goal to lead the future in media and technology, we want you to fast-forward your career at Comcast.






Comcast is looking for a Principal Web Developer to join our exciting confidential team. As we continue to grow, we are looking for talented, passionate people. A successful candidate will have an established background in developing high volume and highly available services, strong technical ability, great communication skills, and a motivation to achieve results in a dynamic fast paced environment.



Responsibilities

Serve as the Lead for the team in the technical development of company's front end deliveries. Working collaboratively with all developers and software engineers

Provides advanced application development and technical support for customer-facing websites.

Provides technical solutions in new systems development, new package evaluations and enhancements of existing systems

Participates actively in agile practices by collaborating with product owners, Business Analysts, Scrum Masters, and other team members in such activities as grooming user stories with cross-functional development teams

Participates in the technical design, development, testing, implementation and maintenance of website enhancements

Responsible for engineering best practices leading to excellent overall quality of software

Provides guidance and work leadership to less-experienced staff

Maintains current knowledge of relevant technology as assigned

Supports a culture of continuous improvement.

 



Basic Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or related field or equivalent work experience required

At least 6+ years’ experience in front end, mobile and responsive web development including: HTML/CSS, JSON, XML, Javascript, JQuery, AngularJS, Apache, source control, Rest API’s



Preferred Qualifications

Professional experience using one or more client side JavaScript frameworks such as, AngularJS, Ember.js, Node.js, etc.

Substantial experience in designing, building, & implementing software solutions in an agile environment.

Good understanding of secure web programming practices and security issues as they pertain to web applications

Understanding of Test Driven Development (TDD) practices and preferred experience with Junit, Jasmine, Protractor, or other testing tools

Excellent coaching and mentoring skills

Understands the fundamentals of iterative development

Understands Continuous Integration/Continuous Development

Understands the value of commitments to delivery made by a development team

Ability to effectively prioritize and execute tasks in an environment with high visibility and similarly high expectations

Collaborative, customer-focused and able to create visible value

jobs.title: JavaScript Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Engineering and Platform Services helps drive the new generation of products that are transforming Comcast into a media and technology company. Engineering manages the operations for Comcast's industry-leading video, high-speed Internet and voice services for consumers and businesses, and runs a network that supports numerous multi-billion dollar businesses.



Comcast Platform Services includes four companies owned by Comcast, namely FreeWheel, STRATA, Visible World and thePlatform, plus the Comcast Wholesale, Advanced Advertising, and Advertising Technology organizations. These companies are creating next-generation technology for the fast-growing advanced advertising market. They enable and innovate solutions to support both traditional and emerging programmatic and premium advertising markets through our platforms, data, marketplace and sales channels.




As part of a team dedicated to Comcast's video playback experience, you'll have direct impact on the consumer experience of watching video over the web. We provide solutions for content protection (DRM), advertisements, and realtime analytics of the video playback experience. Our libraries interact with many different external systems in order to provide a consistent playback experience across multiple devices and applications.



This position is targeted for JS player but there is opportunity to work on all platforms. The Player Platform currently runs on iOS, Android, Desktop (Flash & JS), Set Top Boxes, Xbox, and Samsung Smart TVs.You'll be working with the best and brightest minds in Comcast building the next video platform that will power Comcast for years to come. You will drive the future of the IP Video industry.



Combine your software engineering skills with the latest web and mobile technologies and come work as a Software Engineer at thePlatform, the leading online video management and publishing company.



Skills & Requirements

B.S. or M.S. Computer Science or related Field

3+ years experience

Passion for HTML5 and Javascript development

Familiarity with ES6 and TypeScript is a plus

Familiar with JavaScript module loaders such as CommonJS and/or RequireJS

Familiar with JavaScript build tools such as grunt, gulp, webpack, etc

Experience with writing JavaScript unit tests

Familiar with a scripting language

Familiar with design patterns and how they apply to JavaScript applications

Experience with version control tools such as git.

Experience designing clean, concise, maintainable APIs

Experience with multi-threading programing

Good communicator and able to clearly articulate complex issues and technologies

Willing to take ownership of problems and see them through to resolution

Comfortable working in a fast paced agile environment.

jobs.title: Eng 3, Prodt Dev Engineering
jobs.content:
Comcast's Technology & Product organization works at the intersection of media and technology. Our innovative teams are continually developing and delivering products that transform the customer experience. From creating apps like TVGo to new features such as the Talking Guide on the X1 platform, we work every day to make a positive impact through innovation in the pursuit of building amazing products that are enjoyable, easy to use and accessible across all platforms. The team also develops and supports our evolving network architecture, including next-generation consumer systems and technologies, infrastructure and engineering, network integration and management tools, and technical standards.





Job Summary:

Responsible for assisting in the design of system architectures and

solutions to bring to market new innovative products which span web

service offerings. Assists in the planning, designing, integrating,

testing, deploying and supporting of products. Helps with testing and

operational activities. Has in-depth experience, knowledge and skills in

own discipline. Usually determines own work priorities. Acts as

resource for colleagues with less experience.



Core Responsibilities:

- Supports the architecture, design, development, qualification and

deployment of applications consistent with product and technical

roadmaps.

- Works with engineering project management and principle engineers to

deliver applications that meet or exceed product requirements, project

schedules and reliability.

- Develops and applies performance and bandwidth models for interactive

applications to document network impacts.

- Works with the product development and operations teams to define

technical requirements to accompany existing product and operation

requirements. Designs and develops use cases in support of the technical

requirements. Transforms technical requirements into architectures.

- Defines and documents a detailed design to meet technical requirements

and architecture.

- Assists in vendor technical selection and management including input

to specifications and vendor evaluation. Interfaces with outside teams

in the development of internal and third party software to support the

detailed designs.

- Interfaces with Company test teams to validate Company test plans and

procedures are representative of fully exercising and validating the

product features and capabilities.

- Works closely with development, integration and test teams to ensure

product quality. Prepares deliverables for trial and market readiness.

- Drives the continuous improvement of deployed systems by consistently

looking for ways to reduce costs and improve efficiency.

- Supports operations by providing deployment and sustained engineering

support for all responsible systems and technologies. Diagnoses and

resolves escalated field issues.

- Consistent exercise of independent judgment and discretion in matters

of significance.

- Regular, consistent and punctual attendance. Must be able to work

nights and weekends, variable schedule(s) as necessary.

- Other duties and responsibilities as assigned.



Job Specification:



- Degree in Computer Science is preferred



- Experience programming with Golang is a huge plus



- Solid understanding of networking concepts and protocols



- Software development experience around network performance and architecture as well as a desire to work on Internet standards based projects

- Bachelors Degree or Equivalent

- Engineering, Computer Science

- Generally requires 5-8 years related experience

jobs.title: Solutions Architect Manager
jobs.content:
Engineering and Platform Services helps drive the new generation of products that are transforming Comcast into a media and technology company. Engineering manages the operations for Comcast's industry-leading video, high-speed Internet and voice services for consumers and businesses, and runs a network that supports numerous multi-billion dollar businesses.



Comcast Platform Services includes four companies owned by Comcast, namely FreeWheel, STRATA, Visible World and thePlatform, plus the Comcast Wholesale, Advanced Advertising, and Advertising Technology organizations. These companies are creating next-generation technology for the fast-growing advanced advertising market. They enable and innovate solutions to support both traditional and emerging programmatic and premium advertising markets through our platforms, data, marketplace and sales channels.




This Solutions Architect Manager role requires a strong background in solutions architecture as well as several years of team management experience. thePlatform's media publishing system SDK and custom solutions are extensive and require in-depth technical understanding to apply them effectively. Solutions Architects do not contribute code to the project codebase, but being able to prototype new functionality is important. In this role you will be an individual contributor in a custom-facing engagement as part of our Consulting Services organization. You will also manage a team of solutions architects involved in independent engagements.







Responsibilities






  • Serve as primary technical contact with the client.

  • Gather product requirements, evaluate, and when necessary prototype, alternatives to determine the most appropriate approach for each solution.

  • Determine how to satisfy these requirements using thePlatform's SDK and services.

  • Where appropriate, define new services to fulfill a project's particular needs.

  • Prepare functional specifications that can be understood by customers and internal development teams.

  • Work with the professional services team members to estimate the work for a given project.

  • At times work directly with the sales force to coordinate new projects, many of which will involve multiple phases.

  • Transition finished projects to the support group.

  • Represent thePlatform in discussions with client's engineering, marketing, business development, and other high-level departments.

  • Drive execution of products from inception to release.

  • Manage a team of solutions architects.

  • Be a hiring manager for future growth of the team





Requirements






  • At least 5 years solutions architecture experience including experience defining and developing against SDKs.

  • Prior team management experience.

  • Proven experience with SOA, design patterns, web services technologies, and UI design.

  • Proven experience as a technical leader. Demonstrated ability to lead the design and development of complex applications.

  • Strong sense of responsibility and ownership for the success of projects from inception to rollout and maintenance.

  • Understanding of and experience with the full software development lifecycle (SDLC), including functional and technical specification, implementation, QA processes, deployment, and maintenance.

  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills.

  • Ability and confidence to work closely with a customer in pre-sales and collaborative scenarios.

  • At least 2 years software experience at an engineering level.

  • A Bachelor Degree in computer science or a related field is required.

  • Knowledge of rich media and content management a plus.





About thePlatform



thePlatform is the leading provider of online video publishing and management solutions. Media companies rely on our cloud-based video platform as their open, central hub for managing, monetizing, and syndicating billions of internet video views each year. thePlatform's services provide unmatched versatility for designing and supporting streaming video businesses on PCs, mobile devices, and TV. Some of our customers include SyFy, Fox Sports Network, NBC Sports, National Geographic, Comcast, British Telecom, Travel Channel, and more.





We are determined to create an environment where our employees feel valued, understand our business goals, and are motivated to provide our customers with the best online video publishing and management solutions in the industry.





We are a team of incredibly bright and driven people, who also believe in having fun. We enjoy a dynamic and flexible work environment, and hope you will consider joining us.





This position will be filled at thePlatform's headquarters in Seattle, WA. Our stylish downtown location is easily accessible by bus, train, car, and bicycle (we have racks and showers!). A subsidiary of Comcast, thePlatform offers competitive compensation and spectacular benefits typically seen only at very large organizations.





Check us out on Facebook and learn more about us! http://www.facebook.com/theplatform.people






Comcast is an EOE/Veterans/Disabled/LGBT employer

jobs.title: Engineer 2, Engineering Ops
jobs.content:
Engineering and Platform Services helps drive the new generation of products that are transforming Comcast into a media and technology company. Engineering manages the operations for Comcast's industry-leading video, high-speed Internet and voice services for consumers and businesses, and runs a network that supports numerous multi-billion dollar businesses.



Platform Services includes three companies owned by Comcast, namely FreeWheel, STRATA and thePlatform, plus the Comcast Wholesale, Advanced Advertising, and Advertising Technology organizations. These companies are creating next-generation technology for the fast-growing advanced advertising market. They enable and innovate solutions to support both traditional and emerging programmatic and premium advertising markets through our platforms, data, marketplace and sales channels.




Job Summary:

Responsible for operating, deploying, managing, and continuously improving Comcast's Voice, Video, Commercial, Data, Home Security,

Systems, and Network services as well as associated infrastructure in a 7/24 environment. Examples of infrastructure include, but are not

limited to: routers, CMTS, switches, optical and TDM transport, applications, servers, IP scopes, databases, etc. Position focuses on

deploying and stabilizing code, technologies, services, networks, systems, tools and driving standardization, automation, and service

focused instrumentation. Provides subject matter expertise, resolves complex break/fix scenarios, engaging broader teams as necessary;

partners with/leads engineering, vendors, and regions to achieve continuous improvement. Serves as high-tier operations support for

various field, CARE, vendors, and customer-focused organizations. Contributes to command and control-related activities focused on

restoration of complex outages, communication across Comcast, and rapid restoration. Works and directly leads external vendors, third parties,

and associated agencies, when necessary, to address issues across the PSTN, peering arrangements, inter-operability issues, etc. Works with

limited supervision and direction while executing associated functions and responsibilities. Follows operational practices and independently

determines/develops approaches for non-routine solutions. Receives general direction in areas of focus. Serves as team lead on projects.



Core Responsibilities:

- Administers and deploys configuration changes in a Weblogic, Unix, Linux environments. Develops and implements fail over procedures to mitigate impacts resulting from failures in the application or infrastructure.

- Performs a variety of complex analytical duties in the planning, deployment, testing and evaluation of Comcast's network, products, and

services including CRAN, CMTS, and the IP platform, Voice, Data, Commercial, Systems, and Video platform. Works closely with engineering,

vendors, and field to identify and drive improvements across the topology.

- Directs third party agencies (i.e. AT&T, Verizon) and internal resources while troubleshooting and resolving complex peer-to-peer

troubles focusing on rapid restoration. Devises and implements strategies for solving technical issues directly impacting internal and

external customers or increasing performance across broad eco-systems.



- Develops, produces, and reviews of documentation, instructional, and procedural manuals for other employees to utilize to resolve problems or

make network improvements. Examples include: complex processes for acceptance of new products (i.e. cable modems, systems,) testing such as operational readiness, tools focused on automation (i.e. IP scope tool,) etc.

- Supports all of the XNOC tools and alarms; analyzes systems needs and determines prioritization of break/fix scenarios; implements code

changes and suggests improvements. Ensures the availability of networking services; studies, evaluates, analyzes, and monitors the

network and services to determine problem areas and/or areas of concern. Monitors, isolates, triages, and resolves outages and impairments.

Identifies and implements opportunities for improvement.

- Ensures databases, applications, hardware, and other related resources are properly maintained. Provides subject matter expertise on equipment and services to other operational groups. Updates code and software to ensure proper system performance.

- Provides clear, crisp, and concise technical communication and coordination during medium outage scenarios.

- Directly executes changes, in the network and across systems, focused on deploying new services, implementing changes, and stabilizing

products following established change management processes. Accountable for configuration management techniques, ensuring infrastructure is

correctly aligned and fully compliant with standards.

- Accountable for understanding and managing services across complex ecosystems, cutting across multiple technologies, organizations, and

solutions. Requires detailed understanding of interdependencies/intradependences. Accountable for providing technical

assessment of changes across ecosystems to ensure resolving potential conflicts before impacting intra-/inter- related vertical systems.

Develops and reports on metrics which show system uptime and overall service desk compliance to ITIL standards.

- Possesses in-depth knowledge and breadth across two to three major ecosystems/technologies requiring technical competency, advanced

training, and outstanding verbal and written communication skills. Leverages engineering methodologies is specific areas of focus.

Possesses in-depth working knowledge and application of process design, client server technology, and internal processes. Provides training and

coaching to NSAR, CARE, sub-set of field organizations, peers, and more junior engineering operations staff.

- Consistent exercise of independent judgment and discretion in matters of significance.

- Regular, consistent and punctual attendance. Must be able to work nights and weekends, variable schedule(s) as necessary.

- Other duties and responsibilities as assigned.



Job Specification:

- Bachelors Degree in Engineering, Computer Science or Equivalent

- Generally requires 2-5 years related experience



- 3+ years of in-depth troubleshooting experience of complex large scale enterprise application server environment(s); experience in an ISP like environment involving 24x7x365 support is HIGHLY desirable.



- Well developed oral and written communications skills and customer-centric attitude with the ability to communicate in both a technical and non-technical manner.



- Experience in some formal ticketing system and a demonstrated ability to work in a metrics based service desk that tracks work through metrics



- In-depth knowledge of OSI layers 1-7 and an ability to troubleshoot and categorize issues accordingly and then engage the appropriate fix agents if they are not able to affect a fix.



- Must have an understanding of the various components of a large scale enterprise system such as: IP routing, TCP traffic analysis, application flows, switches, web servers, web services, DHCP, DNS, SQL/RDB backend systems, IP Management, LDAP, HTTP/XML



- Unix/Linux or Windows experience, that includes the basic commands required to effectively troubleshoot, move files, write basic scripts, and quickly differentiate an OS system issue from an application server issue.



- Hands on knowledge and working experience with any enterprise system and application level monitoring solutions. Examples include Netcool, Concord, Wily, Nagios, SevOne, Spectrum, and Network Node Manger.



- Desirable: prior knowledge of major MSO (Multi-Service Operator / cable provider) supporting provisioning systems for video, high speed data services, and/or telephony a plus



- Desirable: Hands-on experience in any of the following technologies:



- IP Networking protocols and systems including DHCP, DNS, TFTP, ToD, ARP, IP, TCP, UDP, SNMP



- DOCSIS Cable modem technology



- IP subnet management



- CORBA, JAVA, XML



- LDAP Directory Servers



- Sun/Solaris hardware/software platform



- TCP/IP and its various protocols



- Cisco Hardware and IOS (routers, switches, CMTS)



- Strong understanding of UNIX heavily weighted towards Solaris and LINUX



- Ability to troubleshoot and work with other operating systems including Windows



- Strong analytical and problem solving skills



- Outstanding interpersonal, oral, listening and written communication skills



- Ability to independently execute the tasks assigned within the scope of this position.



- Ability to contribute as a team member and work in concert with others to deliver a high level of support to the Service Desk's customers both internal and external



- Solaris/LINUX/UNIX Certification preferred



- Weblogic Certification is a strong plus



- Programming skills in Perl, Java, C, C++, JavaScript, all UNIX Shell Scripting plus skills with web based embedding (HTML, PHP, etc.) desirable.




Comcast is an EOE/Veterans/Disabled/LGBT employer

jobs.title: Principal Engineer, VIPER Player Platform
jobs.content:
Comcast's Technology & Product organization works at the intersection of media and technology. Our innovative teams are continually developing and delivering products that transform the customer experience. From creating apps like TVGo to new features such as the Talking Guide on the X1 platform, we work every day to make a positive impact through innovation in the pursuit of building amazing products that are enjoyable, easy to use and accessible across all platforms. The team also develops and supports our evolving network architecture, including next-generation consumer systems and technologies, infrastructure and engineering, network integration and management tools, and technical standards.





As a Principal JavaScript engineer of the Player Platform you will write client side libraries that are used by millions of people to stream Live, On-Demand, and Recorded content on their desktop computers and set-top-boxes.



Our code powers the video playback experience on the Xfinity TVGo, Xfinity TV, and Xfinity OnCampus applications as well as all IP Capable Set Top Boxes. We provide solutions for content protection (DRM), advertisements, and real-time analytics of the video playback experience. Our libraries interact with many different external systems in order to provide a consistent playback experience across multiple devices and applications.



Player Platform team is a diverse technical group of engineers that bridges all internal groups within VIPER. You will be interacting with teams that use our product to build consumer facing applications, internal testing platforms, and research and development projects.



Your customers will be software engineers, dev-ops engineers, and quality assurance engineers that are Comcast employees and partners. You will have the chance to experience and interact with many platforms and software languages if you desire as we expand our platform



This position is targeted for JS player but there is opportunity to work on all platforms. The Player Platform currently runs on iOS, Android, Desktop (Flash & JS), Set Top Boxes, Xbox, and Samsung Smart TVs.



You’ll be working with the best and brightest minds in Comcast building the next video platform that will power Comcast for years to come. You will drive the future of the IP Video industry.



Skills & Requirements




  • B.S. or M.S. Computer Science or related Field

  • 8+ years experience

  • Expert-level knowledge of the JavaScript language.

  • Familiarity with ES6 and TypeScript is a plus

  • Familiar with JavaScript module loaders such as CommonJS and/or RequireJS

  • Familiar with JavaScript build tools such as grunt, gulp, webpack, etc

  • Experience with writing JavaScript unit tests

  • Familiar with a scripting language

  • Familiar with design patterns and how they apply to JavaScript applications

  • Experience with version control tools such as git.

  • Experience designing clean, concise, maintainable APIs

  • Experience with multi-threading programing

  • Good communicator and able to clearly articulate complex issues and technologies

  • Willing to take ownership of problems and see them through to resolution

  • Comfortable working in a fast paced agile environment.



About Comcast VIPER (Video IP Engineering & Research)



VIPER (Video IP Engineering & Research), is a startup division within Comcast’s Technology and Product Division and spun out from IP Video and online projects originated within Comcast Interactive Media is based in downtown Denver, CO. We are a cloud-based, IP video infrastructure that’s been built to deliver a broad mix of on-demand video, live TV streams and an assortment of other digital media to an array of connected devices in and out of the home. Check us out at: http://stackoverflow.com/jobs/companies/comcast-viper

jobs.title: Product Support Engineer
jobs.content:
thePlatform, a part ofComcast Wholesale,is the leading provider of online video publishing and management solutions. Media companies rely on our cloud-based video platform as their open, central hub for managing, monetizing, and syndicating billions of internet video views each year. thePlatform's services provide unmatched versatility for designing and supporting streaming video businesses on PCs, mobile devices, and TV. Some of our customers include SyFy, Fox Sports Network, NBC Sports, National Geographic, Comcast, British Telecom, Travel Channel, and more.






Our Continuous Delivery team's mission is to empower engineering teams to build, test, deploy and operate their own products. We will achieve this by leading the adoption of Continuous Delivery and Dev/Ops philosophies, by modernizing the company's product architectures to be cloud compatible and by implementing a Platform as a Service that our engineering teams can consume. We are leveraging both established and emerging technologies, such as Zookeeper, OpenStack, AWS, Docker, Kubernetes and TeamCity.





This role is focused around supporting customers, who are primarily fellow engineering employees, and operating the team's products. Day to day work will include troubleshooting, configuration management, automation, consulting on integration solutions and representing the customer's needs during design reviews. New and interesting challenges will present themselves almost daily. There is a heavy social aspect to this role, and in time you will come to be known by many as one of those people who knows how to do everything. There is huge upside for someone looking to advance a career in Systems Engineering, Software Engineering Site Reliability Engineering or Technical Support. We value cultural fit, intelligence, self-motivation, empathy and passion for learning as much or more than matching experience. If this sounds like a role you would enjoy, but you're concerned about specific details below, please apply anyway. You might be the perfect person for us.





Responsibilities:




  • Provide front-line support to internal users of the team's products through several channels: chat, JIRA, email and in-person help requests.

  • Troubleshoot and repair issues with the team's products with minimal guidance.

  • Perform regular and emergency maintenance activities.

  • Escalate software defects and the most difficult issues to the rest of the team. Advocate for the customer's interests in getting these issues solved.

  • Consult with users on the design and implementation of Continuous Integration pipelines, custom deployment workflows and complex monitoring problems.

  • Collect and analyze data for root cause analysis and business intelligence.

  • Champion Dev/Ops and Lean philosophies encourage empathy across functional roles, automate repeatable tasks and eliminate waste.

  • Take ownership for high quality, successful completion of projects.





Requirements:




  • A structured and detail-oriented approach to problem solving and troubleshooting.

  • A positive and collaborative attitude. A willingness to take calculated risks and learn from mistakes.

  • Strong foundation in Shell, Ruby, Python or a similar scripting language.

  • Some experience with Object Oriented programming in Java or C# a plus.

  • Proficient with Linux OS and command line operations.

  • Understanding of distributed web service architectures.





Extra Credit for:




  • Hands on experience with Docker, Kubernetes, OpenStack, AWS or Graphite.

  • Experience in UI design or implementation.






Comcast is an EOE/Veterans/Disabled/LGBT employer

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer
jobs.content:
thePlatform, a part ofComcast Wholesale,is the leading provider of online video publishing and management solutions. Media companies rely on our cloud-based video platform as their open, central hub for managing, monetizing, and syndicating billions of internet video views each year. thePlatform's services provide unmatched versatility for designing and supporting streaming video businesses on PCs, mobile devices, and TV. Some of our customers include SyFy, Fox Sports Network, NBC Sports, National Geographic, Comcast, British Telecom, Travel Channel, and more.






Our Continuous Delivery team's mission is to empower engineering teams to build, test, deploy and operate their own products. We will achieve this by leading the adoption of Continuous Delivery and Dev/Ops philosophies, modernizing the company's product architectures to be cloud compatible, and providing a Platform as a Service (paas) that our engineering teams can consume. We are leveraging both established and emerging technologies, such as Zookeeper, OpenStack, AWS, Docker, Kubernetes and TeamCity.





Ideal candidates will be equally comfortable and interested in prototyping solutions, writing design documents, implementing and testing object oriented code, scripting automated workflows and consulting with engineering teams on the best way to integrate. We value cultural fit, intelligence, self-motivation, empathy and passion for learning as much or more than matching experience. If this sounds like a role you would enjoy, but you're concerned about specific details below, please apply anyway. You might be the perfect person for us.





Responsibilities:




  • Design and prototype solutions based on provided requirements, using a mix of open-source, enterprise and in-house technologies.

  • Write design documents and present them to the team.

  • Design, implement and test applications using object oriented programming languages.

  • Support, operate and maintain the team's products.

  • Consult with internal customers (mostly other engineering teams) to understand their use cases and assist in designing operational solutions.

  • Participate in hiring and mentoring of new employees.

  • Stay abreast of industry best practices and contribute ideas for design improvements and new components.





Requirements:




  • Versatility.

  • Effective at working in a collaborative, team environment.

  • Strong object oriented programming ability; bonus if it's Java.

  • Usable skill with at least one scripting language (e.g.: Ruby, Python, Bash).

  • Proficiency with Linux.

  • Excellent understanding of micro-service architectures and the operational challenges they present.

  • Experience designing solutions and leading collaborative design discussions.

  • Bachelor's in Computer Science or equivalent experience.





Extra Credit for:




  • Hands on experience with Docker, Kubernetes, OpenStack, AWS or Graphite.

  • Comfortable presenting in front of a group.






Comcast is an EOE/Veterans/Disabled/LGBT employer

jobs.title: Big Data Engineer
jobs.content:
Visible World is the leading provider of targeted TV advertising solutions. Our technology makes television advertising inventory more valuable for inventory holders, advertisers, and viewers. Visible World's HighYield tech stack is an end-to-end programmatic TV ad sell-side platform. Whether through programmatic sales infrastructure, household addressability, automated versioning, or Smart TV insights, Visible World offers the most complete automated solution for targeting, selling, and managing impression-based television ad campaigns.





Since 2000, we have been developing technology that makes TV advertising more efficient and effectivewe've been awarded 24 U.S. patents to date for technology we developed in house, and more are on the way. However, we're not just doing R&D. Today, Visible World empowers more than 300 advertisers to deliver more targeted, effective and accountable local TV ad campaigns to consumers in approximately 80% of U.S. cable homes in 210 DMAs and our household addressable footprint includes 3 million homes. Smart TV DNA is used by over a dozen leading networks to track their program promotion campaigns. Our AudienceXpress group is using the HighYield platform to lead the programmatic TV ad buying industry. Visible World employees operate at the cutting edge of TV technology. In June 2015, Visible World became a subsidiary of Comcast, joining one of the most innovative media and technology companies in the country. Come help us craft the future of TV.






We are looking for a Big Data Engineer to join our growing Hadoop team. As a Big Data Engineer, you will be designing and coding reliable ETL pipelines and building scalable, low latency, near real-time applications using Spark, Scala, Python, and Hive. Collaborating with other Development, QA, and Product Management teams in an agile environment will be part of the job.





Responsibilities



- Design and build data processing pipelines for structured and unstructured data using tools and frameworks in the Hadoop ecosystem

- Architect and develop applications that scale up to a Billion events per day

- Build streaming and real-time data analytic pipelines

- Implement and configure big data technologies as well as tune processes for performance at scale





Minimum qualifications

- Solid software engineer with excellent analytical and troubleshooting skills

- 1+ years of experience building production large scale big data applications

- Proficiency in a programming language, ideally Scala, Python, or Java

- Experience with big data interactive query technologies like Spark, Hive, or Impala

- Excellent communication skills

- Eager to learn





Preferred qualifications

- Experience with Spark and/or Kafka

- Experience with Scala

- Experience tuning Hadoop jobs for better performance

- Experience working in an Agile Environment






Comcast is an Affirmative Action/EEO employer M/F/D/V
