jobs.title: Manager, Product Development Engineering
jobs.content:
Comcast's Technology & Product organization works at the intersection of media and technology. Our innovative teams are continually developing and delivering products that transform the customer experience. From creating apps like TVGo to new features such as the Talking Guide on the X1 platform, we work every day to make a positive impact through innovation in the pursuit of building amazing products that are enjoyable, easy to use and accessible across all platforms. The team also develops and supports our evolving network architecture, including next-generation consumer systems and technologies, infrastructure and engineering, network integration and management tools, and technical standards.





Summary



Responsible for leading a team of Engineers in theplanning and designing of software and analytical systems. Managesprojects from design to testing, including new programs, enhancements,and modifications. Collaborates with Quality Assurance team to conducttesting. Develops financial and operational objectives. Ensuresoperational plans are aligned with business objectives. Contributes tofunctional strategy development. Has a greater degree of impact onbusiness results, and typically manages one or more groups ofprofessional employees.





Core Responsibilities



- Oversees the planning and designing of analytical and software applications and processes, including new programs, enhancements, and modifications.



- Provides guidance to the Engineering Analysis team and other departments inidentifying analytical and technical requirements. Serves as primary point of contact andliaison between Engineering Analysis and other teams.



- Directs implementation initiatives for new analytical products and applications.Organizes software update process for existing applications and coordinates theroll-out of software releases.



- Manages all the deliverables to ensure adherence to deadlines, specifications, andbudgets. Implements performance metrics and prepares period reports and/orproposals. Monitors and tracks project progress and reports findings to leadershipteam.



- Ensures all engineers keep current with technological developments within theindustry. Monitors and evaluates competitive applications and products.



- Provides leadership and direction to department personnel from lower-levelmanagers to non-exempt employees.



- Manages cross-project communications.



- Consistent exercise of independent judgment and discretion in matters ofsignificance.



- Regular, consistent and punctual attendance. Must be able to work nights andweekends, variable schedule(s) as necessary.



- Other duties and responsibilities as assigned.





Education Level



- Bachelors Degree or Equivalent; Advanced Degree Preferred



Field of Study



- Engineering, Computer Science, or Similar Analytical or Technical Field of Study



Years of Experience



- Generally requires 8-11 years related experience






Comcast is an EOE/Veterans/Disabled/LGBT employer

jobs.title: Web Developer Frontend
jobs.content:
We are currently seeking a Web Developer with a focus on the front end area, who wants to be part of an extremely motivated and experienced team. You will support our team to develop the architecture of the website (both technical as well as conceptual aspects) and will take a central role within this process. You`ll create new features, which will influence the user experience of our site, significantly.


Your responsibilities



  • In this position you are actively involved in the whole design process of our gaming platforms. You will be responsible for conception, development, operation and optimization of our Casino sites. The main focus is always on a target-group specific design.

  • Depending on your expertise and your interest, you are free to define your area of responsibility within this position yourself!


  • Our emphases



    • Please find an extract from the tools etc. we are working with below:

      • HTML 5

      • Javascript

      • jQuery

      • Angular and/or Node a plus

      • CSS

      • MVC.net

      • Razor

      • SQL a plus

jobs.title: Full Stack Senior Ruby Engineer
jobs.content: An opportunity to join a Sydney-based next generation eCommerce start-up in an exciting period of growth that has the financial backing of one of Australia's leading tech VC funds. We are looking for software engineers to join our rapidly-growing team and help to build our platform as our business grows. This role will suit someone who is passionate about using technology to solve real business needs and building custom applications from the ground up. A hands-on approach will be required to continue to build on our expanding eCommerce website front-end and Warehouse Management System and associated logistics infrastructure back-end. Compensation package will include equity in the business.

jobs.title: iOS Developer
jobs.content:
LiveSafe is looking for a very talented junior iOS Developer to join our team. We develop both iOS and Android native mobile applications used by over 100,000 people across the world. We are constantly looking to improve our platform and branch out onto new devices (Apple Watch, IoT) to deliver added value for our users.


The kind of engineer we are looking for will likely identify as a:



  • Polyglot that gets a special satisfaction from picking up a new language, framework, or tool

  • Problem solver that does not relent until digging and discovering an issue’s root cause

  • Collaborator that thrives in a social, transparent, and “got your back” team environment

  • Person who cares deeply that their work realizes positive outcomes for our world

  • Someone that stays on the bleeding edge of technology to help enhance user experience even with new OS releases


You probably also have:



  • Strong opinions on what makes certain languages/tools/frameworks good, bad, or ugly

  • Sufficient experience with your favorite language/tool/framework to describe its faults and shortcomings

  • A pet software design principle that drives you nuts when not used

jobs.title: Backend Software Engineer
jobs.content:
SUMMARY 


Itemize is the receipts processing engine for the digital age. This role at Itemize will put you at the forefront of a new and exciting area of commerce and technology. With the most powerful receipt data extraction and management platform – we do it with a 99% accuracy in real time– Itemize is looking for the right person to join the core development team as a software engineer at the heart of the Itemize IP. 



Try out the platform. Download it for free from Apple or Google Play. 



RESPONSIBILITIES 


The software engineer will join the technology team in building the Itemize platform. The engineer will also be responsible for preparing the systems for increases in scale and continuous improvement of the environment. A good candidate will be a team player who will work alongside the different members of the Itemize tech team and will get involved in all of the exciting projects at the company. Writing clean code is a must. Our engineers develop rapidly to keep the code base manageable and adaptable to future needs.

jobs.title: Full time LAMP stack developer
jobs.content:
This is the developer job you wish you had!


Ready to be a big part of our success and have some fun doing it? Do you like having varied assignments in a friendly and supportive environment? Join our small, dedicated team in a senior role creating innovative web software for media companies and you might just help shape how newspapers survive in the digital age. We need an experienced PHP web developer. This is an opportunity to have a big impact and to be involved in a wide range of tasks, from direct customer support and site construction to new product development and system administration. We're also a leading print design and consulting firm in the newspaper industry and we’re all about making money on the web, so there are lots of neat things to learn. We’re located in East Providence, R.I.

jobs.title: DevOps Engineer
jobs.content:
Technology at Avaaz is scaling fast, and we need a DevOps Engineer whose skills connect the worlds of Software Engineers, DBAs, and Systems Administrators. This role will support maintaining and expanding Avaaz’s infrastructure to improve the way our software is developed.

The ideal candidates will have experience in system administration, developing software using modern languages and frameworks and as well a good understanding of SQL and non-SQL data stores. They will be able to advise on decisions regarding hardware performance for a given software, and will also know when we should modify the underlying infrastructure or fix a particular piece of code. They are familiar with test automation and applications that work at scale.

The DevOps Engineer does not need to be an expert in all areas, but rather have a broad range of experiences in different areas with excellent team and communication skills.

Responsibilities:

  • Manage our deployment and testing infrastructure, supporting the implementation of Continuous Integration.
  • Refine development processes to make interactions between Software Engineers and Administrators constant, fluid, and productive.
  • Participate in architectural decision-making in support of scalability.
  • Automate repetitive tasks required to maintain a secure and up to date operational environment, eventually supporting the Engineering team with hands-on coding.
  • Develop, improve, maintain, and document infrastructure management systems.
  • Work with other teams to build, test and roll out systems.

Qualifications:

  • 2-3 years of experience as a Software Engineer, and 2-3 years of experience as a Systems Administrator.
  • 1-2 years of experience working at large-scale applications.
  • 2-3 years working in Amazon AWS environments, particularly VPC’s with an understanding of the AWS API.
  • Intimate knowledge of Linux (Redhat/CentOS) and at least 2 years experience managing Linux in enterprise-class environments (more than 10 servers).
  • Experience with infrastructure as code (Puppet/Chef/others).
  • Experience managing application build pipelines and continuous integration environments.
  • Strong fundamentals in Python/Ruby and strong bash scripting skills.
  • Comfortable working with a range of storage engines (MySQL, Elasticsearch, Redis) and knowing when each type is appropriate.
  • Understanding of network and application security with deep understanding of all layers involved in web communications, including experience in network debugging.
  • Must be a strong culture match including having a growth mindset and a deep commitment to world change and the Avaaz mission.
  • Experience at large-scale web companies is a huge plus.
  • Fluency in English is a requirement.

Location

Avaaz is a virtual organisation, with most of our work done over email, telephone and Skype. Our staff are based in cities all over the world and meet at team retreats twice per year. Avaaz covers office costs, either to establish a home office or to rent one, and we support staff to house themselves in local similar organisations when preferred.

Compensation and Benefits

Salary varies with location and experience, but is highly competitive with leading nongovernmental organisations. Benefits also range with location, but include 5 weeks paid vacation per year.

jobs.title: Senior UI/UX Designer
jobs.content:
DESCRIPTION

Here at GigSalad, we’re building an easier way for people to hire talent and services for events. From musicians to magicians, we match customers with entertainment professionals for all of life’s events.

As Senior UI/UX Designer at GigSalad, you’ll be responsible for designing a two-sided marketplace that has serviced over a million users. We’re looking for a seasoned pro – a designer who is comfortable creating beautiful, functional experiences and excited to instill their design philosophy in the company as a whole. As an instrumental part of the company, you’ll work closely with engineering and product management to take your vision from idea to execution. Your insights will not only influence the look of the site, but will also extend to branding and marketing initiatives across the company.

We're looking for either a full-time employee or an outstanding freelancer who is excited to improve our marketplace. We’re a private and profitable company. We like tackling rewarding problems, taking time to solve things the right way, and focusing on a single product. Reach out to us and learn more about your role in improving GigSalad.

As Senior UI/UX Designer at GigSalad, you will

  • Lead the UI/UX design and impact millions of people
  • Develop and maintain mockups and specifications as needed
  • Craft our visual identity
  • Participate in ongoing discussion with product, engineering and other team partners to bring beauty and simplicity to complex issues

A little more about GigSalad

We are GigSalad, an online entertainment booking company serving all of the United States and Canada. Founded in 2007, our company has two offices: one is in Wilmington, NC and the other is in Springfield, MO. GigSalad is no longer a budding start-up but feels a lot like one (one exception: we’re profitable!). We move fast, work hard, and have fun. We are passionate about what we do: providing a safe, easy platform for event hosts to hire talent and services for events.

REQUIREMENTS

The ideal UI/UX Designer we’re looking for has

  • 4+ years of experience designing for the web
  • A solid portfolio of web-based projects
  • Experience with e-commerce or marketplace sites
  • A strong understanding of both design theory and practical tools
  • The creativity to design clean, usable solutions to common web patterns (search results, messaging, forms)
  • A permanent home in the U.S. or Canada
  • A desire to help us create the world’s best (and most beautiful) booking platform

BENEFITS

What we offer to you

  • A competitive salary
  • A matching 401k
  • Health, dental and vision insurance
  • $1,500 in an education expense account (books, conferences, programs, etc.)
  • A fitness reimbursement program
  • A startup atmosphere with the stability of an established, profitable company
  • A remote job structure that respects your work/life balance

jobs.title: Senior Backend Engineer
jobs.content:
We are looking for talented and motivated engineers to join our team here at RideCell who can hit the ground running and take our product to the next level, as we scale up and develop our business in our target markets. The Backend Engineers who are building our Core Platform work across the stack, always willing to go the extra mile to deliver the highest quality in enterprise software. As a developer for RideCell you are building the tools today that will redefine tomorrow's transit.

The Role

  • Take ownership over project timelines and deliverables
  • Contribute to the design, architecture and build of our Core Platform
  • Help scale the platform and build out new features
  • Contribute to the DevOps process and tool building
  • Contribute to the frontend if and when needed, developing new skills as needed
  • Apply algorithm development to solve deep problems
  • Work with customers when needed

Requirements

  • Fluency in Python & Django or confident that you can get there quickly, and 5+ years experience in another programming language
  • You always leave code better than you found it, and you have opinions on software design.
  • Self-directed, but also work well with other engineers.
  • Excited about working for a startup and moving quickly.
  • 5+ years of experience (internships included)
  • Experience working remotely in the past
  • Must live in the United States

Preferred

  • Front end experience with javascript frameworks like Backbone.js or React.js
  • Experience with RESTful APIs and API design.
  • DevOps experience, especially with AWS, Vagrant, Ansible, and Postgres.

About RideCell

RideCell is the leading provider of software to power mobility-as-a-service (MaaS), including car-sharing, ride sharing, fixed-route, and dynamic transit services. The “Global Call for Transit Innovators” award winner is helping customers reimagine and re-architect transportation in cities, communities and campuses around the world.

RideCell's unique differentiator is “autonomous fleet operationsTM”: technology that automates end-to-end business operations from consumer apps to the day to day fleet management, demand and supply analytics, marketing, CRM, and payments. Its mobility software platform automates some of the hardest operational tasks in running a transportation system enabling cities, campuses and multi-city mobility providers to launch on-demand, car sharing and fixed-route services in weeks and optimize and scale them without human intervention. In addition to mobility providers such as BMW, RideCell's clients include transit agencies such as Santa Clara VTA in Silicon Valley, companies such as 3M, universities such as UC Berkeley, hospitals such as UCSF.

RideCell is headquartered in San Francisco, California. Key investors include BMW iVentures, Khosla Ventures and YCombinator. RideCell's vision is to help their customers “Run the world, better TM”.

jobs.title: Back-End WordPress Developer
jobs.content:
We are looking for a remote back-end developer with at least one year advanced WordPress development experience. The ideal candidate is someone who is actively working in the website and plugin development field and is knowledgeable about the most recent releases and standards of WordPress. Applicants should be passionate about WordPress and eager to learn and grow with our company.

Please note: This is not an entry-level position. Experienced programmers only.

Your job duties will include:

  • Developing WordPress plugins, custom functionality, and themes
  • Developing and maintaining complex WordPress-based applications
  • Supporting clients in a fast paced environment
  • Using bug tracking, project tracking, and SVN +/or Git software
  • A variety of miscellaneous development tasks involved in the web development life cycle from start to finish
  • Heavy lifting data, migrations, etc.

Requirements:

  • Excellent knowledge of WordPress, PHP, MySQL, CSS, HTML, JavaScript, and jQuery
  • Good understanding of accessibility considerations and web standards
  • Ability to work on multiple projects at the same time and complete tasks in a timely manner
  • Ability to work remotely with little to no supervision is a must
  • Available during the day, Eastern time, Monday through Friday
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Ability to be a team player and grow as business grows
  • Experience using SVN & Git software a plus

Types of projects we’re doing lately:

  • WordPress websites, mainly (some with and some without a blog) for small and large businesses, multisite networks, social communities and lots of social media integration.
  • WordPress with E-Commerce (WooCommerce experience is a plus)
  • WordPress Multisite and BuddyPress
  • Membership sites with WordPress

(…Do you get a feeling that we do a LOT of WordPress sites??? We do!)

Work Environment:

  • Remote work – Monday through Friday 9am – 5pm EST
  • Office dress code: Pajamas, if you like.
  • This is a full-time, salaried position
  • Full-time employees enjoy benefits such as Medical/Dental/Vision, Paid Time Off, 401K
  • Pay rate is based on experience and abilities
  • Lots and lots of informal gif sharing

We’re looking for someone who:

  • Thinks design is about solving problems, not making them.
  • Has excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • Likes to have a lot of fun tinkering around inside the guts of cool websites.
  • Gets more kicks out of removing elements from a page than adding them.
  • Wants to learn, push themselves, and make the web a better place to be.
  • Excellent time management and ability to work, remotely, on a deadline and on multiple projects at once.
  • Great critical thinking skills, a good work ethic, and customer service skills.

No third parties or outsourcing agencies will be considered, but we are open to worldwide applicants!

We give each application consideration, but please do be patient as we go through all of the applications received. We will read them all and will be contacting you within the next week or two.

jobs.title: Front-End Developer
jobs.content:
We are looking for a front-end developer/designer with at least one year WordPress theme design experience. The ideal candidate is someone who is passionate about front-end code like JavaScript, HTML, CSS and the WordPress loop.

Our projects will challenge you and if you’re up for it, then we’re up for talking with you!

Here’s the down and dirty…

Your job duties will include:

  • Working with clients to create website design mockups based on their ideas, samples, likes/dislikes, etc
  • Converting PSD website mockups to functional themes in WordPress
  • Troubleshooting design issues with CSS, website layouts, graphics, etc, including cross-browser compatibility and responsive design
  • Various design tasks involved in the web development life cycle from start to finish

Minimum Requirements:

  • Documented experience in front-end website development in WordPress.
  • Ability to convert Photoshop files (PSD) to WordPress themes using HTML/CSS/JS, etc
  • Experience with WordPress is required (Example: building a theme from scratch is no sweat, and customizing existing frameworks is right up your alley!).
  • Advanced level competency with CSS & HTML (Sass, HTML5/CSS3 a big plus, as well as responsive design techniques).
  • Experience troubleshooting browser compatibilities.

Nice to haves (not required, but would be considered a plus):

  • Understanding of PHP development practices
  • Comfort level with JavaScript, jQuery and/or AJAX
  • Ability to perform some back-end development tasks (ie: building simple widgets & plugins)
  • Experience with creating Photoshop mockups and graphic design

Types of projects we’re doing lately:

  • WordPress websites, mainly (some with and some without a blog) for small and large businesses, multisite networks, social communities and lots of social media integration.
  • WordPress with E-Commerce (WooCommerce experience is a plus)
  • WordPress Multisite and BuddyPress
  • Membership sites with WordPress

(…Do you get a feeling that we do a LOT of WordPress sites??? We do!)

Work Environment:

  • Remote work – Monday through Friday 9am – 5pm EST
  • Office dress code: Pajamas, if you like.
  • This is full-time, salaried position
  • Full-time employees enjoy benefits such as Medical/Dental/Vision, Paid Time Off, 401K
  • Pay rate is based on experience and abilities
  • Lots and lots of informal gif sharing

We’re looking for someone who:

  • Thinks design is about solving problems, not making them.
  • Has excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • Likes to have a lot of fun tinkering around inside the guts of cool websites.
  • Gets more kicks out of removing elements from a page than adding them.
  • Wants to learn, push themselves, and make the web a better place to be.
  • Excellent time management and ability to work, remotely, on a deadline and on multiple projects at once.
  • Great critical thinking skills, a good work ethic and customer service skills.

No third parties or outsourcing agencies will be considered, but we are open to worldwide applicants!

We give each application consideration, but please do be patient as we go through all of the applications received. We will read them all and will be contacting eligible applicants within the next week or two.

jobs.title: Senior Full Stack Engineer
jobs.content:
We are looking for talented and motivated engineers to join our team here at RideCell who can hit the ground running and take our product to the next level, as we scale up and develop our business in our target markets. The Fullstack Engineers who are building our Core Platform work across the stack, always willing to go the extra mile to deliver the highest quality in enterprise software. As a developer for RideCell you are building the tools today that will redefine tomorrow's transit. 

__The Role__

* Take ownership over project timelines and deliverables
* Contribute to the design, architecture and build of our Core Platform
* Help scale the platform and build out new features
* Contribute to the DevOps process and tool building
* Contribute to the frontend if and when needed, developing new skills as needed
* Apply algorithm development to solve deep problems
* Work with customers when needed

__Requirements__

* Fluency in Python & Django or confident that you can get there quickly, and 5+ years experience in another programming language
* Front end experience with javascript frameworks like Backbone.js or React.js
* You always leave code better than you found it, and you have opinions on software design.
* Self-directed, but also work well with other engineers.
* Excited about working for a startup and moving quickly.
* 5+ years of experience (internships included)
* Experience working remotely in the past
* Must live in the United States

__Preferred__

* Experience with RESTful APIs and API design.
* DevOps experience, especially with AWS, Vagrant, Ansible, and Postgres.

__About RideCell__

RideCell is the leading provider of software to power mobility-as-a-service (MaaS), including car-sharing, ride sharing, fixed-route, and dynamic transit services. The âGlobal Call for Transit Innovatorsâ award winner is helping customers reimagine and re-architect transportation in cities, communities and campuses around the world. 

RideCell's unique differentiator is âautonomous fleet operationsTMâ: technology that automates end-to-end business operations from consumer apps to the day to day fleet management, demand and supply analytics, marketing, CRM, and payments. Its mobility software platform automates some of the hardest operational tasks in running a transportation system enabling cities, campuses and multi-city mobility providers to launch on-demand, car sharing and fixed-route services in weeks and optimize and scale them without human intervention. In addition to mobility providers such as BMW, RideCell's clients include transit agencies such as Santa Clara VTA in Silicon Valley, companies such as 3M, universities such as UC Berkeley, hospitals such as UCSF.

RideCell is headquartered in San Francisco, California. Key investors include BMW iVentures, Khosla Ventures and YCombinator. RideCell's vision is to help their customers âRun the world, better TMâ.

jobs.title: Software Development Engineer in Test
jobs.content:
The QA team is looking for an SDET that has a passion for testing complex applications and systems at scale.  You have demonstrated expertise in assessing quality with respect to service contracts, performance, reliability in addition to the standard competencies around software design, testing, and automation.







Responsibilities:


  • Design and build automation systems that reliably validate product code

  • Participate in code and design reviews

  • Advocate for the testability of product code

  • Suggest quality measures to be implemented

  • Write and implement test plans

  • Help development team diagnose and test fixes

  • Aiding issue fixing by recreating issues for Production team review

  • Recommend and utilize appropriate tools needed to better automate testing

jobs.title: WordPress Developer
jobs.content:
About Our Company



ElegantThemes.com is a leader in WordPress Theme & Plugin Development. We have been building the top premium WordPress themes and plugins for the past 8 years and we maintain the largest customer bases in the ecosystem. 350,799 users, freelance developers and web design agencies depend on our beautiful designs and we work hard everyday to make sure we are creating the best WordPress products on the web. Divi, our flagship theme and page builder plugin is pushing the boundaries and has inspired an absolutely amazing community to form around it. A focus on community is a core part of our culture and it makes our work environment is a truly rewarding one.





Job Description



As a WordPress Developer at Elegant Themes, you will be working with a small and agile team made up of talented devs from all around the world. We work with git, chat on Slack and our team structure is flat and open. Self-motivated individuals tend to thrive best here, and we are looking for someone filled with inspiration and who isn't afraid to take initiative.



This position is for someone with a deep understanding of WordPress. You have built your own themes and plugins before and possibly even contributed to WordPress Core. You enjoy finding elegant solutions to complex problems and are familiar with the WordPress motto - 'code is poetry.' You are up-to-date with the latest and greatest trends and technologies because you are engaged in the open source community and you enjoy building software that pushes the web forward. While WordPress is a PHP-based application, we are continually moving towards React as our main development language, so you should be excited about learning and working with Javascript. 



This is a full time position available to both on-site and remote employees. Employment includes full benefits, paid vacation, a competitive salary and unlimited espresso brewed from our Rocket Cellini Premium Plus v2!

 



Responsibilities




  • Be creative and contribute based on your own merit.

  • Be a positive, humble and contributing member to our small team. 

  • Take the initiate to better yourself as a developer and to apply that knowledge to better our products and help our team succeed. 





Required Experience




  • Complete understanding of the WordPress core software and its functions at the code level.

  • Experience building WordPress themes/plugins.

  • Mastery of WordPress coding and security best practices.





Required SkillsÃ¢ÂÂ




  • PHP

  • CSS

  • HTML

  • MYSQL

  • JAVASCRIPT

  • GIT





Bonus QualificationsÃ¢ÂÂREACT




  • REACT

  • JQUERY

  • BACKBONE

  • REDUX

  • GRUNT

  • GULP

  • SASS

  • A history of open source software contribution



Learn More



Learn more about life at Elegant Themes, including our full list of perks and benefits: http://www.elegantthemes.com/careers/

jobs.title: Director of Software Development
jobs.content:
What we’re looking for:
Wyatt Technology is looking for a highly skilled software leader to help us design and implement amazing new features to ensure that we remain the undisputed leader in our industry.


Ideally, you will love software development like other people love baseball. You will play with obscure languages in your spare time, and might have written your own photo editing system, music generation software, or video game…just for fun. You like:



  • Keeping a development team on track and happy (when possible).

  • Building organizations of exceptional software engineers and teams.

  • Project planning and prioritization under tight deadlines.

  • To be the voice of the SW team to the business and the voice of the business to the SW team.

  • Ensuring sufficient processes and tools are in place to meet the requirements of the business and customers.

  • Writing production code and leading by example.

  • Science, instrumentation, and have preferably worked in a laboratory at some point in your career.

jobs.title: Senior iOS Engineer @ Talkatone  connect millions
jobs.content:
Talkatone is a rapidly growing mobile VoIP product with millions of users. Our users rely on our service each and every day to communicate with family, friends, colleagues and even people outside of their existing networks. They want us to make their lives easier and better by enabling reliable, real-time mobile communications when they want, where they want, how they want.


 As a senior iOS engineer at Talkatone you’ll be responsible for taking the existing app to new heights, as well as developing new offerings and taking them just as high.

jobs.title: Senior Android Engineer @ Talkatone - connect millions
jobs.content:
Talkatone is a rapidly growing mobile VoIP product with millions of users. Our users rely on our service each and every day to communicate with family, friends, colleagues and even people outside of their existing networks. They want us to make their lives easier and better by enabling reliable, real-time mobile communications when they want, where they want, how they want.


As a senior Android engineer at Talkatone you’ll be responsible for taking the existing app to new heights, as well as developing new offerings and taking them just as high. More specifically, you will join the development of the existing flagship app, as well as possible upcoming apps for specific markets.

jobs.title: Backend/API Developer
jobs.content: The foremost responsibility of this position is development of (and maintaining of) the backend-end and middle-ware of our flagship product. Development is predominantly in Python with some C/C++. Strong backend-end development skills are a must with the ability to rapidly prototype and work collaboratively with other developers (including our overseas developers). It is important that a candidate be energetic and enthusiastic about this kind of work, with a "take charge" attitude and willingness to devour existing code/documentation to take ownership (or rewrite it if you think you have a better solution). In addition, this position requires work on internal tools and automation. Some basic web development/design skills are a plus. If you are interested in software security this position provides the opportunity to participate in security research.

jobs.title: Technical Product Manager - San Jose, CA
jobs.content:
Reference 122118BR. Looking for a company that inspires passion, courage and imagination, where you can be part of the team shaping the future of global commerce? Want to shape how millions of people buy, sell, connect, and share around the world? If you’re interested in joining a purpose driven community that is dedicated to creating an ambitious and inclusive workplace, join eBay - a company you can be proud to be a part of.

For immediate and confidential consideration, please send your resume to kelcenko@ebay.com. The Commerce OS team is looking for a highly motivated and enthusiastic Technical Product Manager to own and drive the delivery of our platform and web services capabilities. This person will work closely with world class developers, quality engineers, program managers, architects and business stakeholders in an agile environment. He/she will be responsible for driving innovation, delivery, communication and adoption of eBay’s public and partner APIs and focused on making eBay’s partners and sellers successful on the platform. The right person will be passionate about technology, scalability and online commerce and have strong technical and product management skills to drive strategy and execution.


We measure our success by our customers' success.This is supported by the most powerful selling platform, making eBay the place people go to sell things - small and medium-sized retailers and consumer sellers alike. The Commerce OS organization inside eBay sets eBay’s technology standards, provides a scalable platform for web service development, and provides a coherent set of APIs that are used both internally and externally by thousands of partner developers around the world to build these possible buying and selling experiences.


The right person will be passionate about technology, scalability and online commerce and have strong technical and product management skills to drive strategy and execution.


Qualifications:




  • Solid understanding of technical platforms, and internal and 3rd party interfaces.




  • Demonstrated ability to treat technical platform components and API as products and drive their roadmap and delivery




  • Proven track record of building ecommerce applications (native and web)




  • Strong knowledge of REST, OAuth, security and other API-related technologies.




  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills.




  • Very strong knowledge of agile software development methodology.




  • Demonstrated ability to effectively interact with diverse internal audiences




  • Demonstrated analysis and innovative problem solving skills using a systems thinking approach.




Education:




  • Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Engineering, Information Technology, or related field. MBA is a strong plus




•eBay Inc. (NASDAQ: EBAY) is a global commerce leader including the Marketplace, StubHub and Classifieds platforms. Collectively, we connect millions of buyers and sellers around the world, empowering people and creating opportunity through Connected Commerce. Founded in 1995 in San Jose, Calif., eBay is one of the world’s largest and most vibrant marketplaces for discovering great value and unique selection.

jobs.title: Java / JavaScript Developer
jobs.content:
Infomedia Ltd is a publicly-listed company on the Australian Securities Exchange (ASX symbol "IFM"). We are the leading supplier of information solutions to the parts and service sector of the global automotive industry. Infomedia's business solutions are currently used each business day by over 150,000 dealership personnel. They are produced in more than 30 languages and at work in 186 countries. Their powerful search functions and intuitive, user-friendly interface helps boost efficiency, profitability and customer retention for OE Parts and Service Departments.

At Infomedia we do things differently. We develop niche, one-of-a-kind software solutions for the automotive industry but we also know that to stay unique and to continue to be the #1 in our industry we need unique and one-of-a-kind thought leaders and intelligent problem solvers who are always striving to take our products to the next level. We pride ourselves on our values of Integrity, Innovation, Togetherness, Care and on having a Global mindset in everything we do to ensure we are always thinking BIG!

This is where you come in……..

What are we looking for?

  • 1-3 years of full-stack Java development
  • Solid experience in JavaScript development (Ideally AngularJS)
  • Experience with AWS, MongoDB, Lucene or MS SQL highly regarded
  • Strong communication skills both written and verbal and awesome attention to detail
  • Relevant university degree with solid grades

That's the tangible stuff. Now the softer stuff.....

  • Of course we want the passion, the drive and and intelligence but that's a no brainer.
  • Analytical problem solver and intelligent thought leader.
  • Not shy of throwing out solutions to problems and jumping in at the deep end.
  • The person that will be the master of their own destiny - we will nurture, support and guide any of our team into whatever technology or business skill that the want to grow into, but you will be accountable for being the driving force behind that progression

In return you will be joining a company who doesn't just throw out an awesome marketing spiel to lure you in just for you to realize you have joined another humdrum dev shop. Our team works with some of the coolest technologies around, building some seriously innovative and interesting products and we have a culture of openness, honesty and creativity.

Some other key benefits:

  • Onsite gym facilities for staff
  • Games & Breakout areas
  • Onsite parking
  • Fun, relaxed but very high performing environment!

Sound like you? Then hit the apply button and drop us over your profile – we want to chat with you.

jobs.title: Senior JavaScript Developer
jobs.content:
This role is based about 30 miles North of Boston and can be partially remote. Must have experience with React.js. You will be building interactive gaming applications for the educational technology market. Apps that are used by millions of students and teachers on a daily basis.


We are looking for an awesome developer that has very strong skills in JavaScript and can test drive their code. You should also have an advanced knowledge of JavaScript, including prototype-based inheritance, event delegation, closures, AJAX, JSON, JS memory model.

jobs.title: Technical Support Professional
jobs.content:
Milestone Systems, Inc. is looking for a skilled Support Professional to work in our US Headquarters located in beautiful Beaverton, Oregon. We are looking for someone who is tech savvy and thrives in a technological environment. If you are a believer in technology at its finest, then this is the place for you.


We offer an exciting and challenging job in the world’s leading VMS Company. The Support Professional (SP) is typically a first point of contact with Milestone Partners and therefore has a key role in helping Milestone achieve its mission goal of excellent Customer / Partner satisfaction. The SP delivers responsive and reliable solutions to Milestone Partners through application of knowledge of Milestone organization, services and products.


As a Milestone Employee, YOU are the key to our success. Come join our dynamic international team and be a part of our rapidly growing, successful business.


Your Responsibilities:



  • Make every customer interaction a satisfying experience through a professional, outgoing and personable attitude

  • Resolve customer requests, questions and complaints effectively, frequently requiring analysis of situations to determine best use of online or technical support resources

  • Serve as liaison between the customer and the Technical Support team, escalating cases not within own skillsets up the support chain in a timely and effective manner

  • Provide timely & accurate status updates to customers and relevant internal stakeholders

  • Represent expectations, intentions, and attitudes of customers and co-workers accurately

  • Continuous effort to acquire and maintain good knowledge of Milestone’s products as well as Support procedures, practices, and policies

  • Assist in ensuring that delivered solutions are documented as knowledge base articles to help make the team successful

  • Ensures that observed patterns of customer pain-points are highlighted to manager

  • Informs customers of the appropriate support options that best fit the customer's needs

jobs.title: Platform Quality Engineer
jobs.content:
Broala, Inc is seeking a talented, collaborative, and deeply curious Platform Quality Engineer to help us create a new family of cybersecurity products. We are an ambitious startup based in downtown Berkeley. Our customer list includes 10% of the Fortune 50, and we are growing rapidly.

In this important role, you will be a champion for product quality:



  1. Using well-honed instincts for how systems fail, you will identify creative and diabolical techniques to stress our products and make them break.

  2. You will find solutions for the issues you discover, gaining deep knowledge about our platform in the process.

  3. You will test integration with external products and systems (for example: Splunk), and strive to automate every aspect of your work.


We expect you to help mold this role based on your skills, perspectives, and interests.  We’re a dynamic startup, and inevitably you’ll be involved in other engineering projects as well (brainstorming, troubleshooting, prototyping, testing ideas).

To apply, please send a cover letter and CV or resume to jobs@broala.com. Be sure to let us know where you heard about the job, and feel free to send links to any projects or code you’re proud of.  


We are located in downtown Berkeley, and we also have a small team located in Columbus, Ohio - another possible work location.   


https://www.broala.com/platform-quality-engineer.html

jobs.title: Solutions Architect
jobs.content:
We are looking for a Node.js Developer responsible for managing the interchange of data between the server and the users. Your primary focus will be the development of all server-side logic, definition and maintenance of the central database, and ensuring high performance and responsiveness to requests from the front-end. You will also be responsible for integrating the front-end elements built by your co-workers into the application. Therefore, a basic understanding of front-end technologies is necessary as well.



Responsibilities



  - Integration of user-facing elements developed by front-end developers with server side logic


  - Writing reusable, testable, and efficient code


  - Design and implementation of low-latency, high-availability, and performant applications


  - Implementation of security and data protection


  - Integration of data storage solutions {{may include databases, key-value stores, blob stores, etc.}}

jobs.title: Platform Engineer
jobs.content:
Broala, Inc is seeking a talented, resourceful, and collaborative Platform Engineer to help create a new family of cybersecurity products. We are an ambitious startup based in downtown Berkeley. Our customer list includes 10% of the Fortune 50, and we are growing rapidly.

Built on top of the Linux kernel and other open-source software, our appliance platform runs the Bro network monitoring framework in an environment optimized for performance and stability. As a key contributor to our technology, you will translate product strategies and feature requests into working code, in collaboration with the Manager of Platform Engineering and other technical staff.  

In the process you will have an opportunity to:



  1. Write and adapt code and scripts in a number of languages.

  2. Expand your knowledge of Linux programming, testing, optimizing, and debugging.  

  3. Contribute to our backend deployment and management technology, hosted in Amazon Web Services (AWS).

  4. Solve complex technical problems uncovered during quality assurance testing.

  5. Make contributions to improve the open-source Bro code base.


We expect you to help mold this role based on your skills, perspectives, and interests.  We’re a dynamic startup, and inevitably you’ll be involved in other engineering projects as well (brainstorming, troubleshooting, prototyping, testing ideas).  For someone with prior Bro experience, this position could also involve advanced technical support of large-scale customer Bro deployments and innovative Bro scripting work.

To apply, please send a cover letter and CV or resume to jobs@broala.com. Be sure to let us know where you heard about the job, and to send links to contributions, projects, or code you’re proud of.


https://www.broala.com/platform-engineer.html

jobs.title: Network Engineer / Senior Network Engineer
jobs.content:
We are looking for an experienced and enthusiastic Network Engineer to architect, implement, maintain, and support our growing network infrastructure.  You will be part of a team responsible for designing and developing scalable, maintainable, highly available network architectures that meet today’s demanding business objectives and SLAs in a leading edge, technology driven E-commerce Company. 

In our team you will be part of a group that drives projects and innovation. We collaborate with peers internal and across the globe in virtual and physical labs, proving conceptual designs that will be the foundation of next iterations of our IAAS. Then we work with peer teams to plan, deploy, automate, monitor, and maintain those technologies in cutting edge public and private clouds.

What you will be responsible for:

  1. Architect, engineer and install next generation networking solutions in a fast-paced global company.
  2. Analyze network performance data and statistics and provide recommendations and roadmaps.
  3. Stay current with industry trends bringing new solution options
  4. Interface with our company service groups for efficient project delivery
  5. Provide training, mentoring and tier 3 oncall rotation support to other staff on technical topics and network design.
  6. Define, document, and enforce system standards. 

Soft skills we are looking for: 

  • Analytical Skills: Review systems and issues to find corrections or room for improvement
  • Attention to Detail: Create diagrams that convey topologies and traffic flows, insuring systems interoperability.
  • Leadership Skills: Poses the ability to demonstrate calm and professional demeanor when handling critical situations
  • Organizational skills: Project Delivery experience in planning, executing and maintaining a project from start to finish.
  • Teamwork: Collaborate with multiple IT and business teams for the successful planning, execution and delivery of all initiatives. 

What we’d like to see in your experience:

The following are core requirements

  • Production Experience with Enterprise and/or Service Provider Routers 
  • Production Experience with Enterprise & Datacenter Ethernet switching 
  • Production Experience routing protocols including BGP, OSPF, MP-BGP, MOSPF, GRE/IPSec, VPN, VPLS, MPLS, RSTP/STP, Aruba wireless controller and Aruba ClearPass solution.

Additional experience we would prefer

  • Traffic load balancing techniques and design and operational challenges (Nginx, HAProxy, F5 LTM, Citrix Netscaler)
  • Security postures and policy management (Juniper SRX , Palo Alto)
  • Experience with network management platforms and protocols such as Splunk, NetConf, SNMP, RMON, MRTG, Cacti, and Net/J/SFlow.
  • Working knowledge of L4+ DDoS mitigation solutions a plus
  • Linux administration is a plus
  • Experience with programing languages as Python, Perl or Lua scripting, Ansible/Puppet, and experience with Orchestration, Databases MySQL, MSSQL is a plus

Education requirement

  • Typically requires Bachelor's in CS, EE, or IS or equivalent experience
  • Cisco CCNP preferred or equivalent experience/certification
  • Cisco CCIE/Juniper JNCIE or equivalent experience/certification a plus

jobs.title: Agile Transformation Lead
jobs.content:
15+ years ago, priceline.com transformed the travel space. We are now looking for some to work with us to transform how we continue to do that. We are looking for an Agile Transformation Lead to deliver consistency and accelerate our Agile & Scrum practices and mentor process change throughout the organization. The ideal candidate will bring deep experience and a collaborative attitude to enable us to increase velocity, improve visibility, and raise quality throughout our organization.  This position will coach teams at different levels of maturity -- across disparate programs and development teams.  Our group is poised to drive dramatic change within the organization, a successful candidate must be hungry to learn and hungry to teach. 

Responsibilities

  • Work with stakeholders at all levels to be an evangelist and catalyst for our adoption and roll-out of agile methodologies: ceremonies, practices, and values.
  • Articulate the business value of Agile Practices (i.e. answer the question why do we do it this way)
  • Serve as a thought leader to evangelize Agile and industry best practices
  • Establish a coalition of supporters to help drive awareness of Agile processes and Atlassian's software solutions
  • Analyze our current processes, prioritize areas for improvement, and work alongside teams to implement change
  • Manage projects in JIRA and Confluence to ensure stakeholder-appropriate visibility into project status, including the Senior Leadership Team.
  • Monitor and report on key Agile performance metrics
  • Develop and deliver trainings on Agile processes/best-practices and Atlassian software for internal customers (including new hires) of varied levels throughout priceline.com so that everyone sees benefits from Agile and to foster Agile leads who can manage high-performing teams
  • Mentor team members: defining and manage product scope, objectives, milestones, roles and accountabilities, deliverables and approach, and backlog management, Agile rituals, reporting, MVP definition, validated learning, test-driven development, and conflict resolution
  • Function as Scrum Master or manage Scrum of Scrums, depending on need
  • Actively communicate with project / program stakeholders to ensure alignment, visibility, and transparency into all aspects of assigned projects and programs. 
  • Above all else, foster and model a collaborative, cross-functional team environment that's driven to build great products and solve customer-needs and enterprise goals.

Detailed Qualifications

  • A belief that Agile enables individuals to more fully understand, participate, and engage in business objectives.
  • A belief that Agile fosters open team communication, transparency, and the ability to make honest trade-offs in project decisions.
  • A deep understanding of MVP and the ability to guide priceline.com through the pitfalls of process versus flexibility
  • Proficiency with Scrum processes, Lean Agile methodology, JIRA, Confluence, and the rest of the Atlassian suite
  • Experience driving change across companies or industries and deep experience developing teams and helping to align team objectives with business goals
  • Experience using JIRA's Agile performance metrics to drive accountability and continuous improvement
  • 1-2 years of experience supporting and teaching Lean methodologies and practices like Iteration Planning, Prototyping, Release Planning, Retrospectives, Writing User Stories and Acceptance Criteria, Velocity-based Planning, Continuous Delivery, Behavior-Driven Development
  • Empathy and an exceptional bedside manner are essential in gaining alignment and excitement around Agile processes
  • Experience managing software development efforts for large scale web applications using Agile and Lean methodologies with in-house and outsourced teams.
  • The ideal candidate has mentored companies that are transitioning to Agile, Scrum, or the "Lean Startup" method.
  • The ideal candidate has used Atlassian's toolset to foster fostering organizational changes and implement agile processes throughout multiple disciplines (software development, QA, marketing, networking, devops, customer service, help-desk) and industries. 
  • The ideal candidate will possess a deep understanding of Agile PLM technologies, as well as very strong conceptual, analytical, judgment and communication abilities, including with nontechnical audiences.

General Qualifications

  • 2+ years of experience as a Scrum Master / Agile Project Manager
  • Bachelor's degree in computer science, engineering, or a related discipline
  • PLUS: Masters degree in computer science or related discipline
  • PLUS: one or more Agile certifications (e.g., CSM, CSPO, CSP, PSM, PSPO). SAFe certifications (SA, SP, SPC) highly desirable.\

jobs.title: Software Engineer II
jobs.content:
The InComm Software Engineering Organization is hiring! We have a Joel score of 11, work on really interesting projects in a growing sector of financial services, and we are looking for talented and passionate engineers to join our team. 


We provide opportunity for upward mobility and advancement, technical and business training, a flexible, modern work environment and a great company culture. 


Developers would be primarily responsible for implementing new features for lnComm's stand-in platforms. Developers would also be responsible for replicating production issues in lower environments and patching code.

jobs.title: Full-Stack .NET Web Developer
jobs.content:
Come join the InGen team and help us build solid web and mobile applications.


We are looking for entrepreneurs and craftsmen passionate about developing great software for new problems. As a full-stack developer, you will work with SaSS, HTML, JS and server-side C# and databases that range from MSSQL Server to Oracle.

jobs.title: Core Financial Applications C++ Developer Job
jobs.content:
The Core Financial Applications (CFA) department designs and builds business-critical solutions for a diverse set of customers in the financial industry. Our products include analytical and research applications for equities, fixed income, mortgages, commodities, economics, foreign exchange and financial derivatives. The products we build help traders, investment bankers, corporate treasurers, research analysts and portfolio managers solve complex business problems.

As a software engineer in CFA, you will be responsible for the full development life cycle of key projects. You will learn about finance from our subject matter experts and through Bloomberg University courses. Your ingenuity and enterprise will help improve and progress our products in a highly competitive and challenging marketplace.

Our software engineers are quick, resourceful, flexible and collaborative. They combine their technical skills and product knowledge to craft unsurpassed solutions for our customers.

Qualifications:

We are looking for dedicated and ambitious software developers with strong technical and programming skills, excellent problem solving ability, and an appreciation for the scope and impact of their work.

  • 2+ years of software development experience in C/C++
  • 2+ years of experience with object-oriented design, data structures, algorithms and all phases of the software development life cycle
  • 2+ years of analytical and problem-solving skills

Preferred Skills

  • Strong verbal and written communication skills
  • Interest in developing financial applications
  • Leadership and mentoring experience
  • Financial knowledge

More information on individual groups and their products can be found below. When you apply, you will have the ability to select your preferred group.

Derivatives & Cross Asset

The Derivatives & Cross Asset group is one of the fastest growing in both CFA and Bloomberg. We deal with analytics required by a variety of trading, risk management and regulatory reporting applications. The front, middle and back offices of major financial institutions involved in the USD 700 trillion derivatives industry use our products to make sense of the complexity, risks, pitfalls and regulations surrounding these financial instruments. Our derivatives teams meet these challenges by offering a one-stop solution that brings transparency, efficiency and excellence to market professionals.

Fixed Income Pricing

The Fixed Income (FI) Pricing group builds a product that is the market standard for pricing and provides up to date and accurate information to the global financial community. We are focused on building low latency, high throughput systems that employ advanced statistical techniques for generating real-time and accurate pricing information. FI Pricing also builds analytics products that revolutionize the fixed income market place. Our application suite includes high precision pricing algorithms, accurate end-of-day price generation systems, liquidity hubs for storing and retrieving pricing information, sophisticated user interfaces and big data analytics platforms. These products are extensively used by various market players such as portfolio managers, risk officers, analysts and traders.

Foreign Exchange

The Foreign Exchange (FX) group provides market leading analytic functionality and award-winning currency pricing and data. Because FX trades are over the counter (bank to bank; not traded in exchanges), it is important for traders to have transparency into market prices. Our tools provide this service in real-time and allow users to perform FX forwards analytics on them. We develop high visibility applications for FX valuation, idea generation and price discovery workflows, as well as high volume real-time pricing engines.

Commodities

The Commodities group builds products that offer transparency in supply, demand, and pricing of oil, power, natural gas, metals and agricultural goods. We build systems and functionality to house everything from hourly power transmission rates to 15-minute updates on ship movements. Technical opportunities run the gamut from architecting systems to designing databases to UI development. Another aspect of this group is to track and manage the lifecycle of millions of futures and options securities across 100+ exchanges around the world. Our futures and options product makes discoverability of such securities easy, which proves to be a very important for our clients in a dynamic environment.

Economics

The Economics group puts the fundamentals of our economy in front of hundreds of thousands of clients every day. We develop the tools that manage real-time releases of economic statistics coming from governments around the world. We also develop analytics and visualizations of economic data to help users better understand the underpinnings of our financial system.

Equity

The Equity group's product is used by over 100,000 financial professionals worldwide to make investment decisions aimed at increasing alpha. This functionality is among the most used across the Bloomberg terminal and is invaluable to clients. The product allows for clear understanding of vast global data sets spanning 30+ years, big data analytics, real-time alerting and complex financial data. We build applications for discovering and analyzing market trends, aggregating and evaluating analyst predictions, and screening and back-testing investment ideas. The group is made up of fast-paced teams passionate about time-to-market, performance and visual design.

Fixed Income Core

The Fixed Income Core group develops software to support analytics and data that move global fixed income markets. We cover government, corporate, money market, municipal and preferred instruments. Our clients depend on our pricing algorithms, high performance calculation libraries, trading applications and real-time big data analysis to make informed decisions. Our applications are used a million times a day and our APIs are invoked billions of times a day.

The Company:

Bloomberg's R&D department is a global team of more than 3,000 software engineers and infrastructure architects who are responsible for creating the world's premier source of real-time and historical financial market data and analytics - the iconic Bloomberg Terminal. Engineers are given the responsibility to define, architect, build, and deploy complete systems that anticipate and fulfill our clients' needs. Our agile development cycle allows us to roll out new software every day. Bloomberg has always been at the forefront of cutting-edge technology. Our teams of engineers continue to lead and drive innovation, as we have done for years.

Bloomberg, the global business and financial information and news leader, gives influential decision makers a critical edge by connecting them to a dynamic network of information, people and ideas. The company's strength - delivering data, news and analytics through innovative technology, quickly and accurately - is at the core of the Bloomberg Professional service, which provides real time financial information to more than 315,000 subscribers globally. Bloomberg's enterprise solutions build on the company's core strength, leveraging technology to allow customers to access, integrate, distribute and manage data and information across organizations more efficiently and effectively. Through Bloomberg Law, Bloomberg Government, Bloomberg New Energy Finance and Bloomberg BNA, the company provides data, news and analytics to decision makers in industries beyond finance. And Bloomberg News, delivered through the Bloomberg Professional service, television, radio, mobile, the Internet and three magazines, Bloomberg Businessweek, Bloomberg Markets and Bloomberg Pursuits, covers the world with more than 2,400 news and multimedia professionals at more than 150 bureaus in 73 countries. Headquartered in New York, Bloomberg employs more than 15,000 people in 192 locations around the world.

Job Segment: Application Developer, Developer, C#, Financial, Engineer, Technology, Finance, Engineering

jobs.title: Analytics, Trading, And Execution C++ Developer Job
jobs.content:
Analytics, Trading, and Execution is the largest and fastest growing department in R&D, and we are looking to add skilled software developers to our six core groups. The applications and infrastructure we build connect supply and demand across all asset classes on worldwide exchanges. Trillions of dollars of capital move through our systems daily; as a result, market leaders rely on us to flawlessly and seamlessly manage their positions and execute their orders.

We are looking for bold, energetic, and independent developers to take ownership and responsibility in growing our industry leading applications. The ideal candidates should be able to lead projects, work with the business, meet clients, and understand their workflows to build high performance software. Our engineers are responsible for front-end UI/workflow applications, server-side/back-end development, system design, and high performance transactional database programming.

Qualifications:

We are looking for dedicated and driven software developers with strong technical and programming skills, excellent problem solving ability and appreciation for the scope and impact of their work.

  • 3+ years of software engineering experience in object-oriented programming such as C++, C# or Java

Preferred Skills

  • Multithreading experience
  • Familiarity with SQL, Python, and JavaScript
  • A passion for design, problem solving, and hands-on development
  • Experience with high volume, high availability distributed systems
  • Interest and/or experience in financial domains is desirable

More information on individual groups and their products can be found below. When you apply, you will have the ability to select your preferred group.

Trading Solutions

Trading Solutions is the largest group within Analytics, Trading, and Execution. The group designs and builds Bloomberg's three core order management systems, a fully developed connectivity and integration product and an order execution platform. These mission-critical trading applications are used by broker dealers and investment advisers throughout the world for managing orders, executions, quotes and positions. We are the global leader in building and delivering vital financial trading applications that allow banks and investment managers to manage their order flow, risk, P&L and the entire trade life cycle. Institutions rely on our advanced tools for market compliance, connectivity and algorithmic strategy trading. Collectively, our teams provide a front to back environment to meet our clients' ever changing needs.

Fixed Income, Currencies, and Commodities

The Fixed Income, Currencies, and Commodities (FICC) electronic trading group develops a global product that facilitates dealer to client trading, liquidity, and straight through processing using the Bloomberg terminal. It is the primary mechanism by which our buy-side clients source liquidity. Over the last 20 years, FICC has evolved from selling a simple dealer platform to offering a sophisticated trading platform with an array of trading styles. Responsibilities include infrastructure design and implementation, database management and user interface development.

Equity Trader

The Equity Trader group provides highly resilient, efficient, configurable and distributed real-time trading platforms. We build the analytics used to make trading decisions, the UI used to interact with the market and other traders, tools to automate workflow, and advanced alerting to monitor ongoing activity. The system handles millions of transactions per day and enables traders to send orders to over 5,000 liquidity destinations globally. The transactions are published and mined for real-time analytics and post-trade execution analysis, and are then fed back into the system to shape tomorrow's trading decisions.

Institutional Sales Applications

The Institutional Sales Applications group develops multi-asset applications for sales professionals that empower them to provide world-class service to their institutional clients. Our applications leverage sophisticated algorithms to present easy to understand answers to questions that a salesperson faces throughout the day. Successful developers are interested in finding solutions to manage and distill large volumes of disparate data.

Portfolio and Risk Analytics

The Portfolio and Risk Analytics group develops applications that provide transparency to asset managers and analysts, to help them to make well-informed financial decisions. Our clients use our real-time system for performance analysis and returns attribution, risk analytics, intraday monitoring, optimization and idea generation. Portfolio and Risk Analytics also provides a suite of global, transparent and independent indices to serve the needs of the investment community. Our team applies broad financial and mathematical knowledge across a range of asset types to develop a constantly growing set of analytics. The scale of these calculations offers opportunities for optimizing the system using Hbase, Spark, Redis and Solr. The team is redesigning a large part of our architectural stack to keep pace with the tremendous growth of our product.

Tradebook

Tradebook is building the next generation low latency trading platform, which supports multi-asset trading, exchange routing and order matching. With high capacity and sub-microsecond latency, the new system will be the foundation for Tradebook's future and propel it into more markets. Bloomberg Tradebook is a leading agency broker and technology provider of a cross-asset electronic trading platform, supporting equities, futures, options and FX trading. We focus on developing real-time black box and algorithmic trading systems, connectivity/FIX solutions and providing direct market connectivity solutions to 120+ liquidity venues globally.

The Company:

Bloomberg's R&D department is a global team of more than 3,000 software engineers and infrastructure architects who are responsible for creating the world's premier source of real-time and historical financial market data and analytics - the iconic Bloomberg Terminal. Engineers are given the responsibility to define, architect, build, and deploy complete systems that anticipate and fulfill our clients' needs. Our agile development cycle allows us to roll out new software every day. Bloomberg has always been at the forefront of cutting-edge technology. Our teams of engineers continue to lead and drive innovation, as we have done for years.

Bloomberg, the global business and financial information and news leader, gives influential decision makers a critical edge by connecting them to a dynamic network of information, people and ideas. The company's strength - delivering data, news and analytics through innovative technology, quickly and accurately - is at the core of the Bloomberg Professional service, which provides real time financial information to more than 315,000 subscribers globally. Bloomberg's enterprise solutions build on the company's core strength, leveraging technology to allow customers to access, integrate, distribute and manage data and information across organizations more efficiently and effectively. Through Bloomberg Law, Bloomberg Government, Bloomberg New Energy Finance and Bloomberg BNA, the company provides data, news and analytics to decision makers in industries beyond finance. And Bloomberg News, delivered through the Bloomberg Professional service, television, radio, mobile, the Internet and three magazines, Bloomberg Businessweek, Bloomberg Markets and Bloomberg Pursuits, covers the world with more than 2,400 news and multimedia professionals at more than 150 bureaus in 73 countries. Headquartered in New York, Bloomberg employs more than 15,000 people in 192 locations around the world.

jobs.title: Infrastructure Platform Engineer (Chef) Job
jobs.content:
The Role:

Bloomberg's Infrastructure Platform group in R&D delivers services which support the fast-paced Bloomberg environment. This includes key infrastructure capabilities used across all of Bloomberg's products and services.

As a Infrastructure Platform Engineer, you will be primarily responsible for the design, maintenance and administration of the system and services built to automate our compute environment. Our enterprise uses Chef for this function and we are deploying Chef across all of Bloomberg's unique large-scale systems. Not only will your work be used by thousands of technologists at Bloomberg, but as an active open-source contributor, Bloomberg encourages you to work on projects and commit code that raises the bar for the community as a whole.

Talk to us about how you can become part of one of the newest, most technical diverse Chef installations in the industry; we have problems to challenge even the best engineers!

Technical Skills:

  • You have recent experience designing reusable infrastructure using Chef best practices.
  • You have experience with functional and object-oriented programming best practices & design patterns.
  • You have a proven track-record of building and designing reliable, scalable service-oriented web applications/services.
  • You have worked on and understand distributed systems and large scale engineering challenges.

Responsibilities:

  • You will act as a local expert in distributed systems and configuration management best practices.
  • You will build, design and maintain the platform automation infrastructure using Chef.
  • You are able to develop and evangelize sound automation practices enterprise-wide for thousands of engineers.
  • You will maintain documentation, training and SLAs for globally managed infrastructure.

Qualifications:

  • You have a minimum of 2-3 years of experience with Ruby and/or Chef.
  • You are a fast learner, capable and willing to use the right tools to get the job done.
  • You have previous experience implementing a new, large-scale configuration management & automation infrastructure.
  • You have significant experience with configuration management in a mission critical production environment.

As with any role that involves supporting a business-critical service, team members are expected to participate in providing production support in a 2nd or 3rd-level escalation capacity.

The Company:
