jobs.title: Remote Customer Support Associate (New York Based)
jobs.content:
Paperless Post is seeking a compassionate customer support associate that will help our users have the best experience possible on our platform on a daily basis. Because we never read answers out of a manual, youâll spend your days providing the kind of personalized responses that make customers feel like theyâre talking to a real live human beingâbecause, well, they are!

After completing a two-week training session in our New York City office, remote support team members work 40 hours a week in 6-8 hour shifts, including some weekends and holidays, from home. Weâre aiming for 24/7 support as much as possible, so your ability to work odd hours is a plus.

 **To apply, send us your resume and a cover letter that answers the following questions:

  • Please provide your general availability for each day of the week. Is it steady or does it change frequently? How flexible is your schedule?
  • What do you think is the most important responsibility you have as a customer support rep?
  • Explain a scenario when you had to tell a customer ânoâ or had to correct their mistake.
  • Explain a scenario when you made a mistake. What did learn from the experience? How was it resolved? How did you feel about the feedback you received (from your customer, teammates, or manager)?  
  • Whatâs your favorite gif? 

What you'll do here
  • Troubleshoot and respond to customer questions and issues over the phone, via email, and on live chat.
  • Work closely with fellow support reps to identify and track major issues and trends to improve the user experience.
  • Stay familiar with our site and its offerings to best serve user questions.
  • Work flexible hours, including weekends and holidays.
 
What you bring to the table
  • MUST be a permanent resident in New York
  • 2+ years experience in customer support with a track record of both working independently and collaborating with a team.
  • A reliable Internet connection and a quiet environment to work in.
  • Ability to thrive in fast-paced, high-volume environment. We get a lot of inquires and we work through them quickly; our reps are energized, not discouraged, by the pace.  
  • Fantastic written and verbal communication skills and superb interpersonal skills.
  • Experience working with a team to analyze issues, learn from them, and create short-term solutions and long-term improvements.
  • An endless curiosity for our site and product and users.
  • Experience with Adobe Photoshop a big plus.
  • Familiarity with online platforms a plus.
  • Fluency in multiple languages a plus.
 

A little bit about us
The PP Support team takes empathy to the next level. Weâre a small but mighty team of brand ambassadors who are the first line of defense for the company, interacting with customers, analyzing feedback, and working with tech teams to ensure new features match real-world needs. We laugh and cry with users and appreciate a well-timed cat GIF.

Company-wide we enjoy an amazing ecosystem of an even gender split and healthy balance of engineers and designers. Because Paperless Post isnât supported by ad revenue, we get to spend our days focused on creating and improving on the ideal version of our platform, product, content, and partnerships for our users.

To apply: Please apply here: http://grnh.se/pnbo31**To apply, send us your resume and a cover letter that answers the following questions:Please provide your general availability for each day of the week. Is it steady or does it change frequently? How flexible is your schedule?What do you think is the most important responsibility you have as a customer support rep?Explain a scenario when you had to tell a customer ânoâ or had to correct their mistake.Explain a scenario when you made a mistake. What did learn from the experience? How was it resolved? How did you feel about the feedback you received (from your customer, teammates, or manager)? Whatâs your favorite gif?

jobs.title: Web Development Team Manager
jobs.content:
Portland State University (PSU) seeks to enhance the intellectual, social, cultural, and economic qualities of urban life by providing access to a quality liberal education for undergraduates and an appropriate array of professional and graduate programs especially relevant to the Portland metropolitan area. PSU is located in beautiful, vibrant downtown Portland. Easily accessible by bike and public transit, PSU is surrounded by many restaurants, food carts, parks, and local businesses.


In the PSU Office of Information Technology (OIT), we provide academic and administrative computer support and communications for the University. Our number one value is our employees - as such, we actively encourage a healthy work-life balance and strive to support our employees professionally and personally. This is fostered through many avenues. We strongly support professional development, and there are many offerings on campus and in the local Portland area. PSU offers a robust tuition discount and we encourage our staff to take advantage of this, be it for pursuing a degree or personal interest. Dynamic, engaged, motivated, innovative, curious, impassioned, transparent, open, honest, communicative, collaborative are values OIT lives by.  In OIT, we believe that this type of support creates a positive environment for our employees both at work and in their personal lives.


The Web Development Team (WDT) Manager reports to the Associate CIO and is responsible for the leadership and management of the Web Development Team within OIT. This position will oversee planning, implementation, maintenance and administration of the academic & research focused web applications managed centrally for Portland State University. This is a new department within OIT, with exciting potential for expansion and collaboration. This position will also contribute to the OIT management team by providing input on and evaluation of technology based initiatives, helping ensure that OIT meets its goals and mission.


Below are some of the technologies the WDT uses. Our new leader should have some familiarity with similar technologies to:



  • Python, Django, Django REST Framework

  • JavaScript, AngularJS, jQuery, Bower, RequireJS

  • LESS, Bootstrap, and Angular Material

  • PostgreSQL, Redis, Elasticsearch, and RabbitMQ

  • Git, GitHub, and JIRA

  • Linux (CentOS) and Mac OS, Apache, mod_wsgi


The starting annual salary rate for this position will be between $70,000 and $80,000/year with an excellent benefits package including 95% premium paid healthcare for employees and family members; a generous retirement and vacation package; and reduced tuition rates for employee, spouse, or dependent at any of the seven Oregon public universities. Wellness offerings include an extensive and affordable recreation center and free classes on topics such as investing, sustainability, and saving for retirement. More information on compensation and benefits can be found at: http://pdx.edu/hr/core-benefits


If this sounds like an exciting opportunity for you, please read the qualifications in the full job announcement and apply at https://jobs.hrc.pdx.edu/postings/19883

jobs.title: Desktop Support Engineer
jobs.content:
We are seeking a resourceful, reliable and experienced Desktop Support Engineer to help manage the technology needs of a rapidly growing employee base in San Francisco. This individual has experience supporting both Windows and Mac clients from a software installation, technical support and troubleshooting perspective. Above all other factors, we are looking for compassionate, smart, driven candidates who want to be part of a culture of innovation and creativity as we develop and define the peer-to-peer lending market.

                                                                                                      

Responsibilities

• Responsible for day-to-day administration, maintenance, patching and operations of the OS X infrastructure
• Second level escalation path for local IT Mac OS X question/tickets.
• Automate using scripting and enhancing / re-engineering processes to gain efficiencies
• Work on Support tickets assigned from Help Desk Ticketing System. Update system with work performed and problem resolution. Reassign to the appropriate personnel when necessary.
• Able to learn new technologies and processes quickly and having the ability to document and train other team members 
• Assist employees with typical office computing issues, including user access and general troubleshooting.
• Assist other team members responsible for hardware in troubleshooting and repairing failures in office infrastructure such as VOIP phones, printers, projectors, TV displays, wireless networks, etc.
• Support remote users via phone and remote assist.
• Ability to listen and understand issues from the end-user, communicate resolution and then deliver support to the end user.

 

Requirements

• 5+ Years of relevant experience in supporting medium-sized enterprises.
• Expertise with Apple’s OS X, iOS and JAMF or Munki
• Desktop support: Experience supporting major desktop platforms (Windows and OS X) and fundamental employee computing needs. Understanding of active directory policies for management of users and computers.
• Technical and process understanding of patching and software deployments
• Interpersonal skills: the majority of this role involves direct user interaction with both technical and non-technical employees.
• Technical expertise: exposure to or direct experience with Microsoft Suite, Outlook Exchange Server/Office 365, Okta, Slack, Jira, McAfee, box.net, Salesforce.com, etc.
• Process-minded: experience developing and implementing processes and policies to improve efficiency in handling support issues (i.e. ticketing system, internal procedures, etc.)

 

Company Overview

Prosper is built on a simple idea: connect people who want to borrow money with those that have money to invest. Prosper is an online marketplace that gives borrowers access to individual and institutional investors. Borrowers get low, fixed rates with no hidden fees or prepayment penalties. Investors can earn great returns through the platform’s data-driven underwriting for personal loans, creating a new and diverse investment opportunity. Through Prosper, more than $6 billion in personal loans have helped borrowers consolidate their credit card debt, pay for large purchases, make home improvements and cover medical expenses. Prosper Marketplace is headquartered in San Francisco, with offices in Phoenix and Tel Aviv.

Prosper offers an excellent compensation package including monthly incentive bonuses, options for company paid health, dental and vision insurance, paid vacation time, 401k with employer match and even a Prosper Fit Reimbursement Plan where we’ll reimburse a portion of your fitness expenses.

jobs.title: SR WEB DEVELOPER
jobs.content:
FMA is looking for a full-stack Sr. Web Developer to help grow and support our websites.


We use modern, object-oriented PHP in the Laravel framework, with MongoDB and MySQL on the back-end and Bootstrap and jQuery on the front-end. We also work with WordPress and Drupal, and our sites mostly run on Linux and nginx.


It's a relaxed environment with flexible work hours and partial remote work opportunities, but we expect quality work and love to build great products. You'll work with internal product owners as well as some external partners, but we aren't an agency. Our top publication site, thefabricator.com, has experienced 30% annual growth in unique visitors each of the past two years and our industry outreach effort, mfgday.com, boasted over 2,500 events last year. Join us to make a difference on a small, but impactful, team.


Note: FMA is currently located in Rockford IL, but is relocating to Elgin IL in December, 2016.


In this job, you will:



  • Design, develop, test and implement web applications in PHP, HTML, CSS and JavaScript

  • Design and maintain databases in MySQL and MongoDB

  • Lead projects within the web department

  • Provide detailed specifications and serve as a technical resource for coworkers

  • Work with a designer and digital marketing manager to continuously improve UI/UX

  • Monitor website performance and make improvements as needed

  • Implement SEO techniques to improve and maintain rankings

  • Fix bugs and address other issues submitted to the web help desk


Benefits:


FMA offers a competitive salary & benefits package that includes health, dental, vision, life, & disability insurance; flexible spending plans; 401(k) plan; 529 plan; generous paid holidays, vacation, & sick time.


FMA also offers company-wide incentive plan; paid professional development & memberships; tuition reimbursement; & fitness reimbursement.


We encourage you to visit our websites: fmanet.org; thefabricator.com; fabtechexpo.com; mfgday.com; nutsandboltsfoundation.org.


When applying, please include a cover letter noting your salary requirements with your resume.

  • Troubleshoot and resolve high-priority issues affecting the live environment

jobs.title: Software Engineer - Digital Analytics Team
jobs.content:
The BlueLabs Digital Analytics team is a fast-paced, innovative, and agile group that is at the forefront of revolutionizing the ways that citizens use and learn about services. Our analytics support ranges from strategic analysis—such as identifying year-over-year trends in demand and availability—to operational support—such as measuring the effectiveness of specific outreach tactics. Our work focuses on individual targeted outreach efforts across email, SMS, phone, and mail, empowered by a culture of testing. These contacts have direct, measurable impact on the lives of millions of individuals. We work closely with internal government innovation groups, and build on the analytics methodology pioneered in e-commerce, advocacy, and retail.


AS PART OF THE DIGITAL ANALYTICS ENGINEERING TEAM AT BLUELABS, YOU’LL...




    • Make a difference. The digital analytics engineering team supplies the engine at the heart of our analytics operations. Your role will be first and foremost about enabling the BlueLabs team to succeed in its mandate to improve the lives of citizens.

    • Learn and adapt. As a member of the digital analytics engineering team, you will work in BlueLabs cutting-edge technology stack. You’ll be called on to wear several hats: frontend, backend, DevOps.

    • Design. We’re building a platform to support teams like our digital analytics team, and our engineers are the driving force behind it. You'll need to understand the problem and define it. Your own expertise and experience will help us design the solution we need.

    • Collaborate. Every project benefits from diverse viewpoints from the very beginning, and so you’ll work closely with analysts and data scientists and with our clients to develop the technology that empowers them to drive change.

    • Create. Ultimately, we’re looking for you not just to write code—but to create apps, systems, and solutions that are challenging and exciting.



AS AN ENGINEER ON OUR DIGITAL TEAM, YOU'LL...




    • Join a team of engineers with responsibility for the development, deployment, and support of BlueLabs technology in support of the government analytics team.

    • Architect and implement the data pipelines that power the day-to-day work of our analysts and clients.

    • Participate in all aspects of agile software development, including design, implementation, and deployment, with a focus on owning small-to-medium features.

    • Engage in pairing, design review, and code review to improve our code and systems.

    • Contribute to engineering team’s mission to improve continuously, by leading and participating in planning sessions, code reviews, and best practices discussions.

jobs.title: Engineer 2, Deployment Engineering
jobs.content:
Engineering and Platform Services helps drive the new generation of products that are transforming Comcast into a media and technology company. Engineering manages the operations for Comcast's industry-leading video, high-speed Internet and voice services for consumers and businesses, and runs a network that supports numerous multi-billion dollar businesses.



Platform Services includes three companies owned by Comcast, namely FreeWheel, STRATA and thePlatform, plus the Comcast Wholesale, Advanced Advertising, and Advertising Technology organizations. These companies are creating next-generation technology for the fast-growing advanced advertising market. They enable and innovate solutions to support both traditional and emerging programmatic and premium advertising markets through our platforms, data, marketplace and sales channels.




Job Summary:

Responsible for planning and designing internal communications network. Plays an important role in the testing and certifying of new hardware,

configurations, and services prior to deployment to the Company Network. Works with moderate guidance in own area of knowledge.



Core Responsibilities:



- Manage the procurement, deployment, and tracking of all network elements across the Comcast Regional and National TCP/IP network.



- Directs the day-to-day coordination and technical project management of network equipment including change control, resolution of stake holder issues, schedules and timelines to ensure equipment implementation is on track for overall project success.



- Assists in the risk assessment, quality, budgeting, and scope management of deployment technical project plans.



- Manage vendor relationships by providing recommendations for contractual agreements on technical services and installation support.



- Manage facility As Built drawings, cabling running lists, floor designs and records of deployed equipment.



- Accountable for evaluating Engineering Design requirements and documents for nationwide facilities and ensuring that a sound architectural design is achieved.



- Administers vendor relationship communicating the latest industry standards, pricing structures, purchase orders and delivery timelines.



- Acts as the lead interface for internal and field organizations in the deployment of network gear during the design, installation, and configuration phase.



- Responsible for the inventory management of Comcast Regional Area Network, CMTS and related project network elements.



- Responsible for the timely distribution of facility requirements to Field Engineering staff including power, HVAC, space planning and supporting documentation.



- Continued focus on streamlining Methods and Procedure for equipment deployment and implementation.



- Works with limited amount of supervision for job duties and high performance.



- Some travel required.



- Consistent exercise of independent judgment and discretion in matters of significance.

- Regular, consistent and punctual attendance. Must be able to work nights and weekends, variable schedule(s) as necessary.

- Other duties and responsibilities as assigned.



Job Specification:

- Bachelors Degree in Engineering, Computer Science or Equivalent

- Generally requires 2-5 years related experience



- Three plus years of experience in deployment and installation of switches, routers and servers or related equipment.



- Three plus years of experience in High Speed Data, Voice, IP and Data Networking.



- Diverse background and working knowledge of HVAC, power, and cabling terminology.



- Advanced Technical Project Management skills.



- Advanced Microsoft Office or equivalent computer skills.



- Basic knowledge of all current types of networking and server hardware.



- Proven analytical, problem solving and organizational abilities.



- Superior interpersonal skills with the ability to work with vendors, employees and management.



- Develop and maintain excellent team skills including proactive, customer service oriented working relationships with all appropriate levels within and outside the company.



- Plan, organize, assign and prioritize multiple engineering support assignments and projects as directed by the manager of the group and/or other departmental officers.



- Ability and willingness to adapt and accept change with strong decision-making skills to complete project successfully.



- Personal qualities to include integrity, respect for others, personal responsibility, and a passion to approach all aspects of the job with enthusiasm.



- Solid technical skills relative to Voice and High Speed Internet network engineering, planning and management including experience with IP routers, switches and CMTS equipment.



- Strong understanding of AC/DC power configurations and HVAC related thermal architecture.



- HFC and 2-way RF outside plant engineering (i.e. RF modulation schemes).



- Strong proven background in reviewing and implementing Engineering Design guidelines and requirements.



- Good technical understanding of the IP protocol suite (e.g. ARP, IP, TCP, DNS, SNMP).



- Strong abilities with using Microsoft Office.



- Self motivated team player.



- Excellent written and oral communication skills.




Comcast is an EOE/Veterans/Disabled/LGBT employer

jobs.title: Client Integration Engineer
jobs.content:
Engineering and Platform Services helps drive the new generation of products that are transforming Comcast into a media and technology company. Engineering manages the operations for Comcast's industry-leading video, high-speed Internet and voice services for consumers and businesses, and runs a network that supports numerous multi-billion dollar businesses.



Comcast Platform Services includes four companies owned by Comcast, namely FreeWheel, STRATA, Visible World and thePlatform, plus the Comcast Wholesale, Advanced Advertising, and Advertising Technology organizations. These companies are creating next-generation technology for the fast-growing advanced advertising market. They enable and innovate solutions to support both traditional and emerging programmatic and premium advertising markets through our platforms, data, marketplace and sales channels.




The Client Integration Engineer (CIE) role is a very diverse, hybrid role requiring a strong technical background in core-programming (preferably Java)[Office1] and web technologies, excellent communication and project management skills, as well as the desire and skill to design and implement end-to-end online video solutions for thePlatform's customers.





thePlatform's media publishing system API [Office2]is extensive and requires in-depth technical understanding in order to be applied effectively. The CIE requires exceptional resourcefulness and organizational skills in order to complete customer engagements successfully.





This rewarding position offers a tremendous opportunity to learn from working with a broad range of customers, technologies, and project types in the online video space, and a chance to interact with media organizations in Europe and beyond.





The candidate must be flexible to work across time zones and be willing to travel across the EMEA region to client sites, as well as to the US for training and twice-yearly Sales Engineering meetings (travel typically 5%-10%).



Responsibilities






  • Serve as thePlatform's primary technical contact with customers, providing seamless project management through all phases of the customer relationship.

  • Gather customer requirements, and evaluate, prototype, implement and document technical solution designs to fulfill a project's particular needs using thePlatform's products and services as well as other technologies.

  • Coordinating with the customer, account manager, support team and technical personnel on all sides to meet customer needs, while managing customer expectations to prevent overload or missed deadlines.

  • Develop and code custom Java/Groovy scripts using thePlatform APIs according to the customer's ingest requirements.

  • Communicate regularly with the customer to evaluate satisfaction; identifying how new service features might best fit upcoming needs.

  • Formal routing of customers' feature requests/bugs to thePlatform's engineering, sales or support teams as needed.



Required skills and experience






  • 3+ years software engineering experience with Java[Office3]/Groovy (strong object-oriented experience in other languages would be considered).

  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills.

  • Excellent problem-solving, organizational and time management skills.

  • Digital asset management, especially video processing and delivery. Experience of working with transcoding, packaging, DRM and adaptive-bitrate streaming technologies in a media environment would be a huge advantage.

  • Experience with a variety of web development technologies such as HTML5, JavaScript, JQuery, CSS, XML/XSLT[Office4].

  • Experience of working with REST Web Services, HTTP/FTP protocols and methods and using tools such as Charles/Fiddler to analyse network traffic.

  • Strong sense of responsibility and project ownership[Office5].

  • Customer-facing/ project management experience would be a major advantage.



About thePlatform





thePlatform is a software technology company that helps TV stations, pay TV operators, content providers, and media/OTT services solve their unique media management and video publishing requirements. Our mpx software, hosted in the cloud and provided as a service, allows our customers to securely and efficiently manage their digital media and publish it to all manner of IP devices websites, tablets, set-top boxes, connected TVs and so on.





Our proven media management and publishing technology provides a versatile approach, meeting each customer's unique business needs and scaling fluidly to support their growth. Customers include BT, Comcast, Fox International Channels, NBCUniversal, Liberty Global, Viaplay, Time Warner Cable and many others.





This role will be filled at our office on Shaftesbury Avenue in London. We work with customers across Europe, Middle East and Africa (EMEA), providing project managers, solutions architects and technical engineers to help our customers implement our technology. We are a dynamic, technology-oriented group; tightly integrated with our head office in Seattle, USA.





This position is eligible to receive a comprehensive benefits package including private health care.





Please visit our website for more information http://theplatform.com




Comcast is an EOE/Veterans/Disabled/LGBT employer

jobs.title: School Business Operations Manager
jobs.content:
Overview

Success Academy’s commitment to our scholars goes beyond delivering high-quality instruction. Our ability to support our scholars and families is dependent on our school operations team working tirelessly to support our day to day operations ensuring high level of aesthetics, safety and communications. With our rapid growth and commitment to operational excellence, Success Academy Charter Schools is seeking innovative School Business Operations Managers who understand that the foundation of great schooling starts with ensuring each of our schools are immaculate, joyful environments that promote learning. As the sole leader of operations within a specific Success Academy school, our School Business Operations Members serve as core members of the leadership team ensuring high levels of operational excellence every day.

 

Success Academy Charter Schools seeks smart and ambitious candidates who will successfully support Success Academy schools. Business Operations Managers oversee daily operations, manage a dynamic team of professionals to provide our scholars with an unparalleled educational experience.

 

At Success Academy, we are redefining what’s possible in public education. Since opening our first school in Harlem in 2006, we have swiftly grown to 34 high-performing schools, from Bed-Stuy to the Bronx, serving approximately 11,000 kids. We are scaling to 100 great schools serving 50,000 children across New York City, bringing transformational change here and across the country. We believe all children, regardless of zip code or family income, deserve the life-changing opportunities that a world-class education brings.

 

To achieve exceptional results for children, we hire the best, and the brightest. We value excellence, ethics, and celebrate diversity, and are relentlessly committed to improving ourselves and our work to enhance the lives of our scholars.

 

At Success Academy, we invest in talent development, supporting our staff to grow in their careers and expand their impact in service of our school communities and dual mission. As such, we require a 2-year commitment for all School Business Operations Manager candidates.

Responsibilities

Our School Business Operations Managers report directly to the Principal and should be someone who...

  • Is an inspiring leader who continually pushes self and others to higher levels of achievement;
  • Has an incredibly high bar and keen eye for detail, and can manage their school and team to reflect the same;
  • Deeply embeds themselves into the community of the school ensuring strong relationships, high engagement and great operational results;
  • Will champion Success’ belief that in order to educate at a high level, every member of the school community needs to be an active participant;
  • Is a resourceful problem-solver who proactively shares best practices that drive our operational excellence; and
  • Is a learner.

Our School Business Operations Managers will be responsible for…

  • Directly managing a direct team of school operations professionals in overseeing all logistics for school-wide events, parent communications, scholar data collection, technology and inventory management;
  • Being an advocate for all policies, procedures, and communications across the school community to drive scholar outcomes;
  • Ensuring operational excellence and high level of detail in all areas of operations from school aesthetics to school health and safety protocols; and
  • Establishing and maintaining successful relationships within all members of the school and building community to drive the goals our school community.

To join our team, please upload a cover letter and resume that outlines your candidacy. Your cover letter should explain in detail your qualifications for the position. Resumes without cover letters will not be reviewed.

Success Academy Charter Schools is an equal opportunity employer and actively encourages applications from people of all backgrounds. Compensation is competitive and commensurate with experience. Success Academy offers a full benefits program and opportunities for professional growth.

jobs.title: Software Development Engineer - TV/Media
jobs.content:
Req ID: 122968

BUSS (Business Unit Support Solutions)

Software Development Engineer - MediaFirst

Ericsson Overview

Ericsson is a world-leading provider of telecommunications equipment and services to mobile and fixed network operators. Over 1,000 networks in more than 180 countries use Ericsson equipment, and more than 40 percent of the world's mobile traffic passes through Ericsson networks. Using innovation to empower people, business and society, we are working towards the Networked Society, in which everything that can benefit from a connection will have one. At Ericsson, we apply our innovation to market-based solutions that empower people and society to help shape a more sustainable world.

We are truly a global company, working across borders in 175 countries, offering a diverse, performance-driven culture and an innovative and engaging environment where employees enhance their potential every day. Our employees live our vision, core values and guiding principles. They share a passion to win and a high responsiveness to customer needs that in turn makes us a desirable partner to our clients. To ensure professional growth, Ericsson offers a stimulating work experience, continuous learning and growth opportunities that allow you to acquire the knowledge and skills necessary to reach your career goals.

At present, Ericsson’s TV & Media portfolio delights over 19 million TV subscribers worldwide daily, and we manage, prepare and are responsible for over 500 TV channels. The focus for Ericsson is on platforms, technology and Managed Services that do all the processing, hosting, user experience design and platform management on the content owner’s and broadcaster’s behalf. Ericsson will thereby reduce risk, make time to deployment very fast and allow the customer a far less capital-investment-heavy approach, with everything enabled through cloud-based solutions. The customers pay as they go and can focus on their core business and expanding their reach globally.

This job specification is for a Software Development Engineer with experience programming C++, in combination with exposure to web technologies such as Javascript, HTML, CSS, REST. The successful candidate must have great communication skills and have a natural ability to collaborate with international teams, specifically our head-office team in Silicon Valley.

We are looking for broadly skilled engineers, as key responsibilities include specification, architecture, design, development, testing and integration of both: our next generation IP television client platform for tablet, phone, PC and embedded STB; and our cloud services.

Required experience and qualifications:

- A Bachelor or higher degree in Computer Science or related field

- Experience programming C++ professionally and extensive experience in either this or another modern Object-Oriented language such as C# or Java

- Experience in object oriented design

- Experience designing and developing unit, component and functional tests and test infrastructure

- An understanding of web technologies and development of performant and scalable web solutions  

- Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Excellent influential skills

- Passion for quality

- Ability to work independently and be self-driven.

Preferred experience and qualifications:

- Experience developing and debugging complex software on an embedded platform, ideally Linux

- Experience in the development of DVB, IPTV and Internet TV client or server products

- Experience in development for iOS and/or Android based devices

- C# experience

- Experience in Windows Azure or alternative cloud platforms

- Experience in agile development e.g. Scrum

- Experience in working across disciplines and geographical borders.

*LI-NM5

Ericsson provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, marital status, pregnancy, parental status, national origin, ethnic background, age, disability, political opinion, social status, veteran status, union membership or genetics.

Ericsson complies with applicable country, state and all local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location across the world in which the company has facilities. In addition, Ericsson supports the UN Guiding Principles for Business and Human Rights and the United Nations Global Compact.

This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, training and development.

Ericsson expressly prohibits any form of workplace harassment based on race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, marital status, pregnancy, parental status, national origin, ethnic background, age, disability, political opinion, social status, veteran status, union membership or genetic information.

jobs.title: Startup CTO/Chief Architect Full-Stack Ruby-on-Rails + JS Web Developer
jobs.content:
Join us and become a part of history as together we change the face of e-commerce for digital content and preserve the ability of authors to earn a living writing. We are looking for smart, creative engineering and development support to add a long list of functions to our existing web site, create dedicated mobile applications, and extend our database backend functionality for internal support and to provide ebook and audiobook content distribution through all the major ebook and audiobook stores on the web.


The current beta site has baseline functionality developed in Ruby-on-Rails running on AWS. We need your help expanding this and rapidly adding author and customer-attracting functions.


Highlights



  • Get in on the ground floor and become an owner of a new, industry-transforming company.

  • Consult with former kayak.com founding employee & Chief Architect Bill O’Donnell, who is a technical advisor to the company.

  • Create your own solutions to challenging technical problems.

  • Choose the tools that will be used by you and your colleagues.

  • Make mistakes, disrupt the status quo, and help us create the engineering culture that you would like!


If hired, you will receive a hefty equity grant relative to the position. You will also earn direct payment in the form of a revenue share on every dollar from the site, tools, and distribution your work enables, increasing as gross revenue increases, until those rev-share pay levels reach your target salary.


We are located in the growing Lebanon/Hanover, NH tech region around Dartmouth and the Lebanon airport, but during our launch phase, we expect candidates to work from home, wherever that may be. We will pay for relocation, should that become necessary in the future.

jobs.title: Quality Assurance Analyst
jobs.content:
ForeFlight is looking for a Quality Assurance Analyst to join our QA test team. You'll work with product developers, leaders and the QA Team to develop and perform manual and automated tests on new and existing ForeFlight application, web services and server features.


Aviation experience is a requirement for this role. Technical skills are also important. Knowledge of how web and iOS applications work is key, including understanding of APIs, HTML5, CSS3, and how Javascript and Ajax elements work. Additionally, a qualified candidate would have QA experience with Map products including MapBox and Google Map. You should know your way around an iPad/ Mac and be an analytical thinker.


Professionally, this person is driven to execute, deliver, and complete projects independently, seeking advice and direction from team members when needed, and plowing ahead to completion when the path forward is clear. This person will be able to point to specific examples that highlight the individual’s ability to meet the objectives outlined above, and references will confirm this person’s unique abilities.


This position is based in the Portland, ME office.

jobs.title: Javascript Web Developer
jobs.content:
ForeFlight is looking for a talented web developer to join our team. This position is for a unique and technically well-rounded individual with experience building high profile web apps. This person will help us create the next generation of ForeFlight Web and continue our leadership in web-based aviation software.


While you know many different web technologies, you find yourself at home within a JavaScript/Python web stack.


You’re knowledgeable of both legacy and emerging JavaScript standards, frameworks, and tools. You know what prototypes are (and aren’t), general best practices for bending the language to your will, and are familiar with client-side performance optimization techniques. You know when using jQuery makes sense and when it doesn't.


You love Python for the simplicity and flexibility of the language, especially within the context of web development. You're comfortable working on back-end APIs in Python as well as serving up traditional, templated pages.


Shipping software is something you take pride in and you welcome the opportunity to make immediate contributions to software with a passionate user-base.


This position is based in our Austin, TX office. A pilot-coder, or individual looking to pursue his or her private pilot license, is a plus. We are happy to consider all levels: junior, mid-level, and senior candidates.

jobs.title: Server Developer
jobs.content:
ForeFlight is looking for a software developer to join our Server/API team in Austin. This position is for a technically well-rounded individual with experience in Java server-side web and enterprise app development that will have responsibilities for developing server-side features and APIs to support our mobile apps. Experience with weather products and APIs (aviation or otherwise), aggregation of data / mashups, and aviation in general are a big plus.


Technically, this person must have experience with Java programming, including use of one or more frameworks, search, and web services (RESTful, binary, and/or XML based). This person believes building applications in the cloud is cake. This person is naturally curious, exploring new technologies in order to stay current, but balances the use of new and old to ensure that execution is priority.


Professionally, this person is driven to execute, deliver, and complete projects independently, seeking advice and direction from team members when needed, and plowing ahead to completion when the path forward is clear. Junior candidates and recent CS grads are encouraged to apply.


This position is based in our Austin, TX office. A pilot-coder, or individual looking to pursue his or her private pilot license, is a plus. Benefits include medical insurance, 401K with matching, and flight training reimbursement. Relocation reimbursement will be provided if moving to Austin.

jobs.title: Lead Software Architect for Early Stage Startup
jobs.content:
Join me as one of Turn’s first employees in Chicago and let’s build an innovative business together.


I'm Rahier Rahman, Founder and CEO of Turn Technologies. I previously founded Pangea Money Transfer and helped build the critical infrastructure for a global money transfer company, grew a stellar team to 40, developed international partnerships with major players in the fintech space, and raised $15M in venture financing. Prior to that, I co-founded an online apartment rental business called domu.com. And before all that I was on the investment team at Cerberus Capital and the start-up team at Time Warner that launched several magazines you know today.


I'm building Turn to help the next generation of on-demand start-ups grow by developing a platform that combines state-of-the-art AI, streamlined UI, and massive amounts of mobile data. What we will do will help many people redefine work and help on-demand companies scale.


There are three expectations we have of someone in a technical leadership role: we want you to be a technologist, a manager, and an inspirational leader.


As a technologist you should have a high-level understanding of what is possible through technology and be excited about the opportunities technology can bring to a business. You should be able to participate in high-level technical conversations, help break complex business needs down to technical capabilities, and help teams reach a technical consensus. We gravitate towards polyglots that use the best tools for the problems at hand and who are force multipliers and enhance the creativity and productivity of the team. 


As a manager you should be able to help an organization operate to its fullest potential. You should be able to increase team efficiency through communication, focus, process, and consistency - but not bring unnecessary bureaucracy or ceremony. You should be able to grow the people on these teams by providing them with personal and professional development goals and helping them achieve them!


As a leader you should put the needs of others first and help people develop and perform as highly as possible. You should be able to inspire the team to go above and beyond, to fail forward, and to surprise everyone. You should be able to have a vision for where our platform can take this business - and push hard to get us there. You lead by doing and your enthusiasm is infectious.


Most importantly, you understand how to help an organization stay focused, happy, and productive. You’re a leader, but you still have solid coding chops. We welcome new ideas and technologies – you’ll be critical in deciding exactly what technologies we use. You’re comfortable working in and leading teams – and have done so in the past, understand and appreciate the value of test-driven development, and love to work in an agile and rapid environment.

jobs.title: Full Stack Engineer
jobs.content:
About the Engineering Team


We work together in a pretty novel fashion - team leaders are elected by their teammates, and responsibilities normally held by a single manager are distributed across multiple roles. We have very open discussions about our product, our organization, and shared priorities.


We’re always iterating on how we work and what we build. We’re growing fast and we know that what may have worked a year ago won’t necessarily work a year from now. This applies to both the technology and the organization of our teams. We want to provide the best analytics experience for developers and co-create the best work environment for each other - willingness to evolve is essential.



About the Experience Team


Keen is building the future of analytics-by-API. Our team is focused on making the pieces of Keen that users interact with directly amazing. We build and maintain the core Keen website which handles signup+login, project and organization management, building and visualizing queries via our Explorer and Dashboards apps, and also the Keen internal administrative interface the company uses on a daily basis.


To meet these challenges we have to work efficiently and effectively, both as individuals and as a collaborative team. You will help us be thoughtful and deliberate about tackling the right problems at the right time. You’ll help make building and maintaining our projects easier. You’ll have the opportunity to gain deep understanding of every aspect of our service and teach others! Most importantly, you will collaborate with some pretty amazing humans.

jobs.title: Front End Engineer Unicorn Wrangler
jobs.content:
Stealth mode startup seeking like minded Sr. Front-End Engineer!  PacketFabric is creating the simplest way to connect networks to exchange traffic, regardless of location.  The technical team is a small, talented, and close knit group.  We have a bond formed from the love of running head long at difficult problems and finding highly effective solutions.


As a well rounded software engineer, you should definitely be the type that appreciates diversity in your day, and challenges outside of your comfort level! You will own the entire front end application, so you must come armed with a solid understanding good programming principles, have a nearly magical intuition for good UI, and excellent understanding of front end frameworks.


A typical day in the life of a PacketFabric software engineer might include these types of activities:


- Architecting completely new features, or a completely new section of the client side application designing with code reuse, client experience, and speed in mind.


- Scrutinizing page load times and refactoring code to optimize user experience.


- Working closely with the UI/UX and product leads to add some intuitive features to the client side application to enable users to make rapid network changes


- Working with back-end engineers to quickly adopt API changes for a rapidly shifting feature set.


- Interacting with customers and/or sales on a bug in the software, quickly resolving it, and coordinating across the team to push a fix.


- Researching additional ideas you may have to improve the product/platform overall and sharing with the team.

jobs.title: Sr. Front-End Engineer/Unicorn Wrangler
jobs.content:
Stealth mode startup seeking like minded Sr. Front-End Engineer!  PacketFabric is creating the simplest way to connect networks to exchange traffic, regardless of location.  The technical team is a small, talented, and close knit group.  We have a bond formed from the love of running head long at difficult problems and finding highly effective solutions.


As a well rounded software engineer, you should definitely be the type that appreciates diversity in your day, and challenges outside of your comfort level! You will own the entire front end application, so you must come armed with a solid understanding good programming principles, have a nearly magical intuition for good UI, and excellent understanding of front end frameworks.


A typical day in the life of a PacketFabric software engineer might include these types of activities:


- Architecting completely new features - such as a UI for white listing and black listing - with code reuse, client experience, and speed in mind.


- Scrutinizing page load times and refactoring code to optimize user experience for viewing large data sets with thousands, and tens of thousands of items


- Working closely with the UI/UX and product leads to add an intuitive features, such as slick network data graphs with an easily adjustable data set, zoom capabilities, and adjustable/sliding x-axis


- Working with back-end engineers and discussing quirks in network protocols and network interconnection which translate rapid API and UI changes.


- Interacting with customers and/or sales on a bug in the software, quickly resolving it, and coordinating across the team to push a fix.


- Researching additional ideas you may have, like how to make picking and visualizing user/free VLANs a better experience for the customer.

jobs.title: Project Reviewer
jobs.content:
Apply here: https://review.udacity.com/apply.html


Machine Learning Project Reviewers are experts on Machine Learning related topics, enjoy providing feedback, and are generous about sharing their knowledge with others. Reviewers have the opportunity to help thousands of students progress in their Nanodegree journeys and continue expanding their own skills through teaching. Reviewers care deeply about giving Udacity Nanodegree students project reviews because they understand the power of personalized feedback while learning new skills.


RESPONSIBILITIES:



  • Ensure that students receive the best possible feedback on their projects by providing constructive evaluations.

  • Guide students to improve their projects in the reviews you provide them in a professional yet friendly and positive tone.


WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR:




    • Machine Learning expertise. In particular, expertise with the following topics:


      • Principal component analysis, supervised and unsupervised learning, reinforcement learning, Q-learning, feature selection and feature transformation, outlier detection and model validation. Knowledge of statistics and linear algebra is necessary.





  • Familiarity with Machine Learning in the fields of stock trading, robotics, healthcare, computer vision, education, artificial intelligence, or Deep Learning is ideal.



  • Familiarity with the following Python 2.7 libraries and software:


    • Scikit-learn, NumPy, Pandas, and matplotlib.

    • iPython (Jupyter) Notebook.


  • Excellent in debugging code

  • Excellent communicator

  • Passionate for learning and learning quickly

  • Empathetic and great mentor


    • Teaching experience is ideal, but not required.



JOB DETAILS:



  • Flexible work hours: review projects on-demand. Average time to review a project is 30-60 min

  • Flexible pay: get paid per project review. Average price per project is $55.

  • To ensure quick feedback to students, we require that you complete a project review within 2 hours of starting it.

  • Ensure that you are eligible to work as a contractor for Udacity.


Due to PayPal restrictions we accept reviewers only from the following countries: Argentina, Australia, Austria, Belgium, Brazil, Bulgaria, Canada, Chile, China, Costa Rica, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Denmark, Dominican Republic, Ecuador, Emirates, Estonia, Finland, France, French Guiana, Germany, Gibraltar, Greece, Guadeloupe, Hong Kong, Hungary, Iceland, India, Indonesia, Ireland, Israel, Italy, Jamaica, Japan, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malaysia, Malta, Martinique, Mexico, Netherlands, New Zealand, Norway, Philippines, Poland, Portugal, Reunion, Romania, San Marino, Singapore, Slovakia, South Korea, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, Taiwan, Thailand, Turkey, United Arab Emirates, United Kingdom, United States, Uruguay, Venezuela, Vietnam.

jobs.title: Research Infrastructure Software Engineer
jobs.content:
To be considered for this position, we require a cover letter and resume. Your resume should clearly describe your past experiences. We’d like your cover letter to address what you expect your future experiences to look like, such as, what do you want in your next role, what are your passions, and what motivates you. Please include both your cover letter and resume as an attachment to your application.

Quantlab Financial, LLC is a dynamic, technology-driven firm supporting a large-scale quantitative trading operation across a wide range of global financial markets, and supports a very successful proprietary trading organization. Founded in 1998, Quantlab is an established presence and one of the pioneers in quantitative investment management with a track record of consistent profitability under varying market conditions. We invest heavily in attracting and retaining the right people and in leveraging the most effective technologies to minimize latency throughout our trading systems and to provide the tools that we need to develop and maintain highly profitable trading strategies.

We are seeking to fill the position of Research Infrastructure Software Engineer in Boston, MA to work with our Research team. The successful candidate will be responsible for optimizing, enhancing, and maintaining our proprietary trading platforms, as well as designing and implementing tools to support research efforts.

The Job: You should apply if you are remarkably responsible, both as an individual and as part of a team, and love to share, debate, and communicate with other team members to find the best solutions to multifaceted problems.

We are interested in both recent graduates and professionals with industry experience who possess the following:

  • Passion for building and maintaining large-scale software systems that extract the ultimate performance from their underlying hardware resources
  • Excitement to learn and master the details of the entire computation environment across the software/hardware boundary including: memory hierarchy, cache-efficient programming, compiler optimizations, processor pipelining, multicore communication, and network interfaces
  • Strong knowledge of C++, from high-level object oriented design patterns to low-level language constructs
  • A meticulousness, assiduousness, and tenacity that drives you to deliver high quality output
  • Demonstrated commitment to self-motivated education and development
  • Demonstrated use of organizational resources to drive professional development
  • Confidence to contribute to the development of an effective and evolving team environment, using strong communication skills, diplomatic candor, and a commitment to support your teammates
  • Degree in computer science, electrical engineering, computer engineering, or related scientific field

Additional preferred skills or interests:

  • Test Driven Development (TDD) approach to software engineering
  • Impeccable craftsmanship in the spirit of the Clean Code initiative
  • Multithreaded application development and debugging experience
  • Template and preprocessor meta-programming experience
  • Language design and compiler engineering experience
  • Software profiling and optimization experience
  • Assembly language level programming experience

Why Quantlab Financial is a great place to work: Technology and Scientific Research are central to our business and key to our success and are treated as such. We are constantly pushing the boundaries of technology, from high performance computing (HPC) clusters attached to petabytes of storage, to ultra-low latency hardware (FPGA, RF, servers, and switches), to highly optimized operating systems, all in an effort to improve our system. Quantlab attracts very talented and collaborative people who bring fresh and interdisciplinary solutions to trading. Our business casual environment has an entrepreneurial spirit that encourages creativity, agility, and continuous improvement.

jobs.title: QA Engineer I
jobs.content:
TheVelocityEHS work environment is dynamic, innovative and entrepreneurial.  We have a results-oriented culture that demands intelligence, teamwork and follow-through.  If you have these qualities and are a self-starter with creativity and a strong work ethic then this is the job for you - check out the details below and apply now.



GENERAL DESCRIPTION:



 Is spotting errors and finding flaws something you enjoy doing?  Would you like to work in a dynamic and innovative work environment?  If you said ‘YES’, check out the details below and apply now.



VelocityEHS Software QA Engineers test functionality that allow all customers (whether internal or external) to do their jobs with ease.  They do so by architecting test strategies for validation of functionality based on requirements.  We're looking for new or experienced QA professionals to help make sure our web-based solutions are delivered with exceptional quality. In this role, you will have a range of responsibilities which will provide you the opportunity to grow professionally.  We have a results-oriented culture that demands teamwork and follow-through.



PRIMARY DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES INCLUDE BUT ARENT LIMITED TO:



Key tasks and responsibilities of the QA Engineer include, but aren’t limited to:



  • All new product testing, ongoing post release product testing and trouble shooting.

  • Conduct quality assurance testing and analysis within a team setting or independently to ensure systems function properly and according to business standards and end-user requirements.

  • Develop and execute test plans, test cases and other documents needed for testing.

  • Desire to contribute and become a subject matter expert.

  • Provide routine status reports and metrics on assigned projects.

  • Report any issues or risks that may impact the delivery of a release.

  • Using internal applications for documenting and tracking ongoing product issues. 

  • Assist in reviewing product documentation for accuracy. 

  • Assist in creating and maintaining User Guides, Product Help, and Release Notes.

  • Assist the CFO in assuring ongoing compliance with the Sarbanes-Oxley Act

jobs.title: Director of Engineering
jobs.content:
Voxy is changing people's lives for the better every single day. That’s not an overstatement, it’s the truth. Learning a new language is the single hardest things that you can ask an adult to do. We make it happen. Every. Single. Day.


Voxy provides a cloud-based English language learning platform that’s based on 20 years of cutting edge scientific research into language learning. It’s proven effective, in the lab and in the wild. It’s a tough problem, but that’s okay, we like tough problems and you should too.


Come join a growing start-up as we tackle the old-school entrenched players in a $60B/year industry that hasn’t seen any real innovation in decades. If it’s a kick-ass culture, paying customers and top-tier investors that you’re looking for, well, we have that.


These things are important to us, and they should be important to you too:



  • Communication - we firmly believe that communication is the key to success and the way we work relies heavily on great communication skills. You should be an outstanding communicator, both verbally and written.

  • Organization - our engineers practice, and love, eXtreme Programming. While you might not have actually practiced XP you should have experience in running an Agile product process, and understand why it’s the better way of doing things.

  • Management - we have a team of 12 highly functioning engineers in New York and Sao Paolo.  You will have 2 plus years experience managing a team of at least 5 engineers - bonus for managing or working with a remote team.

  • Vision - we believe the director should also be on the ground coding with the team. You will have 5 plus years engineering experience including at least 2 years experience at the "architect" level, or higher and experience with larger scale, customer focused, web-based applications.

  • Flexibility - we’re fast paced and sometimes things change. We all need to be able to shift gears quickly and deal with the unexpected. Embrace chaos.

  • Respect - we love new ideas and discussion, and while we don’t always agree with each other our strong opinions are loosely held.

jobs.title: Oracle EBS Developer - Systems Analyst
jobs.content:
Job Purpose:
Analyzes business needs and detailed system components, identifies, communicates, and resolves systems issues in support of core system functions. Performs systems analysis, design, coding, testing, documentation and implementation for application systems development software initiatives driven by business needs. Develops and enhances computer applications to support the implementation of difficult to complex business requirements. Performs specific assignments as part of a project team or works independently on small to medium-sized enhancements and production support assignments. May perform technical project management.

Major Duties:

Design/Configuration/Programming/Support of 3rd Party HR, Finance and other Corporate systems
Design/Programming (VB.Net, C#, MVC, ASP, PL/SQL, Java, Object Oriented Programming, Oracle, SQL Server, Unix) 

Design/Programming
• Interprets business requirements for system enhancements and projects, translates them into detailed design system specifications including process and data flows, screen and report specifications, stored procedures, batch scripts, and batch scheduling specifications.
• Recommends technologies to be used in building the solution.
• Develops system components based on business requirements and system specifications, codes, tests, and implements components in accordance with standards and procedures.
• Responsible for unit testing components and supporting DEV and QA testing.
• Performs design reviews and code reviews for other team initiatives.
• Coordinates and executes integration testing for development efforts.
• Develops implementation plans and supports migrations through the various environments.
• Responsible for the coordination and implementation of small to medium-sized enhancements and production support assignments from end to end.
• Prepares and maintains technical system documentation for system support and other needs.
Analysis
• Analyzes business needs and detailed system components, including input, process, and output requirements, data and system flows, and hardware and software requirements.
• Identifies, communicates, and resolves systems issues in support of core system functions.
• Identifies root cause of problems, provides options for resolution and documents outcome of analysis.
• Evaluates existing systems to improve their effectiveness and efficiency, reducing operational costs, and providing solutions to resolve data and system issues.
• Provides consultation in areas of expertise and/or 3rd party vendor software products.

Project Management
• Manages various technical aspects of small to medium-sized projects concurrently through the project lifecycle using the PMO process while managing to a budget, timeline and customer satisfaction and value.
• Responsible for estimating, project planning, communicating status of projects, designing, analyzing, coding (where applicable), testing, and documentation and implementation of components in accordance with standards and procedures.
• Works with management team to staff projects.
• Provides objective feedback to management regarding team and individual performance.

Relationships

• Provides support in a matrix-management fashion to other areas as needed.

Leadership

jobs.title: Lead Software Engineer - Chicago
jobs.content:
We work with awesome people every day. We don’t mean “awesome” like how other people use “awesome”—in some conjunctive form with “sauce” or “balls.” We really mean it. We work with some of the greatest people in the tech industry here at GrubHub. We’re looking for more.

GrubHub leads in the mobile food-ordering industry with a portfolio of brands that includes GrubHub, Seamless, MenuPages and Allmenus. We’re dedicated to connecting hungry diners with local restaurants. With offices in New York City, Chicago and London, GrubHub supports every order with 24/7 customer service. 

We want you to enjoy where you work. Who you work with. What you work on. At GrubHub, you can order your cake and eat it too.

About the Opportunity:

GrubHub Holdings Inc. is looking for a Lead Software Engineer to provide technical and architectural leadership for multiple development teams as they conceptualize, design, build, and deploy to the field new and innovative products for our restaurant partners, as well as how those products fit into the big picture of Grubhub. Our Lead Engineers wear a lot of hats - everything from hands-on coding to mentoring developers to working with product to formulate new products to guiding our system architecture. We have high standards for code quality, unit testing, and intelligent architecture. We enjoy implementing new ideas and contributing directly to the growth of the business. 

Some Challenges You'll Tackle: 
  • Architect, implement and test technology solutions at GrubHub 
  • Motivate and advise technical solutions across multiple cross functional teams 
  • Take technical responsibility for a family of systems - manage technical debt, be on the lookout for opportunities for improvement, and work with system engineers to keep our production systems scaling and performing wickedly fast 
  • Actively contribute to the adoption of software architecture, best practices, and technologies. We are always improving the process of building software, we need you to help contribute 
  • Participate in future product direction
  • Act as technical voice for the restaurant technology group 
  • Encourage continuous delivery and an experimentation-centered development process


You Should Have:

  • Masterful understanding of Java (7-10 years experience) 
  • Masterful understanding of unit testing, version control, and front end integration 
  • Must be genuinely awesome

Got These?  Even Better:
  • Experience with mobile technologies is a plus 

And Of Course, Perks!:
  • Unlimited paid vacation days. Choose how your time is spent.
  • Never go hungry! We provide weekly GrubHub/Seamless credit.
  • Regular in-office social events, including happy hours, wine tastings, karaoke, bingo with prizes and more.
  • Company-Wide Initiatives encouraging innovation, continuous learning and cross-department connections.
We deliver favorites every day. Join us as we move eating forward.


Grubhub is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other legally protected characteristics. The EEO is the Law poster is available here: DOL Poster. Grubhub is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities. If you need a reasonable accommodation because of a disability for any part of the employment process, please send an e-mail to TalentAcquisition@grubhub.com and let us know the nature of your request and your contact information.

jobs.title: Content Writer (Personal Finance) -- Full time, Remote
jobs.content:
Student Loan Hero (SLH) combines financial education with easy-to-use tools to help the millions of Americans living with student loan debt to manage their student loans smarter.

Since 2012, Student Loan Hero has helped more than 80,000 borrowers to manage and eliminate over $1 billion in student loan debt. Each year, it helps more than one million people become financially healthy.

For both current and former students who want to manage their loans in line within their own budget, Student Loan Hero offers free loan calculators, unbiased personalized advice, and repayment plans, all with a user-friendly interface and dashboard.

What does the Content Writer do?

The mission of the Content Writer is to craft amazing blog posts and other content that knocks our readers' socks off. We want the reaction to our writing to be "Wow! This is the most insanely useful resource I've ever read on the topic!"

We help our readers and users answer important questions about their student loans and their finances in general. This process includes making concepts from the often-confusing world of student loans and personal finance easy to understand so that our readers can take action.

The Content Writer is crucial to making this happen. The primary way the Content Writer will do this is through the SLH blog and website. The Content Writer should be comfortable writing content, especially related to student loans and topics of personal finance. Knowing how to identify interesting topics and produce a compelling blog post is a must for this position.

The Content Writer will also help SLH create and publish content writing on external sites as well, such as Forbes, Huffington Post, Entrepreneur, and more.

The ideal candidate for this position should have an entrepreneurial mindset and be ready to take on and initiate new projects when he or she sees the need.

Whatâs it like to work on the Student Loan Hero team?

Student Loan Hero is a fully remote team. We have team members all over the world, in cities including NYC, Austin, Portland, Santiago, and St. Petersburg.

Since weâre literally all over the map, communication using Slack, Gmail, Basecamp, Google Hangouts, and other tools is key for us. Don't worryâyou won't be alone. We communicate regularly throughout the day.

In our small group, each team member uses highly specialized skills while working on a variety of projects. We enjoy giving our team members autonomy to do the work that interests them. Weâre focused on the output of each team member, not putting in long hours.

Weâre always open to new ways to create better content and make Student Loan Hero better for student loan borrowers, and we want to hear new ideas from you. A large part of our culture and values is transparency. We believe that team members should collaborate and communicate, not compete or engage in office politics.

At the same time, we like to make work as much fun as possible. We want everyone on our team to grow both personally and professionally, which is why we offer wellness and educational bonuses, as well as several other great perks.

Above all, weâre each proud to work on solving meaningful problems and to impact lives every day. Whether itâs authoring a blogpost read by thousands of borrowers or answering a one-on-one customer support question, we value that working for Student Loan Hero makes a positive impact.

Required:
  • 2+ years experience writing and publishing online, particularly in blog post format
  • Familiarity with proper formatting, style, and tone of blog posts
  • Ability to research and contribute ideas you can write about
  • Ability to quickly turn around assignments for breaking news, etc.
  • Availability to work full time

Preferred:
  • Experience writing about student loans and other personal finance topics
  • Experience with conducting interviews for articles
  • Experience promoting blog posts (on social media, via email, etc.)
  • Familiarity with WordPress
  • Familiarity with SEO best practices

Benefits:
  • Competitive salary: Based on experience and location
  • Equity: 0.05â0.15% in vested company ownership
  • Vacation: Unlimited
  • Flexible hours: Work when youâre most productive
  • Work remotely: Work from wherever you want in the world (Costa Rica, anyone?)
  • New equipment: Weâll hook you up with a $2,000 technology stipend to purchase a laptop or whatever helps you work
  • Remote workspace: We'll pay up to $500/month for a remote office space (e.g., co-working space)
  • Wellness: Up to $450/month for wellness-related expenses, including health insurance and gym membership
  • Continuing education: Up to $100/month for courses, books, or anything youâd like to learn!
  • Financial contribution: Receive a 100% match of up to 3% of annual salary to a retirement account, or a 100% match of up to 3% of annual salary towards student loan repayment assistance.

To apply: Please visit this page: https://student-loan-hero.workable.com/j/9FD445239A

jobs.title: Senior Full Stack Engineer
jobs.content:
Headquarters: San Francisco, CA
URL: http://www.followupboss.com/

Follow Up Boss is a cutting edge CRM for small businesses. Customers love our product, check what people say about us. You'll be solving real problems for our thousands of daily users that run their businesses on FUB. We're bootstrapped, profitable and growing.

Looking for an experienced full stack engineer to join our small friendly team. You will be working on the new version of Follow Up Boss in React.js while extending our REST API to support new features and improvements. On the backend we use PHP, Postgres, MySQL, Redis, Algolia. Everything is hosted on AWS.

We practice simplified version of Scrum with 1-week sprints for faster development and feedback, chat in Slack daily and meet in person on regular company retreats. Our roadmap is packed with new features and improvements based on solid feedback from customers.

This is a full-time job, choose to work remote or in our San Francisco office.

What We Expect

- Experience working in a fast-growing startup building and shipping a SaaS product.

- Great programming skills, ability to produce quality code that is maintainable, efficient, reliable and secure.

- Excellent knowledge of PHP and MySQL, ability to write complex queries that run fast.

- Good knowledge of JavaScript; experience with React.js is appreciated but not required.

- Linux administration skills, ability to set up and maintain production and dev servers.

- Fluent English and good communication skills.

What You Can Expect

- Solve challenging technical problems and put your skills to the test every day. See direct impact of your work and value you created for customers.

- Work in a small friendly team side-by-side with co-founders. Opportunity to learn all aspects of running a SaaS business.

- Provide direct input on technical (and not so technical) decisions, be heavily involved in the product design process. Your opinion matters, your ideas will be heard and appreciated.

- Flexible work schedule, work when you are the most productive and be with your family when they need you.

- Ability to work 100% remote, enjoy working from the comfort of your own home. We’re hiring the best people regardless of where they live.

- Loose vacation policy, take time off when you need it.

- Competitive compensation, year-end bonuses based on performance, trips to tech conferences and company meetups.

- Your choice of equipment, latest MacBook Pro or anything else you need.

- Monthly perks like Starbucks, WholeFoods, Uber, Movie Tickets, Dashlocker.

- Something else you need? Let us know.

To apply: Apply Now at http://grnh.se/ys3m85
